The dogs really enjoy the nylabones. They will be needing more soon. We will be using this site to purchase them.
I was a little disappointed in the quality of leather used. I have owned other leather leashes and this one is very stiff and somewhat inflexible. It is hard on the hands.

My Pitt/Boxer mix loves this ball. Actually, love is an understatement. She is obsessed with this ball. She brings it everywhere she goes, proudly showing it off to anyone and everyone.In addition this ball is durable, easy to clean, and has not lost its color. It is very bouncy and has not lost its shape or been punctured, despite my dogs constant chewing on it.The best toy I have found my dog yet, and she has quite a few. I plan to order this item routinely so there is always a back-up stash in case we lose the one we have in current play.

First of all this product is very expensive for what you get. Also, it discharges itself constantly even if it isn't in contact with anything. Just holding the unit by the battery pack up in the air and I can hear it discharging. That means that it will shock the pet, but the pet has to be touching it when it goes off and the recharge cycle is maybe 10 seconds as opposed to it just going off when the pet touches it. I'm very surprised that someone can't come up with a better implementation of this type of product because as a dog owner with a dog that can actually open a completely shut metal trash can it would be very helpful.

This works like promised... giving a nicer sheen to my kitty's coat since I don't give her wet food (wet food made her a demanding whiny cat, weird, right?!).However, the dispenser pump leaks and the bottle gets sticky. Kinda gross.I also try not to give her this every day since I think it clogged the pores on her chin and lead to some kitty acne which she never had until using this. Once I stopped using it, the kitty acne went away. So in the future I'll make sure to wipe off her little chin after she eats food with the fish oil. But it is great for her coat and less dandruff.

Great price for a high performance canister filter! Assembly and installation was exteremely fast and easy. Within a couple of hours of operation, the water in my 29g goldfish tank was crystal clear. The filter is very quiet, I can barely notice noise coming from the filter. The quick disconnect valve and the easy replacement of filter media makes maintenance is a breeze. Thumbs up for Rena!

only three of the four types of seed really sprouted. my cat loved it and munched on it constantly. however, just about a week ago, it all pretty much died. maybe my cat munched too hard? i still have the nice container, so i'm just going to get the seeds it came with and replant them in the container. maybe thats what i should have done to begin with. its a nice container though.

My cats had zero problem with me moving the litter box into the bathroom, and switching their litter to a flushable kitty litter (I use Feline Pine). However, they have not taken to step one of the CitiKitty system. One problem is that my toilets are not standard and have very wide sides. I had to cut off the sides of the CitiKitty tray to get it to sit in the toilet. I've taped it on to the toilet now, which makes it much more difficult to remove and clean. However, my cats still won't use it. They have taken to peeing on a rug and/or going outside. I'm thinking about getting a deeper aluminum bowl and trying that instead. I don't know if it's the flimsiness (from having to cut off the sides of the tray) or the lack of depth that makes it difficult to bury their stuff. I've been stuck at this stage for a month now and have not gotten my two cats to use the tray consistently. There have been one or two instances but that's all.
The hutch is great and went together easily. Please note it does not come with the required wire clip pliers one needs to put it together. So add $15 to the price.

I'm on the fence about this product. Before you go any further, this product has been the most effective of the many products we have tried. Frankly, we have a major flea problem and I have tried everything under the sun: Program tablets, Capstar tablets, both of those together, IGI-based yard and indoor sprays, flea-attractant lamps, flea baths/dips/sprays/powders from various manufacturers, and, finally, insecticides for yard and home. We've tried earth-friendly and herbal remedies as well as the more objectionable poisonous chemical remedies with little success. I've spent well over $1000 dollars this summer trying to get some relief from our flea problem. One of my cats actually needed sub-q fluids and iron supplements because she was anemic from the fleas despite all these efforts. (Is it the weather this year??) The vet told me this was the best possible treatment to get on top of the flea problem. That's scary because after 2 months of treatment, we still have fleas. I grant you, the problem has improved significantly but we do still have fleas. It seems that the first week after treatment, we see no fleas or eggs at all, but then as the month progresses, they start reappearing. I will continue buying this since it has been more effective than anything else. We are still using a multi-pronged approach - treating the pets and the yard and home with the IGI and insecticide sprays. I hate having to use the insecticide sprays, but these fleas were killing my fur-babies. I had to take drastic measures. I do want to warn everyone that this product will not work very well at all if you do not follow the directions for application TO THE LETTER. It's not as simple as just dripping it on their backs. We have had several news reports recently about improper application of these "spot" type treatments being a big part of why they do not work very well and/or why pets get sick from their use. Read and follow the directions, exactly. That being said, don't waste your money on just any "spot" type treatment. Get the Frontline PLUS or you'll be shopping for another solution to your problem within a couple of weeks.

These blades came with no clear instructions, no diagram, and mostly in foreign languages. It took much too long to figure it out and even though they look the same as the ones they're replacing, I'm not even sure they work well now. Maybe that's because of my inexperience putting these things together. Once assembled, they did not clip well at all.If you know what you'r doing, ie; are a groomer or someone with lots of experience replacing blades on clippers, this was otherwise probably a good source.

Buster has long ago finished this bag but it was a super buy and he loves them!~ I never give him rawhide things to eat or chew...just the natural pig ears or strips. They even helped clean his teeth! He's still a happy camper at 14 and loves getting his favorite surprise!
These boots are very stiff and our dog would not move when wearing these. It is very hard to put them on, as they stretch very little, and it was complete waste of money.

Before I tried this collar, we tried a regular chemical one. That one had an odor my wife and I both found unpleasant, so much so that we started avoiding our cat. Plus, the chemical collar did nothing to get rid of the fleas. So, we tried this one instead. It was better than the chemical one in one major way: it smelled terrific. Even now, after 2 months on the cat, it smells very nice. Unfortunately the fleas remained - we had to kill them with some pills. I do not know if this collar will prevent re-infestation, but it definitely did not get rid of existing fleas. One other disadvantage is that there is no safety release, which makes me a little worried.

I was dissapointed in this one. The only way to get the treats out is to tug it on the ground but the rope encourages the dog to carry it around, throw it around etc... You have to fill it up to get the treats to come out and sorry but I don't want to give my dog 2 days worth of food. Maybe I would have been better off buying the smaller one.

Our dog loved this goose. It has a squeaker in it, but this one actually makes a goose call. Bella loved it soo much that she did end up ripping it apart. But it took her a few days. And who can blame large dogs for tearing these things to shreds. They are meant to look like the animals they naturally hunt. She loved it and she even loved it once all the stuffing was out of it. I'm getting another one today.

My poor cats were infested with fleas. One of my cats was really itching away and starting to pull the fur from her neck. We bought the Frontline Plus to try and help kill the fleas on the cats - well, they still have fleas. Of course, we are aware that we need to rid the fleas from the environment also (we are going to bomb today), but the frontline did not keep the fleas off of the cats in the mean time. We are going to try Advantage next. I know people who use that over the frontline and see more results.

We bought this gate for our entry way, which is very wide area with a step that our 6 month old was trying to crawl down. It is one of the longest baby gates on the market currently. However, the product description states that the gate is 8 1/2 feet wide (102"), but the gate we received is only 94". It is 6" short! Unfortunately 94" was too short to secure our entry way. My husband ended placing a 2x4 up between the end of the gate and the wall. We decided to use the product and keep it, as we couldn't find a longer one, but I wish it had been the length it was advertised. Otherwise, the gate latches well and is sturdy.

This bench seat cover is great for washing, but it lacks a good way to keep it in place on the back of the seat. Once the dogs walk around and laydown and get up it starts to streatch eventually the elastic will come apart. Would not buy again.
I wouldn't recommend this toy for a dog that is a strong chewer. The music is annoying but it drives our dog crazy in a good way for him. Good size toy for a medium size dog.

This crate is a good quality product. I researched several different brands of fabric crates and found this one to be easy to setup and take down and made well. My only suggestion for the company would be to try and make the mesh of lighter color so as not to absorb the heat from the sun (when outside) and to allow better vision for the dog inside and for the owner to observe dog from outside the crate. Also, it would be a nice addition to have zipper "locks" on it just in case a dog "tested" the zipper.Our two grown labs each have used it and seem to be comfortable in it. We have the 36" long (blue) crate.

I bought this product to go inside a kennel that i also purchased. I like this bed in that it is pretty. But it really isn't quite as padded as I'd hoped it would be. But it looks very nice inside my punch pink kennel.

This helped my dog start growling instead of stop barking.He figured it out pretty quick. If he let out a few yaps, it went off, so he just started doing a deeper bark / growl - maybe I just have a smart dog!

I have a Classic Kennel that I bought from Petco for $55. I wanted a second crate for crate training and bought this one because I thought they were comparable. They are not.The Petmate kennel is made from flimsy plastic compared to the Classic Kennel. You can feel the plastic flex on the Petmate. The Classic Kennel has quality screws that attach the top to the bottom; the Petmate has cheap molded plastic clips. The door fits perfectly on the Classic Kennel; the door is ill-fitted on the Petmate and is difficult to close.Basically, it looks like the Petmate went with the cheapest materials to keep their costs down. I would not transport an animal in it, although I will keep it for crate training. Too difficult to return.Update: 6/9/2009After having this kennel for about 1 week, I have been able to get the door to close by taking the reviewer's advice above. I cut away some of the plastic to the kennel opening. I also had to reverse the door (open right to left). However, the cheap plastic clips that hold the kennel together keep popping off.

The motor part has design flaws. The motor is heavy but the two holding clips are very small and fragile. Mine broke on arrival, Please see the uploaded phone above. So when you attach the motor to the container not carefully, I can see they will easily break. Phone calls to Hagen generated no answers. "if you like to speak to the operator, please say yes". After I say "yes", then the phone will ring and ring and ring, after it rings for a while, a voice says"that's a invalid entry". then it restarts the "if you like to speak to the operator, please say yes" cycle.This is very upsetting b/c I was depending on the filter to replace my malfunctioning Aqueon. Now I don't know if I should just return it to amazon, or just try to contact hagen to send me a replacement motor, and that won't happen at least for a week. Meantime, what should I do?Second thought, Hagen has some quality control issues. I also had an aquaclear 30 gallon filter, and after a while it started to leak water from the motor/container junction. But I had another aqaclear 20 that worked just fine for 8 months. I know it may not be a fair assessment based on broken clips, but no customer service by phone during work hours is totally ridiculous for such a big international company.

I use the product mostly to prevent ticks from getting on my dogs. Advantix works really well. Once applied Advantix is totally effective within two days. Even during this first day or so tick might get on the dog, but will not break the skin to feed. After a few days the ticks will not even get on the dog. I check my dogs after every walk and do not find any tick or fleas. I find the application lasts more than a month. This is a very effective product, also does not irritate my dogs skin like some other product I have used. I would recommend this product to a friend.

I have a litter pan just like the one pictured for the product so I thought thats what I was getting. It was not what I got the litter pan I received is slightly different It works for what we need but I do like the one shown in the picture better.

This feeder works fine, however, it is the most difficult thing to clean I've ever had! First of all the container is a really awkward shape. It does not fit in your hand very well due to it's wide girth. An old soda bottle would be easier to handle! Secondly, it has a very small mouth which makes it difficult to insert a bottle brush. Then on the inside there are small plastic squiggles that hold the nectar dispensing buttons on which are also difficult to clean. The other problem is emptying the bottle. It's flattened at the bottom and even with vigorous shaking you can never completely empty it.If they were to change the shape of the bottle (make it smaller in girth and widen the mouth) It could be a great product!

Smooth transaction. Shipping was prompt. I use Advantage every year and it works great. The only problem I have with this order is: I don't see an expiration date anywhere on the box nor on the tubes. This makes me wonder how old the product is. I'm sure the Expiration date is somewhere among the numbers but I have no clue where to find the date. I just applied the product 2 days ago. We shall see.
How does this toy compare to the Ultimate Rings? I've tried the stuffed animal versions of these toys, but they never last as long as the rings. Does the Bowmerang hold up?

I bought this product (size: small, sold by amazon, LLC) for my 18 lbs. Sheltie. The collar fits her snugly and stays in place on her neck. There are lots of ribbons, making the collar look very full. There are also tons of little red and green jingle bells. Unlike other collars like this which glue accessories on the end of the ribbons, the jingle bells are actually tired in place. I'm not sure if this makes them more or less secure as I'm not giving me dog the opportunity to see how well they are attached. My only complaint is that these are not true to size. I measured my dog's neck as slightly less than 10 inches. The collar is elastic and relaxed is much smaller than 10 in., but it does easily stretch to that size. I should have ordered a medium, but this one will be just fine for taking some cute Christmas pictures in.

The information states that this product will work with US Airways. But the height is 17" with a wire making it impossible to bend it down to the U.S. Airways maximimum height of not more than 15". I called Sherpa three times-no one answered in their Customer Services Section. On the fourth try, I got someone in account (no one from Customer Service picked out). The Accounting Person verified that this size was too big for most airlines.Petco required that I had to bring the bags back with a copy of the receipt from their confirmation (since I don't have a printer, that was difficult). But they eventually gave me my money back.Buyer, be aware. You can't use these bags on airplanes.

I have 2 large (17 lb) cats who tend to tip over the front door style boxes. For one of my cats, this was the perfect box. He could scratch and fling and there was no tracking. Perfect. Our other cat was a different story. She did not like going down into the box and at first she was clever and sat on the top and did her business into the hole, just like using a toilet. Good kitty!!! But then, she got sloppy and would just go anywhere on the top of the box. Ick. Bad Kitty!!! That was the end of that. Since it's just a glorified rubbermaid box, it now holds kindling wood in our garage. So, if it hadn't been for our stupid cat,this would have been the perfect litter box. Oh well, I'm still looking.

I got two of these, one for the Dane and one for the boxer. It is definitely big enough for the Dane (which I was a little worried about as she is closer to the 130-140 lb mark). I was very happy with the beds until we washed them as directed at the laundromat. They simply fell apart. The seams came loose and all the stuffing is now on my floor. Both beds are ruined and once again I am on the search for affordable bedding for two large dogs:(

I am echoing some of the earlier reviews of this product. First, the picture of two lids shown is misleading. Yes, I should have read the description better, but with two shown and a price of over $5, I naturally assumed I was getting two lids. Nope, only one showed up.Also, I have to agree with other users about the lack of usefulness for small cans. My cat will only eat food that comes in three-ounce cans. This seemed to be the only lid that would fit that small of a can. It went on easy enough, but the "just pull up on the kitty ears" thing is not really working. I now have a can of food in my fridge with this lid more or less permanently affixed.This is one of the most useless things I have ever spent $5 on.

I love the quality, ease, and size of this pen however, it took our 4 lb. yorkie-poo 5 mins. to figure out how to climb out. I then added the top. Due to the gaps between the velcro straps our little guy was able to climb up and slide under the gap of the top in no time.This would be awesome for a dog that is not a climber!

Love these smaller size cans that I can use up in one feeding and not have to cap and store in the fridge, BUT they're expensive! Like a dollar a can as compared to other cheaper brands which can run 79 cents for the huge size. What we do for our dogs!

I purchased the Kyjen Hide-A-Squirrel toy for my 3-year old "niece", a yellow Labrador retriever. She truly loves chew toys, and is extremely fond of ones that contain "squeakers" inside of them. Since I dogsit for my brother-in-law and his family when they are out of town, I wanted to get Bella something special during her time at my home for the week while they were gone.With that said, I picked up the Jumbo sized Kyjen Hide-A-Squirrel toy while it was on a Lightning Deal from Amazon. I liked the idea that this toy was more interactive for dogs and thus would provide hours of fun and enjoyment. When the product arrived, I liked that the size was suitable for large breed dogs, and I felt confident that the toy would last, as it seemed to be made of quality materials.This feeling lasted perhaps an hour when the first casualty arrived in the form of a gutted out squirrel with its guts strewn across my living room. A few hours later, squirrels #2 and #3 were also laid to rest and I had a sizable pile of white stuffing sitting on my kitchen table. I found that the stitched seams of the squirrels are a major weak point, as the seams easily tore apart during pet play. No other parts of the squirrels were damaged however, so I re-stuffed the squirrels and stitched them back up using heavier-duty thread.Aside from the rather weak stitched seams on the squirrels, the toy definitely exceeded my expectations where pet enjoyment and fun are concerned. Bella enjoys carrying the stump around, with the squirrels inside, and showing visitors how she can remove them from the tree. As far as overall quality goes though, the stitching on the toy definitely needs improvement, although if you're handy with needle and some good heavy thread, you can stitch up your squirrels without having to buy replacements.Overall, I would recommend this toy for dog owners, as long they are warned that some repair may be needed to the toy after a few hours of playtime.
Without knowing how my dog feels, it seems to do the job. Easy to pick him up when he has it on but always gives a funny look when you do (hey put me down man).

We bought this cat door to replace an older door with a flexible flap. While this is a big improvement over the vinyl flap varieties, this door is exceptionally drafty. Rain and snow also gets in if the wind is blowing.Don't plan to use this flap on an exterior door unless you've got a secondary way to protect against wind.

6 cats and no issues! I use to have two average litter pans and they would pee outside the pan and there would be litter laying all around the pan after a single use. It was just a burden cleaning everyday, but now since buying this litter box the mess has decreased 90 %! Shipping was fast!
Please do your research before buying anything. These items are not meant for guinea pigs. Don't buy them for your GP. It may be fine for smaller rodents, but not GP!

We bought this product from our vet for our 5 year old lab mix. Before starting Cosequin DS it seemed she was fairly uncomfortable when getting up from laying down and had a hard time getting up on the bed. On cold days she was really stiff and had a hard time moving around. Our vet told us to start her out with two in the morning with breakfast and one with her dinner. We started this regimen on December 28th and, after less than three weeks, the change in her is phenomenal! She is running and playing with our other dogs again and jumping up on the bed is now a breeze. I can see she is a much happier dog and I only regret that we didn't try this sooner.I highly recommend this product but I also highly recommend talking to your veterinarian before using this or any other product to make sure this is right for your pet.

I just received this cute toy however my cat has already managed to remove the ball from the ring. I didnt think the ball could be removed by a cat, but it was. I do not own a lion, tiger or cheetah. I own a regular house cat. My question is, do I own a Super Cat or is the product I received defective?

We purchased this crate for travel with our Labradoodle puppy. The crate is very easy to set up. Seemed comfortable enough. Unfortunately, it is not meant for a puppy. Our little guy chewed through the covering on the base of the crate (which was just a piece of hard plywood with a zippered lambskin cover), chewed the plywood base and chewed through the mesh on the side of the crate. He didn't do it all in one sitting but this crate only lasted us a few months. I would only recommend this crate for folks with more mature dogs.

We recently purchased the newest LitterMaid. After a month of use, we have decided it is worse than manually scooping the litter. Four to five times a day we have to go and scoop the litter box manually because the motor is not strong enough to push the rake to the end of the litter box. Instead, it will keep going back and forth from the middle to the back. We have attempted reducing the litter, but this does not help. The "improved" rake also does not scoop all of the feces when it does scoop. I think that since this company charges so much money on this product that they could use some of it on improvements for future versions of the Litter Maid. The older version was much better than this one. If I could go back and make my purchase again, I would have bought the older version again.

This perch bends over with 2 quaker parrots on it. There is no way it could hold a cockatoo or a macaw. Though it is fun for my quakers to tear up, I wouldn't recomment it for anything bigger than a conure.

Our German Shepherd was scratching all the time when the season changed, we live in New England. We thought at first allergies but then realized it was probably dry skin. A few applications of Kalaya Emu Oil and his scratching stopped and we now just maintain with a spray every week. Great product.
I have a mini schnauzer and I have been feeding her puppy wellness until she was one which is when i got her this one. She likes it a lot and i think she is happy and healthy!

My dog lost his favorite frisbee--I don't know the brand, but it had an opening in the middle which made it easier for him to pick up off the ground. Anyway, of course as soon as we received the Kong, we found the other frisbee. Kong is OK so far. He's not managed to tear it up, and he chews up everything. It's a little heavy when flying.

This product is not as good at cleaning as it represents, you cannot get near the bottom of the aquairium, nor hear the top where the most buildup exists. I would rather use the sponges with the non-scratch cleaning side along with a long handled brush to do the job once a week.

We've tried a lot of different treats for our dog. Some are more successful than others, but these ones seem to be a hit even after the novelty of them has worn off. While there is some debate on chicken treats for dogs that have come from China, the Dogswell people have very high standards for their treats and they are sold at Whole Foods -- who are in themselves very picky about their vendors and the quality of the products sold at their stores.Your dog will love these treats -- and our dog's coat certainly has never looked better!

I decided to find these locally, and am very glad I did. The bag of "large" bully sticks is anything but. There were mixed sizes, many considerably smaller than a pencil. The pet store wanted $39 and change for the bag. So, if you need the thicker bully sticks for a heavy duty chewer, you'd be better off looking else where.

First I have no issues with the seller. This product is cheap. I have 3 dogs. 2 labs 70 pounds & a german shepard 100 pounds. I have purchased 2 of this brand. Both pulled apart at the handle & unraveled while on walks. My dogs are very well behaved & do not pull much. I would expect a leash to last more than a month. Walmart sells a similar brand for half the price (less than $8). The reflective material stays on much better & the leash from Walmart has lasted almost a year with out pulling apart. I have already replaced this red leash with a red one from Walmart & will be buying a 2nd black one to replace the blue one I bought.
Looks great for cichlids!! Really brings out the blues in fish. I'm happy with this product. Much better than the standard perfecto bulb.
Good introduction for anyone considering getting a Boston Terrior. The background "music" in the video is obnoxious and dis-tracting. HP Dallas

The toy is good, but the little feet on them don't last long with heavy chewers. The noise of it makes it more fun for them but as I said don't be surprised when the feet are gone, and u are picking it up outside. JW Pet Co was great though. I did complain thinking that is a defect in them and they did replace them with no questions asked. It is just the toy itself that isn't as tough as I hoped.

This product really works well. I have a 7 year old pup who was starting to show signs of weak hips and stiffness. I could see that her joints were a bit stiff because it took her a while to sit or lay down. However, after a few weeks on this product, she's sitting much more quickly and she doesn't struggle with sitting or laying down.The downside to this product is that she doesn't like it!! Its a chalky pill that she spits out every time I give it to her. I have to coax her with a treat but its starting to get a bit tedious to bribe her every day. Good thing I bought the small bottle! Once its done (10 more to go!), I'm switching to something more palatable.

I have given my cats this catnip, and they don't really react much at all from it. They just roll around in it, and that is all. They don't get catnip that often, so I don't know if it is the product, or that my cats have a high tolerance to catnip. Thanks.

I bought this toy for my 9 month old lab and had to return this twice. My dog loved it, but he dropping it on our hardwood floors and the bottom twist off part broke with each one. Good concept but plastic too brittle. Company does stand behind it, just not good for my dog.

PROS: Overall, we like the drinkwell fountain for our cats, and they like it too. If we had a place to put another one, would even have a second fountain somewhere else in the apartment.CONS: Constant issues with the motor. With the first fountain, the motor eventually broke and made a REALLY loud noise, so we bought an entire second fountain. With this one, the motor seems to be slightly too large of a circumference for the hole it fits in, and is almost impossible to turn it and get it out. We tried it in both the old fountain bowl and the new one and it is just not the correct size. So now we have the choice of a loud motor or practically spraining a hand getting it in and out.It was already difficult in general to deal with the original motor with the way that there is only a tiny place to brace your hand when turning it, but this too-large-motor takes an extreme amount of elbow grease (difficult to do with nowhere to brace your hand without breaking the bowl). Ordered a replacement motor from petsafe.com, but this is Drinkwell's last chance. If this one doesn't work, I'm buying a completely different brand of fountain. Lastly, a pain to take apart and clean all of the pieces, but as other reviewers have said, if you use filtered water (we always have), you can easily get away with cleaning only once a week, which is not bad.However, overall, the fountain works well (once the motor is in) and I think has encouraged the cats to drink more. Would love to give 5 stars if the motor wasn't always such an enormous problem.

While it looks pretty good, I had to have a carpenter build in a wooden rail around the inner circumference to keep the litter and the pee in the pan. I've had it for a couple of years now and the door is beginning to come loose and the finish to chip. The manufacturer should upgrade the design and the materials for what is overall a really good idea.

Below is the original post. A few months later the nozzle, no matter how many times you soak it will only drip. I would buy a replacement but I can't find one anywhere. I wish there was more competition in the market for this. I still use it but it is not enough.*************************************************This product is great. It not only saves you loads of time from hand pumping the mist but also gives your pet and plants what they need. No matter what your schedule is , your pet/ plant is getting fresh water and the terranium has increased humidity levels. At first my veiled chameleon was thrown off from the sound but he got used to it in less than 2 days. Its also great for the ficus I have in their because I have two heat lamps on in the winter and the constant mist (I have it scheduled to mist for 60 seconds every hour) prevents the tree from drying out. Important tip is to use filtered water or else you will have to soak the nozzle in vinegar really often. I really think it is great. I just went away on vacation and had my friend come to feed him. It was great to know that he had access to water the day she wasn't able to show up.

This harness definitely stopped both my dogs from pulling, but it does that by squeezing their front legs together, which isn't necessarily a bad thing, and is definitely better than pulling at their necks and choking them.I think I had it fit correctly, but the reason that I took away two stars is that this rubbed both my long haired Golden and my short haired Dobie mix raw in their armpits. The harnesses were used for running with the dogs, and they may have just been on too tight, but I stopped using them after these rashes developed. I still prefer this company's Gentle Leader, which is a head collar. It stops pulling just as well as the Easy Walk.

The bed arrived on time and was easy to assemble. It is rugged and should serve as a bed for my Labrador retriever for many years. The only problems I found was that the bolts work themselves loose if you move the bed often. This could have been avoided had they provided lock washers with the bolts.

My dog loves this. He will chase it until he drops. However, it is not made real well. The laser keeps going off and you have to twist the image plate on the end just a bit to get it to come back on every 30 seconds or so. But, we are still enjoying it.

As a long time owner of automatic litter boxes I find the new design to be structurally negative. The only good effect of the newer design over older designs, is that a larger cat may find it more room but... here are the problems.1. The larger size is design in a thinner plastic, double walls with space between. Creates a weak structur, bulky, flimsy and subject to cracks or breakage.2. Makes you feel you are getting more for the NOW high price; but it is overkill in size and takes up too much space. I still keep one of my old old, smaller litter boxes because the structure is well made and it is easier to take with me when I travel with my cat, and easier to find a place that gives me aesthetics beside function. Its size causes my cat to throw more litter around and I'm constantly cleaning up the floor around it.. not so with the smaller model.3. The rake is good but now it is a chore to put the bottom of the container for the dirty litter into place. Again I believe the cheaper design probably saves the company money and I pay for it in fustration.4. You have to be careful in moving it around. The bulk creates few hand holds and if your not careful you put strain on a weak part. I have spent a lot of time glueing this costly unit together while my old old Litter Maid is still strong and has been packed back and forth across the United States a few times. This new design is just moved so I can sweep under it and I dare not do much moving unless I take it apart and move each piece seperate.5. Unless you have this massive problem with a litter box running at night when you sleep, the clock is useless and you shouldn't buy into gimicks. Just turn the switch off at night. Give me a break.6. Don't know how much clean air or dust it keeps down. I have no visable way of knowing if it really works?Should you buy one? Well the stores don't seem to carry the less expensive litter box, put out by this company. And I didn't find them on line so I assume the company has decided bigger, cheaper and cost more is the way to go. All are over $100 now and the $89 old models were superior. All I can say is 'Litter Maid, you had a good product but greed is ruining your creation'.

This was just so gosh darn cute on my black pug! Loved it! Because of the reviews I read about this running small I decided to go for a size Large even though 'small' was the recommendation for Pugs. But he is stocky, pudgy pug so I was worried about getting something too small. Large was definately too big for a Pug, even a fat one(22-25lbs). I was able to sew it up a bit so it was still quite usuable and adorable but a Medium would be the most ideal size.
Our hamster didn't like this nearly as much as he does the ball, it does look cool, but for actual use, I would just go with the ball!
Did nice things for my cat's joints but gave her intolerable diarhea. (not sending video...)

My betta fish's water was mostly in the 60-degree range, below a betta's ideal temperature (70-80F). As a result, the betta was very inactive. I bought this heater for a one-gallon bowl, and it increased the water temperature about 10 degrees. Now the betta is very active.Even though the specs say it's designed for a 2-5 gallon tank, I'd still recommend it for a 1-gallon bowl. Just keep an eye on the ambient temperature because this heater does not have an automatic shutoff.
i ordered this because the picture shows it as black. i wanted to replace my ugly clear intake. THIS ITEM IS NOT BLACK. It is CLEAR!!!!!!

These catnip bananas are over the top! The cats just love them. I gave one to a friend and his cat went bonkers so they had to take it away! If you want to really give your feline friend a blast- get one of these, you wont be disappointed(neither will the cat!)
Yellow lab ripped the thing up in 5 minutes after i left him alone with it. It doesn't fly like a frisbee either to heavy.

My cats think it's great. I bought it because my girl cat insists on drinking from taps, and I thought a 'cat-tap' might make her happier.She loves it.NOTE: if the fountain doesn't flow all over the bowl, check whether the pump intake is clogged. Ours got fur in it somehow, and it just needed a light clean with a brush.

This is nice material, soft and made well. My only real complaint is it is very thin and my dog needs to have more of a cusion to lay on. I would recommend to put over a cusion or use for a cover on couch for favorite place for a dog/cat to lay on.

We put this heater in a small insulated outside pet house for a small, "dropped off" cat we adopted, but can not bring into our home. Since the tempature falls into the single digits at night here, we wanted to give the little guy a chance to survive. He seems to love it, and spends every night a little warmer than he would otherwise be.IT'GREAT!!!

I've had this feeder for just over a year. It's a pretty good feeder for occasional use. I've only used it for weekends away. The motor just failed after one year, just beyond the warranty period. I have read other reviews that had this problem, but it seemed to be the ones using it everyday or at least on a regular basis. I think I'll still buy this one again, if I can't find something better. Decide if it's worth the cost of replacing it once a year.

I ordered 2 of these leashes. One was obviously brand new and still had the tags on it. The other one is a piece of crap that looks used! No tags and it was all unraveling and falling apart. Who would put an item like this in a package?? They need to be fired ASAP. Don't waste your time and money.

I purchased one of these a year or two ago for my two chinchillas. They almost never sit on it, even in summertime when it's warmer. I have two ceramic tiles (6"x8", which I got for free) in their cage and they prefer those over the granite stone. The product itself is fine - durable and easy to clean, but they just don't seem to use it.

The product arrived quickly and neatly packaged. I didn't notice any issues after the first few doses however I did find one capsule had leaked out of the applicator and into the plastic packaging; I had to try and rub what I could on my cat to get use out of it. Not ideal for about $9/capsule.

I ordered this post primarily because of its size. This is a large scratching post, the top of it is even with the top of the back of my sofa. I really suspect the sofa was occasionaly still used as a scratcher because of it offered a bigger stretch than the small posts I'd made available.After placing this post in a common location and moving one of the smaller rope wound posts to the side, I see the cats using it frequently, but also still see them using the small rope one as well.In my attempt at cat mind reading:1) Texture and feel: Excellent, as good or better than the back of the sofa.2) Height: Ecellent, allows for big stretches.3) Stability: the base is sufficiently large and firmly mounted that there's no fear that it is going to be tipped over.4) Complaint: when reaching up high on the post to scratch, hind legs often get up onto the wide base of the post. The base of the post is smooth so that hind paws slip with no grip and the stretch feels uncomfortable and unstable. Carpet or other grip coating on the top of wide base would make for a much more stable hind paws for those long high scratchings.

Bought this because of the KONG name. My 11 yr. old labrador loved the squeaker in it but chewed it up by the second day. I had hoped KONG would be worth the money and provide a toy that would last longer then the cheap plastic ones.
Im noticing a buzzing noise when the dimmer is not at full power, does anyone else notice this?? otherwise, it works well with the stand and i like the way it can be mounted for safety.

We have been using this system for about 9 months for our labs and it worked up until Christmas day when our dog stopped traffic on a busy highway because his collar stopped working. When we retrieved him from the highway patrol the first thing we noticed was that three of the four screws on his collar receiver were gone, so the box was hanging partially open and was very wet inside since it was raining that day. The night before when we took his collar off for the night, it was completely in tact with all screws in place. We kept our dogs in their pen or in the house for the next two days. At that point I thought his collar receiver may have dried out and while I was waiting for the replacement screws I replaced the battery and tested it out. No go, blinked once or twice and dead. At that point I took the receiver box from our other dog's collar and attached it to his collar (bigger neck), tested it, and all was working well. We still kept the dogs with us at all times for the next day. That night my husband opened the back door to the let the dogs out to do their business at about 10pm on our 5 acres that is surrounded by the in-ground fence wire. A few minutes later he called for them to come in and only one returned. Our boy was gone again. We spent the next hour with me stationed at the nearest freeway on ramp and my husband driving around our neighborhood and checking back at the house. My husband followed the scent of a skunk and found our dog about a mile from our house. When he arrived home and prepared to bathe him, he removed the collar and again three screws were missing! It was also raining that night, so another collar probably bites the dusk. At least our dog is okay and no one was hurt, well, except and unhappy skunk. But, now we are faced with forking out another $150 for new collars because the screws appear to just fall out. Keep in mind we had only opened the battery compartments twice - once to initially install a battery and again at 6 months when we replaced the batteries to insure that we didn't have a battery failure issue. I used a manual screwdriver each time, so the screws were not stripped, but in firmly. We had never had a problem before and handled the collars daily when we took them off for the night. We invested a fair amount of money in this system, actually purchasing two complete systems, so that we have a back up unit, as well as multiple additional spools of wire to surround 5 acres...not to mention the dr bills for the poison oak treatment for my hubby after he finished installing the wire around the property ;). I'm fearful that screws just falling out could jeopardize the entire system and put our dogs and others at risk. Check your collars daily!

Regardless of whether this collar works for training and control I have 2 beefs with it. The links on mine are soooo hard to pinch to remove and replace. This is the only way to put this collar on and off if you have it sized properly. Some are made with a quick release- this one is not and was not advertised to so it does not lose points for that, but there must be some way of making the links easier to pinch. I have seen videos of how this is done and it does not look that hard. Maybe I am weak but when it is not on the dog it is not so bad but trying to pinch the 2 prongs together, line them up with the holes on an excited dog while trying not to pull it any tighter is painful for my fingers! Yes I tried the trick where you put one prong in one hole then just pinch to get the other one in but still think it is harder than it needs to be.More annoying is that you can't leave the rubber tips on the link you are using to open the collar. You could put them back on after you have the collar on the dog but it would be very difficult and then you would have to get them off before you could open the collar. This leaves one link that can not effectively have the rubber tips - maybe not a big deal but annoying! Otherwise this is a durable collar that is what it is. I wish I had gotten one with the quick relase closure and may end up with one of those soon.
coat in the front (front of 2 legs) was way too big for my shih tzu...also the coat smelled really bad...like a strong chemical was poured on it or something...definitely returning.

Wow - the FURminator deShedding tool really does an outstanding job on our two cats. Neither enjoys being brushed but both let us groom them with the FURminator. I can't get over the amount of loose fur that it removes. A real "plus" is the significant decrease in fur balls. I highly recommend this grooming aid.

My Rott loves these, I just wish they were tougher. She plays with them for about 30 min, then just crushes them, pulls all the nubs off and then tears the shells to pieces. I salvage the batteries then buy a new one.

The product is good. No Complaint about it. But never trust Asena Shop. It never replies your e-mail if you want to return. I lost $69.95 without opening the item b/c its ignorance while returning items, even I followed its procedure.

Stopped giving this product to my 9 yr old lab mix because she developed really bad diarrhea. Now I have her on probiotics and scheduled a vet appointment. Other than her having a weight issue, she has never been sick. Sorry I switched to this food.

I found that it did nothing to keep my dogs from barking. Even though I placed it in close proximity to where they bark, it did not work at all. My daughter however, complained that it botheres "Her" ears.

Guess this will go to barn for the outside cats to play with. I purchased because looks like one of my one cat Rocky's fav toy (except for legs on it) ,but none of the 3 house cats wanted to play with it. Filled catnip i had in other toys they love to play with( havent used the catnip that came with it). Is first cat toy from amazon i have got house cats, maybe smells wrong to them, got one from Petco store and Pets Plus store day before this toy arrived and they play with those toys.Hard to understand but thats how it rolls sometimes...
The product looks and works great. I've watched squirrels fall off the top dome when trying to get at the seed.

My cat Sully has been in early renal failure for about 5 years now. In addition to giving him subcutaneous fluids, he has been giving Epakitin with every meal and has been stable for the past 5 years! Get the big container and save lots of money.
Frontline plus effectively prevents fleas and other bugs on my dog. I like that it's waterproof so it's still effectively even if I take a bath for my dog within the 30 days.

We've had this for over a month now for our guinea pigs. It comes with the most explicit directions I've seen on a water bottle. As other reviewers noted, you need horizontal bars (2) at the correct distance apart to hang this. You do need to use both hangars or it leaks. We always fill the bottle full of water (never partially full), and when you invert it to hang, it does squirt water and then does a slow drip while building a vacuum. If we're lucky, one of the guinea pigs decides to drink while it's dripping, and then it stops soon after. We have a plastic container to catch drips under the water bottle, and with this water bottle, it never overflows. We always had problems with the previous two (smaller) water bottles that would slowly drip over a couple of days and fill up the container and get everything wet. I'd give it five stars but it does need the horizontal bars and it does get stuff wet when you initially hang it.

I wanted something for my dog and didn't want to spend a lot of money on it. This is kind of expensive for the material. The fabric is just cheap, I'm planning on making something waterproof one day. The sponge seat is just a big sponge and I'm sure that doesn't cost that much. But I guess I have no other choice since there aren't many pet car seat to choose from.I got small since it's good for dogs up to 18 lbs. I have a mini schnauzer and he's 14 lbs now, but I don't think he will grow much anymore since both of his parents are only 10 lbs. But this car seat is kind of small for my dog. I don't know how any 18lb dog can fit in it. He can sort of lay down but not like the picture. There's no way he can be in this seat like the picture. Either he has to sit, or he has to stand diagonally, or he has to curl up in it. I'm still going to use this though.Now I think about it, I think it would be better if they also had the dimensions of inside of the seat.

We got the salmon and the peanut butter flavors for our puppies, and they go crazy for them. They were really hard to potty train, but these were small and healthy enough that we were able to give them to our dogs every time they pottied outside. They worked great for that, and our dogs finally got the message! But they really don't smell appetizing, and even one of the salmon ones will make their breath smell terrible for a whole day!I'm giving it 4 stars for that reason. If your dogs like them as much as ours do, I think it's well worth the stinky breath.
The only thing that can change the nitrate levels are water changes every day until levels go down. Plants are also a big factor-get and keep them if the fish you have don't eat them all, my fish do!
This may be a great dematting tool, but not on my Old English. It ripped his hair out and was too painful to use. I ended up just cutting the mat out with scissors.

I was really excited about this product before I actually got it. Cats naturally prefer moving water (like drinking from the faucet) over still water (like their pristine water bowl you just filled). However, the design is seriously flawed. The water and filter chambers have little niches and indentations which are virtually impossible to clean without running the unit through the dishwasher (and who wants to do that daily?). A layer of slime builds up on the inside within a few days, reminiscent of algae in a pond (yum!) The filter compartment traps food and fur so it's not in the bowl, but all the remaining water gets pushed through the collected gunk, which means all the water tastes bad. Definitely not useful for leaving the cat by himself over the weekend, because he won't drink water that tastes bad, even if he is the one who got the food and fur in it.
This stuff is great for getting odors out of a dog's fur. Best product I've ever found for stinky dogs!

This bed is perfectly sized for a kennel however, my lab mix puppy destroyed it almost immediately. This behavior isn't unusual for a lab but this bed is pretty chintzy and very easy to break down. You get what you pay for.

For a price that was around a third of what the big chain pet stores were charging I was expecting the worst. I got the 48" lights I ordered and all 4 worked perfectly. I returned the pet store lights and saved a bundle!

It does work. It just takes a while to get rid of those pesky mites. Expect weeks of treatment with a bad infestation. Many of the cats I rescue have severe infestations. Wish there was a better quicker remedy for their sake.

I must say that my dog and all at the dog park LOVE these treats. Even the very fussy boxer sniffs at my pocket waiting for them. The sizes are quite variable which is ok.The product arrived with no protective covering on either the outside of the tub or under the lid which bothered me a bit (not sure if they had been open, returned by someone, then sent to us) so that is why I rated 3 stars.The amount of product for the price is great!I would most likely purchase again.

I have bought this toy a few times for our pups. They like to play with soft toys, but most last only a few minutes before being destroyed. The stone bones usually last 1-2 weeks before they are too torn up to be safe. Our pups are 8 month old, 45 lb. lab/terrier mixes.
we tryed this with our yorkie-poo puppy we put it on a blanket on the back of our couch dident make a difference she still jumps up thare BOUNDARY PET REPELLENT DOSE NOT WORK

this thing is a waste of time.. first of all the instructions are not even close to how to work it,. .. after getting the timer to work (things like see page 6... there IS no page 6)... when plugged in all it did was give food constantly.. timer be damned.. its a horrid waste of two days... huge piece of junk.. DONT bother.. (the ergo water dispenser however we like)..
This clamps very tightly to my grooming table and hold my dryer in place without any fuss, leaving my hands free.
I wish it did the job but my neighbor has cats and they are always at my home did not do the job

My 4 kitties all give it two paws up, especially the younger ones who are fascinated by running water. They do seem to drink more, which is what I was hoping for. I agree with others that the motor is less than perfect. Mine sometimes doesn't pump initially, but it'll work if I unplug it and plug it back in. If the motor is noisy (we have a tile floor) it usually helps to unplug it briefly and/or shift its position slightly. I tried a folded towel as someone suggested and it helped but it was one more thing to clean. Speaking of cleaning, I give it a rinse-out once or twice a week and it's been fine. So although there's room for improvement I've been satisfied with it, and my cats certainly are!

We saw these and thought about how easy they would be to clean and they are. This is the first year we have used them and more than half of them leak and it is very difficult for my wife to put them back together.

I love the stickers but I paid more for the shipping than I did the decal! When ordering I couldn't understand why it cost so much to mail until I recieved the decal. It came in a 4" by 6" box when they could have just mailed it in an envelope! I thought that was ridiculous and wasteful. Despite the shipping I am glad I bought it and I am glad there are companies that care as much for my pets as I do.

My cat needed a waterer, especially cause she kept tipping over/playing in her water bowl. She never spills water/plays with her water with this waterer. I like this unit, cause all I need to do is drain water out of it every 5 days or so. She'll drop her food in her water, leave it there, and her water will get all 'yucky'.In addition, since I filled the item when I got it several weeks ago, I haven't had to re-fill it. So convenient!

The Dental Kong with a rope is a great toy for dogs who like to chase things and chew on them. And that includes most dogs. This toy sort of simulates say a small pray animal that dogs normally would chase. I throw it and my dog chases after it. When she gets it she shakes it around vigorously like a dog would do if it caught say a rabbit and then chews on it. The ropes are easily chewed threw by heavy chewers in a short period of time but the rope is made of cotton so there is no danger if the dog ingests small pieces of the rope. And the Kong Company sells replacement ropes with instructions for tying the special knots at each end for a nominal charge and they don't charge anything for shipping them. Don't be tempted to use replacement ropes made of anything but cotton, nylon or polypropylene for example from other sources, as this material will harm your dog if ingested.I would give this dog toy five stars if the ropes lasted longer but that is the only shortcoming in this terrific toy and I really don't see how the toy could have the appeal it does for my dog without the rope.

This did not work as I had expected. The magnet strength was not very strong. It constantly disconnected when I was trying to clean the tank. This must be known because they give you a piece to thread to pull the fallen piece up.
I love this brand of dog food but the pups just didn't like this particular flavor....

I have bought a number of these in varying sizes. At least 50% of the time, I have to return them because the mounting screws are not threaded properly it makes it impossible to turn the butterfly bolts. I had to use a wrench on one occasion ~ that one was returned. These DO rust as the mounting part is not made of stainless steel so keep that in mind if you are using near or for water. I have some plastic crate cups that work much better, however they cost a lot more money. For the price on these, it is a decent value. Be prepared to return for an exchange if you order this. It is a crap shoot if you will or will not get one that is hard to unscrew and mount.

We bought this for our fairly calm golden retriever and it worked well until he figured out that it was worth the mild shock to get to the interesting smells beyond the fence. At first we felt guilty that we would "hurt" him with the shock, so tested it on ourselves and it really is about the same feel as when you shock yourself with static electricity -- uncomfortable but no pain. After a few weeks of him running the fence, we lost our fear of hurting him and ordered the "stubborn" dog collar (which I thought of for more pit bull/german shepherd dogs, not this teddy bear of a retriever.) Despite having to buy 2 collars now (actually 3 because he somehow got off and chewed up the first), I am thankful to Petsafe for providing a more economical route of electric fence than the big companies who only offer a total package with installation. Am hoping that the stubborn collar works better. Also like it that the stubborn collar works with 9V batteries that we can find at drugstore rather than having to special order ones.

It's an excellent tool for training so long as the batteries are charged. They lose their charge quickly. Don't rely on it to keep your dog under control, you should have a backup just in case it stops working.

I did not like because the device turn off as the dog walk. The switch is very sensitive to move and this include when I storage the device. Sometimes the light turn on and waste the battery. I have two dogs and I place the leash and all walking equipment together. Do not worth the money. I had a light collar that works better. I bought this to replaced one of my dogs night light. He likes roll in the snow and lost his light collar.
Horrible waste of money. DO NOT BUY! They are not a good fit. Litter everywhere! Very messy as soon as my cat stepped in the dome the bag came of the sides and litter went all under the bag.

all he wanted to do is sniff the bottle of bubbles! He didn't pay any attention to the bubbles sitting all around him, on the floor, desk, shoe, anything they landed on, they just sat there looking pretty! These would be EXCELLENT decorations for a party, shower, or centerpiece for holidays or birthdays, because they do last a LOOOOONG time, but MY DOG did not find them very interesting. I'll give them to my nieces.
I found with my lab that a shock collar works better. But this training collar works great if you you want your dog on a leash!

This is a darling little stuffed creature along with the eggs. However, my dog, who's pretty intelligent, cannot get the eggs out of the fish. The opening that the eggs are to fit through is far too small even for human hands. The eggs are great alone cause they squeek and are easy to play fetch with! However, the purpose of challenging the dog to retrieve the eggs from inside the fish has missed its mark totally!

My biggest concern when buying a dog crate was finding a good quality crate that was big enough for my 100 Lb doberman. I already owned two black wire crates for my other dogs (and I thought they were very good quality,) but they were given to me, so I don't know what brand they are. I read many reviews for other crates saying that they were flimsy and arrived bent. The Midwest Life Stages had very few claims of bent crates, so I decided to go with it. It arrived in perfect condition, took some prying to get one of the sides up, and is perfect! There is also a latch to keep the heavy plastic tray from sliding out. Boomer seems likes it and it is definitely big enough. He is 100 pounds, but not overweight at all, so he's a pretty tall boy. I will never buy another brand.
This works great. You do get litter on the floor at first but it is worth it to get rid of litter forever!

I've owned three Litter Maids and had to return all three. Terrible, terrible product. It's not just that they break, they didn't even work well while they worked. I finally splurged on the Litter Robot and love it. It works perfectly, and even though it costs $300, you don't have to buy any special contianers like the Litter Maid, and it's also extremely frugal with litter. Over the long run I believe the Litter Robot is actually less expensive. Believe me, just save yourself time and money and get the Litter Robot.

Our golden retriever is the worst combination of dog: massive chewer and smart. By smart, I mean rocket science smart. I thought we had come upon the perfect toy for him. He was licking and biting at the treat and it was great. He had something to do and it seemed the treat would last forever. That's when he figured out a better way to get the treat. He figured out if he could pull the rubber off the edge around the treat, he could get the whole treat out. He set out to do that so we were taking big rubber pieces out of his mouth. Still thinking the treat was pretty solid in there, we let him have it back. Soon he had the whole disk of the treat in his mouth! We added a treat to the other side a week later and he set out to dismantle that side. Our dog opens gates and figures things out very easily so this toy was no match for his genius, but evil, smarts or crazy chewing skills. He just happens to be able to figure out angles to achieve his goals so this toy was a fail for us. I think it's a great toy for most dogs and the treat should last a long, long time for hours of fun. If your dog isn't such an evil genius or a huge chewer of rubber, then it would be a great toy.

I think its too thin and tightens as my rabbit runs. Rabbits are skidish by nature so having anything like that around their neck is stressful. I am going to use it for my bearded dragon and wrap it around the dragon like a vest. I would recommend a vest for sure!
Great price...this stuff costs 3 x as much in your normal pet store!! Great price and recieved quicker than i expected!!
Bottom of feeder would not affix to the feeder. They sent me another one. It didn't work eitherVery bad engineering. Would not buy this product again. Wish I hadn't bought it in thefirst place.

With two dogs of our own and occasional visiting dogs, we've always had at least two leashes. The Flexi leash has outlasted at least three other leashes of various brands going on ten years now.It's a well made product of Germany that has withstood the ravages of weather and pulling, rambunctious dogs.Originally I bought this for our bathroom shy Evie so she could have some distance when I took her to the large field across the street. If she was too close to me she wouldn't go unless I turned my back and looked the other way.The leash has two locking mechanisms, one that fixes the leash at a certain length and one that is a thumb controlled brake that I use to pull the dog towards me when a car, human, or another dog approaches us. Releasing the thumb returns the leash cord to a flexible mode.In ten years and maybe thousands of walks, the leash has never jammed, never failed to retract.For wild, energetic dogs like our Gabby, a shorter leash length is advisable. For her I am using a nine foot retractable that gives her a little bit of roaming room but not too much. Many dog trainers insist that your dog must walk beside or behind you. I don't subscribe to such restrictions and allow my dogs to explore and enjoy the exciting outdoor scents.With the retractable leash one has the option to keep the leash short when circumstances require more control of the dog.
Our first collar didn't work. Called and was promptly sent out a second collar. Quality appears just to be OK but at least the company was responsive and got a second collar with no hassle.

We feed our small 12 pound Coton the different Merrick canned foods, and occasionally their dried food.He's been a little finicky lately, but gulped this New Zealand mix as fast as he could.Cut to look like sausage links. Lamb is the main ingredient. Definitely give it a try.

I love"D" this product. One of my cats refuse to use the litterbox and prefers training pads. I was buying this Nature's Miracle cases at a time. It "WAS" very thick. Every now and then, because I bought so much, I would have a pack with defected pads. Then one day in 2011 (?), I bought another 8 bags (2 cases). I was so disappointed with the change in the quality. The pads were so much thinner that they have a sheer look. It is so obviously that they were not as thick which affected the absorbancy. I no longer use Nature's Miracle.

Ok, I'm not gonna lie. I have bought at least five of these dangerous things. This is the only toy my picky cat likes. But be careful, the safety feature break-away tab thing does not work. And like I said, I've had a number of these, and the cat will either break the cord or wire that is attached to the doorway will come flying, taking down anything in it's path. We usually just leave it up if we are watching, but take the bird off for her to carry around the house. When it turns into a yellow piece of fluff that she carries around, I'm compelled to buy a new one for her. I've tried to spark her interest in other toys, and even in a look-alike stuffed with catnip -- but she is totally uninterested until I pull one of these out of the box. She barely let's me detach it from the package. So my rating is a "It's OK," because I hate it, but she loves it.

The Everlasting Treats are best combined with the Everlasting Treat Ball. This is a great concept to keep dogs occupied, give them something to chew on,etc. but the Triple Crown products are overpriced.

We purchased this brush to handle our two Pembroke Welsh Corgis (double-coat, medium length). The two heads are GREAT: they give us flexibility depending on the need. However, the handle is made separate from the head, and the joint has been loose on two brushes that we purchased. This gives an odd sensation while brushing, corrected by a bit of superglue. The pin head has coated pins, but these will come off relatively soon. The brush continues to work, but we tend to be a bit more attentive when using the pin side once the covers start to come off.For a light user, this would be a great brush. As a heavy user, I'd think twice...

I have two aqua-clear 110 in my 55gallon tank and my tank is never clear. Always cloudy. This filters don't do there job in any way. The filter pads are terrible and get dirty so quick, and its gross to try and clean out. And when you do have to replace them they are about $6 each so its close to $40 when changing both of my filters.I just bought marine land filters to replace these.

We have a hyper-active I-must-go-first pulling lab and the gentle leader has been the only thing that helped to be in some control over his energy. He absolutely hates the gentle leader, and I can now understand why. Unfortunately, it doesn't stop him from pulling which results in the straps getting tighter and tighter around his nose. Then, he starts rubbing his nose everywhere, including bushes, his people, ground, etc. Well, a couple of days ago, I discovered a very bad open sore on the side of his face, just where the strap goes over. It's been very hot this summer, and he's been panting non-stop, in which case the strap gets tighter around his face because the mouth is open all the time. Nylon is a very rough fabric and can cause burns from constant rubbing. Please note that we have been using the gentle leader for a couple of years now and we switch to a new one when the plastic parts get loser and make it impossible to adjust the straps. The gentle leader that caused the wound is relatively new, probably a month or so old. In conclusion, this is not a perfect solution, and you need to keep checking if your dog has any sores/wounds if he/she starts to really dislike it. And we learned our lesson - it's best to invest time into training our dog rather than into fancy leashes.

My dog (10 yr old Dash) is very docile and will only do what's easiest for her, she won't even get on & off a chair without someone picking her up. But she easily gets out of this pen by lifting it off the ground even when the door is open, she routinely piles toys all over it but rather than move them to get to the door she just lifts the side of the pen with her nose. I wouldn't rec for anyone with a dog over 5lbs or not seriously arthritic. If you need to confine your dog while you're at work or to protect areas during potty training this is not it! We use it just to keep all the doggie toys, bed & what not contained to one area. She does consider it home but it's not secure.
I bought this product for a 2 year old golden retriever and the dog chewed it up within minutes. Not worth a buy for large dogs.

Not only does my cat love the kitty cube, but I love watching him play in it. This thing makes them go nuts. My cat is a young male and he has gone through some "hormonal changes" making him less active, but when I bring this thing out he just goes bonkers. He can even entertain himself in it for long periods.

I've used the gentle leader now for a few weeks with my 8 month old dachshund/beagle. He used to run to the door and hit the bells to go outside, now he cringes when I want to take him out and will even hide so I can't take him out. When putting it on him, he will stretch his nose upward extending his neck so I have a difficult time closing it. once it is on he seems fine. He does not try to rub it off and he walks great with it. We have been going on nice long walks and he seems to enjoy them. I have mixed feelings about it though. I love how easy it is to walk with him now, but really wish he didn't hate it so much. I'm almost afraid it will affect his house breaking.

Really? This item works for some people? My dog has fleas, my home is mostly carpeted. This item is a night light perched above very sticky paper. I saw this product and thought it would be a good indicator of the presence of fleas in the house. We went away for 6 days and I left it plugged in where our dog usually sleeps. When we came home all that was trapped on the sticky paper was an ant.I guess the light/warmth is supposed to attract the fleas? I have been vacuuming constantly. I tried diatomaceous earth, I tried spraying the carpet, I tried flea powder in the carpet.BTW do not buy flea powder over the internet from Amazon, the packages arrived damaged and unusable. Although Amazon finally make good, it was an unnecessary hassle. For the dog I tried to knock down with Capstar then gave him Advantage. Later I tried Comfortis. We are still suffering from fleas. He is bathed every other day and now not allowed to run in our fenced in back yard. We now walk him. I feed a 2 stray cats outside which I also gave Capstar and Advantage. There is a raccoon which I guess must still be carrying the fleas, because I have put granules on the yard and sprayed the yard. As you can see we are under siege from the fleas and it is making everyone's life more difficult. I have had the flea trap plugged in constantly for 2 weeks now and caught nothing other than the ant and a few hairs. My dog still is suffering from fleas. This is a night light perched above sticky paper. Does it really work for some people because I know I have fleas in my home but this trap has not caught even one? I will be returning it as soon as I find a suitable box.

The cat feeder works as advertised and is reliable. However, what they don't advertise is that the electronic timer can only be set in fixed increments of time (e.g. 4, 8, 12, or 24 hours). What this means is that if you want the unit to feed your pet at noon, you must set it at either 8 that morning, 8 pm, 4 pm or noon the previous day. If you have multiple cats, you need multiple units, unless the cats are willing to share eating in the same space (mine aren't). So, for multiple cats, you not only need to remember to start the units at the appropriate time so that feeding occurs at the desired time, but you must also turn on all of the units at the same time to synchronize the opening of all at the same time.

Like a lot of the other reviewers, my dog is notoriously rough on her toys. As a German Shepherd/Rottweiler mix, she definitely has the power to destroy stuff when she wants to! Unlike the other reviewers though, these balls haven't popped or fallen apart while my dog played with them.My biggest problem with these tennis balls is that she's indifferent to them. I noticed right out of the package that they didn't have any peanut butter scent, and I guess my dog can't smell them either. I've purchased other scented/flavored tennis balls for her before - including some other peanut butter ones she went nuts for. That's the whole reason I bought these, so it's a little disappointing that they're not a "treat" for her. We do still play with them, but at my house they're just overpriced tennis balls.
You get your money's worth, and if you have a dog that is an aggressive eater this is a must. Stores and extends easily. I highly recommend it.

This collar worked for my lab initially, so I actually ordered a second one for my much smaller corgi. The strap is very adjustable so it fit both dogs fine. Soon after I received my 2nd collar, the first one pretty much stopped working. It would make a click like it was going to spray but then wouldn't. This problem was solved on a few occasions by shaking the device, but within another week or so it was totally toast. The 2nd collar lasted about the same amount of time, 2 weeks. It worked great on my dogs when, well, it worked...but that was not very long. I would not spend money on this product again.
Dogs love these things but `I do feel they are overpriced for the quantity you get.
My dog is a yellow spot machine. This product works but not consitently.Overall I will keep using it, but I wish someone could creat a product that prevents the burn spots vs. repairs them.
I have a German Shepherd Dog. Frontline seemed to control most but not all the fleas. Maybe it was just a bad year for fleas.

My buns loved these mats! Digging on them, chewing on them, throwing them, and eating them. They last for a long time, even with my German Giant / Angora mix tearing these up daily. We bought several for him and they were always something we could buy we knew he would enjoy having in his cage or in his favorite spot to hang out.

The squeaker makes a grunting noise, which is cute, but the type of squeaker is one that doesn't last long as it relies on a plastic baggie to hold air (easily punctured) and make a sound. I think my main disappointment is it is a lot smaller than I thought it was going to be. To me, this is a medium/large size toy.
My English Cocker Spaniel took this apart in minutes. Not a good toy if your dog has a habit of taking soft toys apart.
I have a decent sized pond and I thought this thing would help with some of the sludge. The bag was hard to clean. It really is better for larger, hard to reach items, like leaves and such.

Reasonably priced, healthy & all natural, low-calorie. They're small and easy to chew, so they are great for training sessions. They're also not too stinky or greasy, like lots of other dog treats, which makes the training sessions easier and less messy! And the best part - my dog adores them!!

I have purchased many dog collars but purchased this one to save a little money. It worked well as the dog was quiet but she soon was back to barking. I verifed that baby was still working. My Beagle/Jack Russel Terrier mix is very much in the stubborn dog class. I would reccomend this product for many dogs but just not for my pooch.I will buy the collar that I used to purchase which is the PetSafe PDBC-300. Or thats the type of one I used to buy before from Petsafe.
I ended up not needing the food since my fish passed on just after I ordered it. The customer service was great and they gave me a refund without any problems. Very prompt service as well.

This shampoo does work. My dog is parti color with a base of white. I have noticed a difference in the whiteness of his coat when using this shampoo as directed verses other shampoos. However, you have to follow the directions and leave the shampoo on the dog for a few minutes before rinsing or you do not get the results.

Not too excited about this product. It seems to rip the hair off the animal. I used it on a dog and also on a cat. It seems to work okay, but it takes "forever" to take off enough hair to make a significant difference. It is a long and tedious process, and I have never finished deshedding any animal because of this. If you have patience, it may be a good product for you.
After finding the code numbers were not the same on both package and applications I chose not to give this. The articles I read on fake products was scary.

I bought the lighthouse and installed it with my miracle beam led modules that I love. The lighthouse though I was less impressed with. It looks really cool... but on the side of the box was a warning not to look directly at the laser. This makes it very hard to watch the fish if you have to keep looking away each time the laser passes by. The laser beam looks cool going around the room but I get the feeling the fish don't like it as they seem to stay above it when its on and swim away quickly when the laser passes by them. It didn't have the effect in the water that I thought it would have either. The only time it makes a beam appear is when it is pointed directly at you, and that is when you are not supposed to look at it. I feel it would have been a better product if they would have used an led instead of a laser for the beam. Also I wonder, since it says it kills bacteria, if it might kill the bacteria that is benificial for fish also. I unplugged it.. it still looks cool with the mirror rotating, but I won't reconnect it for more than a few minutes in the future.
