I like the idea of the collar and the "handle" works well however the collar frays so much in a short period of time. I also have the leash but have had no problem with it.
We needed a crate large enough for our basset hound.The door on the front works great for in house or car(hard to turn corners with long dog). We are very happy with the quality & workmanship.

I am a long time user of Bags on Board refills. This time, the bag seems to have been redesigned to include some sort of ties. Tearing the bag is problematic, and two bags of my first roll tore off with the bag's seams completely torn. So, I could not use two bags in first batch. Sticking with the old design, a plain rectangle bag works best. I wish I knew of this new design before purchasing this product.

The retractable action on this flexi leash is not strong enough, often causing a delay or sagging of the cord when you want it to take up some slack. This makes walking my dog extremely tedious, and dangerous. I also use a lightweight rubber extension to cushion the impact of a 'strong walker' (dog that pulls hard or makes a break for a rabbit, bird, etc.), and this flexi leash cannot handle it. The sagging occurs whether I use the extension or not, but is much worse with the extension. Flexi should manufacture these retractable leashes with a stronger springing action to make them more functional in the real world. I am hoping my pet retailer will take it back and refund me.

I bought this to feed my seven chicks. It works with a narrow necked mason jar. It is messy to fill. I have to empty the base and turn it over to screw onto the jar of food. My chicks fill it up the holes with bedding. It hasn't tipped over. I have to refill it once a day.

We love this carseat! This is our 2nd Snoozer purchase. We have theSnoozer Console Lookout Car Seat, Black, Smallfor our 6 pound dog and got this lookout seat for our new 14 pound dog. In fact, my husband got this one for me for Christmas (after getting our 2nd dog in November) and it was one of my favorite gifts! Both dogs LOVE their seats and hop right in them when they run to the car. We are able to use the seats in either our car or my husband's truck. We just took a 2 1/2 hour trip pulling our trailer and both dogs rode happily in their seats. Although some people might think car seats for dogs are silly, it's not just about pampering your pet (although they do feel pampered with these), it's about safety!!! My little 6 pounder would gladly sit in my lap, but I know that if an airbag went off (even in a minor collision), she would not survive. We are able to take the dogs with us much more easily with these seats!

This is a great stuffed toy for dogs who tend to get a little over zealous with stuffed toys. I have all three of Fat Cat's 'Yanker' toys (Aligator, Snake and Fish) and they are pretty indestructable. My corgi loves to play with stuffed toys, but he also loves to rip them apart. Most average toys are gutted and destroyed within the first day of play-These will last for sometimes several months and some (like the snake) will last for years. My corgi adores these, as he can play to his heart's content, and the fish is by far his favorite. Yes, sometimes a dog can catch a seam in the right way and pop a little of it open, usually about an inch or two, they can be repaired, but it really will only stay you off until you can find a replacement.This is why I can't give the toy a five star rating. Still, as stuffed toys go, these are the only toys I can feel okay about spending money and know that my dog will have a great stuffed toy to play with for more than a day or two.
The merchandise was great and the response time in shipping was very good. Thank you

I've had it all of an hour & the screw for the battery compartment broke off(without trauma). Hope this is not an indicator of it's performance. I have not got to test the Anti- bark at nothing function yet. I will ammend this after that...Update: It's useless. Does nothing except irritate me cause...I CAN HEAR IT!

Worked well on our little Yorkie, Had congestive heart failer and could not hold her bladder due to the meds! We did have to put on harness to keep them on her. You can buy the harness seperatly, but they did the job. Sadly she passed away after we bought thease we miss her so much!!

Even when there is nothing in the litter box, there is dust in the air and an awful smell to go with it. The smell is the litter - nothing else. Swheat scoop (?) wheat litter is so much better. I can't even finish the box of this litter. Bought it because it was the only thing available at a small natural store and I was in a hurry. Won't make that mistake again!

I bought and returned 3 of these in one week. The first one never bubbled, the second one bubbled for 10 mins and the third one bubbled for 3 minutes. The valve and hose attachment is poorly designed and cracks when the bubbler is assembled. The pet store where I bought this said they are constantly returned and suggested another type of pet fountain. Save yourself the return postage and look at another brand.

My dog loved playing with this toy, however it is very dangerous to your pets safety. The toy has a small hole at each end and is solid in the middle so when the dog chews on it, it creates suction that can pull your dogs tongue into the little hole at the end. The tongue then gets stuck in the toy. It happened to my dog and fortunately I was there to remove it which was very difficult. I had to cut it off without injuring the dog. The vet said that had I not been there to remove it, the dogs tongue would have become swollen inside of the toy and if it had remained on for any extended period, there was a good chance that the tongue would of had to been amputated. If you are buying chew toys, always make sure there are at least two holes in each side of the toy, which prevents suction pulling the tongue into the toy. This toy has two holes, however it is blocked by solid rubber in between. This item should be recalled, but there is no such thing for dog toys. Always be careful with what your dog plays with when you are not home. Beware of this item!
this wheel is so noisey it sques so much also it cuts though its self as it is used because of a plastic covering i would not buy this product agnian

my 8 month old pit bull puppy broke out of the side of this (not even one of its two doors - he got out the side). I really wish I could find a better made crate because he has severe separation anxiety, even for 10 minutes, and we have to go to work like normal people. He is absolutely not ready to be left home alone.
Product is not working. Had to reapply after 21 days. My dogs are going crazy with ticks galore. Will never buy this product again.
said fresh and salt but the strips say fresh and alkalinity is not rite i i ii i i i i i

CAME THROUGH AMAZON, NICE ON TIME AS ALWAYS.BUT THIS ITEM LOOKS OLD, LIKE AS IF IT WAS USED PREVIOUSLY. SAFETY PLASTIC WAS ALREADY DAMAGED WHEN I GOT THIS PRODUCT.IT IS NOTHING EXITING.IF YOU DO BUY FIRST CAREFULLY CUT OUT THE PACKAGING, THEN PULL THE SPLITTER OUT DONT PULL FIRST.I DONT RECOMEND THIS TO ANYBODY.SORRY.I NEVER DID BUT YOU CAN TRY SEARCHING IN OSTER BRAND. NOW THATS SOME OF THE BEST STUFF I HAVE USED.CHECK IT OUT

The cage is easy to assemble and also conveniently folds down for easy carrying. However, the cage needs modifications if you have a large, energetic dog. My dog (lab mix ~50 lbs) was able to push the door out and bend it down in order to get out. I had to zip tie the sides together so that was not possible for him to do any more. Also, the cage comes with two handles that you can put wherever you like for carrying it. One of them broke one me because I was trying to put it on one of the wires that was too thick for it. So make sure you are careful when you are putting those on.

this system has worked great for my boston terrior. Unfortunally I have had to replace two colars at $70.00 a pop within the last two years and need a new one again. Bottom line is the colars break easy and you will have to invest money to keep your system working.

I'm giving this three stars for now because I haven't gotten to use it very much, and the several times I did, I had mixed results. Like other reviewers, I had some trouble putting the battery in, but my battery case has not popped off (yet).Yes, dogs DO notice when you use this product, but they don't necessarily stop barking. I purchased and carry it to and from work after a few too many incidences of (big) dogs coming up to me and trying to jump on me - I was never attacked, but I really don't appreciate anyone's poorly trained beast coming near me. It was particularly useful in making a dog that would growl at me from the other side of a chain link fence run away whimpering...however, the next time I saw that dog (about two months later), it became enraged upon setting eyes on me - all I did was cross the street and use the sidewalk. Man, I thought that dog was going to jump over the fence and and kill me! It ran along the fence barking, snarling, and baring its fangs the whole time I walked on that part of the sidewalk. The Repeller didn't make the dog stop or go away at all, although the other dog in the yard ran back to the house away from me without barking.I've used this on yappy, annoying dogs that bark and follow people as they pass on the sidewalks as well, and it didn't work; at times, they'll pause and resume barking, or they seem to get more agitated. So I am not sure if the reason it doesn't work is the product itself or the dogs. When I bought this, I understood that this was not a fail-proof way to keep dogs from barking at me or trying to come near me/jump on me, but I did not expect that using the Repeller would cause a dog to go into attack mode. This product would probably work better if it was used in conjunction with a handgun for the dogs that still pose a threat to people and their pets. In my honest opinion, dogs will not stop being a nuisance or a public danger until they are properly trained by responsible owners who will be their masters and not their parents.

I got this because of my little dog trying to get treats from the litter box. Initially it worked well, though one of my cats wouldn't use it with the lid on (my dog was still unable to get into the litter). However, then when I took over care of a rottweiler, even with the cover on it provided no protection from litter box diving. If you have a small dog, and a flexible cat, this product will work wonderfully. If your cat is inflexible, and the dog is large, keep looking.

If i had read a little more carefully i would have noticed that connections to this product are solvent weld not threads. If i were advertising this product i would make sure to specify that fact and to point out that the threads are NOT iron pipe (NPT). Service,product and delivery very good.
The Furminator comb is wonderful! It works great! It removes the undercoat of the cats so they don't shed as much. Much less fur on the sofa, chairs and carpet.

My dogs are full bred labs 9 and 11 years old and I give them this everyday with their food. A 2.5lb amount will last a long time. My main beef with this is that you can get it direct from Gateway for 20.00 shipped. 16.09 shipping from this seller?? Come on. Glad I found a better deal.
Always a useful product to have avilable when clipping dog or cat nails. Works fine and this size should last for years for the average pet owner.
My 80 lb golden retriever housed this treat in 30 minutes. Hopefully it comes out as easy as it went down.... :/
The advantix for dogs 21-50 lbs worked fast removing most fleas. But a week or so later there still were some fleas still annoying my dog.

I purchased this at first because it looked like the expensive ropes for sale at the local pet store.mMy little guy will chew forever. I keep the bag in a ziploc so they stay fresh. All his doggy friends love them as well. Great price, great product
Batteries last 2 days. Don't waste your money. PetSafe is a ripoff anyway. I'll try fido's fences version. Worthless peices of chit.

No, this should not be your front-line defense against fleas, but as other reviewers stated, it's a great adjunct to your overall flea arsenal. It caught about a dozen fleas during a bad infestation this summer. Any any dead flea is a good thing.

I bought this door from one of the big box stores because it was the only one I could find and it was priced right. I move a lot so I have a lot of experience with installing dog doors. The installation for this door is "Average" it's going to take some time but no major design flaws in my book. However, this is a weak door and you get what you pay for. The slightest breeze and the door would open 3-4 inches, letting heat, cold and unwanted critters to come as they please. The magnets are very weak and even if i manually "shut" the door it would open with the wind or when my dog used it. I think this would be a fine door on a dog house or maybe even for a garage or barn but I would not recommend it for entrance into a home. We finally bit the bullet and shelled the big bucks for a freedom pet pass door. Nothing but good things to say about the door - still hurting over the cost.

The product wasn't defective, it just didn't work on my pet. I bought it to keep my cat away from the dog door, but the shock had no effect on her (I know it was working, I tried it on my self!) Maybe she has too much fur blocking the contacts from her skin. I'd imagine it's a good product as long as your pet can feel and responds to the shocks.

i got this for my dog because she just doesn't like to listen... and it's great... because it's not a barking collar that just goes off when she barks... this collar let's me let her know when she's doing wrong... and you can adjust the settings to how little or big of a shock you want to give each time... plus now i don't even have to put the collar on her if she just sees me holding the remote she calms down... i'm not sure if that's how it's supposed to work but it made me happy

This trainer was certainly worth the money! I have a very intelligent but hard-headed 23lb min. schnauzer who would tend to leave our yard even when being called. We put off buying any type of training aid for over 6 months because of price and the fence was not an option because we did not want to limit him to a small area. Our frustration of having to chase him through the neighbors' yards put us over the edge. I have had this less than a week and used no initial training whatsoever. After correcting him twice on the lowest setting, anytime I warn him, he comes running. The only problem now is he shys away when I try to put the collar on him. I am sure after a few more times he will learn that it won't correct him as long as he minds.Great product!!

The ShedEnder is ok. I don't see too much difference between it and a wire brush except a wire brush doesn't have to be cleaned 52 times per pet side. The ShedEnder seems to hold 4 hairs and need to be cleaned before the next 4 hairs can be "brushed" out. Yes it produces a ball of hair after 4 hours of brushing but it just seems a little long to spend brushing out a pet. And since the product doesn't actually STOP the shedding the name really doesn't fit. I can see the appeal but I don't think it's worth more than $5. Good thing I got this as a gift.. I'd be mad if I paid $14.99

Size large would not fit around my bulldog. Measurment accounts from length of head to tail, not width. It looks cool but tophat is useless and flat. The large would not fit on my 45lbs. boxer puppy either and he is still pretty skinny. Outfit must be made for very small dogs.

These work great, but make sure to put in your order well in advance from needing them, this company takes forever to ship out. Also horrible communication ..I emailed for a status on the order and never heard back from them..

Great toy. This is the second one we have got because it Is our dogs favorite toy. This first one is wearing out after two years of constant paying and it still squeaks. She plays with both the new and old. This is the only toy our dog has had that the squeaker still works, she usually distroys them in most toys in a matter of minutes.
The dogs love the everlasting products, but this flavor left red stains all over my light carpet.

Purchased this toy for my small dog. Within 5 min. he had managed to destroy the squeaker. Thinking this might have been a defective squeaker, I replaced it with the extra one that came with the toy. He destroyed that one also in less than 5 min. The squeakers must be very cheaply made. Very disappointing purchase! Will not purchase another KONG toy with squeaker. Don't waste your money on this toy.

My dog loves these treats. He's really picking with his treats so it says a lot that he loves these. I had been buying him bags of the freeze dried treats at petco, etc. and it was costing a fortune, not to mention they were smashed. These are great quality. You get tons!! in the 14 ounce bucket and my little dog is in love.

Like many other reviewers I found this product ineffective. After three weeks and two vials there is no visible reduction in my dog's flea infestation. Please read the many recent reviews that support this before you buy.

I have a cat who refuses to come indoors, even in the worst weather. She just toughs it out, laying in her favorite spot (the doormat). It's been unseasonably cold (deep freezes) here in Georgia this winter, so I ordered the heating pad, hoping to give her some warmth. All I had to do was plug it in. She absolutely LOVES it. It's been hours, and she hasn't moved an inch! I can certainly rest easier this winter.Other notes: it's quite large (the cat in the photo must be a BIG CAT) - there's room enough for two. The cord seems very chew-proof. I love the fact that I can hose it off to clean it. All around a good buy.

I have a 9-year-old Mastiff that still prefers chasing her giant ball around the yard to sleeping all day. I bought her first Jolly Ball when she was still quite young and since, I've had to purchase two more. Three balls in the span of six years. The last ball I got for her was about six months ago. She chewed that thing into oblivion in record time. She has chewed away nearly half the ball. It now sits in the back yard like a bowl (when she's not carrying it around, that is). She still loves the thing though and I'm afraid to purchase another knowing she'll likely just chomp away at that one too. Now that she's an expert, I bet she'd have a new one ravaged in a few short months.I've given this a 3 star review because a) my dog loves this product (she doesn't care for any other toy I've ever given her), b) when it's still in full form, it's actually quite enjoyable for myself as well (easy to kick/toss around the yard), and c) the price is very decent (I've seen 50 dollar balls exclaiming they are made for "chewers" but I'm afraid to put down that kind of money when I know what my dog is capable of).I will note that once my dog created a hole large enough for her to pick up the ball, she was slightly less inclined to chew constantly at it. It didn't stop the process entirely, however, hence the crescent moon shaped ball in my backyard.
Can't complain, doesn't cost too much and it seems to work. Teeth are small enough to field through the hair, I can see from it picking up even dry skin. My cat doesn't complain either.

The new LME9000 Mega Advanced Automatic Self-Cleaning Litter Box is a piece of JUNK. I bought it when our regular old one gave out--we had it for over three years. The old one was great. This one does not clean the box and it will not stop running until I turn off the switch. Do not waster your money on it.
Cats go crazy for this product - and it's all natural and good for them.

Please do not buy this toy! It is fun and the cat loves it very much! But it will tangle and will choke the kitty. If I wasn't home, my kitten would've choked because it got warped around his neck! Because it is a string, it will tighten itself and the more kitty struggles to get it off the more pressure is places on the tangled body part! Please spare your kitty's life and do not buy this! I cut the string off right there and then and threw it out! Be very cautious with this and do not let the kitty play with it alone!
the scooper and the enzymes did not come in the box as promised. all i received was the septic tank, which is very difficult to install. other than that, the product works.

This is a great product. I originally tried Angel Eyes and it didn't work that well. This was recommended by another Maltese owner. I tried it, and although it does take a couple of weeks it works great. I have tried so many things that have not worked. This is a great seller with great prices and fast shipping also.

The cat formula Urine Off is terrible. First of all, it does not get rid of the smell of urine. Second, it leaves behind the smell of a urine soaked old lady's house who is using perfume to disguise the smell of her own filth. Third, it is damn near impossible to get rid of the smell of the Urine Off.Here's a tip - use plain, old fashioned white vinegar if your cat or dog pees on the carpet. Just spray it on, let it dry, clean the area the next day with some soapy water. Repeat if necessary. The vinegar neutralises the urine - works every time. I sincerely regret ever using Urine Off; should have just stuck to the vinegar.PS - the only reason I have given it a star is because it wouldn't let me not. Zero stars from me!

I thought the dinosaur would be an interesting change of pace for my dog. He immediately loved the dino-chew. He loves it. But, he was able to chew the head off in less than a week. The main body is still holding up.
My kitties just gobble these up - sooo glad we found a source to buy these from!

I foster Kittens for a local rescue and kittens LOVE This arc! They are caged during the day when I'm not home and I always find at least 2, if not 3 kittens snoozing in or on this arc in their cage. Even when I let them free, they'll wander back into their cage to snooze on this.

When we got a second labrador, the first time I tried to hold both their leashes they pulled me out into the street. I still have scars on my knees. I shouldn't have been surprised - they weigh more than I do, combined (55lbs each - small Labs, really - but I'm a pretty small human). I started dreading a future of taking two walks each time the dogs needed exercise and my husband wasn't around to take one of them.Well, the Gentle Leader meant that future never came. I can walk them by myself, and while sometimes they still pull pretty hard, I've never felt in doubt that I was the one in control. That being said, the dogs hate the Gentle Leader. All the stuff on the package about how the dogs would like it once they're used to it proved utter folly in our case. They shy away when I try to put them on, pout about having them every time they get a chance on the walk, and once I take them off at the end of the walk, they both run over to bed and start scratching their muzzles against the bed. I guess they must really itch? So, I can walk them by myself, which is fantastic - but I do feel terribly guilty putting the dogs in a harness that's so obviously uncomfortable and irritating for them.To me, if you're in a position where the choice is between this product and not walking your dog because you're afraid of being injured, trying the Gentle Leader is a no-brainer. Otherwise, I wouldn't buy it, because I'm sure our dogs are not unique in hating how it feels. I only use it when my husband is away - otherwise we use a more traditional harness.

We have two Litter Maids, a mega and a standard. The standard size almost never jams; I think the design is slightly better (it's deeper than the mega, although it's less wide and shorter). The mega is a pain in my neck. It jams almost every day; sometimes twice a day. And deep-cleaning it is a two-to-three hour chore. However, on those special occassions the box works without jamming, it's a much better alternative than the old-fashioned way.

We currently had our hardwood floor installed, and I have 2 hyperactive Jack Russells who also have sharp claws. I bought 2 sets of Soft Paws after finding out from online that this was the best option to protect our floor. They worked great; although, I have decided not to use them anymore for the following reasons: 1.) If you have dogs that are partly outdoor, they come off when the dogs are running around the yard. 2.) Due to this, I decided to put more glue and really push them in. That solved the problem; however, it's been over 8 weeks and now they won't come off, and we are dealing with the problem of the claws growing into these covers, and it was making one of my dogs limp. We took her to the vet and found nothing wrong, but common sense tells us that her nail was growing into the rubber cap and had hurt her toe. 3.) They are not cheap since you will constantly be replacing them. Although I did not have any regrets using these, I have opted for a better way which is trimming and filing their claws using a Dremmel.
This toy lasted 3 months with two destructive puppies! I consider this a success. Most toys I buy last less than two hours. They loved it and had lots of fun with it.

I bought these collars for my two lab mix dogs after we went through a near choking incident with them, where one dog had grabbed onto the collar of the other, it ended up getting caught on her lower jaw and twisting around the other dog's neck and cinching tighter and tighter. Unfortunately, my dogs discovered with their new collars that if they pulled hard enough, they would come off, so it became their new game when they would play out in the back yard. They pulled them off so much that the safety clasp would barely hold anymore. They also chewed on the regular buckle which made it impossible to open the regular way. I have gone through two sets of these collars now, and as much as I think they are great products, they just don't work with my dogs. The last one I bought lasted all of one day. I think if you had one rather easy-going dog, it would be fine. They just don't hold up to the chewing/playing power of two lab/retriever mix dogs.
This was absolutely adorable on my Jack Russell! The only problem was that the top part with the ears wouldn't stay on her head, but everyone thought it was hilarious anyway.

+ Product works- Light lock nut arrived crossthreaded (requiring tools to correct)- Thin plastic- Light burnt out in first weekIf you are mechanicaly inclined build one yourself. All you need is a light, tupperware bowl, and carpet tape.

I really wanted to give this product a nice rating and review, because my children's python has done so well with the small size. It was durable, easy to clean, and a good price. But I can't. She's now outgrown the small size which served me so well, so I ordered the medium size, expecting the same quality and durability. Unfortunately, that has not been the case. The first time it arrived the lip that holds the lid on was cracked, broken, and crumbling in several places. I exchanged it, and the replacement has just arrived. I was disappointed to find that this time the lid had a small chip out of the bottom of it, and the inner paint appears to be peeling. I'm just going to sand down the sharp edge and the peeling paint so they're not an issue to my reptile and use this one rather than exchange again, but I'm bitterly disappointed at such poor quality in what was in the past such a fine product.Part of the problem seems to be the packaging. Not amazon's packaging, which is done very well, but the disintegrating styrofoam and the careless way the two pieces are placed right against each other in the product's box. However, from the cracks and crumbling pieces and the peeling paint, I can tell it's not all packaging. The product seems poorer quality and more fragile than in the past. It's thin and somewhat brittle, and from the other not so glowing reviews I've read, I can see I'm not the only one to experience this. I can see now why none of my local pet supply stores stock them. I don't know if this has just been a bad batch or if they've changed something lately that has lowered the quality, but either way, it is a subpar product, and I think in the future I might just try to find a similarly designed equivalent product with a better record of quality.I really was hoping this product would be as wonderful as the small size version I bought 2 years ago, but it's not, and I don't think I would recommend this product to other reptile owners after this experience. When proper quality, this product is a wonderful humid hide that's easy to clean, affordable, durable, and comfortable for a reptile, but with such high chances of receiving this product damaged or brittle enough to damage soon after arrival, I would think twice about ordering this again.EDIT: After further inspection I noticed another chip missing from the bottom lip that holds the lid on. That was the last straw. I'm returning the second one and just getting a refund this time rather than risking receiving another damaged or poor quality product.

The perforation for separating bags is "S" shaped to make "ties". It is very difficult to follow and the bag rips easily making the next bag unusable. Don't try to use at night unless you have a light and three hands.

I bought this for our 70 pound lab/shepherd mix, but it seems to be too small for her. And it's hard; if we put something fluffy on top, the heat doesn't get through and it's no longer a heated bed. For whatever reason, our dog refuses to sleep on it, and we've given it to our cats. It's a good size for two cats to sleep on.
These are replacement bags for the scooper. The scooper works OK once you get the hang of it. You have to be pretty fast to get the scooper in place once the dog starts the squat!

We have a leopard gecko that should have his warm side of the tank around 85 degrees, this heater is not able to heat it up to that temp. We did install it properly to the bottom of the tank, but we are disappointed in it.
Our golden loves to run, and chase, these are good and easy to find in the snow. Also with my Arthritus I don't have to bend over to pick up....

I thought this was irksome to attach. And when you want to ride on your own, it's a hassle to remove. BUT, if you haven't taken the time/don't know how to train your dog, even a large, strong dog will not pull you off balance.All that said, If you have trained your dog with commands, you don't need to purchase any of this: all you need is a six-foot lead (this a normal length training leash) that clips around your waist (often called a "Hands Free" or "Runner's Leash") to give your dog a great run. I am a huge believer in ample exercise for dogs. We live in a condo and exercise makes all the difference in obedience, health and boredom level for our 40 lb. dog.

Water Wiggler is constructed well and operates as stated. Used it for several weeks - no birds - could they be afraid of it? I have two feeding stations and a fountain (close to the house) that the Finches love! I even moved my bird bath to another location - maybe dirty birds-just don't bathe.No problem with the product - just with my flock.

Omega Paw Tricky Treat Ball, LargeHad the original Tricky Treat Ball and it lasted 6 1/2 years. When it finally gave out ordered this one, the newest, and it lasted about 1 hour. Not made of the same strong rubber, whole too big, my dog got his bottom jaw stuck in it. Threw it out within 2 hours of arriving.

A bird stand is quite convenient for parrot owners to have (my babies can now come with me to the living room while I'm washing dishes/doing crunches/other miscellaneous activities), but this particular stand isn't exactly the ideal.For starters, the box doesn't have assembly instructions for those of us that are retarded when it comes to assembling/building anything; but despite that, it was pretty easy to assemble, for the most part.Also, the stand is more ideal for medium sized parrots - for instance, African Grays, or Sun Conures - which wasn't clear from Amazon's description of the dimensions and size. Although it DOES suffice for my Green-Cheeked Conure and Cockateil, the wooden bar is a bit too large, and the closely placed cups a tad bit too tall; subsequently, feeding or drinking from the stand's side cups often entails some pretty entertaining acrobatics (well, for me to watch).My final complaint is that the stand's parts aren't very high quality (i.e. it's cheaply made), nor is it sturdy or stable.Overall, it's nice because it's convenient, but I think the $40 would be better spent at a local store where you can get a sense of what the end product is, rather than online.

I was really hoping to use the chains from toys that they've already chewed up, and was disappointed that it was too big to fit thru most of the holes in these toy parts. A piece of twine could be strung, but not chain from medium-large bird toys. Maybe 2 pieces out of the whole box could be restrung on chains from old toys.BUT, my two goffins, lesser sulfur crested, and labrador retriever (dog) all enjoyed chewing on these pieces, and taking them out of the container they came in! I put peanut butter in the grooves and small holes, which kept my hyperactive goffins busy for hours. I was also glad that they didn't splinter in the dogs mouth like other wood toy parts can (my 3 cockatoos all like to feed the dog and shove toy parts thru their cages to him, so bird toys also being dog-safe is a real concern for me).I'm glad I bought this toy box on sale, or I would have been disappointed.Like the description says, they make great foot toys; just not good as replacement parts or for stringing your own toys.

good product, had little trouble getting put together. it is easy to use clean do not have to touch litter. Recommend to use clumping litter. could have bought smaller one takes up a lot of space but I am glad I bought it best litter box

I put this thermometer on the bottom left corner of my freshwater fish tank. I use it for a reference point only, as it is not as accurate as my thermometer inside the tank. Good Product works fine, but not needed if you have a thermometer inside the tank.

This is a well built gate that serves it's purpose well. No need to sell you on that part. But, I do have three small complaints:1. The door only swings open one way. So far as I can tell, there is no way to reverse the swing, and it just so happens that the door I want it in is situated in such a way that I wish it swung the other way. And no, you can't just turn it around. I mean, you can, but then it opens to the other side, which isn't what I want.2. The cat door isn't removable. For whatever reason, my cat is not bold enough to push the little door open. So, whenever I close the gate, I have to make sure that the cat door is swung wide open. I wish I could remove it. My only option is to cut the hinges with a hacksaw, which I'd rather not do.3. The red safety latch is difficult to unlock. This may be a positive for people who are using this as an actual baby gate. However, I am only using this as a gate to keep my 70# black lab out of the office where my cat likes to hang out, and where we keep his food (so the dog won't eat it). So, I have no need for it to actually be child-proof. You can push the handle down without engaging the red latch, but I seem to be the only person in my house who has figured this out. Guests, friends, and even my wife, all seem to think it's very important to engage the latch. And seriously, it is a pain in the butt to unlatch. It requires two hands to open, which is difficult when you are carrying something.But overall, it is a well built product that is easy to set up, move, and adjust. I'm giving it three stars: 1 for not being a total POS, the second for being a unique product that fills a special, and the third for good quality construction. But the fourth and fifth starts would have required a little more thoughtfull engineering and more than just one cool feature (the cat door).

I ordered this because it said it was for "ferrets, rabbits and guinea pigs". It is NOT. It also says the panels are 55 inches long, they are NOT. They are 5 1/5 inches long - BIG difference.It is also NOT 24 feet wide, it is 24 INCHES wide.Someone wasn't paying attention. Guinea Pigs are WAY bigger than hamsters. This thing is smaller than my GP's cage... not very useful as a playpen.I notified the company horseloverz and they are supposed to make changes. I'm sure this is fine for a hamster (as the box states - hampsters and gerbils) so if you have hamsters, go for it. Do not get this for a ferret, rabbit or guinea pig.
I think I'd rather have something professional, this thing just didn't get all the hair off and seems to tear at my cat fur. The fur goes everywhere too, I would not buy again.

My cats love the Da Bird toy, but they weren't really too thrilled with this attachment. They prefer the sparkler and the original feather attachment over it. If there is nothing else to play with, it will do, so maybe they're just spoiled, but they seemed to be waiting for me to put the other attachments back on. I'm guessing the other attachments are more exciting because of the sounds they make, while this is a rather silent one.

I ordered this item a few months ago and it worked well for the first week. Like another reviewer, I placed the watering bowl underneath to catch the water until the auto-shutoff. The product started to work intermittently - so I replaced the batteries but it still only worked every other time I tested it. Our two labrador retrievers must have gotten frustrated when it didn't work, because we came home to find it laying on the ground chewed up. After a complex repair, we got it mounted again, only to come home the next day and find it on the ground, chewed up again. It is a great concept, but it's too easy for the dogs to work the unit loose from the pipe, and too expensive to replace each time it gets attacked. Maybe it should be made from stainless steel.
These pheramone treatments were recommended by our vet, and work to make my cat calm. This vendor has the refills at 66% LESS than the local chain pet store.

I bought this hammock about a year ago for my German Shepherd and I've been pretty disappointed with it. The fabric itself is holding up well, but that's the only good thing about it. After not even a month of use, the zipper broke, so now we have a permanent hole for hair and dirt to fall through, which defeats the purpose of the hammock. And even though my dog is really big, he rides calmly in the car, so he did not break the zipper. The zipper is just too small and cheap for a product like this.The grommets on the hammock are also cheap and quite thin. After a couple months of use, the fabric started tearing out of them and we had to punch in more heavy-duty grommets. Again, my dog pretty much just lays down in the car, so he wasn't bouncing around and tearing them.The headrest covers are kind of small and just barely squeeze onto the headrests in our car. The straps on the headrest covers are quite long, so we had to wrap them around a few times to keep the hammock from sagging too much. Even after that it still sags quite a bit and does not hang nearly as high as the promotional picture. And we have a Nissan Altima, so it's not a tiny car. My dog can still easily step into the front seats if he wants. It may not be such a problem for a smaller dog, but even a beagle-sized dog could easily get into the front seats with how the hammock (doesn't) fit in our car.

I liked the filter itself, but it was hard to put the tubing onto the fittings. So hard in fact that the quick disconnect valve was damaged on mine while I was trying to put mine together. I didn't realize it until I began running it. Then I had to return it. The other thing I didn't like was the hose clamps that are provided for the tubing. They kept popping open after I had squeezed them shut. I think they need to be a little bigger. As it was, I had to use pliers to sqeeze them shut enough so that they would stay closed. I don't think that they were really doing much anyway since the tubing was so tight on the fittings. The filter itself worked really well and ran really quietly. I really like the different options that the unit comes with for the outlet into the tank. My recommendation to anyone buying this product is to stretch the tubing opening before trying to put it on any of the fittings so that it goes on easier and far enough to put the hose clamps on. Try using pliers to close the hose clamps if it seems like they are too small. Other than those small issues I think that it is a really good filter.

That said, I guess it depends on your cat's taste. I desperately tried to get our cats to eat this stuff but the pellets are fairly large, so I think they hurt their mouths when they tried to eat them (one is a Persian and they typically have smaller mouths than most cats). Our "Tom" cat didn't care for it either for some reason. So, since we couldn't get past the taste in our house, the dental portion didn't work. Sure wish it did though. That $200 teeth cleaning bill yearly is quite ridiculous! Good luck with this but I guess it's just like any other food for cats. Try it because it is a GREAT idea but ultimately, it will be up to your cat if he/she decides to eat it.

I bought this so my African Grey could have an additional outside stand option. It's great how it has an attachable food bowl but the perch is way too harsh on the feet.I understand that it is to help keep the nails trimmed but the extremely course surface can be painful to the fleshy feet. I ended up sanding the top part of the perch into a smooth surface. I left the bottom slightly course where the nails hit.
While I see our cats play with them now and then, I find them in different parts of the house, which means that somebody is playing with them, and I don't think it's my husband
Turtles don't like this as much as the dried shrimp, but they did eventually eat it. Not the treat I was hoping for.
This product is good for the price. But if your dog is a messy drinker I don't think it will work well. Mine still get water all over the place!

Initially I was very satisfied with this product, the 1524DD crate. Nothing wrong with it's construction. It claims to hold dogs up to 25 lbs, which it does, to a point. However, my fox terrier(16 lbs) has outgrown the cage due to the fact that he can't "stretch out" when he's resting, and his ears stick out of the top when he's standing. So I'm planning on ordering the 36" version of this product, and using the partition as necessary.

Product came with applicator bottles and instructions only. When I have ordered from other places in the past, they come in an original box with the applicator bottles sealed in foil and plastic, so you know that they have not been tampered with. I am very unsatisfied and unsure about using them on my dogs.

While on our second set of Muttluks within the last 3 months, I can hardly believe that someone has used a single set for 4 years! Our 19 month old Cockapoo has just blasted two holes in one of her boots that we just got 21 days ago and her last set lasted less than 45 days. For us, that's about $80.00 in approx. 3 months.The fact that the boots have no right or left, front or back-paw concept yet our dog would blow holes in one boot before the others (twice!) would imply that the leather on one of the boots might be more thin or weaker than that of the others..I don't know.To their credit, the Muttluks were marvelous at keeping Willow's 'moppet feet' clean and dry (or, at least clean)...You get to the door, take them off and in she can go without dragging dirt and slop into the house. We also became quite adept at putting them on so that wasn't an issue..About 90 seconds, total.The leather soles of our first pair (size small) were slightly different than the second pair (size X-small which fit better). The smoothness of the first set, combined with our very icey conditions made Willow's first set unbelievably slippery. Again, to the company's credit, I wrote to them and, although having no answers or suggetions, simply offered to send us a new pair for free...That was pretty cool!The new set of Muttluks arrived on the very day that Willow had two holes in one of her 40-ish days old boots. The second set's more suede-like soles instantly had notibly better traction, although the smaller size was a little more challenging to put on...Still, not a big deal.We found that Muttluks stay on very well but you have to make sure that the dogs feet are in properly and that the velcro straps are properly tightened.Our bottom line is that we believe the concept of Muttluks to be excellent but feel sincere that they could (or we could) come up with a better soling material or 'after-market patch' to give them better traction and longer sole-life...An idea I posed to the company but got no reply.We're going to look into 'Neo-Paws' which are promoted as 'Dog Tennies' offering excellent traction and long wear.(A Few Days Later)Since posting the above review, we cut pieces of leather in the shape of the Muttluks boots and glued them on over the old 'holey soles' which, after 22 days of two long walks per day, had holes in 3 of the four boots. We did not attempt to cover the entire sole, just the flat base as the glue will have a hard enough time holding as it is. We used a leather-to-leather rubber cement type glue, letting them set-up for 24 hours under pressure. So-far..All is well and Willow is glad not to have her feet washed off twice a day!That's our report. Hope you approve...Willow's Dad"A Week Or So Later"Here is my latest update on Willow's Muttluks and the brand new Neo-Paws that we just got for her...No Comparison!! The 'Neo-Paws' are the most beautiful,flexible, light, super traction, water resitent and durable boots for dogs that I've ever seen! They go on ions more easily than the Muttluks and don't get stiff because there is nothing in the sole to suck up water.The vulcanized rubber soles are bouncy, quiet, extremely flexible and show absolutely no sign of wear where-as the Muttluks looked burned up after the first two days. Remember, we're the people who's 28 lb. Cockapoo burned through 2 pair of Muttluks and 2 pair of Canine Casuals in less than 3 months. The Neo-Paws are also notibly 'Left & Right' which makes tons of sense...Like shoes!Here's some 'Super Important Advice': Because Neo-Paws come in sets of 2, you measure their front paws and get the size you need and measure their back paws to do the same. Measure both front and back paws very carefully (both Length & Width) because usually their back paws are a size smaller than their front paws. We learned that lesson the hard way and are now waiting for Willow's smaller boots to come for her back paws.To be clear, we have not had the Neo-Paws long enough to give a full report. But it doesn't take a rocket scientist to appreciate the genius and simple common sense in their design. On a Muttluks 'good side of town', my resoling efforts have worked well and the rubber cement that I used also worked great to patch the holes in the toe-tips of the Muttluks, (another issue resolved by the Neo-Paws)...They'll make for some good 'spares' in case we need them.At about $40 a 2 pair set, Neo-Paws are right in the ball park with them all, but far better. That's the report from "Willow's Dad" J.M. LohrWe are so impressed with Neo-Paws that I joined their 'Referral Team'.If you go to www.neopaws.com and like what you see, you can get a discount by useing the (Ref. Code 910472)Remember..'Measure both the 'Length & Width' of both 'Front & Back' paws to ensure a perfect fit the first time. I think the Width will be your best clue as to the size but get as close as you possibly can.

I decided to purchase a cat fountain because (i) I changed my cats water bowl twice a day and wanted something that would be a bit easier, (ii) my cat loves drinking water every day out of my hand from the bathroom sink and (iii), quite frankly, I love spoiling her and thought this would be a loving gift to her. Originally, I conducted research on the Drinkwell and Petmate fountains and decided to purchase the Drinkwell, particularly after reading about the review's on the Petmate's filters being recently changed into a cheaper version.Before the initial assembly, I cleaned all of the parts. When I started this thing, it sounded like a a pool filtration system was in my kitchen! I mean, this thing was LOUD! So, I contacted Drinkwell: they said to disassemble the motor, clean it and add some olive oil to the spining little metal rod in the motor...did that. When I started it back up, it was quieter for about five minutes...then I was back to the pool filtration system sound. So, I contacted Drinkwell again. They said to allow 24 hours for the motor to "prime itself." Did that, too...no change. I tried changing the speeds to the lowest it can go, to the highest it could go, to everything in the middle...still no change. This thing was so loud, that my cat wouldn't even go near it unless it was turned off! There's more...Changing the water reservoir is a NIGHTMARE! I don't care how careful you are...you're going to get water all over the place. Let me try to explain: if you have used a humidifier before, you know that the water reservoirs on those things have a "stopper" so you can turn the reservoir right-side up or upside-down and no water should seep out; the same holds true for those water containers you see at the work-place. This is so you remove and replace the reservoir without water spilling. There is no such stopper here!! Get this...you have to flip the reservoir a certain way OVER the Drinkwell foutain--as the DIRECTIONS say--to "MINIMIZE" (not "prevent") the spilling of the water!!! In other words, no matter how you do it, water WILL spill out! I mean...really?! This means, if it's near a wall, which I put mine and where I think most people would put it, you'll have to move the foutain away from the wall, where it will spill when removing the reservoir if there is any water in it, and then it will spill again (no doubt) when you put the reservoir back on it, and then you'll need to do some clean-up! When the reservoir is on its side, it GUSHES out! When the reservoir is the direction such that the stopper (and I use the term "stopper" very lightly) is on the bottom (how it goes into the fountain), it drips heavily...more likely streams of water coming out. So, you'll need to clean the water spills EVERY time you deal with the reservoir. I would not change this thing over any rug...that's for sure.The directions recommend weekly cleanings. In order to stay within the warranty, Drinkwell informed me that it must be cleaned at least once every two weeks. Speaking of warranty...it's only ONE YEAR!! Horrible!The first two issues (i.e., the loud pump and the reservoir spilling) were easily enough for me to want to return this product. However, there was a third...and I do feel that this is a cat-particular issue...meaning, one cat may find this to be an issue (like mine), and another may not: It is the free-falling water. My cat didn't like it. In fact, when my cat puts her head in the fountain pool (when it's turned off), her head would probably hit the running water...and I have a five-month old small female kitten! The Petmate (and Catmate) fountains still give the benefits of running water (i.e., the attractive sound for the cat, keeping the water cool, oxidation, etc.), but without the obtrusiveness of free-falling water.As I write this, the Drinkwell is on its way back to Amazon. In doing more research, I narrowed my alternate choices down to the Petmate Deluxe (medium size since I only have one cat) and the Catemate fountains. I ultimately chose the Petmate fountain since it has a reservoir, and the Catmate fountain does not. I wanted the ability to not have to add water all the time, which the Petmate will allow. The Catmate needs to have water added directly to the fountain and I read one review that said this person added water daily. I also feel my cat will prefer streaming water down a slide over the free-falling water.An incidental benefit to the Petmate fountain is that the Petsmart medium fountain is HALF the price of the Drinkwell ($27 versus $44).Let's now talk filters: Yes, I'm reading about complaints of the Petmate filters and how they are supposed have undergone a loss of quality with a recent "update" to them. For me, given the above, I'm more than willing to have this as a trade-off, IF they are in fact "poorer" quality than the Drinkwell filters. Of course, I won't be able to gauge this until I actually receive and set up the Petmate fountain. However, know this: in the Drinkwell directions, it states that the filters aren't even necessary for normal operation! Additionally, the Drinkwell filters are supposed to be changed (again, according to the directions), every "4 to 6 weeks." On the other hand, the Petmate filters are recommended to be changed (ready for this) every 60 to 90 DAYS!! So, if all is, in fact, equal, regarding the filter quality, then the Petmates last up to THREE TIMES longer than the Drinkwell filters.I currently have the Petmate fountain ordered and I really hope I don't have the same issues I did with the Drinkwell. I can then provide feedback on that foutain.

This gate serves our purpose. It keeps our 2 small aging pugs from going upstairs. It does not keep our toddling grandchildren from knocking it over onto themselves. I know it's not meant to be a child safety gate, but it is actually very unsafe to have around kids. I would not recommend this gate to anyone with medium sized dogs, or dogs who have lots of energy. This gate can be knocked over easily. It does serve our purpose, and it looks attractive. I do think it is overpriced.

The bed is flimsy and the bottom is exposed foam, so it will not last at all. The fabric used is thin and cheap. Not worth even buying this, it will not last!They did refund all my money and the return was simple,

The cover is not what I call sherpa. It is not what sherpa looks like if you go to the Majestic webside and zoom in on the texture of the cover. It is soft but doesn't have the sherpa texture.Also, the bed comes in a box (from Majestic) folded in half. It took a couple of days for it to lay properly. I agree that this bed is very light weight. I am using it for 2 dogs that are each under 20 lb. Therefore, it is sturdy enough for them. I would not recommend it for a 50 lb. dog.
I got these for my cat, and they are super cute. However.. she finally learned she could chew them off, so within 24-38 hours of putting them on, she chews them off.
This product did not work. It did not seem as though the light provided enough heat to attract the fleas and I only saw one flea trapped inside. I would not recommend this product.

My dog loves this ball. He had one before, but the inner ball popped out. We thought maybe there was a crack in the ball. After the ball popped out the ball started to come apart. We bought a second one and within one week he popped the ball out again. We examined the ball and there were no cracks and we couldn't find out how he got the ball out. A couple of weeks later the ball began to crack and it is cracking at the hole the ball was in and in the paw symbols. I just orderded two more because he loves this ball. I wish it would last longer.
this product came in broken they shipped it in a envelope and there was more product in the paper and on the floor of the steps then in the bottle . It should have been shipped in a box
Well made, colorful and fun. Very nice size bowl - keeps you from over feeding your cat.
Hard to install, almost cut myself on the metal stripping and the screws are on the outside entrance. Not the best door but looks pretty good

We were looking for a seat that would stand up to a lot of jumps and hanging on. Our kitty, Hemi, likes to be around us but not right next to us. We installed this next to our recliner and she loves it. It is large enough for her to sleep on and sit comfortably. She likes the shaggy carpet on top because our house is 80% wood floor.It does include 2 screws for it to be mounted. Our sill sits out about an inch. When we installed it, it was saggy. We bridged that gap by stuffing pieces of cardboard from the box it came in behind it. You can't see it at all.Also, when she jumps on the top, air comes out of a little hole. It sounds like "ffffffffff." So when we hear that noise, we know she just jumped up on the seat. She is about 11 pounds and it has held up well for the past 6 months.

This pad I ordered is very poor thin quality same as what I ordered from a different seller for less then half the price! What a rip off and the delivery shipment was very late! Yes the seller Overpriced it! I contacted the seller for return shipping and the seller wants the customer to pay for the return shipping. And the Product is not opened and still in original shipping package. Shipping cost estimate was too much! So I just keep and use it. Warning do not waste your money on this poor thin quality pad. I just want to share this to everyone before they decides to order this. Hope this save people from wasting their money.

I was super excited to order this product after reading the great reviews. Unfortunately, after receiving the product, I am disapointed. The pen is way too small. I have a four pound puppy, and her bed and puppy pad barely fit in the pen. I have no clue how people are squeezing labs and larger dogs into this pen. I have a larger pen made by Top Paw that is much more sturdy and spacious. I keep my puppy in the Top Paw pen during the day while I am at work, and I keep her in the Iris pen at night to sleep. Overall, this pen does look nice and is sturdy, but is a bit too small for our needs.*EDIT* After posting this review, I noticed that you could order the 4 OR 8 panel pen. I wish I would have realized this when I ordered my pen. I have purchased two more panels in hoped of making the Iris pen a bit more spacious.

Be aware that this company is knowingly marketing this product using a an imaging that represents the current range; however, they will supply an older version of the drug. Once you're order is placed the image will miraculously change to the old product line as if that is what you ordered all alone. Very devious.

I work in Alaska in the summer and winter in New Mexico, so have to fly back and forth twice a year. I have a 63 lb. sled dog that flies with me. If a large powerful dog like mine wants out, this kennel will not keep him from getting out, he has destroyed two doors and now the bottom half of the kennel. Unfortunately, neither will any of the other plastic airline kennels sufficiently contain this type of dog. I am looking into a foldable aluminum kennel from Kalispel.If you have a normal dog, this kennel should be fine, and costs 6 times less than the Kalispel.PS My kennel was the LARGE size.

My vet claims the Feliway products work but I have doubts. My brought a new male into the home months ago and I expected more from this. It's not a miracle product by any means. They still fight and I've had to separate them because now my female is marking. There are some things that cannot solve all of our problems and this is one of them.The other problem I have is that my house is 100 years old and most of the outlets are horizontal, not vertical. I can't really plug this in anywhere on the first floor without some sort of adaptor, so take that into consider ation.

I lucked out and bought this exact one at the local Goodwill for $20 in almost new condition and it works great. I especially love the double door for easy access when in my SUV and also the way it collapses for storage. If you haven't tried before it can be a bit difficult to assemble/disassemble but after you've done it once you'll become a pro at it. Great product with nice handles to carry it by.
Kind of flimsy. Didn't realize the foam at the bottom was exposed. Foam is also kind of thin. Was expecting a better quality bed.
It's a good concept, but the rope part of the tug a jug is not as durable as I thought. My Corgi/Australian Shepherd puppy cleanly separated the rope into 2 pieces so now it's just a jug.

Please do your research on pet foods and what is actually good for your cats. Hills science diet is a horrible food filled with horrible ingredients. They charge an outrageous price because it's the #1 vet recommended food. This is a joke and the only reason why it's rated #1 buy vets is because Hills gives money to soon to be vets to help them go through school. Then they sell the cat food to them cheap so they can jack up the price and make a nice profit off of your marketing foolishness. Read the back of the labels of Hills brand and you will see that most of the top ingredients are grains or cheap meat by products which are the feathers, bones, unwanted organs from animals, basically all of the stuff we wouldn't eat. try something like orijen or evo.
This light has a bright white light. I've gotten other lights that were very dull, but this one was very bright. Makes my fish tank, and me, very happy!
I have been using the rings for years and they work great, I change about a quarter of the rings every time I change the filter.

I bought my mini-bow aquarium in 2002 and have enjoyed it a lot. I have never had any problems with it and would recommend this for any beginner or breeder who needs a "baby" tank. I have a bigger tank as well but this is my favorite as it is a lot easier to clean :-)

Be aware that this probe pack doesn't fit the Petsafe PIF-275-19 Wireless Radio Collar, even though it "implies that it does."Just under item's description there is a section, "Frequently Bought Together." This has the PIF 275 in that section suggesting they can be bought together. It's obviously an over site and only a $3 one at that but it's not worth the effort....The black plastic plates that fit under the probes are NOT SLANTED like the PIF-275 requires. I hope this helps someone not to make the same mistake. I wish someone had put this in the reviews earlier.

These are great for the aggressive chewer, but you'll need to time it if you base it on my experience. I tried the 8" with a 75 lb american terrier, and an 8 lb toy maltese.Both are pretty aggressive chewers, but both got diahrrea from getting to about half the bone. (I tried 8" for pit bull and 4" for maltese).Limit it's intake and you should be fine.They DO entertain for what I'd say is good, which is an hour. If your pet is to be confined, unwatched, or crated for over an hour, I'd say use a Nylabone or other bone for aggressive chewers.

My puppy loved to play with this toy but it only lasted a week and a half so I'm not sure if it was worth it. It came with a replacement ball which was nice. Maybe my puppy was just too rough with it but one arm was torn off by the second day.
I received two soccer balls and one had a hole in it and becomes flat when the dog puts it in their mouth! My dog loves these balls but I will not order them again. Too much money
Great cover for dog run but the zip ties that came w/it were so old and brittle they just snapped as I tried to use them!
I gave them to my sister and her dogs and cats like them.I can't really blame the product my dog is spoiled and picky.

My dog loved the treats themselves, but wouldn't touch the rubber ball part because of the awful chemical smell it puts out! I finally had to throw the thing away because the smell was making me sick as well.. expensive mistake!

Not sturdy enough. I go through one of these every 2-3 months. Large birds like Cardinals, Dove & Jays are too heavy for this and eventually break the bottom off. They prefer the tray which is why I bought this model and it works well for about 2-3 months, but the tabs that hold the bottom off ALWAYS breakdown. I'm trying other "tray" models. Cheap and great if you don't have "heavy" birds or squirrels to deal with. Definitely attracts a lot of birds, just doesn't last long.
This is by far the best value for Aspen Bedding I have found.I am very satisfied and will buy again.

How long was this thing is storage? I tried washing it once and then sprayed it down with Fabreeze but it still stinks to the point that I wouldn't even put it on my dog! And, I have to store it in a ziplock plastic bag so the stink isnt going to fade anytime soon.

the feeder holes on this feeder are too big for small seed so i bought chunky stuff with nuts and fruit, nice idea and the song birds loved it. unfortunately so did the squirrels and grackles. the grackles got frustrated because they couldn't get to the food the conventional way so they began to fly at it (I swear) to get it swinging and dump the food on the ground. the benefit for them was that the top came off too -- easier access! the squirrels then promptly figured out how to pop the top as well. i have stopped using it.

I bought this mainly to reinforce my dog's inconsistent response to my requests and to stop his bad habit of eating every thing that's on the floor which often causes him to gag and vomit it back up later. My two main problems with this product was:1. The intensity of the correction at the lowest setting was too intense! I had the dial set at 1 and my dog would yelp and bark out in pain and run around the house in fear. I would never forget how angry he looked and barked when he got that correction, ran down stairs to escape while looking at me with anger. The lowest setting was just too strong for him to even concentrate on being trained.2. The transmitter buttons did not always lead to a correction. Hitting the buttons on the transmitter was hit or miss. Sometimes the message got sent to the receiver and sometimes it seemed as if the buttons got stuck or just wouldn't send out the message to the receiver. Of course, it is crucial with remote collar training for the dog to receive the correction immediately once you press that button.My other gripe was that the transmitter was kind of large, you need a screwdriver to access the battery compartment and no rechargeable batteries. Needless to say, I returned this item and wound up getting the Petsafe Yard and Park Trainer which I have only been using for 2 days now but I am much more satisfied with this product. It costs twice as much than this device but I get rechargeable batteries, a small transmitter that consistently gets the correction to the collar. I keep it on the lowest setting and that correction does not make my dog vocalize to the correction. It just gets his attention. I will see how that one stands up against time but so far, so good.

I bought on of these for my Australian cattle dog that pulls when i walk her. This harness is ok for calm dogs but If your needing a harness to make walking easier i would suggest getting one that crosses in front of the chest. This one stills allows the dog to choke themselves. But the stiching and ring design is good.

Pros:Dogs like itUniqueStays functional even after breachCons:Really not that durable (stuffing was leaking within the week.)A little awkward to play with.Protip for dog toys: Go to the fabric store, get some cheap fleece (3$/yard or so) tie into knots, braids, whatever. Get creative. Give em to the dogs. Enjoy.

I purchased two of these vests for my dogs so that they would be seen in the snow as something other than a hunted animal. First off, I found them to run a bit small. My male, Herman Munster, has a very large chest, and the strap barely fit around it. The back strap also has a fit issue. If I were to close it, it would come right across his penis. Not a great feature. So I had to snap it together on his back, so it just kind of flaps around like a cape. The first time he wore it, the strap got caught on a branch, and totally unraveled. So even if the placement had worked, it's of no use to me now. My female, Lily Munster, is on the chubby side, and the straps barely fit around her. I couldn't go up a size, because it would be too long for her body. So all in all, I'm not impressed with them. Sizing was an issue, placement of straps, durability also did not impress me. The concept is great, but I could've been more impressed.
I thought it would be great, but my dog doesn't even touch it. Sits in his basket of toys negelcted.

If I am going to spend this kind of bread on a dog bed, I expect higher quality and better durability. I purchased this bed for my mini Daschund because she just loves to burrough and be cozy. At first, the cost did not deter me because I love to find things for her to enjoy, and she is certainly worth what I thought would be a very special treat. The bed's cushion compacted very quickly and has done so unevenly. It is like a cheap, lumpy, flattened pillow. Because of that, she has taken to sleeping on top of the bourrough pocket. Again, my doxie is a smaller type of her breed, and so she does not weigh much. She is also pretty gentle with her bedding in general because she considers it her own little territory and she is pretty neat and tidy. I have purchased other nice beds for her for less cost which she enjoys far more and finds a lot more confortable. I am just really disappointed with how lumpy and flat the cushion as become. It is a very attractive bed, and the outter materials are of good quality. I would also recommed, however, for the sticthing to be better reinforced. If the manufacturer could design a similar bed with better filling for the cushion, it would make a HUGE difference. I shared my opinion with a co-worker who excitedly purchased two for her small dogs right after I bought this bed. She also shared the same sentiments with me. We agreed that we would not have purchased this bed for the price being asked had we known.
The bed is nice and sturdy. My dog did put a hole in it after a few weeks. Not sure if after such a short use if a replacement cover would be worth it.

My cat loves to sit on my lap when there's a heating pad on it, so I got one of these so she could have her own heating pad. The last time I bought my cat a cat bed she sat in it once and that was it. Not interested. She LOVES this cat cushion and sleeps on it every day. It really does warm up with her, it's like magic! I wish there was a huge cushion for me too like this. My cat is a bit older - 8 years old - and I'm guessing this is extra-good for older kitties. She gives it four paws up!

I was hoping this product would be enticing to my cats with its yummy salmon scent and flavor. Unfortunately, my cats hate the salmon oil and won't go anywhere near it. I'm not sure if it's because they're not used to it, but they really don't want to eat it, so now it's just collecting dust in my pantry. At least it was affordable, so I didn't waste a ton of money buying it. Maybe someone else's cats would like it? Or a dog, maybe? Better luck to anyone else who buys this for their pets.
My 30 lb dog had this in 5 pieces in less than a minute. I didn't even get the tag off and he already had it torn up. Not for chewers!

Ordered this for an 8 week old 3 pound puppy. Thought small would be a pretty good size for her but it is actually rather large. She can't get her mouth around it and squeeze treats out. Instead she rolls it around and one or two fall out which seems to entertain her for a bit but does nothing to help with her need to chew. Surprising because I ordered other puppy kong products and in small and they are perfect size. Maybe she will grow into it but for now she just chases it around. Also the material is very stiff and not easy to bend leading me to think even if it fit her mouth shed have a hard time with it anyway. If you are looking for something for pup to chew on and release treats I wouldn't really recommend this. However as a chase it and maybe a treat will come out toy its working pretty well.

I love the design and look of this feeder. After receiving not one but TWO of these sets, (In case the first was an error) I am so very sad. The paw print design on the bowls and mat is not black, but a very distinct ROYAL BLUE. If you can use blue, then you will love it. I cannot, so I will keep looking for an attractive elevated feeder. Of course the metal stand itself is black. The packaging it comes in states the product is black, but it is certainly NOT. The bowls were nice and heavy. I did not bother assembling the rack since the other items were the wrong color so I can't comment on how sturdy the rack is.
This little device is the same as leaving a night light on and putting some tape on the floor. thats it. Yes bugs attact to light that is the truth but this did nothing for us.

I think the idea of this product is great. The rolling box is certainly helpful, but I have found that as my kitten has gotten bigger she doesn't like it as much as the open air one. She is still pretty small, but she almost makes the "regular" size one look too small.Pro: rolls nice and easy clean upCons: TOO small and maybe not worth the nice clean up.

Please do your research. You can get a tank like this at Petsmart (made of GLASS) for no more than $20, probably less. And with a tank so small, you really shouldn't be that concerned with getting a super high quality/expensive tank. Maybe if you are getting a 55 gallon you should be more concerned. Acrylic and glass have their advantages/disadvantages, and Petsmart actually doesn't carry very many acrylic tanks.

We have two young cats and the LitterMaid box worked well for us for approximately 3 or 4 months before extended kitty use took its devestating toll on it.1. Cats scratch up the litter which then ends up in the tracks the cleaning comb moves in. Litter and other debris (you know what I mean :-) can gum up the tracks and prohibit the comb from sweeping all the way across the litter box. Fixing this requires a major, detailed cleaning which is hard to do well and not risk damaging the electronic components of the box. Aside from the "cleaning the box thoroughly" issue (see #2 below), prior to cleaning the product it will sometimes get stuck in this loop where it continually tries to keep push comb down the track, get jammed, detect this, and then retry only to fail again. It effectively prohibits the cats from using the litter box until you fix it by unplugging it and waiting a few seconds and plugging it back in. This is disasterous when it happens while you are not home for several hours -- say at work all day.2. Cats often don't pee directly down into the litter. Our male cat hit the sensors, tracks, etc... There were two consequences: (a) you have to be very careful cleaning out the sensors and wiring to make sure the water doesn't damage the electronic components of the box -- this was a huge pain and very easy to screw up and (b) and in the end, even if you are diligent about trying to keep the electronics clean, dry and functioning, I don't think they are designed to handle long term exposure to the pee. In the end, all the sensors and electonics simply stopped functioning for us, making it a very expensive regular litter box which is hard to clean.

This is not the first time I have purchased a LitterMaid Self-Cleaning Litter Box. Previous products resulted in somewhat a mixed review. The last unit seemed a little less powerful and bogged down frequently. This unit performs well. Though it is not a cure-all, some manual effort is needed to scape the bottom of the tray, it certainly makes the job more a part time clean up. I would recommend it to anyone that is looking for some assistance on a nasty job or who spends some time away from home.
this is a GREAT collar for the price... looks exactly as pictured. Shipping from this vendor was fast (but a little pricey). Really fun collar

Every time I ride I get chased by dogs because I ride a recumbent trike. The Silent button with the ultrasonic sound is less effective than the other button that makes the continual irritating noise. The dogs do pause which gives me an opportunity to cycle away, but on a few occasions they have continued to pursue - especially the smaller dogs. Generally it works though. I wish they would make it smaller so attach more conveniently to the bike and also that it would stop the dogs dead in their tracks once the button is pushed. All in all it has actually been very helpful.

I purchased 2 of these collars (mango orange and snowball white), 1 for each of my 2 cats. One loves it and has only taken it off once. My other cat won't keep it on. It bothers her neck I think. I have had these since April 2012 and the cat who hates it has managed to put all kinds of teeth holes in the clasp and chew marks on the collar itself. She wriggles her bottom jaw through the bottom part and stretches it out so she can take it off. OR if the part nearest to her chin is the clasp, she chews on it until it pops open. I am not sure this is a flaw in the design or functionality of this product but it has since been lost for a month or so.

I have a 13 y.o. Golden Retriever who was having a very difficult time getting up and walking. She had lost all muscle tone in her hind quarters because of this and I was afraid that my time with her was getting short. Her spirit was still pretty good, but she would fall down often and then struggle to get up again. I started her on a combination of Cosequin DS and Liquid Health's K-9 Glucosamine on Thanksgiving weekend and am amazed at the difference it has made three months later! Actually, she started showing signs of improvement within a few weeks of starting her on the supplements. Last weekend she even ran several laps around the back yard. She is still a little slow to get up and limps for the first couple steps, but once she regains her balance, there is no stopping her! She is as playful as she was at two years old again. Highly recommended!
The pads are sort of small, it makes it had to wrap around a finger. Once in contact w/ dog saliva they get very slippery & hard to hang onto. But the dogs don't seem to mind the taste at all.

This is a good disenfectant for animal quarters and kills most of the common nasties and a few not so common. Ken'l-Lan 128 doesn't have a strong odor or perfume smell which is a big plus in my book. The only major drawback is the pink color which can stain clothes or table tops when diluting. If you do get the concentrate on clothing it can be permanent if allowed to dry.

This filter came with my 5 gallon tank kit. At first, I thought it would be good because the filter packs are easy. After the first week, a gunky film developed at the bottom of the tank. I tried to siphon it out and change the filter more often, but it kept coming back. I finally bought the Aqua Clear filter and it is much better. The water is crystal clear and there is no built up on the bottom of the tank.

Some background info about my pup: She tugs and pulls everywhere we go. It's like she doesn't even recognize me at the other end of the leash while at home she listens to everything I say. Sometimes she likes to make my life harder when she hops 4-5 ft instead of walking. She is a 45 lb labrador/hunting hound mix.
