Two of the eggs already had splits on the seams straight out of the packaging.I don't know if my pups is just too rough for plush toys or if this was truly a bad design. For comparison, I got the small mallard (AKC Mallard Dog Toy, Small) and that's still going strong, despite being carried around the yard, squeaked in rapid succession, dragged through and ground into the mud, tumbling down the stairs and run through the washing machine. He got that 6 days ago and there's just a little fuzz missing from the nose.I think the platypus was made for gentle dogs.
Bought it for our small Holland Lop rabbits, who are small. But, this box is only appropriate for a very, very small rabbit.

I know, the title's pretty lame, but then...I'm not so fond of the wheel, either. When my chinchilla gets running, this wheel starts BANGING, and it doesn't matter if I have it attached to the cage wall or the stand. It's a pretty flimsy construction, and of course as others have said, plastic and chinchillas don't make a healthy combination anyway (but it was the only thing my pet store had, so I decided to try it out anyway). I can't give any good substitutions, unfortunately, since I'm still looking for one myself. All I know is that this wheel is certainly NOT a very silent spinner!
My yellow lab was not at all interested in the toy. I think I'll give it to my grand son's dog he might have more fun with it.

This seems to be a well made crate, tough material etc. It is harder to set up than some more expensive brands, but since I leave it open most of the time it works great for me. I use it in my car, for transport to and from dog classes. At class it is easy to just carry back and forth if needed. Would definitely buy it again.

Works well and have had no problems. Only complaint is the pump motor, which is louder than I expected. Puts out an audible humm, which can be heard through the floor in the room below, even though the fountain is on a thick carpet.

The product looked very cute online. When I opened the box I could tell that it was a piece of junk because the paint was already peeled off the side of the stand. Very cheaply made and very over priced for it.
this dress is really cute, unfortunately the size info wasn't accurate enough and it turned way too big for our mini pinscher. We were very disappointed.

I've had problems with the suction cups on the heater since day one. They don't keep the heater secure. I have two turtles and they easily knock the heater around on a daily basis. It does keep the water at an even temperature.

Unit functions well. Adjustments don't tighten up enough for two active Golden Retrievers, so I find the head pointed a kilter at times. Big issue is our desert climate. The sun heats the water in the metal clad hose to very high temperatures making it unusable at the times the dogs would need it most. Otherwise I would recommend it for automatic drinking.

I bought two of these because they were cheap and would seem like a good fit for my aquariums, a 5 gallon and a 10 gallon. There wasn't much information provided, which would have helped me out and kept me from buying it--it's not the kind I needed, or so I thought.*Unfortunately it's not submersible. (I didn't realize not buying submersible would mean needing to reach a water line indicator.)*This heater's range is 67 - 72 degrees Fahrenheit. Even though the range is low, when I had the heater on the first few hours, it got the 5 gallon tank water over 90 degrees. I've kept it in the 80's range as much as possible.*It requires the tank to be full to cover the water line indicator (I'm breeding snails so I can't have the tank full if I want my snails to lay their eggs on the tank's glass, and if I want to keep them from escaping). The water line indicator also rises above my power filter, so I'll never be able to get the water to the height it's asking.*The power cord is much shorter than I thought it would be. I had to get an extension cord to plug it in. The picture on the back of the packaging suggests to make a drip loop, but the cord is barely long enough to do that, and the top of the aquarium is only a couple feet, give or take, from the socket. Very inconvenient.*It's only good for aquariums up to 5.5 gallons. I haven't tried my second heater in the 10 gallon yet, mostly because the cord is so short, and the tank is much farther from the socket.*Temperature control knob seems really sensitive, and even turning the knob a quarter of an inch seems to cause the temperature to shoot up. But as soon as the desired temperature is attained, it will maintain.Overall it's a decent product especially considering the price. I was surprised and thankful it worked so far outside of its range.

I have a pet care business and wanted a brush that I can use on multiple animals to help their owners with shedding. I heard about this product from another dog walker and a client. It is amazing! I use it on cats and a few long hair breeds of dogs (Shiba Inu, Flat-coated Retriever/Border Collie mix, and Corgi/Aussie mix, Chow mix). It works great for all these animals and the fur comes out much quicker than a regular brush or wire brush. You can clearly see a difference in the coat afterwards. Several people who saw me using the brush purchased it after because they were so amazed. Would definitely recommend to anyone with a cat or a dog with a thick undercoat.

I have a 7 pound cat and this litter box is all his own. I've had it now for 3 months. First I used it without the hood. The cat became enfatuated with the scooper and the workings and kept the machine running every 20 minutes. After 15 days, the poop odor became unbearable though I didn't smell any urine. To stop the cat from playing with the scooper, I added the hood. It worked. The motor sound attracts the cat but the hood made it difficult for him to yank it when it stops moving. To better control the odor, I have added some additional powder which I put in first before adding the litter. This has helped. Still, after 15 days, the poop reservoir is full and sometimes starting to overflow, so I have to change it.Overall, it's better than scooping every day manually. But this comes at a price, the refills are not cheap (on sale, you can buy a regular litter box and litter for less than 1 refill) and, for me, I have to replace the refill twice a month. Overall, it would be about $360/year for me to keep this going--if it doesn't break down.

Nice spring loaded attachment for these cutting guides.Take care to avoid catching the tips of the teeth on the skin of your animal. These teeth tips are far sharper than the set that came with my Andis clipper.

I have a small 3" goldfish and also a large 8" goldfish in one large tank. I am always struggling to find a food they both can enjoy eating. These crisps seemed perfect so I tried them out only to have to clean my freshly cleaned tank in approximately two days of using them because of the STRONG RED Dye they use to make these flakes a desirable looking color. If tetra would leave the dye out of these crisps they would be fantastic! Until then it back to a small mix of flake food and Koi pellets.

Small amount of aluminum around flap, the rest is cheap flimsy plastic that wont last. The add for this product is misleading, that you are getting an aluminum dog door. your not! Dont buy this product!

The Furminator worked great on my short hair dog. Very easy to take the hair off the tool. The teeth on the tool does not irritate my dogs skin, she loves it when I sit and comb her coat. Would recommend to a friend. Great bargain for the price.

I really should have listened to the other reviews, but I thought, "Hey, my dog's aren't like those dogs." Really though, my dogs are pretty easy when it comes to me working with them. But even I went cross eyed a few times trying to get the harness on the dogs. Once I got the harness on the larger dog, my wife and I just started cracking up. I mean, we might as well have duct taped the dogs paws together. However, it did work as advertised, No Jumping! But, not much walking either. If I wanted my dog to just stand there afraid to move, I would have been better off putting her in a crate...lol. Shortly after, we were pretty quick to look up how to return the item. Sorry, it's just really not a great product.
I was very pleased with the timely manner of witch I received me product ordered. The product itself was exactly what I ordered and I am very pleased with it.

I checked the reviews before I purchased. They warned me that it was too hard and the heat didn't last the night. I bought it anyway and sure enough they were right. At least I knew what I was getting into so I can't really complain. I wish there was something better. I use it outside so an electrical plug isn't an option (I'm afraid of electrocution or fire). This is the best option I could find at this time.
My dog loves it! BUT the batteries died after 1 week...so how much will these batteries cost me? more than the toy?

These were right for the price, to test out whether or not my Mini Aussie liked having anything on his feet (he doesn't). I bought them to use in the snow, but one shake of the paw and they were flung into the yard not to be seen again until the snow melted a month later! Overall, if your dog doesn't mind having these on his/her feet, then they're a good bargain, but they're definitely the quality of a bargain and for anything more than occasional or seasonal use, spend the money on a good pair of high quality dog boots.

After the dog chews on an end, it makes indentations that turn into small sharp edges that start cutting the gums. If you see the color red, it's not inside the product. It's your dog bleeding. I tried a couple of brands so it's not the manufacturer it's the nylon. Where's PETA when you need them?

This scratch post is okay. We have two kittens and they have used it a little but they don't seem to like the top of it because there is no padding. I would recommend purchasing a post with padding so the cats can climb on top or if you're going for this one you probably want to add some padding to make it more inviting.
Very disappointing - past units were very good (I have had 3), but this one was nothing but problems and broke after 6 months. I would avoid this model, very disappointing - a waste of money.

Best prices on a superb topical flea/tick treatment. Both my dogs are flea-less, and also tick-less. Works really well, but definitely not water-proof. If you wash your dog(s) often, perhaps, find another treatment that works after continual washings. Otherwise, Frontline Plus is a great product in controlling fleas and ticks throughout the year, especially in the hotter months of the year.

I have two dogs, one medium-small, another medium-large. I used to buy the Old West Tendon Strip Chews and have been looking for something to replace them since they seem to have been discontinued. These Old West Pizzles are a disappointment in that they lasted no longer than three minutes with either of my dogs and the medium-small one is not a heavy chewer. I suppose I expected these to be more of a "chew", but instead they were quite lightweight and brittle, almost like hard taffy sticks, and were gone in no time. These are still good treats for my dogs - they sure aren't complaining - but the search continues for an affordable treat that'll last longer than ten minutes.
This coat is very nice. Very warm. The sizing is the only thing that bothered me. I have bought this size for Trixie before; but this is a little big.

I ordered this collar and made sure that it was not listed as a "containment collar". You will not receive the collar pictured you will receive a containment collar. They sent me a collar with holes in it and no ring (so his leash will not attach). The holes are to attach an electric fence zapper. I do not have an electric fence so I had to return it.**I gave it three stars because I have a lupine collar for my dog and love it. He chewed it once and they replaced it no questions asked. I

My dogs really like this chipmunk, but right away they broke the squeaker, and then a few days later they ripped off the tail. They still like playing with it though. It's very cute and a good purchase even with the negatives.
I bought this for my cat to keep her away from the doggy door and safely inside the house. I had to cut the collar quite a bit to make it fit, but it works like a charm.

When they say Extreme, they mean it. This is way stronger than the regular version. I put a few little doggie cookies in there, or some dried chicken jerky, and my doggies are happy and busy for quite some time. These are easy to wash, and just last and last. Awesome.

The product works fine until it breaks. That said, mine tripped the GFI (ground fault interrupter safety outlet that MUST be used to prevent electrocution) after the first season. I dried it out and tried another GFI on a different circuit and the same thing happened. One of the Amazon reviews tells of another user's interaction with the manufacturer in an attempt to receive warranty satisfaction. Having read that review I decided to buy a different product to replace this one. If the product fails in the dead of winter the pond will freeze over then it's very difficult to insert a replacement heater.

This is the second one of these we purchased because we really liked the first one. We use them in our cat condo/towers for our Burmese short hair cats to use in the winter. We liked the fact that the plug in the wall had a switch that turned the heater heater on or off if you weren't using it. When we got another one for our other cat they changed the unit and there is no turn-off switch. You have to unplug it from the wall. A real inconvenience since it's plugged in behind other furniture. Try to find another brand that has the on/off switch on the on cord.

Old model worked wonderfully which prompted me to purchase the new model. New model not nearly as efficient and have to "tweak" it frequently. Don't know what they changed in the past 7 years but something is different.

I love Lupine products and I have the matching leash, so I thought I would give this a go when my RC pet martingale wore out. I have to say I prefer the RC product because of the chain versus the cloth on the slip (martingale part). The Lupine collar slip will get "stuck" in the tight position and not release very well. It also is fraying where the cloth meets the metal. I expected this to happen, but thought it would take longer than it did. Will get an RC collar again soon, even though it doesn't match my leash!

I thought this would stop more rain from getting on my dog than it did. His feet still get wet of course, but the hood doesn't stay on his head and it's difficult to get the back elastic straps to keep this straight on his back end. Overall, it keeps the bulk of his body dry, but be prepared to still wipe his belly, head, and feet.

I haven't used the product yet. I will be using it this weekend. However, I was taken aback when I only received one. So, I had to order another one. I wound up spending over 22 bucks. Please read the advertisment closely to make sure you are getting what you want.

Got this thing used and it works like a champ. Fully submersible and simple to use. I really like the way you can change the water flow direction at the top. The only downside if any is it's slight bulky size.

Sadly I have tried every medicine suggested including this one for our shitzu. I have been giving her 2 tablets a day, I am almost done with the box and she still eats her poop. I am resorting to taking her to potty every time and keeping her away from it. I have lost all hope. This product must work for some and not others.

This product, though pricey, has given me such piece of mind for my dogs. It was simple to install and use and now my dogs roam the yard and I never worry about them getting out or following another dog in street.

Got this for my 9-yr-old Australian shepherd. I also bought the orange one for the younger dog. Both dogs were able to remove the treats from the balls in under 10 minutes. (It took me at least 5 minutes to put the treat in.) I'm glad I tried it, but won't get any more. Neither of my dogs is a very aggressive chewer...just very clever.

I, too, bought this to deal with an overweight cat, and weekends away from home. Unfortunately, the cat quickly figured out how to help himself to extra food by tapping the auger with his paw. No, he doesn't get much with each tap, but I can hear him messing with it all night long, so I know he is getting more food then his diet allows. So it sits empty and idle in the corner of the kitchen.......To it's credit, the device is sturdy and the timer's many programs makes it versatile.

I love this product! My dog would not chew on toys or rawhide things and her teeth were getting brown in the back from just foods she ate without cleaning them. My vet told me about Greenies, so I went on a search online for the best prices. They are wonderful, she gets one a day, chews it so it actually is helping with her teeth cleaning. It's all natural and even her breath smells better :)

I have fed hummers for 54 years. We have been driven mad with the bees, sometimes emptying a 16ozbottle in a day. I am concerned about these new feeders for the fledglings and adolescents. I am seeing that they can't enter the feeder because of the depth their beaks in the basin. I had to revert to my Perky bottles for the little guys still hanging around. I can't express very much about the new feeders because I got them towards the end of the season. Next season the new feeders will be out first training the adults to feed at them and I will go back to Perky. I raised exotic parrots for 17 years.

We had this product before and it worked amazingly for several years. This new one I ordered does not work at all however. The timer simply does not even open to the next portion! Luckily Amazon is sending a new one. I hope this new one will work as designed!

This product came in perfect condition, and in a timely manner which i loved! However it is very confusing trying to strap it onto the console...I basically gave up trying to strap it in and it seems to be squished between the two seats well enough that it doesnt move too much. Otherwise it does what it says it does and my dog seems to like it (after she finally figures out that she is connected to it and stops trying to jump around the car with it strapped to her collar...)

Bought this for my lab/pitt puppy, it fit alright, she didn't fill it out, she was about 20lbs. Also the hat didn't really stay on so that was disappointing. Everyone thought she looked very cute so it was a huge hit. Happy with my purchase but only gave it a 3 because the hat didn't stay up.

When I first received the Drinkwell fountain and took it out of its package, I knew I was in trouble. The unit separated into pieces. Talk about getting a bad feeling about a product. I put it all back together and immediately noticed how flimsy the connections were that held the unit together, especially the water refill tank. That part of the unit just lays up against the back of the fountain. Next came the almost insurmountable task of filling the unit with water and moving it to its location. It's extremely awkward to try and carry this thing around without spilling water everywhere. I challenge anyone out there to fill the water tank and the unit and not spill water on the floor as you take it from your sink to its resting location. In my opinion, it's just an awful design. Drinkwell recommends that you clean the unit every week, but I found it too much a hassle to abide by that maintenance schedule. Inevitably, I ended up cleaning my floors as well.I was so frustrated with this unit, that I threw it out after only using it for a month. At least most of the unit was recyclable. As far as I'm concerned, that was the only plus to this pet fountain.

Cleaning the litter box is so much easier now. All it takes is a couple minutes a day and it is clean. You just roll the box and all of the dirty litter gets trapped in the container. Finally no more touching the dirty litter. I find I clean the litter box more often now. This is a winner. The only downside that I have found is that the clips are not that strong. Mine haven't broke yet but I am prepared just in case. You can easily fix it just by using a screws or something similiar. Overall this is still one of the best litter boxes that I have tried.

I bought this for my 15 year old short hair pointer. She is always cold in the winter. Now that she is so old, I thought she would love having a warm spot. But she has not sat on her bed since I put the warmer in it. I think the plastic smell that it gave off the first few days caused her to dislike it. It has now been plugged in for 2 weeks, and no longer smells, but still no use. I am about ready to call it a mistake and unplug it.

we love the idea of draining a dog's energy, stimulating their mind, giving them a fun challenge, and feeding them all in one. we have bought a lot of the products that do just that. the buster cube was one of the first products we bought. it does what it says. the only downside is loading this thing. it takes time and is kind of a pain. we have since moved on to theKong Wobbler Dog Toy,OurPets DT-10504 Smarter Toys IQ Treat Ball, 5 Inches, andPremier Busy Buddy Tug-A-Jug, Medium/Large. all of which are easier to load and accomplish the same goal.

I used this on my horse. I used to get Frontline Spray but they don't make that anymore so I've been trying to find an alternative. This lasts 2-3 applications on a horse. Frontline Spray lasted once so that's a plus. And this is cheaper than Frontline The first time I put this on repelled all ticks. The second time I still found several ticks. When I didn't use it I found 54 ticks when I went out for a ride! The second time when I did use the spray I found much less - somewhere in the upper teens, so it did make a dent, but I'd rather find NO ticks especially since I live in an area where lyme can be found.
THE PRODUCT ARE EXCELLENT AND THE RESPONSE OF THIS SELLER IS TOO FAST AND GOOD, THANK YOU TO ALL FOR THIS.

Just a warning - this crate might abide by all FAA regulations, but if you're planning on using it to take your pet overseas, it does NOT meet IATA requirements. IATA requires that a crate have ventilation on all four sides. This crate does not have ventilation in the back.Additionally, IATA requires that "For rigid plastic containers, the door hinge and locking pins must engage the container by at least 1.6 cm (5/8 in) beyond the horizontal extrusions above and below the door opening where the pins are fitted."I realize that this is not advertised as IATA compliant, so I'm still giving it three stars because it seems well-made, but a little expensive.
Just wish this came in smaller size as it looked great on my dog, just would not stay on his feet two seconds. Had to return. Fortunately return was very easy and full refund was given.

Fighting the litter box every morning, trying to get all the pee blobs out of the box pushed me to purchase a metal scoop, hoping that the metal would more easily disengage the pee blob form the side of the plastic box (my one cat INSISTS on peeing in the corner, for maximum adhesion to the plastic side!). The metal part is dandy, but the handle is just too small. Or maybe my hands are too big. Either way, I generally just suffer with the plastic scoop with the larger, more comfortable handle.

I bought this pet carrier for my new Boston Terrier puppy - probably 5-6 pounds right now. The "Small" size Argo carrier is still much too big for him. However, even if it were the right size, the quality doesn't match the price of this carrier. It looks great, but 1) The holes you load the dog through on the sides are VERY small, even for my little dog - I could barely get him into the thing; 2) The inside is lightly padded on the bottom, but is covered only with hard plastic - other carriers have nice furry insides; 3) It doesn't have any pockets to hold your personal items (wallet, cell phone), or the dog's items (clean-up bags, treats, etc.). The peep hole is nice, but there's no way to cover it up (in case the dog gets over-excited in public, you want to make a quick run into the grocery without anyone noticing him, etc.) In summary, the bag looks very cute, but is not very functional. I returned it immediately.

The replacement covers installed easily. My dogs love these beds!I only wish the covers lasted longer than 6 months. I live in Hawaii, so the beds are outdoors and get a lot of sunshine. Not sure if the wear down is more the result of UV rays or just the constant use by the dogs. But the frames seems to be holding up well.

can not get any of our four persian cats to consume this product no matter what we mix it with .we have tried everything we can think of even thier most favorite food and they will not touch it once this product has been introduced in it .

If you just use the stand, this wheel is wobbly as hell. My hedghoge spins it loose every single night-I wake up, the the wheel is on the floor of the cage with the screw that holds it in place lost in the bedding. The damn thing is loud on account of how wobbly is. My hedghhoge has actually learned to spin for a while one way, flip around and start spinning the other way just so that the wheel doesn't pop-out! Again I am sure if I go out and buy the lug-knot and bolt it to the cage some how, it might work like it's suppose to.. Considering I payed like 25$ for it and it comes with a damn stand I just expected it to work without further hassle. The cleaning sucks as well, we all know hedghogs like to poop when they run - outcome is disastrous, after 1 night the wheel looked like I hadn't been cleaned in months and it was gonna take a lot of elbow grease to clean it up.
One of the videos showing the pigeons and squirrels was a hit - the other two nothing! Basically more for the owner and the cats
My puppy at 27lbs and 9 months had this chewed to pieces in under an hour.
These are tiny -- about the size of jacks. My mistake for buying them for my grey. He loves small foot toys, but these are just too flimsy. I'm sure they'd be fun for budgies or 'tiels.
These work fine, but as the Real Locker ones have the line that allows you to know the roll is about to run out, these don't, and trust me, that can be a messy & frustrating.

I was really happy when my gates (I ordered 2 gates) arrived within 3 days. One of the gates was in perfect condition while the other gate had a broken door hinge (which is nothing more than a small wooden dowel that the door swings on). I think the construction of the doggie door was not thought out very well. It is extremely flimsie and is not built to be used very often or to last for very long. You can tell that "cheap" was the main concern with the company who built these gates. I'm really surprised that the gates on both were not broken during shipping. I now have to tie the door with a piece of twine. I choose not to return the gate because I needed it right away because of an elderly sick pet and I didn't want to go through the hassle of packing it up, mailing it back and waiting for a new gate to arrive. I really burns me to have had to pay for a broken gate. Other than this compliant the gates are a good height and they fit tightly in the doorways. If I had to buy gates over again, I would go to the local pet stores and check them over in person for quality before ordering.

Very well constructed carrier and of nice quality. This is perfect for concealing your pet when needed. There are privacy panels on three sides. The back does not have a privacy panel, but if you have all three panels down it's so dark you can't see inside. Just looks like you're carrying luggage. Who will ever know you have your pet in there! Yay! Also excellent improvement Sherpa made from previous bags such as the Sherpa Delta, is the removable waterproof bed. I had to give my Delta away because my pet pees in the carrier on car rides. I highly recommend this carrier.

This toy was a gift for our husky for Christmas and she loved it and quickly chewed the stuffing out of both eggs in mama playpus to get at the squeakers. We took them away, and she continues to chew the mama playpus. This is basically shredded after 2 days, but she still likes to carry around the carcass. I knew when I bought it that it probably wouldn't last long, so I can't say I'm too disappointed.

When I purchased the original version of the Innotek Ultrasmart contain and train system, it was great. MY dog learned quick and he stays within boundaries even without collar on all the time. When I got a second dog, I ordered a second collar for ~$100. Within 2 months, I had to replace it since the glue holding on front cover did not hold and the front cover fell off, disconnecting the two small wires that control the sound. I called Innotek and got a free replacement collar. At the same time, I replaced the other ~2 year old collar since it stopped responding to the remove. This was done for $40 under limited lifetime warranty. Unfortunately, the collars have been redesigned and made with much cheaper quality materials. The collar straps are made of flimpsy rubber material. They tried to introduce a clip collar along with the buckle, but even with the clip part of the collar the buckle part is holding the clip part on. The buckle is very loose an deasily slides back and forth and with the thin, flimpsy straps, the plastic loops that are supposed to secure the length of strap easily pop off. Mine did just that so the collar came off one of my two dogs and the colar became a chew toy. Fortunately, my dog did not choke but the receiver is destroyed so my free collar replacement is goign to probably cost me another $100 to replace. I am now digging out the straps from the original receiver to put on the one remaining collar. If you are purchasing the collar to replace an old one, save the straps of the old one and use those. If you are purchasing the system for the first time, I would ask what the straps on the collars are (durable rubber or flimpsy rubber with the clip and buckle). IF it is the latter, I would request whether they have the old replacement straps or consider another system. Otherwise, there is a risk that your dog will lose the collar or choke on the parts after losing the collar.

I used this on a carpeted rug that could not be washed in the washer. I used as directed and was not able to remove the odor. I wonder if it works better on certain types of rug materials. In any case, it did not work very well for me.

I used this pee pad for my dogs to pee on when they couldn't go out and wondered for months why I still smelled their urine after replacing the pads. After checking every crevice of my house for pee spots, I finally got around to checking the pads themselves. As it turns out, they are NOT completely waterproof. Apparently the plastic lining is not really plastic, because after checking the pad directly after a spill, I felt (and smelled!) urine seeping directly through the pad.I resorted to double padding, and sure enough, every urine mark leaves a shadow of urine on the pad underneath it. I suppose it's still a decent price for the number as long as there's a double layer, but these pads are still pretty unreliable.

I picked this up because there was a coupon for it and I've been trying to find a litter that is more natural... This litter clumps amazingly, but it smells SOUR. I'm used to scooping the cat box, but this litter smells worse than cat feces and urine. I'll definitely be switching back to something less repulsive.

I bought two of these, one for each of my cats, based on customer reviews. Some of the reviews addressed difficulty with the instructions but I thought if I read them slowly and carefully enough, how difficult could it be?? Boy was I wrong! It took me quite some time to really figure it out and once I did, so much time had gone by that I ended up having to re-program the first one to coincide with the second one so that my cats would be fed at the same time. I read in other reviews that an important piece of information was omitted from the instructions and indeed it was. Heck if I know what it is now. I was so annoyed and agitated by the time I finally figured it out, that I did not take the time to write it down so I'd remember for the next time. The feeders themselves work great once programmed to perform the way they are intended. Getting them programmed was just shy of a nightmare but once programmed, they perform wonderfully. Let's just hope the batteries last a long, long time...

I would have given this bed more stars, but there are absolutely NO washing instructions with it, either sewn on the bed or inserted in the small, attached,folded description of the bed. I bought it for my 2 cats, sister, who like to curl up next to each other on top of our bookcase in the winter, near the ceiling where it is warm.I will try to contact the company about washing instructions, but they should have been included.

My border collie, Nora, was actually giddy with delight upon receipt of this hedgehog. She made up a game where she puts "Hedgie" on the bedroom floor then jumps up on the bed and POUNCES on the toy. It is big and it grunts, which she wildly loves, (the grunt isn't really that obnoxious, I've heard worse). Nora shakes it silly and throws it around, indoors and outdoors, and Hedgie is holding up just fine. Nora is not delicate with her toys and I've seen many bite the dust quickly. The hedgehog is very well made and keeps my border collie busy for quite a while. FUN! FUN! FUN! Kudos to EntirelyPets and Amazon!

My Lhasa Apso loves his kong and all of his Kong toys, but these Ziggies make him sick. I do not know if he is allergic to the ingredients but he doss not have a sensitive stomach for other foods or treats. The only time he has ever thrown up is after chewing on these. My vet indicated that she no longer reccommends them because she knows of other dogs that throw up after chewing on Ziggies. So much for easy on puppy's stomach as they claim.If you have any question about why your pup is sick after these I would take them away and see if it clears up.

First off it comes in a joke of a package... Just a cardboard box with paper wrapped around the litter box... Cheap plastic... I don't understand why they thought the filter idea would work (just wanting you to buy more bs).. And beside that, i had a design flaw with what holds the filter on... The litter box IS HUGE!!!! Now some positive Comments, It keeps litter from getting thrown all over the floor... It has a nice look to it; more stylish than a standard box ... It helps keep the stench down... (JUST DON'T WASTE MONEY ON EXTRA FILTERS AND BAGS!!!) Overall I'm happy i bought it... cost 28$ buying it from AMAZON.com rather than 40$ at pet supermarket

The birds eat the stuff, the only reason it isn't a 0-rating.The "easy-peel" packages are totally worthless - 90% of the packages are sealed so tightly that it is impossible to open the pack without using a knife and getting greasy-gunk all over the place. A simple baggie would create far less mess, and be easy to open without requiring tools. The only reason I can think of to create such a lousy package is that they pour the hot suet directly into the lower tray of the pack, and thus save time at the expense of consumer annoyance.I will never buy a Heath-brand suet product again, and wouldn't recommend it to anyone but an enemy.
It took our pit exactly 1 year to destroy this kong. He was so proud when he finally destroyed it.But next time I'm ordering the extra large size.

It's the best chewable habitat I've seen. We had a different model our gerbil demolished -- but that model was painted bright colors. I suspect it was somewhat toxic to chew on, though our gerbil survived.This is unpainted and seems as safe a habitat as one could buy. Only 3 issues:1. The label was a nuisance to remove.2. It's tacked together, so hope the gerbil can figure that out.3. It's made in China, so we can only cross fingers and hope it really is relatively non-toxic.Update: Well, four issues. Our gerbil is a manic chewer, and he chewed into a tack on a similar structure. He broke a tooth, which the abscessed. He's now the 150 dollar gerbil, recovering post-op. This wood hut has similar tacks holding it together. If Kangaroo recovers fully, we'll cut this structure apart and build him something held together by string.

This was to catch the thistle seed from falling to the ground under my feeder and making a mess, as well as to prevent so much loss of seed. However, with any rain or moisture, the seed would clump all around the tray at the bottom of the feeder, making it hard to clean as well as creating a moldy environment for the birds. I took it off and threw it away.

I only purchased THIS product due to the price BECAUSE it stated Feeder AND Waterer NOT Feeder OR Waterer. This is a single item to be used for WATER only it is NOT a feeder. Although NOW I see that the description of this item has now changed to just a Waterer. That sure would have been helpful for ME.On the item itself, it does not sit well in the slot and it's difficult to manage the tiny cap once it is upside down (it's filled with water so HEAVY). You would be best to purchase another item like the pet fountain for a top fill water station.

First of all, these are NOT anything like the Hikari waffers I usually feed my plecostomus. They are very tiny, maybe the size of my pinkie nail (I'm a woman with small hands) rather than the large waffers that are closer to my thumb nail in size. They also resemble kibble more than they do algea waffers I've used in the past (small brownish nuggets verses flat green waffers). I tossed some in my tank but none of my bottom feeders seemed very interested in them but I'll wait and seem if they change their mind once they get hungrier.Bottom line: I cancelled my subscribe and save order and will go back to Hikari. Sure, they're more expensive but they seem to be of better quality and my fish seem to like them.

I got this yesterday and had it installed in a few 'short' minutes. It seems well designed and that it will do its job well. It's cheap plastic and is made in China, but seems to work. It's very easy to unlatch it and put a cuttlebone in it.I got tired of the cuttlebone falling off the cheap metal holder and hope this is the solution to that problem... I will update this review if I have any issues. So far, 5 stars.

Conures have become an increasingly popular companion pet; intelligent, affectionate, small and curious. It's this last attribute that can be a challenge to a new birding enthusiast, following around and cleaning up "gifts" in surprising locations.Many establishments permit birds and you find you want to take your bird everywhere.My Conure is young and not an experienced birder, after hearing about the flight suit, I decided the benefits of a leash to reduce hazards, a diaper eliminating mess and, retaining the ability of limited flight (her wings are clipped) all made sense. I didn't relish the thought of getting her to accept it though.I suppose individuality is present in all living things... my bird immediately seemed drawn to the colors and played with her flight suit a couple days before trying it on. Only slightly reluctant at first (there are many, many video experiences recorded on YouTube), my bird quickly got over her apprehension and was spreading her wings.She chews on it but a medium bird wouldn't likely ever chew threw it... its very well constructed.Aside from enjoying more freedom around the house (still MUST supervise however), she seems to enjoy public outings tremendously.Its a 'birdie' fashion accessory that we all have enjoyed so much that we ordered another one! Its great not searching for a wipe and instead disposing of a diaper. Our bird seems to know that slipping it on means fun is a few moments away.Simply a great invention !!

At first my 6 month old lab mix was petrified of it, but we put it in a long soccer sock so it has a tail like effect, muffles the volume a tad and has a softer/friendlier appearance and now he won't leave it alone! Will definitely need to limit the amount of time he gets to 'kill the sock' per day. Not sure if its worth $10 since it is just a hard plastic ball that rotates between 6 annoying phrases, but ill rethink that statement on a rainy day when he is bouncing off the walls and needs something to occupy him in the house :-)

The Kennel is great! its sturdy and well made for the price. However, the color is falsely advertised, it is not blue/cream it is actually a brown/camel color. And i was pretty dissapointed when I received it

Our pit mix loves to chew especially when bored. We bought this thinking it was cheap enough and it might last a week. He chewed through the rope within a day. He loves the purple bottle though and carries it around the yard, sometimes trying to chew through that but he has not been successful. We have been looking for maybe some kind of thick rope from a ship or something, maybe then this toy would work for our boy.

Purchased to allow my wife to walk two dogs on one lease without tangling. Did not work for 4 year old male Shiba Inu and 7 month old mixed breed rescue pup. The pup was constantly getting tangled with larger Shiba. Purchased Xtreme Super Coupler Short Bungee for two dogs, much better solution.

I'm only giving this system three stars because the plastic bottle it comes with breaks so easily.I live in the mountains where it's very dry, so along with birdseed and peanuts for the squirrels, I provide the outdoor critters with water. I started out using a large bowl, but had to refill it too often. The animals often turned the bowl over during the night, and it just wasn't working out well.So, one day while at WalMart I saw Le Bistro watering unit and thought it would be ideal for providing water for the wildlife. And it was... for about eight months, when suddenly the bottle developed a large crack and could no longer be used. So back to WalMart in search of a replacement bottle, but none was to be found. I bought another unit and brought it home, starting over.Again, within a year the bottle cracked and I had to throw it away. Now I have two water bowls but no replacement bottle for either one. I am now on my third unit (they are so cheap, after all), but wishing I could find replacement bottles for the future. I have searched pet stores and elsewhere, as well as online, with no results thus far. I do wish this company would provide replacement bottles!

Although advertised to hold a 20-pound dog, it is sorely inadequate in many ways. My dog is only 11 pounds but the sides don't even come up half way up her body to hold her securely inside. The security clasps are not even long enough to secure to her harness. The bottom is not stable and therefore does not provide any support for a dog's back. In summary, this was money totally wasted.

These Nylabones are fantastic! I have a boxer/lab mix and he loves to chew these Nylabones. We go through one about every 2-3 months. Just wish the local petco kept the large "Souper" size in stock...

This is his favorite ball! It gives treats AND bounces. I use the beef stick dog treats, and cut them up in it. This toy is literally his bff. Right now he is 13 weeks old and a little over 20 lbs and has had the ball about 2 weeks and it show NO SIGN of wear. I think it will last.

I bought one of these about 3 months ago for my 3 cats (albeit the fugly pink one, but it was on sale... so why not?). At first they were a little apprehensive about using it (except for the pushy 3-legged russian blue) but within a day they were all lapping from it. They seem to like where the water spouts out of and rarely drink from the reservoir, but I'm fine with that.Maintenance it NOT that bad... let me explain- I own 2 50 gallon fish tanks- so cleaning this motor pump is a breeze- just a quick scrubby scrubby and all is good. The filters do need to be changed every month though of some funk builds up. My cats are pretty hands off when it comes to water so they aren't dipping their paws into it and you do need to get some food out of the dish when it falls in. Leakage- haven't noticed any- I also have it on a mat that has a rim, so were there any I'd see them. The motor is noisy when it's trying to work out all air bubbles after a cleaning (not as noisy as the fish tank motors) and it's a pretty good indicator when to add some more water.All in all, I'm happy with this product, my cat who gets bladder stones drinks much more water, and there are more pee clumps in the litterbox, so they are drinking a lot more water it seems.
I was very happy at how fast got there. Unfortunately the dimensions were not quite right and I need to find a different one. Would probably cost more to ship back then to just keep.

First, like the others stated, this litterbox is HUGE. Do not get it if you don't have adequate room, as it takes up a ton of space.My cat is the type that climbs in the litterbox, hangs her behind over the side and urinates on the floor. My vet suggested the Booda Box, as that is the one she uses for her 5 cats. Bought it with high hopes....Well, my cat doesn't pee in the litterbox area of this box, she does her business ON THE STAIRS. So I am constantly cleaning the puddle that accumulates at the base of the stairs.Based on what my vet told me, this litterbox works wonders - again, she has *5* cats that use ONE litterbox, the Booda Box being it. I have ONE cat, THREE litterboxes, and she can't seem to urinate INSIDE of any of the three.... :(

The toy is a pretty neat idea. The company really thinks of everything. For example, the squirrels are to be placed in your dirty laundry for 12 hours to obtain your smell, making the toy more attractive to the dog. However, our Lab figured out the puzzle in about 2 minutes and then became bored with it. It's not very durable either, she chewed through the tree the second day we had it. I wouldn't buy it again.

the worse quality, the glue falls off the ornament on the ribbon and can create a problem if your little pooch eats it,cant get them to stay together. will try gluing them into place myself but I recommend dont buy choose one without the problem unless you dont care what your poochy swallows

This says it's for a medium dog but the package said for not over 30 lbs. Also, one end came uncrimped the first time we used it and had to use pliers to recrimp it. Not for a medium dog at all. Still, it functions ok.
Products works airly well in small area. If you have large room you will need several of these to cover the area.

Like others on amazon, I've recently learned that the fine print under 100% Biodegradable "*except in California," means that they are NOT following California state guidelines, which means a product must be biodegradable at the rate of an apple. They are stating "100% Biodegradable," which merely means, "in about one million years or so, this will start to fall apart and degrade."

I bought these for my dog in heat and every one of them ended up ripping at the velcro attachment. I even got the right size. They are not flexible at all; when she sits or lays down they just rip. I've just started buying baby pull ups and cutting holes in them for her tail.

My only complaint about this product is, it comes in a brown paper bag that rips open very easily. It had puncture holes in it when it was delivered so the second I brought it inside it tracked through the house. I just emptied the bag out into a plastic bin so I wouldn't have to clean up the mess every time my son changes his guinea pigs cage. Other than that its a great quantity for the price.

I have a miniature dachshund who is a chronic barker. Having tried the shock-style collar, and finding them too intense, I hoped this would be a better alternative. For my very small dog (9 pounds), I could not get the collar to adjust to the correct position for the microphone to pick up her (very loud) barks. Also, as noted by other consumers, the battery runs out very quickly.

I agree, it is just right for a kitten, but for a full sized cat it is just too small. Mine like to scratch with their back claws, too, and it isn't big enough. And they just aren't smart enough to turn around to scratch.Some cats prefer to scratch horizontally, so the flat design gives them an alternative to scratching the carpet. I have a couple who prefer the ones made at a 45 degree angle, though. Some won't use this at all, and prefer to sharpen their claws upright, so they'll need a different scratcher.But for someone just starting off with a small kitten, it's perfect. By the time the kitten is too big to use it, it will be time to replace it anyway. I had to throw mine out before it was all scratched up, though. Because when we adopted a new kitten, one of the disgruntled elders took a mighty crap right on it, to demonstrate his disgust with the addition of the newcomer.
I ordered these bulbs for my bearded dragon and the bulbs did not last long at all, two only lasted a few nights! I pay more at the store but they last much longer.

We just brought home a new cat from a rescue and in the span of about 15 minutes she tore a hole through the mesh that was almost big enough for her to stick her head though. Luckily we were almost home. So, now I'm shopping for a hard-sided case.We did use this carrier with our last kitten without problems and the fact that it collapses for storage is nice.

This tool is awesome. It removes tons of hair from my cat, and she even enjoys getting brushed! She sits in my lap and I pet her face with one hand and brush her with the other hand. It makes her coat very shiny, diminishes her dandruff, and greatly reduces shedding. I highly recommend this product.

I love this! I brought it home after vets and used it on my dog. I was able to create two more dogs from the hair I brushed off. No bald spots and pretty gentle too. Don't use hard pressure or it can hurt them. Then I tryed it on my cat. Which has great fur a beaver like pelt. I still got a lot of hair and the coat was even and not bald in area's. This reduces shedding and fluffs them up. I took it to my neighbor that had a calico with long fur and it fluffed her out and made her look less grease/nappy. This is one that will make you throw out all you old useless brushes.
These work great in the aquarium when new but over time they tend to grow stiff and then separate from the tank wall.Just be sure to have extras on hand.

One liner came with the Booda Dome and it was great. I tried these replacements and they aren't as big. They don't fit well and after a few days, the bottom has small tears in it from scooping. They aren't at all like the sample that came with the dome. They need to be a bit bigger and a bit thicker.

So we just made the unfortunate discovery that we appear to have gotten a bad or counterfeit batch of Frontline plus. Three days after giving our dog her dose (we are very good about giving it to her every month, on the day) she had upwards of 20 fleas on her which have now spread to the carpet and us. I'm livid.Our vet told us they get a lot of stories like this about bad, counterfeit, out of date or inert batches of frontline being sold. Sadly for us, we get to spend the rest of the weekend flea-bombing the house.

Never thought I be writing a review for a pooper scooper, but I really like this one! The only reason I didn't give it a 5-star rating is because some of the small pieces of you-know-what fall between the "tines" of the rake. Other than that, I'd say this is the best scooper I've ever had for use on grass.

What the pictures don't show is the horrible gap in the tunnel where the two sides come together. I came home to find the dog door installed by my carpenter and was sadly disappointed with the design - to put it mildly. The plastic inside puckers and pooches and does not allow a smooth flow of the two plastic flaps. For the time being I've removed one of the flaps and have nailed up the other. I am trying to train an old dog to go through, and two flaps are more than she's going to be able to muster. It is unlikely my cats will go through two flaps either as they like to be able to see what's on the other side before passing in case a dog might come barreling through. No doubt, as soon as the animals begin using it, they will be tracking dirt and fur that will get caught in the gap on the bottom and on the sides. I have sealed the gap with tape for now. The plastic is a little oversized for the aluminum, requiring a good bit of insulation. I wish I had purchased a single door model dog door unit and had the carpenter create a tunnel frame made of wood so that it would have been smoother with only one flap to deal with. If I am able, I may add a photo later.

My dogs lets say...aren't the most cooperative bunch. My fiance and I have probably spent over a hundred dollars on different types of leashes and slip leads trying to find out what works best for them. Both my dogs have a tendency to try and lead us on walks, so as a last resort I tried this.Fitting:As soon as we got them we tried them on both our dogs and our older dog took to it okay, he was really scared of it at first. Our youngest one however had a holy fit and started rolling around even did a back flip trying to get it off. The video DVD that came with it said that if your dog does this to adjust the lead as it may be uncomfortable for the dog. After the adjustment he was perfectly fine. One thing is, I went with a size smaller than what I would normally get for a harness or a collar. My older dog wears a medium in harnesses and collars but for this I got him a small and it fit perfectly. Same with our younger dog. He usually wears a small and I went with the petite.Walking:We too both our dogs to the park. Our older dog still managed to get ahead of us, but with a light tug on the lead he seemed to fall back in line. Our younger dog did better on it, not sure if its just hes more impressionable or what. Three days later our older dog is back to pulling at his leash again and not walking in line with us, even when we give him a tug and gorge him with treats.Overall feelings:This is probably a great product if you already have a dog that just needs a little extra guidance but its definitely not going to substitute taking your dog to a obedience class (ours are already set up to go but we wanted to try this in the meantime). The DVD video that comes with it makes it seem like your dog is going to make a miraculous change but if you notice a lot of the dogs are sitting with trainers.

I bought this thing after a recommendation from a pet store rep. My dog hardly touched the stuff, and then I looked at the ingredients: one of the first things on it was corn-a grain known to cause allergies in dogs. As a matter of fact, corn might be the most allergy-prone food amongst dogs. Not to mention, thanks to our friends at Monsanto, it is almost always Genetically modified (GMO) or a franken-food, unless it's organic. Real "premium" dog foods brag that they've no corn.Right at the top of the list of ingredients is chicken-by-products, another no-no among real "premium" dog foods. This means all the waste that it is usually thrown out from the chicken since it's not real meat. Cheap dog foods put this in their food simply because it's cheap, but it's not real meat. A little further down you will notice BHA, an artificial preservative, which again real "premium" dog foods do not have.In short, BilJac is a joke. It is basically, insanely overpriced Alpo, with no organic ingredients whatsoever, and uses all the shortcuts, filler, and chemistry that the cheapest dog foods on the market use. Don't be fooled by the old-fashioned appeal of the company's 60 years in business. There is nothing but modern chemistry in the bag, and all the folksy appeal will not make up for cheap, lousy ingredients. Calling this stuff premium dog food would be like calling a Kia a Mercedes. For nearly the same price as this overpriced Alpo, one could buy organic dog food, free of preservatives, corn, and cheap by-products!

In terms of durability, for my 20lb shetland sheepdog this crate is sufficient. I have issues, however, with the door where it seems to slide downwards so you have to lift it up a little bit to latch it shut so the black paint is wearing off the latch. I've had this crate for about a month and a half and it's been like that since I got it. Doesn't seem to be much else you can do aside from lifting the door up a little bit each time you decide to latch it closed. Aside from that it seems decent, especially for the price. I purchased mine thirty bucks on here with Amazon Prime trial (free 2-day shipping) after going to Walmart the day of my order and seeing a smaller one there for forty-five dollars + tax. I'd buy another one of these again (maybe the slightly larger version) and if I had this issue again I'd most likely return it for an exchange.

Updated on 2-20-12Although I still love what this collar has accomplished for my pup and our family, I feel I must comment on some major flaws that I have noticed over the last few months.My number one complaint is that it eats batteries like CRAZY! And they run about $8 every few weeks! And this is with us turning the unit off once she comes inside from doing her business and/or playing. So, I really could have invested my money in a more expensive, rechargeable collar and not had the hassle of dealing with the batteries all the time.My second complaint is that the range does not seem to be as good as stated in the description. I feel like it's much closer to a 30-40' range, which is fine the majority of the time, but occasionally she darts after something and is GONE! I really need something to get her attention when she gets further away.So, I although I appreciate the results we have achieved with this collar, I am probably going to invest in something that is rechargeable and that has a greater range.--------------------------------------------LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS COLLAR!!!! And here is why.....We have a 9 month old Cavachon (Sadie) that weighs about 15 lbs. She is a VERY smart dog, however, very independent and stubborn at times. We also live on an acreage in-town so fencing in our yard was not an option. I had become concerned about her safety after she had darted across the road several times after squirrels, and also played hard-to-get after getting away from us on more than one occasion! She also likes to sprint over to visit her boyfriend's kennel in the neighboring yard no matter how much I would yell STOP! Also, with winter well on its way as well I wanted to be able to train her to go potty outside by herself, and then come back in when called. Was I dreaming or WHAT?Initially I was torn about buying a 'shock' collar and really put a lot of research into the matter. We then decided to try a vibration/beep collar first, that I bought off eBay for about $20. This started out as an okay training tool, but all too quickly she began to ignore the vibration and the beeps. A couple months went by and my frustration grew. So, after much more research and reading of reviews on Amazon and other websites we settled on this collar.The first day I took her out with a LONG leash, a pocketful of treats and the collar turned on. We started with some simple commands that she knows....like SIT and COME. I had the setting on 1 and the first time I hit the zap button when she wasn't listening she yelped and looked around anxiously. I tried it a few more times when she wasn't paying attention and she really got freaked out, jumping on me, cowering between my legs and overall just freaking out. I took her off leash and she immediately ran to our porch, just shivering and scared. I thought, "OH NO, WHAT HAVE I DONE!" As well as, "I JUST WASTED ALL THIS MONEY ON THIS STUPID COLLAR!" I took her inside, took the collar off.The next day I started her second training session and she was a little more alert, but also started freaking out a bit at first. She did the whole run to the porch and cower thing again, but this time I went over and coaxed her off the porch. She started following me around and the training seemed to go a little better.By the third day she had completely gotten it! I keep the collar on her during the day (except when she is kenneled), and only turn it on when she starts having some minor behavior problems inside (like barking at the cat or sniffing to get into the garbage), or when we are going to go outside. We now go out and walk around the yard and she stays by my side, or within a very short distance from me. I rarely have to tap the beep and almost never use the zap anymore at all! (By the way, we keep it at 1 and have never had to go over a level 3)Four to five days into the training I started getting her to go potty in the yard while I stood on the porch to supervise. She stayed right in the vicinity, did her business and came back in when called! I was THRILLED! After 2-3 days of porch supervision I let her out, watched from the window and she was absolutely perfect! Before the collar, anytime she would get out the door unleashed she would immediately bolt to visit her next door boyfriend. Now she watches me, does her thing, and comes back inside! I am completely amazed at how changed she is. It is so much more enjoyable for us to be outside now. I feel like she is safe from getting hit by a car or getting lost, and she enjoys the freedom of being off leash. I can also continue to deter her from her annoying little habits such as eating goose and deer poo as well....yum....her favorites!Now we have only been using the collar for a week or so, so I can't speak about the longevity of the batteries or remote, but I am really thrilled with this purchase so far! The batteries for the collar do seem a bit expensive (I think two at Walgreens run around $8) but are WELL worth the peace of mind this training tool has given us.Always make sure that you do adequate research and know what you are doing before you start training with this device. I hope this review helps you with your decision, and good luck with your puppy! :)

omg. bought this for my quail to play with, yeah right. it's bigger than they are! So we hung it in our quaker parrots cage, he won't touch it and it's super heavy. Not sure how birds are going to play with something of this size and weight. Oh well.

Well, I have not really used this one alot because it seems a bit too rough for my gelding. The times I have tried using it he has not like it much. I have to be very careful to not press down at all as I curry his back. He will usually "squinch" his back and move away from me if it starts to become painful. I think it would have been better to make it a bit softer.
I do not believe this product did anything at all, nor did the other 5 brands I tried.I am at my wits end.

I bought this pen for my 14 week old Shih Tzu. The breeder kept her in one exactly like this with the extra panels and had NO PROBLEMS. When I put her in it during the day, by herself now that she had been taken from her litter mates, she JUMPED it each time. She is only 5.5 lbs and very small but had no problem getting over it easily. I am using it in the bedroom at night to surround her doggie bed to teach her where she is supposed to stay during the night and it works perfectly for that. It's well made, nice looking and sturdy but as others have already listed, not so hard for even a small dog to escape from easily.

Although I like the idea of this product, my cats hated it. One is very picky, so no surprise there, but the other eats anything! He was meowing and excited but when I put the bowl down he sniffed it and reared his head back and completely snubbed it. I can't tell you how shocked I was by his reaction. I ordered it direct from the company, so it wasn't spoiled. I have to give it 1 star because neither of my cats would touch it.

I bought this about 3 weeks ago or so and used it immediately on an area of my carpet that had been peed on by the cat. And let me just say, this cat has the worst smelling pee of any cat I have ever owned. HORRID. I poured a good amount over the affected area and let it set for about two weeks. I gave it a good whiff and I could still smell the cat pee, but not as strong. I applied another good dose to it about 3 days ago. Yesterday I gave it another whiff and I can still smell the cat pee! It has gone from the horrid smell to a lesser horrid smell, if that makes sense. I am hoping the enzymes will keep working and in another month the smell will be gone. Maybe there is no cure for cat pee. Sigh.UPDATE 1/30/13: I have applied Nature's Miracle to the affected area of carpet approximately 3 times now since I wrote the previous review. I can notice a reduction in the ammonia smell by about 50%. I can still tell a cat peed there but it is not that horrible ammonia smell that just hits you in the face. Maybe I will try another dose and see if it improves any further.

This is the best ball in the world. It's soft with a squeaker that does not break. My dog loves this ball so much that now when UPS comes with a brown box he is convinced more balls are in it for him. I order 4 at a time so I always have a few new ones on hand. He plays with it every day and if he doesn't get to he is all out of sorts. I hope they never stop making these clutch balls.

It was a nice ball, but I expected better from Kong! Only took our Lab 2 days before he tore it up. Wish they would make a great ball that these big furry kids can actually get a good amount of play time with. We never let our Lab just sit and chew his balls. If we are not throwing it with him it gets put up. So that lets you know how well they are NOT made! If someone knows of a great ball that will last, Please let me know. Thanks! :-)
What a waste of money. Cat will not use with cover on. Does not clean itself. Only used for a couple days.
It's hysterical to watch my keets jump through the hoops on this toy. They love using it to get between two other perches and playing with the bell on the bottom!

First, let me be honest. Our dachshund is a toy-destroying machine. He's taken apart high quality toys in less than 15 minutes before, so the fact this thing survived past day one is a testament to its construction.We had previously purchased an AKC duck, which lasted an amazingly long four months before being de-winged and destuffed. Based on the longevity of the duck, we decided to purchase "Reggie the Heggie", hoping he would give similar results.First, the hedgehog is a bit oddly shaped, which made him difficult for our dogs to carry or play with, due to their small mouths. When they finally did take an interest in the hedgehog, it was only a matter of an hour or two before Reggie's nose and mouth were gone, his stuffing completely strewn across our living room.All in all, I don't think this is a bad toy, but I wouldn't buy it for a small dog, and I probably wouldn't buy this particular animal model again. We've since purchased another duck, though it seems like our puppy has learned from Duck #1 how to dismember it more effectively. I still think the duck (or squirrel) are better, longer lasting choices.

Based on the high ratings this product received we invested in two of these. It has been less than two months now and both are inoperable. The latches fail to close properly after a short period of use and every time we roll the box litter pours out the back. This is NOT what you want.. absolutely disgusting! So needless to say these two relatively expensive litter boxes are on their way to the trash, and we're going back to scooping. Don't waste your money!!

Lilly loves her booster seat. We go to football games and travel every weekend. We travel to my son's games and it averages 6 to 7 hours one way. Lilly stays in her booster the whole time except for potty breaks.

Works quite well as a cat deterrent. Has a limited range and cats are smart and learn to stay out of range. If it is for a specific area it works well but if it is to be used as a general garden deterent, then it is not so good. The battery runs down quite quickly

This is a great crate. I have had it for 3 years now and love it. The open top is a great feature for cleaning and removing items from inside.What is also nice, is now that my dog is older and does not need it everyday it comes apart and stores nicely.

who would think that a product could work so well? I have used this for years with my maltese. eyes clear up quickly. i stop use after a few weeks and everything is good. so i use intermittantly as eye problems come and go.

Length:: 1:30 MinsFirst of all -was very happy to see a "shipped" notice when the day before the PJ's were back ordered. They arrived quickly-and once again the product description for the size I ordered says "Out of Stock"But now on to the product. I have to say I am a bit disappointed in the material and COLOR, which doesn't come close to the photo. The material is thin and lightweight (how is that thermal??) I didn't purchase these to make a fashion statement or play doggie dress up---my Miniature Poodle gets COLD at night. The color-no where NEAR like the example..this is a deep muddy wine red.First time I have been this unhappy with a purchase from Amazon in a VERY very long time

I ordered this with Exotic Environments Red Sea Hide-Away Aquarium Ornament and a keyboard.Both fish decor boxes mutilated, red sea decor cracked in half, while the outer box and keyboard box in perfect condition. Did the packer not notice? Or just not care?This is pretty decent in my 10 gallon, however the paint job looks rushed on it. The clam specifically looks pretty bad, like a child painted it. For the price it's nothing I'm to surprised about. I personally won't order from Amazon Blue Ribbon pet products again, but this is nice and cheap if your willing to take the risk of their product quality control and poor packaging.

We've had the ScoopFree unit for nearly a year now and it has some good and bad features. The good news is that it works very reliably and does the best job of reducing odors and mess. It's large enough for nearly any cat and has a good strong motor.The drawbacks are as follows:1) the crystals are extremely expensive even if you elect to purchase a reusable tray and refill it manually. This method is also cumbersome and difficult as the trays are heavy and too wide to carry through doorways easily.2) only one of our cats will use the unit. The other one just doesn't like the crystals and even when we mixed in a little litter he wouldn't use it.3) the crystals do a fabulous job with solid refuse but urine is simply trapped on the bottom and stays wet until you empty the unit. This is messy and some cats just don't like having the moisture trapped under the crystals.I'd give the unit 4 stars for trouble-free operation but only three stars over-all because of the drawbacks to the crystals.Al
Don't buy from them, they wont let you return because the batteries are hazardous but they can ship them with out a hazardous label wonder if the post office knows about this.

The idea was on the right track, but it look my thirty pound dog about a minute to dislodge the "everlasting" treat (which took him about ten minutes to consume). He's not a power chewer either. The pockets, inside the treat ball, made my financial loss a little more bearable - the ball itself will be useful.Pros: Won't have to buy the everlasting treats every so often.Cons: Will have to find something else to occupy him.

This particular item is a good sturdy strong guard. However, I bought the extension which was pretty pricey. I wanted the backs of the seats to be covered to resist chewing by my dogs. They are not good in riding in vehicles in the first place. My medium size dog still managed to squeeze through and wound up on the bench seat. This dog weighs sixty pounds and still slipped through. Fortunately I bought one of the seat covers with the slots for seat belts, and had that already on there in case things like this would happen.

This collar worked fine on our bigger dog (21 lbs) but not on the 12 lb dog that we actually bought this for. I tried adjusting the fit at different locations up and down her neck but to no avail. Maybe the problem was her hair or her breed (Dachshund mix) or something else. A spray collar worked before as far as sensing her barking so not sure what the problem was. I'm getting a little more expensive one that might be more sensitive for her.

I work for a large pharma company who sells their over-the-counter products to employees at their Company Store. I was surprised when the store started carrying this dog food as we have no affiliation to it. I was currently using Iams which at the time was going thru tainted ingredient issues. So I did some investigative work on some dog food review/rating websites and was pleasantly surprised by the positive reviews for this product.You can also go to [...] website for details on the holistic benefits. I switched my dogs to this food around 3-4 years ago and am so glad that I did. I just read an article on [...] which rated this brand as one of the top 4 dog foods and a "best buy" compared to other premium brands.
It is quite and effecient. You don't need to change water every month.I really like this filtersystem.
I like the easy to clean and elevated part of this. however, I find it really difficult to get the top part back on the bottom so i never store our dogs food in it.

Great treat for your pets. All chicken and beef, better than the junk treats that are on the market. My cats love them. Order them on-line, much cheaper than buying in pet stores (almost half the price).

When I first received these and scattered them on the floor, only one of my two cats seemed interested. The second one warmed up to them quickly though as I caught her playing with them in the middle of the night. I think if you push them down and let them spring up while the cats are watching they get more interested. The only problem is I have beige carpet making it very difficult to spot the yellow ones at times and the circumference is small enough that they easily roll under couches and anything else with a 1" gap like a stove.

With one small change, this harness would get a 5 star rating from me. I made the fix myself, so I give MY version of the Easy Walk harness 10 stars (please watch the video with this review). The front-leash harness makes walking with my active standard poodle puppy fun. With a slip collar neither of us enjoyed our walks - me because I was being pulled, and puppy because I was constantly correcting her with snaps of the collar. HOWEVER - as other reviewers have stated, DOGS CAN SLIP OUT OF THIS HARNESS UNDER STRESS. My puppy did this when she encountered a favorite playmate on our walk. She rolled over on her back, legs flailing, and bingo, she had slipped the harness. (I do have it adjusted properly - I watched the video 3 times to be sure). I didn't want to give up on the harness, so I spent about 15 minutes creating a simple fix for the problem. I hope the attached video helps you. If you are using this harness now, and your dog hasn't escaped yet, please be very careful - it can happen in an instant. Dogs are born escape artists!

Two out of four bags purchased have been great. Good for at least a day of chewing by our happy Lab. However, two bags must have come from old cows, because they couldn't be chewed. The dog gave up interest quickly. We tried soaking them in water, but this had little effect once the they dried. Overall, they're great whan you get a "good" bag!

Cool product with a great concept. My dogs love it. The material on the outside is well made and perfect for chewing. After fetching the tennis ball the dogs are excited to try to get it out of being hidden in another ball.

My 15 pound Cavalier Spaniel loved this toy, it took him longer to destroy than most of his other toys. He went straight for the paws and slowly chewed them off until he could get to the stuffing. I was quite impressed at how much stuffing this squirrel held, very big mess but oh well, my dog had a blast destroying this toy.
Was a great height for my cocker spaniel which is keeping her head level with her food instead of her being over for it.

This unit works fine, but you have to keep the water level sensor clear of oxidation. I use a pencil point (minus the graphite) to scrub the small rectangle of mineral build-up. The well water we have is rich in copper, so I get a green-blue oxidation every 2-3 weeks. Vinegar sounds like a good idea, I'll try that next week. The cord holds up well to hermit crabs' claws climbing up it. I am buying a second one to start a tropical terrarium with. I use mine on a day/night aka wave-maker timer that has programmable 15 minute intervals. I use 15 minutes on, 30 minutes off.
Did not really do anything for our dog..ended up getting a thunder jacket which seems to help a bit. It may work for your dog as I am sure not all dogs respond the same.
My younger lab, Bella, who is 10 months absolutely loves this! It only took her a few minutes to figure our the concept and now she's addicted. She hops around happily just when I reach for it.

The plecos liked the algae wafers, but their were very few of them in the package. Also, the shipping cost more than the product. It was too much money for what I got. I got some advise from the internet and am feeding them squash. They love it and it is cheap.
I love this bottle it help keep my Birds water clean, so I don't have to clean their water every day.The shipping was fast I recommend this seller. PE.
Great for turtles. Don't think that this product is horrible by looking at all the reviews. Keeps my 20 gallon long tank crystal clear.

I was really hoping to be one of the hugely happy customers for this product, but just okay is the best I can do. We have five cats who for the most part don't scratch the furniture, but the occasional incident had turned into a bit more freguent. We decided to try a sturdier scratch post to see if that would resolve our issue. Two of our cats use the new post and the others just ignore it. We've tried the play inticements and the physical showing them the new post, to no avail. The scratch post is very sturdy, doesn't look bad in our living room, and will clearly last for a very long time.

Bought this trainer and it worked as described for one week. Then, the collar would shut down after a few seconds. Replaced the batteries in the collar and the transmitter but the problem persisted. It was very frustrating and defeated the purpose of the collar, by not being ready when you needed it. I am returning this product and cant recomend it based on my experience.

Hi,Hamster saga link (Super Pet CritterTrail Discovery Deluxe Habitat)Has plenty of room (good), slide falls down and gets SO DIRTY. Hams sleep in wheel; carry cage bigger than Discovery Deluxe (above) ; wheel fun, but FLINGS POO!!! Clean often, at least. Is big enough to comfortable hold 5 dwarf adult male hams (see Hamster Saga.) Really cool-looking; however, clean it very often.
