The strap that goes around the console lid the clip will not stay hooked so I'm not to happy about my purchase. If I put on the brake my dog is not going to be flying in the back of the car. I am going to have find away to fix it.
I'M STILL OUT ON THIS. HAVE PUT IN MY CARPERT CLEANER SHAMPOOER..LIKE TO PUT ON JUST ABOUT MY WHOLE CARPET..WILL LET YOU KNOW

I as well bought these to get the shipping deal. My dogs really did like the scent of the tennis balls, but to me they did not smell like peanut butter. They were methodically torn apart in about 30 minutes. Do not buy these unless you need something cheap for the shipping deals.

I'ved owned an earlier Littermaid LM900 that was purchased back in 2004 and I've been very happy with it through all these years. Recently, I decided to buy another LM900 because my old one was getting worn out and the gears were starting to jump the tracks when the load was heavy. Unfortunately, the new one did work when I plugged it in. The light came on but the rake would simply not move. I had already disposed of the packaging so to return it might pose a problem.Fortunately, being somewhat of an electronics hobbyist I managed to figure out that the circuit board was defective. After about an hour with a soldering iron I managed to swap out the bad circuit board with the good one from my old LM900. Everything works fine now. Nevertheless, I was very unhappy with this experience. The quality of the new one was definitely not as good as the old one. For instance, the old version made use of 2 pairs of good quality switches to detect the rake position whereas the new one only used 1 pair of cheap switches. Although I had loved it in the past, I would no longer recommend this product.

I've had 2 of these auto feeders for over 3 months now, and this is exactly what I needed, for my two cats. I set it before I leave for work with some dry food in it, and if I get home late, they're fed for the night! I also have a water fountain feeder for them, so they're all set in case I'm late for dinner! I did not buy the cold pack accessory, but I'm thinking of trying it to use wet food with it. It takes AA batteries, and you can set it for anytime over a 24 hour period. My one cat is pretty clever, and tries to break into it when he hears me pour his dry food into it. The first few times I set it, I noticed his attempts, and stopped him. I have yet to come home to a disassembled unit :)I would recommend that you try it out, and for the first time you set it, be home when it is set to open to make sure that you're cat doesn't break into it, and that it does in fact open. I havent had any problems with mine. In fact, it is very easy to clean as well, the white tray comes out for easy cleaning, and replacement. The only problem is that when they are not in use, you cannot close the lid without setting the time, and if you have batteries in it, that means it will pop open when the time is up. I don't close the lids when in storage, but this could be a problem for people with limited storage space.

I have had this Port-a-crate for two years. I use it for my (fairly large) cat. I have been on several road trips with the cat and have had no problems with it at all. I like that the top opens to give me access to the cat if she hides in the back of the crate. The cat sometimes sleeps in the crate when we are not on the road. On occasion, the cat flips out and claws the crate when she doesn't want to be penned up inside, and the crate shows no signs of damage. I really like this product, and I am placing an order for another one to house my other cats.

When my dog died the hospital made up one of these for me. I decided to make them for my other two dogs. I had one that was given to me some time ago and I hadn't made up. And I bought a new one. They were entirely different experiences. The old one was a sticky gooey mess and probably won't set. The new one was easy to use and I think it will be fine. So perhaps they have changed the product or maybe age causes changes to the material and those who found them sticky were using old kits. If the one doesn't work, I will be buying another to try again.

Although I've only been using this product on my dog for a little over a month, it does appear to help. However, my dog is picky and doesn't really care for the taste and smell of the product. I've had to come up with a couple of different ways to disguise the product in the food. So I guess it really depends on the animal and whether or not your willing to spend a little more time making sure that your dog will eat it.

I received the six gallon tank as a gift because I was looking to add a pet to my bedroom. The setup is generally easy and only takes maybe five minutes. I purchased three small fish the next day and had some great results. Over time I added a few more and now the aquarium is just thriving! It's great because the tank is so small and can fit almost anywhere. You just need to be careful not to overcrowd the fish. Your list of fish possibilities are small, but they'll look amazing under the flourescent lighting. The only inconvenience of the set is the top opening. When the lid is open, the filter is right there, and the hole that leads into the water is suprisingly small. Plus, I can't clean the tank without having to take the entire top off and drip water all over the floor. But, there are definitely more advantages to it. Just remember to clean the tank once a month, check the maintenance of the filter, and not overcrowd the tank (add about one inch of fish per every gallon), and you'll have some happy fish for years.

First of all, when I contacted the seller they responded quickly with the answer to my question promptly, which was very appreciated. Also, this product smells very good, unlike other products I've used. Got it very quickly, and am very satisfied!

I gave this stuff a shot, I really did.I recently hand reared 4 kittens. Once they were about four-five weeks old, I decided to give weaning a shot.Every feeding session I put this down for the kittens to eat. Every time, they ignored it and waited for milk.I ended up getting Royal Canin (tiny hard food pellets) for them to see if that made a difference. Instantly two of them dived in and were weaned on the spot.The last one took another week to wean, but would only do so on wet food (from pouches) mixed with formula. Then after five days or so she was ready for the Royal Canin.I gave it three stars, however, because it really is reasonably priced, and I could see how cats would appreciate the consistency and meaty flavor. Mine didn't.WARNING: Two of the kittens in the litter were long haired. They got this food all over their fur as I was trying to get them to eat it and it was terrible to get out. I ended up having to use a toothbrush, which took off some of their fur. For furry kittens, use at your own risk.
Product fits the small cat food cans that I have been looking for, but is somewhat hard to get the lid off the can.

This product does not work consistently and amazon has denied my request for a refund.The product description is somewhat confusing as it initially states that the motion sensor range is up to 3 feet, but the graphic shows a maximum range of 24 inches. In any case, my wife's cat triggered the sensor about 25% of the time. I set up the deterrent for sound only as to not subject the cat to needless blasts of air. No animal or human was harmed during this experiment. Despite other reviewer complaints regarding the inconsistent motion trigger, I was hopeful when I placed my order. Unfortunately, I must add my review to the pile of the unsatisfied.An even greater disappointment is amazon's current denial of my return for this product, despite the manufacture's return policy included in the box that states I can get a refund. Apparently, there is an issue with returning "hazardous" or "flammable" material, although amazon's own product description would lead you to believe that Contech StayAway Pet Deterrent is safe. Caveat emptor! You may not be able to return this product even if you are unsatisfied because of reasonable objections. I'll provide an update after amazon reviews my appeal.
I run with my dog, so weight matters. I love this concept, but man is it heavy compared to other leashes.

I started off with a Tetra Whisper filter for a 10 gallon tank when my turtles were babies. When I upgraded them to a bigger tank, I needed something with more capacity. Since my first Tetra filter worked well, I was open to getting another one of the same brand especially after finding out the Whisper BioBags cartridges will also work in this unit- sweet! The only down side is when using the BioBags cartridges in this compare to my previous water filter, it seems to get clog quicker (despite this taking two vs. one in my previous tank). I was a bit disappointed that I might have to change the filter more often- previously, I changed it once every 3-4 weeks, with this my water got murky after a week or so. That will be going through 1 cartridge every month vs. 4 every month with this water filter. After reading some of the other reviews and different forums, I took the advice of removing the filter cartridges and spraying them with water to get most of the gunk off. This actually works! I take them out to clean about once a week, and change the entire cartridge (carbon and all) as recommended (once a month). This keeps my water clean. I also do a 25% water change with a siphon to get gunk out of the gravel- turles are messy!This unit basically its a tall as my tank (I have a 20? gallon long tank). The turtles like climbing on this and have used it to climb over the edge of the tank. Since then, I have also install a lid which defeats the purpose of using the top part as a basking dock (there is only half inch of clearance). I might just have to get a taller tank- or get started on my extension project really soon.

Good points: you don't have to scoop out your litter box every day or every other day and it is extremely easy to switch the old box with the new box.Not so good things about this: If you have two or more cats in your household, this should be changed at least twice a week, not the 10 to 15 days as described in the product description. It starts stinking after about four or five days.

My dog isn't crazy about this bed. He'll sleep in it about as often as on the floor, on our bed, on the couch, or on our meditation cushion. He's only about 35-40 pounds and takes up the entire thing even when he isn't all stretched out, so I wouldn't recommend the bed for a dog any larger than he is. The color does not at all resemble the "khaki" shade pictured. It's more of a light brown or tan color.

by the time I figured out how to put the harness on my dog, we were both frustated. I bought another kind that is adjustable and once he was fitted, all he has to do is step into it (which took only one time ) then it just clips on, much better and it keeps him from pulling on the leash.
Bird cozy seems fine, however, I ended up receiving the one color I hoped I wouldn't ... yellow! I wish they would let you choose the color!

Not sure what to say.... Either they don't or or I did not have a problem. -Rescued two 3 week old kittens. Had the kittens in my house for 3 days before finding out they were ENTIRELY INFESTED. You could see the fleas jumping on and off them) had the kittens treated at a vet before finding them a home elsewhere. Nervous that my house/ the area that I kept them might have gotten contaminated I purchased this. I followed the directions and at the end of two weeks the only thing that it trapped was a house fly.
Super fast shipping, product exactly as described.This will work fine for my anodizing line for the air actuation, and seems to be stiff enough.

Frontline worked fine for a while. But fleas are like viruses. If everyone in an area uses the same flea treatment then the fleas learn to tolerate it. This summer a lot of folks around here started complaining the Frontline no longer worked for them. Unfortunately, it was true of my dog as well. She is riddled with fleas within the first week after treatment. If this happens to you I recommend using a cheap Nitenpyram pill. You can get them on Amazon. One pill will kill pretty much every flea on your dog, but it only lasts a day. But it will give you time to find another treatment that will work before you house gets overrun. Lets hope you never get the Super Fleas!

Works as advertised. We put it on the dog before going to work and remove when we are home. We have had our dog since she was a pup about 5 years. She never did anything like this until my wife returned to working full-time about a year ago. Other than removing everything we couldn't keep her from getting in the trash. And she has broken may glass things getting on the kitchen counter. She would never do it while we were home so it was hard to discipline her although we tried. This has saved her from being banished to a leash or even worse. Would recommended to all if you have similar issues. The shock isn't to bad for her, it just makes her jerk back. Its better than cutting a paw on broken glass.
It's nice but not as plush as it shows in picture and dimensions are off,36in pad will not cover the floor of 36in crate.

I was very excited when this product arrived. I read the reviews and even got suggestions from other pet owners that this was the best thing for tear stains. I have a 12lbs Pomeranian mix that has some pretty dark tear stains and he didn't care for me putting things near or in his eyes. I also tried changing his food to a healthier version and that didn't work. I figured that this would be a nice alternative.First issue: My dog isn't a finicky eater at all. However, when I put the recommended amount in his food, he could smell it and wouldn't go near any piece that had it on it. I tried reducing the amount. The resulted in him tipping his bowl over trying to "dust" the food off (I guess). I tried mixing it in other foods. That didn't work. Anyway, after a while, he figured out that it wasn't going anywhere so he started eating it. I was still very slowly trying to work up to the recommended dose for his weight. But he was VERY hesitant to eat his food because he didn't seem to like it at all. I wanted to make sure he was still eating.Second Issue: After he started eating the food with the Angel Eyes, the consistency of his feces became much softer. He also was become more and more dehydrated.Last issue: He started vomiting up his food. Mind you he already wasn't eating that much but the sheer quantity of it was frightening. I know this is inevitable with dogs at times. However, this has never happened to him before where he vomited so much. I could tell he was upset. I am also upset that I gave this to him in the first place.While I very glad that it works for others, I'm very sad that I paid money to make my dog sick.I hope others interested have MUCH more luck than we did.

I would have given these a 5 star rating, except for the fact that I had to cut off 60 TAGS - EVERY MOUSE HAD A PLASTIC TAG ATTACHED TO IT WHICH I HAD TO CUT OFF.... very tedious and time consuming and I did not want to leave them on. Might I suggest to the company Zanies, when you are selling these 60 to a box, please sell them without individual tags!The photo should have shown them with all the tags. Very misleading. I would have returned them if I hadnt already cut some of the tags off.The other problem is when cutting the cat tags off, if the tag isnt cut close enough to the toy it leaves a very sharp point that could hurt the cat!To the manufacturer, please stop putting tags directly on these toys, they are not safe.
Soft and warm, easy to put on and he looks just too handsome. He gets many compliments every time he wears it.

These collars worked well on my two eighty pound mutts who were driving my neighbors nuts. The only issue I had was when we left the collars on, unsupervised, for a day. Our dogs proceeded to chew the collars off of each other, which defeats the purpose. I will say, though, after this, the collars still worked, I just had to rig a way to put the device on our normal collars. Be sure to supervise for a little while if you have giant puppies!

Bought this bed for my 125 lb dog because he sleeps a lot and I wanted him off the ground. He loves it and it is big enough in area for him, but it has stretched and sagged so much that he now hits the ground. I got some canvas thread and stitched up all the sides to make it tight again. This worked for a while. Now the fabric has holes in it from his toe nails I think. I need to replace the cover. I had no problems assembling the bed, but I do need to tighten the bolts at least once a week. The biggest problem was the stretching of the fabric. It stretched so much that the entire bed came apart one time. I am hesitant to purchase another fabric, and go through all the stretching again.

My 1.5 year-old lab loves to fetch tennis balls and is infatuated with squeakers, so when I saw this ball I had to buy it! Well, she fetched it one time and then ate it in 10 minutes flat! Guess the squeaker/ball combo wasn't the best for my dog. If your dog is an active chewer, save your money and stick to rubber Kong toys, Nylabones, and the Buster Cube!

Why not call it the "terrorize your dog" mat? Aversion training never, ever works as well as positive reinforcement; you needn't be a professional trainer to know that. This mat should be taken off the market immediately.

I bought this hoping my cats would like it. Summers are very hot here, and when the house is in the 80's-90's, they lay around looking like road-kill (so do the people, but that's a subject for another product review!). But the cats wouldn't use it. Not at all. If I put them on it, they immediately jumped down. If I put it in a pathway to try to make them walk on it so they'd get used to the feel of the fabric under their feet, they would crawl UNDER it or jump over it rather than walk across it. This summer I lent it to a friend whose house is always in the 90's in the summer and whose 9 cats normally will climb all over anything new, and even her cats wouldn't use it. The fabric is very rough and scratchy, and I'm guessing that it's painful to the pads of their paws (just a guess--anyone out there who channels cats may be able to find out for sure!). Otherwise, the product is sturdy and appears well-made. Definitely hard to assemble and the reviews that give tips for assembly were very helpful--thank you! In terms of size, I really wasn't sure what size to get. It turns out the small size was plenty big even for my friend's extremely large cat--lots of room to spare. Bottom line, it's a gamble--if your pet(s) will use it, it's a great product! But if they won't, you've wasted a not-insignificant chunk of money. So only 3 stars because, though well-made, it's potentially a waste of money and there's no way to know unless you try it. Tip: They do sometimes lie under it! So now that it's winter, I might drape a blanket over it to make them a cave, just so I can get some benefit from the money I spent!

This is an okay bone, kind of big; not so much as in length, but in fluffiness. The squeaker is too small for the size of the toy. All in all, I found it to be fine, but had to give it a low rating because my Miniature Schnauzer found no interest in it. She is, after all, the best judge.
I have only one cat but it doesn't last as long as it says it does but it's good system.

This product is easy to use -- simply plug in and forget it. No getting my dog to swallow pills. It seems to run out in a few days under a month.I can't tell how much of a difference it makes. He sleeps on his bed more when the comfort zone dispenser and he seems to be somewhat calmer.

I am very frustrated trying to find a pad that actually works. I have 10 lb. dogs and when they use these (and 3 others)it goes right through them most times. I am currently in a wheelchair and really need a pad that works. I'm going to continue looking for a good one!
This product was supposed to be strong enough for chewers. It was not. My doxie puppies thrashed it in a day, so sad and exspensive.

This product is probably o.k. for most dogs but not for mine. I'm writing to caution others who have small dogs. I have a Yorkie and after taking one capsule prescribed every other day by our Vet for dry skin, she had a severe allergic reaction last night after taking only one pill. She's on benadryl now and I hope that works. My guess (and it's only a guess) is that she is just too small (11 lbs) to take an entire capsule. To make sure, I won't be giving her anymore Omega 3, 6, 9.

When i received this fountain it came assembled. it also had a leak. the leak was a crack where the pump attached to the unit. it was highlighted by a black arrow pointing to it. this must have been a return or defective unit but was never mentioned in the sale!!! it was a quick fix for me because I'm kind of a McGyver with fixing things. a little super glue did the trick but who knows how long it will hold for. i shouldn't have to fix something i just bought. i don't blame the manufacturer, the product does work fine now, the seller is the one who is selling broken merchandise and not advertising that very important fact. Why would i wanted to buy something that's broken?????

I give Flea Free 3 stars mainly because the dog's like it. but as far as the flea's go they sill have them . There has been no improvment on the digging and scratching . I'll continue using until its all gone, I'm almost thru with the bottle now. Who knows maybe it will start working at the last minute. I hope !!! But i've got my doubts

I'm shocked by all the bad reviews. I bought my 70 lbs Doberman one of these after she has destroyed every other toy that she has come across.She has chewed frisbees to shreds, ripped stuffing out of anything soft, turned rope toys to dental floss, turned tennis balls to rubber chunks and shredded the "stuffing-free" soft toys.I picked up one of the fire hose toys and she loves it as much as any soft toy she's ever had. She has chewed off all four corners of this toy, but not enough for the squeakers to fall out or for the toy to lose its puffiness. Although the corners have been chewed through, the squeakers are still intact, functioning and in place.She has probably had this toy for almost a year now, and it is still her favorite toy.If she ever gets through the rest of it, I will definitely pick up another one.

I have ordered this playpen 2 times and both deliveries came with missing parts. There were absolutely no instructions or hardware to assemble the pen door. I attempted to call the manufacturer to obtain the necessary hardware but was never able to reach a person. I left 2 voicemails and have yet to receive a return call. I then returned the item to Amazon and a replacement was sent very quickly. The problem was the 2nd delivery arrived the very same way - no hardware! Amazon is quality checking the items now. I do like the playpen but am very disappointed with the lack of customer service from the manufacturer. Hopefully I'll be able to receive the item with all necessary parts to assemble it.

I wish I could explain it, but the tool works like a champ. Not only did it remove a lot of undercoat without much effort (and even teased out slightly matted hair with a bit of work) but both dogs put up with it MUCH better than with any other method so far; one of them even went so far as to lie down to be groomed, which he NEVER does. In over ten years of owning these guys, they've never looked better with less effort. In short: I don't want to like it, because I don't want to admit I paid so much for a glorified comb, but it works like a champ. Highly recommended. Two labs here, and we've tried a number of things--ZoomGrooms, combs, brushes, undercoat rakes, those groovy serrated flexible metal things... none worked particularly well, and the dogs lost interest and patience very quickly. Then our vet-tech recommended the furminator. I was very resistant, not necessarily for the price but just because I couldn't believe it was that much different.

I purchased this bone based on the research and reviews on amazon.com. I was also attempting to buy a product that was USA made. I will say that the delivery was fast. I have a 38lb. Cocker Spaniel and Black Lab mix. She loves this bone and it definitely keeps her interest. I opened the package not realizing that it was not filled. Well there was maybe 1 tsp. of filler in the entire bone. Of course a product never looks exactly like the picture, but to not be filled hardly at all? I will be contacting the company directly and will repost or remove my rating if they honor their company. I will be asking for a new one! I should have taken video of what I received and checked it over more throughly. I'll let you know the outcome!
It attracts my hummers, and because of the size the nectar doesn't have time to go bad. Bit of a pain to clean.

For the most part I like this pet door and think it works well. However, it has one tragic flaw which I had to remedy myself. The problem is in the flap - it doesn't weigh enough at the bottom to shut if a breeze is blowing by. I had to attach a small steel plate toward the bottom of the flap in order to weigh it down enough to shut every time. I suppose if you install this pet door inside an interior room door, or through an attached garage to house door it wouldn't have a breezy flap issue. Otherwise, be aware of this potential problem. Installation is very straight-forward. I chose to install it on my storm door. Just be sure to make your measurements twice so you don't make any cutting mistakes. Remember, you've only got one shot at making a proper cut!If you're worried whether or not your dog will use a doggy door, rest assured he or she most likely will. I have a Shiba Inu (They are well known for being stubborn), so it took several days of holding treats on the other side while partially pushing open the door flap before he finally started walking through it by himself. At first it seemed hopeless, but if he can figure it out, I'm fairly confident most other dogs will too.

We still use this but the 2nd day it was up, the squirrels chewed a hole in it. We used duct tape to fix it and kept using it. The lid and perches are a heavy metal, I just wish the plastic tubing was more substantial.

we already had one of these toys for our cat. he'd managed to shred half the fabric off the toy so I bought 2 as backups. the price was great. 4 dollars compared to paying 7 or more at the big name pet store in town. I was very surprised when the toys came 2 days after I ordered them. very happy with this seller and thrilled with the toys. our cat is going to have a lot of fun with the new toys!!

The Drinkwell Fountain in operation is quiet in operation and our cats did drink from it. But over the long haul the design made cleaning impossible. The shape corners and unaccessable areas make this fountain not user friendly. It is also not dishwasher friendy for the washer hot settings can ruin the plastic and it also does not get it totally clean. We went with the stainless steel Pioneer Pet Fountain and with it round design with no sharp corners cleaning is piece of cake and it has no dishwasher restrictions.

I take in stray cats. I currently have 14. When one comes down with something possibly contagious, all go on antibiotics. The other week I picked up some antibiotics at the vet and then went and got these at the pet store ($8!!!). I was so happy that pilling this many cats was finally going to be so simple and easy for a change.Imagine my shock and annoyance when 10 of the 14 refused to eat them. The four that like them, love them, but the rest smell them and walk away.

This is the second Richell Frestanding Gate I have purchased. The first one broke after one too many falls and knock-overs by our teenagers-which I do not consider a product failure. The original 20" gate only truly fenced in one of our four small-breed dogs. (The 20 " gate is no contender against a determined Boston Terrier, I can assure you). However the new HL is 7.5" taller and is a VAST improvement over the original 20" gate. It looks much better than other gates out there and I love that I don't need to fasten this to a wall.

Ok, so my stepdaughter somehow talked me into getting her a rodent. Ok, hamster. Whatever. (It's still a rodent) So, we needed a cage for it, and she wanted it to have lots of room to run and play. Apparently, square footage is important to hamsters. Who knew.I dug an old 10 gallon fish tank out of the garba... umm... I mean garage and we ordered this to top it off. Sure enough, her rat.. umm... I mean hamster seemed to have great fun enjoying his captivity. He scampered up and down the ramps and ran seemingly endlessly for hours on his squeaky wheel (usually in the dead of the night, when I was trying to sleep) to announce his sheer joy at such a marvelous domicile!The quality of the topper is somewhat questionable however, since the clever little fellow managed to find a spot where the wires were not quite solidly fused together, allowing him to shove them aside and escape for a few days, until I spotted him sightseeing along the floor beneath the kitchen cabinets. A bit of wire to reattach the broken area and he was back safely home.Lots of fun for your little pet, just be sure to check the spot welds or be prepared to go on a hunt for your little fugitive.

I have been battling fleas this year and it seems like this flea med is taking a while to conquer the problem I have used this for a few months now and still a few fleas on both my cats. I know fleas are bad this year and my vet said I may just have to switch to a different product to combat the problem.

After reading about the "self-heating" pad, I looked at this item at the store and realized that the magic crinkly noise coming from inside the pad was just mylar sheeting, the same stuff a $2 emergency blanket is made of. It reflects nearly 90% of body heat. As I already have a regular cat pad lying around and didn't want to buy another (especially if the mylar interior goes into the wash with the pad) I just cut a square of mylar from the emergency blanket and inserted it into a fleece pillow case to see if my kitten would like laying on a crinkly pad. He enjoys the mylar sound, but also liked attacking the sheeting before I could get it inside the case. It definitely keeps him warm. I can feel the heat under his belly when he's been lying there for a while, plus I've selfishly sat on it and reaped the benefits myself. I don't think I'll open up my cat pad to insert the mylar, as it just seems better to be able to remove the sheeting when I want to give the pad or case a washing. The key is to have the mylar closest in layer to the cat's body, just below a thin soft fabric. The reflective heat is noticeable that much more quickly. So inserting it inside a dense pad doesn't seem as useful. I may place the mylar on top of the cat pad, and just add a fleece cover or the pillowcase.The cost of the product itself is fine, if I didn't already have a cat pad lying around. And while the product does work, I don't like the idea of washing the pad with mylar inside, Seems like the aluminized coating will crinkle and wear off with each rigorous washing cycle, lessening it's effectiveness over time.

This product works well to prevent scratches on the door when it is in place. However, the small velcro dots do not seem to hold on to the door well. The velcro sides are fine, but the adhesive side for the door comes losse very often, especially when the weather turned cold. I would supplement this product with better adhesive velcro dots, or for that matter, cut out your own piece of thick clear vinyl and create your own.

Asking my 3 cats: One rejects this for regular bowl, another goes either way, but my diabetic cat ONLY DRINKS FROM THIS FOUNTAIN--so for that reason alone, I'm thankful for this fountain. In the last 1-2 years I've had 3, maybe 4, of these fountains because past pumps stopped working after 3 or 4 months, but this present fountain's lasted 6 months so far. Low maintenance: filters work well and are easy to change and fountain's easy to clean. We have not tried the alternative Drinkwell fountain, whose water freefalls, however the cats have tried and unanimousely rejected those bubbler water reservoir contraptions. (update: see customer image of BooBoo bypassing waterbowl for the Petmate Fountain)

I don't mind dogs, but when they decide to bark because they think it served thier purpose to do so, this lil wonder saves you the trouble of running around and reminding them who is the alpha of the pack and that they need to shut up. It really does train the dog not to bark, all you have to do is go pick it up and they silence themselves.

These worked to calm our cat and help to ease his anxiety. Used for several years and would purchase again. Friends and family have tried. It worked for some but not for all. Do not expect it to work perfectly, it seems to be specific to individual cats. Found the price online to be much cheaper than at our vet.

I bought this item for my golden retriever. A trainer had recommended that I try feeding her meals this way so that she wouldn't just inhale her food. I typically feed her 1 cup of kibble, and the capacity of this seemed to be about 1/2 that. I filled it full, showed her how it worked, and set it down. She did seem to enjoy the challenge (or at least the food coming out), but after the first couple of minutes, the amount of food that came out at once (1-2 little kibble) decreased significantly even though there was still lots of food inside. After 15 minutes, I lost patience with the toy, and attempted to shake out the rest of the food. It took me a few minutes, which means that it would have taken her another 15 or so. I had particular trouble getting out the last 2-3 pieces. This could be a great toy for dogs, but it certainly is not a good tool for meal feeding. Plus, since she was rolling it everywhere, I had slobber and dog food crumbs everywhere when she was done. Yuck!

This is a cute, soft, cuddy toy which will, no doubt, entertain dogs without much interest in chewing (or lack the teeth to do so). However, our sweet little miniature dachshund (A) removed all three "squirrels" (they're really chipmunks and very cute) within less than 5 seconds the first time out of the box. Game over. Tree stump irrelevant. Within 15 minutes the three luckless chipmunks were in need of major surgery. Sadly, they are all deceased. The squeakers, like those in almost every dog toy of this type, are cheap, poorly inserted, and inadequately protected from anything but a toothless animal. The seams holding these cuties together are easily ripped open, spilling little chipmunk guts all over the carpet and leaving the "squeaker" for your pet to pick up and choke on! If this toy was for children, it would require a danger warning label. All-in-all it looks cute, but unless your dog is toothless and passive, look for another, better made toy. Amazon is doing no one, including the toy maker, any favors by including this poorly made item under the heading "for aggressive chewers." It is most definitely not! There's a reason the price is so low.

i used wood aspen bedding and it doesn't keep in the odor so the room smells horrible but now i use care fresh and it works the best!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!i had a rabbit and thats when i used aspen now i have hamsters and i use care fresh and i smell nothing and the aspen is pretty rough and this bedding is very soft and gentleits great!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

My Maltese got a bunch of toys for his 2nd birthday and this was his absolute favorite! He loves his squirrels and sticks his head in the trunk looking for more. He's 9 pounds and the size Large is PERFECT. Thank you Kyjen, for making such an awesome toy!

This crate was very easy to put together & is fairly sturdy - EXCEPT for the bottom tray. There is a panel that supposedly secures the tray but does not do a great job. My 2 yr old (50 lb) shepherd was able to push the tray halfway out of the crate within 15 minutes. She was then able to move the entire crate around by pushing on the tray. She was also able to chew off some of the corners of the tray. Today she pushed the tray halfway out & managed to break it into sharp pieces. Luckily she did not hurt herself doing so. We had thought about using zip ties to further secure the tray but did not have a chance.I removed the bottom tray entirely & she seems to be doing okay in the crate now. For dogs that are being crate trained, this is not a good crate to start with. Maybe if she did not have separation anxiety & want to get out of it - it would be fine.
Dog destroyed this in less than a minute and we had to throw it away. Not exactly what I'd expect from Kong.

I purchased two of these to keep my dogs from getting at them selves and each other. They worked well and for the price I have nothing to complain about. The one issue we had was the cloth piping that goes around the end came off from the dog itching at it. Not a big deal...

I received the bed as promised but when i opened it , it didn't seem as sturdy as i was made to believe. Then i found out i had to screw it to the ledge and that wasn't something i wanted to do. I will try it out and revisit my review

With my dog, it is inevitable that she will destroy everything I get for her, it is only a matter of time!What is great about these balls is that the fuzz on them is non-abrasive on your dog's teeth like a normal tennis ball is. My dog loves these balls because they squeak- which is part of their weakness. The squeakers are always the first thing to go, usually in the first day or two. Once the squeaker is gone, it is really up to my dog on how long she wants it to last. Sometimes she will let the ball survive because she wants to play keep away and catch with it, other times, she immediately goes into destroy mode. With the squeaker gone, she has a starting point to tear the fuzz and rip apart the rubber of the ball. Eventually, I end up with half a ball and a bunch of fuzz and rubber on the floor.I will saw that at least the squeaker usually falls into the ball, rather than out, keeping it out of her mouth, since that is something she would love to eat.While this can't be a forever toy, these are a nice treat for my dog!

Although my Vet say's Zentonil is the only product she is aware of to treat canine liver problems there are several problems in administering the medication.My dog "Lady" is a 101 lb Spinonie Italiano (Italin Retriver)She requires 800 mg or (2) 400 mg pills each dayThe lable states that the pills must be taken on an empty stomach 3 to 4 hours before or after meals so that the pills will pass to the intestine before desolving.THE PROBLEM IS:The pills are quite LargeThe pills are enteric coated to prevent their desolving too soon and the coating makes the pills very Slippery.Athough that is a plus in getting the animal to swallow them it also makes it easy for the animal to Cough them Back Up.Over a period of about 2 months the only way I could get her to accept the pills was to wrap them in a piece of lunchmeat( I know that wasn't recomended because it stimulated her stomach acids)At one point she Chewed a pill (which must not taste good)Now, she absolutely refuses to accept the pills any way, shape, or form.In a few instances even when I was able to get her to the swalow the pills and keep them down down for several minutes, she actually threw upand ejected the pills.Is anyone else having this problem or know how I can get her to take them?ThanksROCKY4260@aol.com
Extremely big bucket of yummy treats for training! This is a great value. The pieces are large, but I cut them up into smaller pieces for regular training purposes.

Very unhappy. The collar works when I blow hard in it but put it on the dog and doesn't even work. And what's worse is that I cannot return it once it is used. How are you going to know about a product unless you use it. Most companies accept returns so I didn't think to read the return policy. They have a 15% re-stocking fee! Ridiculous! I learned my lesson. I will always read the return policy!

My vet told me about Lupine products as my dog is a chewer due to jaw issues. This is my second purchase as I had to send my first back for replacement(did not want to be without harness or leash while other was being replaced) No problems with replacement. Took less than 2 weeks for replacement. I would recommend this to anyone who has a chewer.

My dog is only 2, and has bitten through 6 nylon leashes. This leash is so heavy duty, it could probably pull a truck! And at half the price compared department stores. Shipping was lightning fast also. Thank you!

This feeder saved me from early morning attacks by my cat wanting to be fed. But I soon realized that my cat was eating three meals per day as programmed plus whenever she felt like sticking her paw inside and grabbing a snack. This product would be perfect if it closed off the food completely. Why have they not fixed this? It may work better for a dog with large paws that do not fit in the opening.

I'm of mixed feelings on this product. My dog really likes these rawhide bones and will munch on one readily, but I noticed that they are marked as "Made in China" on the back of the package. It could very well be that they have quality control in place to ensure these bones are safe for pets, but I've heard too many horror stories about this sort of thing to feel entirely comfortable.It's up to you as the purchaser to decide if you want to bother. My Keeshond-mix would heartily recommend these treats, but she doesn't know where China is.

I too wanted my cats to have silica dust free litter, so I switched to this brand. While it may be silica dust free it is NOT dust free. It is full of corn dust, and I recently found out from a veterinarian that corn is an allergen that can cause chronic urinary tract/bladder inflammation. Guess what? My cat has chronic UTI with no known source... Also this litter does not last the amount of time that they claim. My cats track this dust all over the house and on our clothes if we are holding them(gross!)and it has no odor control. One of my cats eats some of it and then throws it up. After several years of using this I am at the end of my rope. Not only is this NOT the Worlds Best Cat Litter, if your cat is allergic to corn it may be harming them, and it is expensive. I recently switched over to Dr. Elsey's cat litter. I am very happy with it. It clumps well, no dust, some odor control, and far cheaper.

Replaced our older model. It's not as well made.Had to return it after just filling it with seed. Thescew within was faulty, it is now made with mostly plasticcomponents. Amazon replaced quickly, but, beware theycharge to ship, even if product was defective.

To be fair, I can't really speak to the quality of this item, because I never received it. I placed my order on December 5th. I waited and waited, and it never shipped. Ten days later, on December 15, I contacted the seller, asking if and when they were going to ship my item. No response. Three days later, on December 18 (one day after the delivery window according to the seller), I wrote them again, saying if they didn't respond by December 20, I was going to file a claim with Amazon. Still no response. Lo and behold, at 4:30 pm on December 20, I receive a notice from Amazon that the seller cancelled my order as the item is out of stock. NO communication from the seller, and NO consequences from Amazon for their actions. DO NOT TRUST THIS SELLER.
This was too large for my dog. It said it was for small dogs, but mine would not play with it.

The 3 stars is not for the quality but from my dogs enthusiasm compared to the other Merrick dog foods. She just prefers the other flavors more. The packaging could be better to keep the cans from getting dented and crushed.

Although it is listed under a dog toy, I can see why it did not work out as planned for some people. My daughter had this as a 4-year old and it was a lot of fun for her to watch bounce around all by itself and try to catch it. It might be appropriate for smaller dogs who do not chew, it will not be durable enough for dogs who like to catch it and chew.

The cats LOVE this toy. When it's put away after playtime, they will search the house looking for it. They've found it a couple of times, so we had to hide it better. What more would you want from a cat toy?
I'm sure these would be great for a larger dog, my doxie couldn't get them out of the ball nor could he really chew on them. When I tried to give him the treat alone he turned up his nose at it.

Not really a fault of the product, but this won't really help if you have a flea problem. I caught tens of dozens of fleas with this, but when they number in the thousands, it's ineffective. Vectra (non-poisonous, unlike Frontline/Advantage) is what you really need.

I've had 2 of these over the past 10 years and each one still works great, the only issue is that over time the impeller shaft starts to wear causing grinding sounds. It's actually cheaper to just buy a new one, which solves the problem for another five years or so. So again, my filter started making sounds again, no problem, I went online, ordered the product and fired it up. I was shocked that the brand new filter literally right of of the shrink-wrap started making MORE of a grinding noise than the other two! It has been my conclusion that Hagen's (the manufacturer of Aquaclear products) quality has SIGNIFICANTLY decreased over the years. I am just going to return it, get my $50 back and deal with the noise. Please, don't get me wrong, these filters are absolutely amazing. they're one of the best, but a word to Hagen: don't let your quality standards lower or otherwise you'll lose your customer base and reputation.

As much as I like the feel, materials, concept and quality behind this product, it is the SECOND time I've ordered from Amazon and gotten a GREEN toy. I don't know what other folks' lawn color is, but mine is GREEN. The last one we bought blended in perfectly and lasted about 2 weeks before my husband shredded it with his tractor mowing the lawn. As annoyed as I was at him (so were our kids and our dog, who really liked it), I agreed with his retort: why would you get the dog a green throw toy for outside, anyway?PLEASE LET US PICK THE COLOR when ordering... It might last longer and encourage me to buy more. I didn't think that lightening would strike twice on getting a green toy, but it certainly did. I won't be buying a replacement when this (inevitably) gets lost or shredded in the yard this Spring/Summer. What a shame, as it is a durable dog toy.

I purchased the StarMark Collar after reading about it in the puppy book by the Monks of New Skete. It made no difference to our golden retriever puppy; she pulled on the leash as much with the StarMark Collar as with a traditional collar. My wife had a hard time fastening it at first; it took her about a week-and-a-half to get used to putting it on. The collar popped apart 3 times when I was walking our pup; twice was when the pup was confronted by hostile dogs, and the situation could have gotten ugly; the other time it popped apart was when she was playing in the park.I talked with Martina Contreras, a dog behaviorist, about the problem. She recommended the Premier Easy Walk Dog Harness (Amazon product number B0009ZBKG4). It instantly and dramatically reduced the amount and force of pulling on the leash. When we first got the Premier Harness, our dog did not like it, but after two days, when we say "walk," she runs to the harness and sits for us to put it on. We did not train her to do this; she just likes the harness.I threw the StarMark Collar in the trash.

Made in the US---one ingredient and I can pronounce it-100% liver. My dog loves it. Its freeze dried so does not have a strong odor--overall a great product.

Hi have 4.5 lb dog who is 2 years old, and we've gone through 3 of these bags already. The faux leather straps start ripping after a few months of usage. Poor quality, but pretty-looking bag. I get compliments on it all the time. I just wish these one last!

Encouraged by the reviews, I bought this for my rat terrier. No results with the first bottle so I contacted the manufacturer. Felt I wasn't using enough of the gel so bought a second bottle and tried again, being careful to follow their instructions to the letter. After 2 bottles I still see no change in her teeth. The Gentle Leader is an excellent dog product! My dog, a Labrador Retriever who weighs 70 pounds, is strong. This product keeps him from pulling because, when he tries to pull, it pulls his head at the same time. Dogs can't pull when their heads are being tugged. Obviously, my dog isn't crazy about the Gentle Leader, but I am!

Petmate Copolymer Plastic/Steel Lifestyle Kennel Cab, Medium, Lady Pink/Dark Pink, It arrived with some small damage, since the damage was something that I could live with, I kept it. It serves it's purpose. This item also need a standard size chart other than (Small, Medium, and Large).

I found this when my syrian outgrew her 7-in ball. While it works, it is quite strange that there are no sizes between 7-in and 10-in. She is not quite as skilled at steering it, nor as skilled at stopping... but she can still make it go and it does not scare her anymore since she got used to it (about a week). I forgot to tape the door several times, but it seems a bit sturdier and she has not popped it open yet.

The EHEIM Classic filter is a great filter. Had a bit of trouble with the clips falling off when the filter was not on and not under pressure, but once it's up and running it worked like a charm. No leaks have been noted, not a single noise from the filter, often I wonder if its on! I would recommend this filter if you need a canister filter, its cheap and work great!
Exact replacement for the Eclipse 6 gallon aquarium. Dropped my first one and broke one of the tabs. This was an exact copy.

I purchased this for my two big maine coon kitties. They are 20 plus pounds apiece and didn't fit on the smaller versions sold in stores. It is well made, has some weight to it to withstand some vigorous scratching and stays put. Going back to this store to order the upright one. All four of my kitties, love this scratcher. Fast shipping too!

I've owned nothing but All-Glass aquariums for almost 10 years, and in my experience, the plastic hoods are a waste of money. I've owned many, and have been impressed by none. The All-Glass VersaTops are far superior in my opinion.1.) The deluxe hoods generally come with a single-tube strip light with no reflector, only cheap plastic above the bulb. The twin-tube strips will have a reflector to increase the efficiency of the bulb. Invest in at least a twin tube right away (make sure to get the twin-tube glass tops as well), especially with the deeper tanks. Quality of lighting is much better without having to break the bank with specialized lighting.2.) The access panel is clumsy and the plastic hinged joints break or crack easily. Every one I've owned has been very noisy when opening/closing. Glass tops offer more visibility and a smoother range of motion (they're quiet and will last longer).3.) More inconvenient to clean than a glass top. Visibility of water spots/mineral buildup very obvious if you don't maintain them properly. Usually takes a lot of scrubbing to remove the deposits completely.4.) Oak accent coating on light strip tends to wear off easily.5.) Hood allows for a greater rate of evaporation. Glass fits snugly into the lip of the aquarium and greatly reduces evaporation; i.e., you don't have to top-off the water frequently.6.) Cutouts on the rear of the hood are inconvenient and if the outlined pattern is followed, leaves too much room for that occasional fish to escape (nobody wants carpet-critters) and restricts customization for placing equipment. Glass VersaTop has a clear plastic strip for the rear panel which is easy to cut (to your specifications, also helps with evaporation, leaves less room for jumping fish to escape) and is very easily replaced.In my experience, the hoods are functional, but I've found glass to be far superior in performance, reliability, quality, appearance and maintenance (and I haven't broken one yet).

I thought these perches were a brilliant idea at first. My cockatiels loved them.Two days ago we woke to find a very healthy 10 month old cockatiel dead, face down on the bottom of the cage. There was no signs as to what had killed her. We were naturally devastated. I had gone over in my mind repeatedly what could have killed her as the night prior she had been her usual chirpy cheeky cocky self. But last night was to reveal exactly what had happened to herLast night just before I went to bed I was watching my cockatiels who had just paired up and before my eyes what killed my first cockatiel repeated itself. Both birds were very healthy, lively characters. The cock was perched on the pedi perch to roost. He shifted slightly on the pedi perch, lost his footing, gave a squawk of fright and in shock plunged to his death. 10 minutes later he died from his fall. His mate who had witnessed the first plunge [unknown to us] also died from the shock of seeing a second cockatiel die in the same manner.If I could give a negative 5 star on this product I would.I have spoken to our local pet shop about what has happened and he is now sending all pedi perches back and is no longer stocking themBeware! I lost 3 very healthy birds in 2 nights through this perch

My two dogs love these. Now as to do they work. I honestly do not know. Both of my dogs are right now at what my vet calls stage two on dental health. Stage four is the worst on his scale. I am going to monitor and see IF just maybe they will either still be a stage two in a year or maybe better. If they maintain at stage two I would love it. Teeth cleaning on dogs is very expensive so if this product works it will save me big bucks. Here's hoping! I will come back and update this after their next check up which should be around August of 2013.
i used both of this products this way and neither one worded will buy the oniginal for now on just a waste of money

I'm not entirely sure - I'll have to check the battery, but this collar was working at first and now he barks right through it. He will yelp in pain with his first bark and then continue to bark. We are using the long prongs, because we heard the short ones don't work.

I had to give this a review to ask the question ;) Sorry.I have a Yorkshire Terrier that consistently barks. I don't want to use one of those 'shock' collars. I was wondering if this would work, i.e., I would click it each time she barked. Would the noise be enough to stop her from barking?Thanks.

My Himalayan cat, Smokey, loves these treats and never gets tired of them. I use these as rewards for tricks. Smokey can sit, shake one "hand", then the other one, wave, and give a kiss on command, as long as I have a treat for him. In fact, I just have to crinkle the bag and he comes running.Of course, it took patience, lots of treats, and a smart cat. At least, I think he's smart; he also walks on a leash! He is pretty mellow.My Tabby cat is not as polite. If I leave the bag out, she rips it apart to get the treats.

This thing is 5 stars in the air output department, but dude... my cousin and I named it "the KAMA3" (a communist era soviet diesel truck that was VERY loud) and I mean loud! right out of the box and this thing is roaring. I'm using both outputs with a T connection and regulating flow for a couple undergravel filters and 2 airstones in a 55 Gal tank. This pump leaves a rescued penguin 350 I have in too (whose impeller seems to have fought in WW2, Korea and Vietnam) in the floor when it comes to noise, And I thought I had a diesel truck with the penguin... I think I'm gonna install it in the patio and route the tubing back to the bedroom 'cause right now I feel like I slept beneath my grandma's fridge last night.

This product contains Carageenan. This ingredient is unsafe for animals. Do your own research. It seems harmless at first, (seaweed) however it is linked to stomach cancer and IBS in animals. Probably still a better alternative treat than all the other 'junk' on the market, but still not the best alternative.

Seriously. I tried. I REALLY wanted this to work for two reasons. My boy cat refuses to "squat" when he pees causing pee to seep out of the side of my top entry litterbox. My girl cat is just flat out a jerk and kicks her litter halfway across the floor. Living in NY in a tiny apt this is far from ideal. The Clevercat Top Entry Litter Box seemed like the perfect solution. I was so excited when it arrived. I had dreams of a litter and pee free floor!At first I kept the old box out as a standby. My cats REFUSED to go near this giant white monster. Infact, my boy cat walked up to it and hissed at it. Not a good sign. I tried putting away the old box leaving some poop in the new box to show them this is where the crap goes. Instead my boy cat ran to a basket I have next to my sofa and peed there. It was two days of pee and crap all over the apartment. Day three I was fed up.So, if anyone wants one, I have a completely unused one sitting in my living room taunting me of what could have been.

I order these treats in bulk since they are a favorite of my Boston Terrier. She is allergic to a number of things, and these don't contain any ingredients that she is allergic to. They are a little bit on the expensive side, but they are totally worth it!

This item worked the first time right out of the packaging, but it has a habit of slipping off and down to his hind legs when he jumps or takes off from the sitting position. My dog stopped tugging on the leash and actually walked next to me, so the harness does what it claims. It's just the poor design of the strap placements. The reason I think why this harness slips off is because the front chest strap is designed to be lose and only tightens together when your dog tugs or walks ahead of you. Since it's loose, it tends to hang down below his chest when he's in a sitting position. Then when he gets up or jumps forward, his legs sometimes slips through the low hanging chest strap and then the whole thing slips back to his hind legs. The few times this has happened I was afraid my dog was going to take off running, leaving me behind holding the leash attached to the harness and no dog.

I thought I would be getting something that helps with all that litter my cats seem to track around my house. Instead Ive found the perfect URINE MAKER! Since there is NO INNER WALL between the steps and the middle of the box if your cat decides that's where she (or he) would like to pee your in for a huge problem! PEE STAIRS! And after you have PEE STAIRS you get PEE PAWS! HOORAY! Now I have urine all over the house instead of litter!!!Luckily, my other cat does not pee out the stairs, she pees against the wall. And then her urine drips down from the wall and into the seam and then DOWN ON TO THE FLOOR! HOORAY! PEE FLOOR!WHAT A PEECE OF JUNK!AVOID AVOID AVOID!

I have always had a self cleaning litter box for my previous cats, and just loved them. This was my first LitterMaid and I am very disappointed. The rake does not go to the bottom of the tray and misses half the clumps, which I have to scoop out myself.I have tried to repeat and still I end up scooping, very disappointing. I called them, but they said there was nothing they could do. What good is the warrenty!! I will be calling them again!

When we got our 2nd cat I noticed our regular litter wasn't doing the trick so I decided to try something new. My sister in law who has 2 rather large cats and a small-ish apartment recommented TWBCL so I picked up a bag. This litter did not kick up dust when I poured it into the pan, but that's the only good thing I can say about this litter. My cats tried to eat the litter initially, but then took to using it. There is NO ODOR CONTROL whatsoever. My cats are great about "covering their tracks" in the box and I feed them a high quality cat food. It was as if I did not have any litter in their box at all. It also does not clump like the bag claims to do. I scoop daily. The clumps were not solid and crumbled regularly. Also the litter would barely cling to the solids. It also did not keep cat waste from gathering in the corners or the bottom of the box. My black kitten would come out of the box with her paws covered with a fine film of yellow, and our floor was getting covered in what looked like sawdust. I finally got fed up and threw everything out...the litter and the box...and am starting over again with a new brand of litter and pan.
... by a friend. Plugged it in and about week later tested the cat. He sprayed approximately 5 feet from the unit. Doesn't even phase the cat. :o(

We have a high energy 36lb puppy who understood by clicker training where he was supposed to heel, but would lose position and pull whenever he saw something exciting on the walk such as frogs, birds or squirrels.So we tried out this harness. By using a small piece of cheese as a lure, he quickly learned to put his head through the harness and then stand still while we clipped it on. It doesn't rub or come loose or dig in anywhere, but you do have to make sure everything is in the correct anatomical position according to the instructions and adjust it if your dog is still growing. After a week or so, we didn't need the cheese, as he loves to go for walks and wanted to put his head in the harness all by himself.On walks it was fantastic - a gentle correction and he would just come back to heel perfectly. He never minded the corrections at all and it was also easy to stop him before the behaviour escalated. It really seemed to make him understand that we didn't want him to pull. The harness is very gentle, very effective and there is no chance of injuring the throat or neck. I think it is great and it worked wonders with our dog.The downside? It says on the box not to leave the harness on your dog. They're not kidding. Unless your dog is actually walking with you, you cannot leave it on for even a couple of minutes. One day I put the harness on him and popped him immediately into the car as he was going to the vet. As soon as he lay down in the car, he was able to get his nose under the breast strap and he chewed it through in about 20 seconds. He did the same thing to the replacement strap. It's very flimsy material - it looks just like one of those inexpensive colored mylon leashes that you see all over the place, but our dogs often chew on those and they don't break or fray. If they upgraded the breast strap to a regular strength I would give this harness 5 stars.

I bought this food after researching ferret nutrition for some time before getting my first ferret. I wish I would have read some more before I bought it. Not only did I pay too much ($19 at Petco) but I'm not crazy about some of the ingredients. The 3rd ingredient is rice, which ferrets can't digest so I guess it's there for filler. It also has banana puree and raisin juice- sugars are not good for ferrets. I also don't like that the fat level is low and the shape has a tendency to get stuck in ferret mouths.On the plus side, it's inexpensive and my ferret likes it. It only makes up about a quarter of his food mix so it balances out. (He also gets Natures Variety Instinct Duck/Turkey and Wellness Core)The ingredients are better than Marshall's food so I recommend this food over that. I used the MoreDooks food chart to compare.

At the beginning was working great. Two barks and the dog was silent. But now, I don't know if he got used to it or the batteries run out, but he is not responding to it.I also bought a package of ten extra batteries but I'm waiting for the indicator light to flash.
My JRT had this chewed up in 20 min. After the squeaker was removed he lost interest. Too expensive and it smells like cheap rubber too.
excellent storage - using it to store bird seed - has pouring spout & tight fitting lid to keep bird seed fresh - perfect size
Not the fault of the product, but this is basically useless for any real infestation. I caught dozens of fleas, but it's not like they are flocking to this thing.

I really like this stuff. It smells good and for dogs that don't like the water or are too big to stick in a tub, it works pretty good. I have used this product for years and so I will continue to buy it.
Its noisy. It takes up more space than the old litterbox. The only good thing I can say is that my cat dosen't scatter as much litter outside this litterbox.

This is a very inexpensive, but quality reflects the price. It is very difficult to read the temperature without having to read it very intently and even squinting! Even the cheap(er) walmart product has better readability.... Won't buy again... Better spend a bit more an get a quality thermometer. Three stars and I am being very generous...

I bought this for my black haired part lab dog, whom I keep tripping over at night. At least for my dog, this collar is useless. Her hair covers up the glow-in-the-dark strip and so I still trip over her. This would probably be a good product for a short haired dog, but for my medium length haired dog, it's useless.

I legitimately think that Hagen does not like to package their shipments correctly. All there was were three tiny little bags of air, they didn't even help fit the box inside snuggly so that it wouldn't get thrown around! My AquaClear 70 was severely cracked and I am getting my replacement. It's a great company, but they should learn not to skimp on the safety of their shipment to customers.
We had this unit about 6 months. After about 2 months the bottle developed a small crack and then a few months later developed a huge crack. Evidently you can't buy a replacement bottle.

I have had a cat and a kitten for about 6 months now. I had tried a myriad of kitty litters prior to settling on Feline Pine. Since one was a kitten and both came from a shelter, I don't think the cats were particularly picky about their litter. I switched them from clay to pine pellets without using any transition and they were unphased.After using Feline Pine for a few weeks, I decided to go ahead and buy two of the litter boxes made for the litter. Having the ability to sift out the sawdust (which is created when cat urine breaks down the pine pellets) into the bottom pan has made litter box cleanup SUPER easy!This is what I do: 1. Scoop solids once per day and shake the box side to side in the evening to move any sawdust that the cats didn't scratch down into the bottom pan. 2. Empty the bottom pan about one time per week by dumping into a 5-gallon bucket with lid. 3. Place a few of the slightly broken down pellets (those that have been in the litter box for a week) into the bottom pan. This keeps the sawdust from sticking to the bottom pan and makes dumping easier. 4. Add some fresh pellets to top tray if it looks too shallow. I do this when dumping bottom tray. 5. Completely empty the top tray about one time per month. Place some old pellets in bottom tray as stated above.You can apparently use the sawdust as compost. I prefer to get rid of it by dumping the 5-gallon bucket into a trashbag when full. Then again, I also have dogs and I worry they would get into the compost. Another note - a 20-25lb. bag lasted me about a month (with a little left over) and that took care of two litter boxes.My final suggestion ... and this has been mentioned before ... if you have a local farm store such as a Tractor Supply Company, look for Equine Pine which is horse bedding. It is the same thing, but costs FAR less. Up until recently, I was buying Feline Pine at $9-11 for a 20-25lb. bag. I found Equine Pine for about $6.50 for a 40lb. bag. MUCH CHEAPER!
Had purchased a smaller crate previously and am as pleased with the larger one. It is an excellent value, and my dog is quite happy.
The urine finder does show areas where the urine is. The only thing I would like to see is a wider beam and a bit brighter.

My sister loved scoopfree she raved about it . It works really well but BEWARE DOG OWNERS !! Her tiny jack russel came down sick, hiding in the closet could barely walk. Come to find out while she was at work he was getting into the catbox eating the crystals. as soon as she discovered this she changed to reg litter, different catbox and made it impossible for dog to access. 2days later dog is fine.Just use caution dog owners!!

First off, the concept is great. Honestly, this is great for the cats and containing the litter fling. Now the reality:1) Is this really manufactured by Littermaid as well? I know it is, but can someone not take accurate measurements? Assembling the plastic rods was annoying enough, but for the joint connectors to be so dang brittle they snap? That was the first call to them asking for a free replacement.2) We have the Littermaid Mega Elite pooper scooper. The dang thing doesn't fit in the tent. The cartridge box hangs about half way out. Hello? Does Littermaid not design these for their own product? Also, this was designed so poorly to move the box in and out of the tent. You eventually have to do a cleaning of the entire contraption, and they sure don't make it easy.3)That little flap on the bottom of the entry is utterly useless... and zipping the tent back up is like trying to put on a pair of jeans three sizes too small just after you at at a buffet for 3 hours: Utterly impossible. I had to literally take the tent apart and take a quarter of an inch off of each rod to assemble it in a fashion that I didn't think the tension was going to implode the tent on my poor cats.3) The little window flap for the box switch and electrical: Why is it on the left? This is annoying. I need it on the right wall. This is just not convenient. If anything this flap should be on the back of the tent.Recommendations:If you buy this thing, take about a quarter of an inch off of each rod BEFORE you attempt to assemble it. If you don't, you'll drive yourself nuts trying to zip the dang thing up and about the point where the zipper fails on you the first time, you'll snap one of those joints.I modified the tent: I put a piece of wood in the bottom of the tent to allow for easier sliding of the box in and out. I snipped the little lip off to accommodate this.I also attached a vent in the upper right of the tent at the back wall with a exhaust fan of sorts to draw the kitty smell away and out. I have three little computer fans and a plastic flexible dryer vent that links to a port and draws the smell out a vent like a dryer. Yeah, I'm in it for the long haul but you appreciate this when the windows aren't open and the house is stuffy.Lastly, if Littermaid really cared, they would pick up on this by now. They haven't and we still buy the darn thing since it is the only one. All I can say is, if it breaks, call 'em up and tell 'em to replace it. Don't throw away the Customer Service paper that's in the box.

So I purchased these bows for my female maltese, being that she has long hair and I try to keep it out of her eyes...and for once I decided to use something pretty instead of regular black hair bands....MISTAKE. These bows are made in a strange way, the way the band is attached will leave the bow sideways....impossible to straighten them out. And the elastic is very stiff and will not stretch...which makes an already hard job even harder. When I did managed to get them in (crooked) they lasted about ten minutes...and then fell apart.....This being a dog that wears a sweater constantly and never pulls at it....the tiny beads are glued on and my pup promptly ate one of them, and while you should receive two of each color you will receive about four or five that do not match whatsoever....I would not buy these again.
You get what you pay for...good price but poor quality, however does have some weight to them so, they may last longer than others. But do you want them to?

we recently adopted a stray cat and i went searching the web for a litter box. we've only ever owned dogs so this was very new to me. Well, after reading all the positive results, I decided to buy one. I was excited to use it on my dog when it started barking. I have had many power and canister filters over the years and this NOT one of the better ones. I love the concept of the Bio-Wheel and have a smaller version for my 10 gallon tank. So I decided to get a big one to help with filtration on my 210 gallon (I also have a Fluval FX5). The main purpose was to have a handy filter I can switch out bags of Carbon and Purigen with (it is a pain to open the big FX5 every other week- and a filter such as this takes seconds to switch out, since it has lots of room). The filter has 4 slots for media cartridges (it comes with 2), and has a high output, gallons per hour (that I've noticed), which is good. It does it's job very well, and I can switch out my media bags (I use the 2 front slots for the media cartridges and put 2 bags of my own media behind them). The ONLY problem I've found with the filter is that it makes noise (yes I know it's a power- or hang on the back filter, but compared to the Aquaclears I've had- it is a bit much). Even with the tank filled to the brim - it puts out noise comparable to a small fountain in my living room! I can understand a slow meandering trickle or even a small steady waterfall, but this sounds like a roar compared to other filters like this that I've owned. Ok, to be fair it is what it is- the high output of this filter(which is actually a good thing), is what is causing the amount of noise. So it's not a design flaw- it's doing what it is supposed to. I just wanted to warn you of the amount of noise you should be prepared for. My 10 gallon has the smallest version of the Bio-Wheel and I love it. But this huge one is quite annoying. I still love that it does what it does perfectly for me (high output, and easy to switch out media). So I am going to have to find a way to slow down the output (which I haven't figured out a way yet). That WOULD be the ONLY way (besides filling your tank to the very top-which doesn't work), to get the noise to settle down- despite what others have said about the Bio-Wheel loading up with bacteria and slowing down. What actually happens is that the Bio-Wheel loads up with algae and THAT is what slows it down. In MOST cases this isn't that bad, but since I use Purigen in my media setup- I don't EVER get any alage. Which is one of the reasons why I love it (besides others- see Purigen), but if you don't have purigen in your setup then your filter WILL slow down eventually. So in closing I hope you find this information helpful in your filter selection.

We have used angel Eyes for about a month on a small Yorkie-Poo whose eyes teared red leaving a dark red streak from his eyes down his face. The tearing has greatly improved allowing his cute white face to show, It is not perfect at this time but we hope it will continue to improve. It's worth a try if you have red tearing on your dog

These things are great for masking the odor of litter boxes, but they do have trouble staying on the litter compartment. I find that using super glue works well though and requires just one extra step.

I bought this thermometer to use with our dogs and cats. Works great, much safer than a rectal thermometer and very quick. Makes a beep when you activate it and a beep when it is finished but this has not bothered my dogs or cats.It is supposed to be good for 20,000 temperatures or up to 10 years although it only has a 1 year warranty.***The reason for my 3 star review instead of 5 stars is the battery.The internal lithium battery has an estimated built-in life of 5 years. You have to send the thermometer back to the factory at AMC (Advanced Monitors Corp) for service and for a "nominal fee" at their discretion they will either replace the battery or the thermometer.Not sure it would be worth the postage fees and "nominal fee" which are between $49 and $79 from what I have found in their manual and online.Obviously it would be cheaper to buy a new one but I am hoping that it will last for several years before I have to do that.

The door has come off several times and in order to get the door to shut, my 5 year old bangs on it repeatidly with a fist. Also the bottom of ourswas cracked in about 1 day (perhaps someone stood on it) so no longer good for any water type critters. Haven't used it to house anything alive yet.
I got this for my Siberian huskey that's full of energy and thinks she needs to mush all the time . has completely changed my dog. I highly recommend
My cat likes this toy a little bit. Sometimes it entertains her. But mostly she loves the cardboard packaging that came with this toy.

I just received the bed today. The overall impression is that its cheap and won't last a month. The cover material is very thin and I expect it not to make it though two or three washings.
