Do not believe most of the cleverly marketed training guide which is way too optimistic, apart from the beginning when it suggests that you move the original litter box slowly toward the bathroom in a week.

Halloween is a time for spooks and treats. It's a time for ghosts, witches and goblins. Should humans be the only ones who get to dress up for this terrifying event? Of course not. That's why I purchased this adorable DOGZILLA costume for my puppy dog. His name is Professor Xavier and he looks cute, maybe a little too cute. What a muffin. When the trick-or-treaters knock on my door, I let the dog answer the door. While the kids are admiring him, I jump out in my witch costume with an axe and I scream at the top of my lungs to scare them away. I guess it would be scary since I'm an overweight man but it's a good way to keep all the candy for myself.

using it while clicker training my cats! it's a really nice size for them, since they don't go thru treats like dogs do. everything i saw in stores was WAY too big. i never close up the drawstring, so can't comment on that. but definitely nice option if your looking for something smaller.

So far, the Zodiac flea collars work okay. They were thinner than I thought they were going to be. The question is: will they work the length of time stated? The true test is whether or not, within a 4 month period, the cats and I start performing a synchronized scratching routine at 3am.

The flexi leash is exactly what I wanted .The release mechanism works great . I had read that the handle might be a little small,but I did not find it to be. it fits my hand just fine and I am over six foot tall with large hands.
doggies hate it and i love it. works great if you can keep the dog still long enough to clip. vet quality.
The Squeaker is fine, inexpensive and works well. I won't order again because the shipping cost was several times more expensive than the item!
Nice idea and lightweight but my deerhound tore one up within days and i can't find a replacment mesh anywhere. What a sad waste of money.
It is in good working condition, but it is SO loud! My dog was terrified of it for a few days.

Our's lasted for 8 months and then the motor died right before we were going out of town. I ran to the a nearby pet store to pick up a new one. Out of the box the new one was defective. The feeder would only rotate half way and then get stuck. I ran back to the pet store, exchanged it and the new one was also defective! Same problem. So I picked up a PetSafe 2-Meal feeder and this has worked well, so far. (No motors or rotating with this one). There is a silver lining. The feeder has a one-year warranty. I called PetSafe and they sent me a new feeder, virtually no questions asked. I didn't even have to return the broken one. In summary, I'd still buy one (it seems to be one of the best feeders out there). Just keep an eye on it and have someone drop by your home while your gone to make sure it is working.

I ordered this crate for our dog to be shipped to us across the country. I had to ask a friend to drill holes in the back for required 4-sided ventilation and to replace the plastic fasteners with metal ones. It is definitely solid and otherwise worked to get her to us safely.

I'm not an aspen bedding expert. This is only the second bag I've purchased. I thought these were more like shavings. They have the texture of chips with shredded sharp edges. If I had to live and sleep on this stuff I'd be full of wood slivers. The last brand I bought was Harlan Sani-chips which was much more to my liking. They were wood shavings, softer w/o the sharp splintered edges. Looks like Harlan was just bought out so I hope the new owners are putting out the same product because I'm ordering a bag. I'm not buying another bag of Kaytee.11-28-11I'm going to suck it up and say that my opinion of the Kaytee litter has improved. The critters (dwarf hamsters) love to burrow into it and make nests out of it which they can't do w/ the Sani-Chips. So in the future I'll buy some of both since the critters give them both a thumbs up for different reasons.

I have tried several types of filters for my red eared slider and this has kept the tank the cleanest, however its really hard to take it apart to clean it and the filters dont last more than one time before the fall apart. My red eared slider is in a 65 gallon tank now as she has grown very big, about large lunch plate size and its necessary to clean out the filter at least once or twice a week. I found its less expensive to buy the disposable filter pack for a different brand of filter and take out the plastic holder, fold up the cotton pouch and use that. I havent been able to find replacement white filter "absorbers"? that go on the one side but have been changing the blue sponge about every 3-4 weeks. there are basically three componets to the filter system, the carbon bag, the blue sponge filter and the white circular stone type things that go under the carbon pouch. So in addition to the filter you will need to buy these items too. Overall my biggest complaint is its VERY difficult to get the thing open to clean it.
My youngest bulldog made short work out of this. And by short I mean he chewed it in half in less than a day.
My dog loves everything we've tried from Merrick. No GI upsets from anything we've tried so far, including several varieties of the canned food.

I was hoping this Super Bark Stop would be strong enough to reach to the neighbors and stop those dogs from barking whenever were outdoors but no. Apparently, even chainlink fences will stip the signal. I was very disappointed. I tried.

This product is very expensive but my dogs love them. I can get them to do what ever I want as long as they know they are getting these as a reward but then again, I can also use cheap hot dogs with the same results. If you have money to burn, then buy this, if not, stick with store brand hot dogs cut up into small pieces.

I bought this mat for my cat because he is such a slob. It contains most of his mess but now he has taken it upon himself to pick out each piece of food individually and still eat it on the carpet. *Sigh* At least it gets some of the food!
Dog loves the bed. Bed does get flat with time but other than that excellent for the price.

I've been using this particular hummingbird feeder for several years now and my hummers love it because of the perches. They seem to hold up well even in the hot Florida sun. As a matter of fact, I just ordered two more to had to the collection.

Very attractive for large spaces however our pet could get out of it easily. My husband attached it to the wall with hooks that close. That made it more functional. Without attaching it to the wall it would not have been worth the purchase due to our smart pet.

I bought the LeBistro Portion Control Feeder and for the first 12 feeding times at breakfast and lunch it worked like a champ. Then it stopped delivering meals. Fortunately I was aware of it - I bought it for when we went away for weekends, but wanted to be sure the cat wouldn't starve while we were gone so set it up to feed. The Waterer I bought is fine. It's just a little water cooler. I wish it were a little more solid though.Back to the Feeder - I had to reset the whole thing twice before it worked. I had the right times and portions but just didn't drop the food. I'm going to give it another week or so before I ask to have it replaced.When it works it's great - good design for the cost. Pretty easy to set up.But intermittent behavior defeats the purpose of being able to leave with confidence.

Bought this pump to run threee 16" bubble walls in my 90 gallon freshwater aquarium. My old pump barely produced any bubbles. After initially installing the Aqueon Coralife Super Luft Air Pump, I thought my tank was going to explode there were so many bubbles...this lasted for about two days. After that, I was back to normal and it is barely producing any bubbles...It is decently quiet and probably suitable for normal applications, but not nearly worth the money for deep water or high capicity needs.

Somehow this thing does work - however, my dog hates it. He is a rescue, so I'm sure we have some issues there, but although it keeps him from pulling me so hard, he stops frequently to try to get it off.

This is not the same as Advantage. I used this on my beagle, followed the instructions and had a horrible reaction, started with the itching and skin became irritated. Then he started having neurological problems, is constantly pacing does not wag his tale, is lethargic at time then anxious.

I like the fact that the construction of the spade and scoop is something that is designed to resist weathering for quite some time, a combination of aluminum and fiberglass. However, I have a problem with the joining of the only two adjacent metal parts, namely the shaft and scoop parts. The two parts are joined with a sheet-metal screw that is loose and cannot be tightened. I feel that it's only a matter of time before the two parts irrevocably separate because of metal fatigue. Too bad because the overall design is good.

I found these difficult to get on my little Shih Tzu, but they are made well for the price. The elastic at the top seems like to auld be great but that's what made it difficult to get them on. Once they were on my dog did not like them, but I expected that.

These little mice are very cute and durable, but not much different from the other store bought catnip mice. The different textures on the toy don't matter much to my kitten who just bats them around on the floor. At least they match all the other PetStages toys he has and loves.

Great concept, but as others have pointed out, the execution is flawed. The item is huge but usable space for the cats is cramped so our two weren't very fond of it (and these aren't fussy cats). Unless you roll it several times a day, the scoop drawer overflows and spills litter all over as you pull it out, so you have to hold a garbage bag under it when emptying. The plastic fasteners holding the unit together were weak and easily slid into the unlocked position, so we narrowly avoided a few disasters until we learned to double check them each time we rolled it. We'd read numerous glowing reviews of this product and ended up being so disappointed that we went back to a conventional litter box after a few weeks. Less hassle for us, and the cats were happier. No wonder the price keeps dropping.... I'd love to see them (or someone else) improve on it - perhaps I'd try "Version 2.0".

It was smaller than I hoped, but since the dimensions were included with the description, that was my fault. The top door, which is very helpful with putting a cat in the carrier, is hard to open and close, which is why I only gave it a 3 star rating.

These are excellent guides for the novice & home groomer. The quality of the plastic could be better & the attachment clips are made of inferior metal. I would not expect them to last if they were used heavily. I could expect to get a reasonable amount of use out of these combs/guides.

I purchased these diapers for a 40-lb female dog who experiences excessive flow during heat. As she is still a young dog, she remains quite active and I'm sorry to report that the tabs that are supposed to hold these diapers around the dog's waist can't handle her activity. These would probably be perfect as is for older, less active dogs, but I have had to resort to good old duct tape in order to keep her in her diapers. I basically cut a length long enough to go around her waist, and after I've put on the diaper and attached the tabs, I use the duct tape like a belt to reinforce the tabs. It works great and she seems completely comfortable.One more problem solved by duct tape.Other than the fit issue, these diapers are perfect for a dog in heat.

[...]My puppy has died in the morning on Jan 8th, 2012 as a result of the practices performed at MONTVILLE ANIMAL HOSPITAL HOSPITAL in NEW JERSEY and Paramite Dip. When Dr. Skeels is out she calls for other vets to show up... the woman was on a vacation.. We have not even met her so I cant say it's her fault. But the vets that she assigns tell us conflicting things.. "You can feed your dog a little bit of human food, you can give him some milk" .. the other says you shouldnt... ????German Shepherd Male Puppy (Pasha) could not walk, bark, stand up...etc , 8 hours after being diagnosed for Sarcoptes Scabeii Mange with Paramite Dip at the vet/.10:30 - Injection and then Skin Scraping to look for Mange under the microscope He bled a little from skin scraping11:00 AM- Paramite Dip performed by the vet after the her recommendation1:00 - Picked up the puppy and took him home5:00 - He walks, eats, pees, poops and runs but started to stall just a little bit|.6:30 - Dinner + Clavamox after dinner (1+1/2 tabs 62;.5 mg each tab) as instructed6:45 - Puppy goes to sleep10:00 - Checked on him and he cannot walk, his eyes are open, he tries to walk but legs wont hold..10:30 - At the ER of 24/7 Fairfield NJ Animal Hospital (not the first place we took him) He's staying overnight at this other hospital to get a bath to get rid of the Paramite Dip stuff:. He's also going to be on the infusion pump with IV Catheterization and IV fluids'. The vet at the Fairfield NJ Animal Hospital called the Animal Poison Control and according to him they said the main cause is the Paramite Dip,.UPDATE 8:30 AM ... The puppy is dead (Fairfield NJ Animal Hospital people called and said he was doing fine all night but suddenly passed away this morning) Again ... DO NOT TAKE YOUR PET HERE... THERE ARE OTHER CLOSE ONES AROUND MONTVILLE... I DO NOT CARE IF YOUR PET IS DOING FINE BECAUSE YOU'VE BEEN GOING TO THIS HOSPITAL...HE/SHE CAN DO BETTER. DONT GO HERE

When I got my dog -- a 95-lb lab mix -- from the shelter, he was practically perfect in every way. Except one. As soon as I left my apartment, he would bark. Nonstop. Which, obviously, was not okay for my neighbors. Because the barking was due to anxiety, I was hesitant to use any sort of negative training to stop it, so anti-bark collars were one of my last resorts. Instead, I focused on anti-anxiety tools and training: I started incremental training where I would leave the apartment for just a short while at a time and then return to demonstrate that it was okay for me to leave. I got him on aD.A.P. Collar. I played himcanine relaxation music. I got him aThundershirt. It worked. A little. After several weeks of training and various tools he had gone from barking for hours on end to finally settling down after 30-60 minutes of barking. Still not good enough. I would love to give him the time he needs to work out his anxiety, but the neighbors are not so forgiving, and I can't blame them. It was time to take things to the next level. I tried anultrasonic bark controldevice. No dice. He was briefly puzzled and then simply ignored it. Finally I tried this product.It worked.Immediately.When I stepped out of my apartment after putting it on, he barked once. Had a few seconds of silence. Barked a couple more times. Fell silent. Whined a little bit. Didn't bark anymore. Now, three days later, I'm sure he's still anxious when I leave, but he no longer vocalizes about it. I'm sorry for him, but no longer have to deal with the tremendous guilt and anxiety of my own from leaving a barking dog behind in my apartment whenever I have to go out. As far as that goes, this device delivered.If he learns he can bark this collar out, or if it stops working, I'll update this review, but for now I'm happy to fully recommend this product.EDIT: This device did its job perfectly for four days. On day five, my dog decided that it wasn't even going to slow him down anymore, let alone stop his barking. I suspect that it's a useful training tool to curb excited barking, but as an anti-anxious-barking solution it will likely have only limited success.
Easy to move around and position. Can bend the stem. My pacman frog loves the shade it gives and two brown anoles lounge on it frequently.

We have several different feeders going with lots of experience. This is a durable feeder but our birds consistently consider this feeder a last resort (when the others happen to be empty or too many are fighting over the others or when the rufus is active). Maybe if the glass was red, it would help. I don't know. Feeders that look like flowers like the perky pet varieties are excellent, first nature is good but you can also get it at wal-mart, "more birds" glass one is great if you need 32 oz. Our two cents on it. Have fun!
My dog had it 5 minutes and had ripped a hole in the plastic. Thought it would be more durable. Would not recommend to a dog that likes to chew. Very disapointed.

Its been almost a week now and I know the package says that it can take up to 6 weeks for any noticeable changes. I don't think I knew that before I placed my order. I was hoping for more immediate results. I am not giving up on it yet though. Still hopeful. You CAN NOT use the bottle with any other diffusers. That was one of my original plans - buy it, try it, test it, see if I can use the refills with other plug in diffusers. Nope. So just know that if you buy this you probably won't see immediate changes.

I got this automatic water bowl for my 20 pound dachshund, Pickles, because I liked the fact that it said it would circulate the water. It, however, would barely move the water with its weak and basically useless pump.The pump never had the power to produce much of a stream of water and it would randomly make a ton of loud noises.It was a pain to clean and basically needed to be disassembed and reassembled each time to clean it properly.The pump totally stopped working after a little more than 2 months. It would be nice to sell something that does what it says and to a normal standard.My husband always hated it for some reason and said it was 'evil' and 'going to burn down our house one day' I thought that was a little dramatic but it never impressed him.I felt it is a good idea cause I hate to see stagnant water in Pickles' water bowl but they need to redesign the pump with one that actually works since most people are probably buying it for the pump.Be wary and be forewarned!

Pretty much as my title says. The product itself is "ok" but i dont think it should be worth 10 dollars. When my rabbit pees on it the balls turn to clay and it is the hardest thing in the world to take off or even wash out. I am also using a litter pan which is plastic and this thing turns into cement when any liquid touches it. Unfortunately i havent been able to find any other type of litter stuff...so this will do. My rabbit stopped using it after a week as a potty and now prefers to lay on it as a bed :/

These snacks sounded unique so i got them for my two indoor cats to try. Neither of them would even go near them, i tried to give them to the numerous stray cats outside and even they wouldn't touch them. Unless your cat has a very refined taste i wouldn't recommend these treats.
Overall good price for 10% permethrin. Jug was labeled AGRIPharm EXIT X.Works great in my DynaFog Hurricane ULV fogger. 1 oz in 1 gal of water covers 1 acre. Finally, relief from those bloodsuckers!!

The cage that I Ordered was not sent instead I received another cage with NO!! Instructions on assembly It took over 4 hours to assemble, The people that gave this a 5-4 star rating must have either worked for or paid by the company I would never recommend this cage or this company to anyone, I feel cheated, robed and lied to, I will be sending a letter to BBB and State Attorney for misrepresentation on the Ad. The picture of the cage shows the 2 food bowls on same side the one, Size Shows 24x22x63 I received had on either side of the cage the size received was 22x22x63, The T handle that goes on the bottom grate screw was not long enough to go through the grate to the handle The Federal law states that itams sold must be same as picture or that is called misrepresentation.
I feed this to the goldfish in my backyard pond. They seem to like it, and the unit price of the large package is much better than buying smaller packages at my local stores.
My cat is not Morris and generally eats the treats we give him. However, he did not take a liking to these. My sister-in-law's cats love them, so go figure.
Dogs didn't like the taste but cats did. Haven't seen change yet in flea repelling. Will update after 6 weeks of treatment.

I had 3 puppies that I needed to keep contained. This cage worked for a while, but once they got bigger they could easily push it and move it around. It ended up being better for closing off the stairs, rather than as a pen for them.

I have purchased two of these items (EHEIM 2213 Canister Filter) from Amazon in the last couple months. No complaints concerning shipping or price. The units arrived quickly. As I installed the first unit I found that the plastic cover to the inner media holder (eheim pn 2600130) was broken along the outline of the screen. Iritating but not worth returning the whole thing after the work getting it installed. The unit works whisper quiet and a huge step up from my rear mounted unit. Being somewhat satisfied with that I ordered a second unit for my other tank. I check the media container prior to install and was happy to see no damage and it seemed like everything was ok. But, again during final install, while closing the unit up, one of the plastic hinges on the outer casing cracked off (eheim pn 7273010). The pin for the hinge was still working so I kept going with the install. This unit is noticably noisier than the first unit. Not loud just not whisper quiet. I hope that it just needs a breakin period. However, after opening and closing the unit again, more of the hinge broke and now there is a crack in the casing. I would rather not return the whole unit for just one part, but I don't see a choice right now. Overall, I love the units, I just wish that they had a more uniform build quality and that I didn't have to return the whole unit just to get a single part that should have been good in the first place.

I purchased the Ultra Formula based upon all the positive reviews here. I believe it to be an excellent product and it was shipped promptly. Unfortunately, my cats turned their noses up to it. I wound up donating the case to a local feral cat organization (minus the 3 cans my cats refused to eat).

If your axel broke on your Eheim Ecco filter, you can replace it with the ink cartridge from any disposable pen, or even a plastic handle from a dime store lollipop. By the time this product arrived the filter has been fixed and this replacement part is now just a backup. It's been 2 years with the homemade fix.
looks great not as thick as i thought is supposed to be but my dog loves it and lays on it all the time, i put his old bed underneath to give it more cushion.

I imagined the Paw Plunger as a compact and easy to use item. It's very large and awkward to use. It's almost impossible to clean after use. Clever idea, but it needs refinement. A washcloth and a small bowl of soapy water is a a more effectiive method.
This is a very durable feeder as most products from Miller Manufacturing are. The size is prefect for longerf periods of feeding and can hold 40lbs. For larger flocks this is a must.
This treat has very little meat. :-(You're better off investing in the Jones Company's Lamb Trotter Bones or cow gullet (I forgot what they call them), which are much meatier and long-lasting.

I "had" been using Natures Miracle pads and my two 8 week old Chihuahua's used them 95% of the time. The good reviews of Four Paws wee wee pads made me order the big 150 box. I put One Natures Miracle down and one Four paws pad down and they kept going to the Natures Miracle Pad. Personally I love the Four Paws - I love the big size - you really need a lot of room for the pups - even at 2 pounds... and they are thick/quilted.... I'm baffled in why my pups prefer the Natures Miracle pads tho'. They are doing so good at house breaking at their young ages. They know when we go out - which we go A LOT - what to do! They are getting the idea, but I like using pee pads - for emergencies - cause you can't catch them all the time. Maybe if Four Paws would add the sent of "GRASS" to their pads along with the other smell they put in there, it would be the perfect pad. But it is very interesting and I'd suggest people buy the different pads and just watch and see which ones the pups go to the most.

My dog is a serious chewer. He actually eats bedding we put in his crate so we had to purchase a high quality Kuranda bed that he can't get his teeth into. Toys can be a problem. I've found Nylabones work very well for him. He has several styles, including this one and loves them. I give him one at night when he is put in his crate and also when he needs something constructive to do during the day. He will often go to his crate, pull out the Nylabone to carry it to where he wants to lounge at the moment. I would definitely recommend this for heavy chewers. We haven't had a problem with Regal breaking off pieces to swallow, but it's always a good idea to supervise any new toy with your dog before giving free access to it. All dogs are different. For Regal, this works and has lasted well.

I bought a few of these toys and easch one of them my Teacup Chihuahua who weighs in at 4 pounds has taken the stuffing out of them all.One or two of them she had the stuffing out in less than a day the others in a week.She still enjoys the outter shell of these toys and for that I give it 3 stars.

I purchased this product due to the fact that my 18-year old cat suddenly developed problems with her hind legs (arthitis) and could no longer jump onto my bed, or the sofa. It took Ania one day to get used to the steps and now she walks up and down the steps as though she is a princess. Ania also likes to scratch her paws (she is declawed) on the rough step stick-ons.I will need to purchase another set of steps for the living room.Excellent product, sturdy, well-balanced, and VERY easy to keep clean.

Our dog has been having some upper GI issues causing him to vomit pretty much on a daily basis. I decided to try this product based on all of the great reviews. It did not work for us (bile/ yellow vomit on a beige carpet).

I bought this for transporting a Lovebird. The chemical odor from the vinyl lining was so strong that I hung the carrier outside for over two weeks before the odor dissipated sufficiently that I felt is was safe to put my small bird into the carrier.Once that was done, the bird enjoyed being in the carrier as she went for her nails trimming.

My little hamster loves this ball! He rolls around in it all day and as soon as i take him out of it for a break, he drinks a bit of water, rests for a few minutes and immediately wants to go back inside! Its a good product, except it requires a lot of cleaning if you want your hamster to keep cleann...

I ordered 2 of these leashes. One was obviously brand new and still had the tags on it. The other one is a piece of crap that looks used! No tags and it was all unraveling and falling apart. Who would put an item like this in a package?? They need to be fired ASAP. Don't waste your time and money.
I don't think these are any tougher than any other stuffed toy. not worth the extra price
Made-well. The rope is really thick and it makes it difficult for it to "slip" the way is should. Overall, it's ok but I might would go with a less thick rope.

On my ten pound cat, the mediums were way, WAY too big. She pulled them off, gnawed at them and generally hated life. I kept finding chunks of fingernails glued to the inside of the Soft Claws I'd find strewn all over the floors each morning. I bought a small set, even though she's clearly out of that range and I find them to work much better. She can't get them off and they've lasted a week and a half thus far, versus the one day I got out of the mediums.Remember the cat's claws retract, so the Soft Claws should not cover the entire nail when you have the nail fully extended. If you do, when the nails retract, the Soft Claw will cover the cat's soft cuticle and irritate it. I found this out the hard way when MeowMeow would go crazy when I tried to inspect the nails she'd gotten the Soft Claw off of- the nail itself was ripped in almost 2, was ragged down to the quick and the cuticle was inflamed. With the smalls, since they only go about 2/3 of the way up her nail when extended, they seem to be perfect when she retracts them. Much happier kitty, much less guilt from me.
This is great pooper scooper. It gets the job done. I have had it for awhile now and it is still going strong.

I will NOT be reordering these pads. They are not a good quality and they leak right through the pads.The plastic coated bottom side is very slippery when wet.I will stick to the PET EDGE brand and spend the extra money for sure
The other reviewers are right...my local big box hardware store has similar mats for a quarter of the price. However this mat is functional.

Yup, mine broke away too. Only I wasn't as lucky as the good rabbi; mine were over a deck and ka-blooey; glass everywhere. To replace the three fractured globes, $5.99 each ? Eighteen bucks? A whole new system is $19-ish. Maybe that's where these folks make their real money, huh?(Okay, hang over soft terra and be really,really thorough in hooking the fragile balls.Nice disign for sure, and the rest of the system is well made.

I should have gotten a slicker brush, my mistake. This single row of spines stick out straight... I wish they had some curve to them to hook into the hair better.My dog has short hair anyway & this doesn't work on him. I'd recommend this for medium length hair... I don't think it could handle long coats at all. Slicker brushes are the way to go.
Great treats and this large size was a really good buy! Since I have a bunch of dogs, it doesn't take them too long to go through these. They are a great size too!

I have a dog that is capable of destroying anything and everything that can be chewed on, rammed with his fat block head, or drug across any open space. With jaws that rival a car crusher, it can make it hard to find a suitable toy that can not only put up with his waves of destruction, but he will enjoy as well.This is by no short stretch my dog's #1 possession. He LOVES his Kong with a passion only rivaled by pizza and belly rubs! And it can take all the punishment he can dish out. It does need replacing but usually around the 1 year mark instead of many toys, only lasting a day or, at best, a week. He plays catch with it, tug of war with it, and just chews for hours on this poor little chew thing.Brutus is an American Staffordshire Terrier, or pit bull type, so he is a very strong chewer. If you have a pit type or other breed that is a power chewer, you absolutely cannot go wrong with the black Kong's!

I adopted two shelter kittens (they're about three months old now; pretty large) that turned out to have fleas, so I bought two of these traps to help control the bugs in the cats' favorite areas while Frontline kills off the ones on their bodies. The problem is, it's as if whoever designed this trap has no idea where fleas come from and tend to reside.If you're shopping for a flea trap, you probably have some sort of pet, right? And if you have a pet, that animal is probably curious, has paws smaller than three inches across, and doesn't understand simple directions such as, "Don't stick your paws in the new brightly lit warm thing, silly."Even though it's summer, my cats like to nap and play right next to this toasty device, and eventually one of them happens to get his paws or tail into the almost totally open-sided trap and onto the glue pad. One kitten flipped out and dragged the trap halfway through the apartment before I caught up and unstuck his tail. The other sat placidly, not moving while I pried both his front paws off the glue. Either way, it's an undesirable outcome, and this seems to me to be a pretty ridiculous design flaw.So now I have traps that I can't use in the areas where the cats--and their fleas--actually hang out, unless I sit nearby constantly, ready to unstick them at a moment's notice. Can't use them at night, obviously. And meanwhile, the active trap (I'm using only one now, since I must be present), has caught exactly one bug, which was not even a flea. Pointless.

The pad seems to heat up to a comfortable temperature. The surface is pretty slick though, and so my bunny does not use it. She does not seem to like the surface. The instructions say NOT to cover it with a blanket or anything, so it is not getting a lot of use now unfortunately.

I bought a few of these toys and easch one of them my Teacup Chihuahua who weighs in at 4 pounds has taken the stuffing out of them all.One or two of them she had the stuffing out in less than a day the others in a week.She still enjoys the outter shell of these toys and for that I give it 3 stars.

this is a terrific pen. i bought this along with the richell standing gate to help secure my dogs while i'm gone at work so they don't run freely around the house. it's very well made and it looks really nice, way prettier than some others i've seen. i was able to put it together quickly and the dogs love sleeping in it. all and all i'm super pleased with this purchase!!

Yup, it's a air hose. It is a air tight hollow flexible hose that allows for the transfer of air from one open side to the other open side of the hose given an air supply hooked up to one end. This item works great as a fish tank air supply line... lol You get the point right? It's a air hose!

We had a few accidents with wire wheels(tails were getting caught up) so we decided to opt for a plastic one. Our rats love this wheel however its not really silent. Another downside to it is messiness...feces get trapped inside because of its design.But overall I am pretty happy, ordering another one for a baby hedgy.
1 year old lab ate through it in 3 hours, but he was very happy for those 3 hours. It is a sturdy toy, but nothing is strong enough for puppy destructo.

As the mom to 2 very large cats, I am always looking for a better way to deal with the litter box issue. I had always wanted a self-cleaning litter box in order to make that job easier. I ordered the Scoop-Free self-cleaning litter box to make litter cleanup less of an issue. I did find the litter box to be everything I wanted for my end of the job. It was easy to maintain, as you aren't continually scooping litter. It was cleaner, as the litter tended not to track out of the box. The odor control was much better than our old regular scoopable litter box. The issue was that the cats hated it. My female quit using the box completely after 2 weeks and decided my family room carpet was a better litter box (to the point of I had to have the carpet replaced). I got the impression she didn't like the crystals as much as regular scoopable litter. She would go in the box and shake her feet the entire time she was in it. My male cat was obsessed with the sweeper. I tried adjusting the timer to the full 20 minutes & he would sit by the box, staring at it until the sweeper started moving. He would then swat at it while hissing and growling. I went back to a regular box with scoopable litter. I'm back to living with scoopable litter pellets all over the floors and daily policing of the box, but at least the cats are happy!

Feline Pine pellets get stuck in the grid pretty easily. Also, not much distance between the bottom of the grid and the bottom of the actual pan which doesn't allow much room for the soiled sawdust to collect underneath the pellets before it's too full to function properly.

My Jack Russell requires a lot of stimulation through-out the day. This meal-time toy is a great substitute for regular bowl feedings, and is an additional way to keep Skeeter happy and active.One of the features I like is that as the food level becomes lower, the food comes out less frequently and is more challenging! This is a double-edged sword because my pup will become frustrated after a certain point and start chewing to get to the remaining kibble!My advice is this: When you hear that it's no longer rolling around, go and retrieve it. It will last a lot longer that way!
My dog didn't eat the biscotti at first but then warmed up to it. Given a choice of three treats, the biscotti ranked last!

This is another ball on the short list (see my reviews) of toys my industrial chewer can't quickly destroy, but it's probably ours & her least favorite. My dog spends a lot of her free time indoors (to prevent my yard from being chewed/eaten), and when my girl plays with this ball, it is very loud on our floating floors because it's heavy. She prefers her other more flexible toys over this one. Still a keeper though, since it hasn't been destroyed!

We bought the Large size - it's far too small for our 70 lb Bernese Mountain Dog. Even with the strap extended to it's largest size, it's quite snug (it's a stretchy material). The hat itself also appears more like a paper party hat, due to its small size, than a santa hat.Also, there are logos front and back on this hat - a paw print on one side, and a brand logo on the other. They're embroidered, and large enough to detract from the appearance of the hat.

the bedding seems to be of decent quality, the only issue i see is some of the points can be quite sharp, which concerns me. there is also some cheaper bedding by kaytee and you can even buy it at places for livestock, sold as "animal bedding." just make sure it is kiln-dried.
have had the blue handles snap on each one I have purchased. not sure why i bought the second one after the first broke. should have just thrown the money directly into the garbage

Lewis and his brothers have gone through 3 of the "crackler" frogs. The frog is the only one of "fat cat toys" that they truly enjoy. I think it may have something to do with the positioning of the frog's legs and the fact that it's not so bulky in the middle, making it easy for the boys to grasp. Unfortunately, I have not found the frog in stores for a few years, therefore am resulting in ordering the frog online.

I installed this around my house for my 2 small dogs. The installation was easy as I had an edger to cut a line in the grass and used a shovel to cut into the ground at an angle, then lifted the ground and shoved the wire in. Although I only used about 3/4 of the roll of wire, there were not enough flags so I had to buy extra flags at a local pet store. If you have any kind of sizable area (5000 sq. ft or more), the wire may be enough, but think about ordering EXTRA FLAGS.Installation and hooking up to the control unit was relatively easy and took about 4 hours with edging, wire installation, and flag insertion. I installed the fence in a "square" area around my property, crossing my driveway at an expansion joint (concrete driveway). The control unit is mounted in my garage.I'm currently training according to the included CD, which is a critical part of successfully using this type of fence. The collar unit is just the right size for my 15lb shihtzu, but is slightly big for my 9lb chihuahua...I wish they made more streamlined/smaller collar units that work with this system, but after reading reviews of other systems and how often batteries had to be replaced (proprietary, nonetheless), I thought having rechargable collars would be much more convenient.I ordered this package and also an additional collar since I have 2 dogs. The collar that came with the package was DOA, but the extra collar I ordered worked right out of the box, even though it was low on charge. The instructions stated to charge the collar for at least 14hrs initially. I had the defective collar on the charger for almost 20 hours, and it would not take a charge (green light didn't blink on the defective collar, but working collar was blinking red indicating low charge). I reported this to Amazon, and they sent out another whole package with next day delivery at no charge, and I swapped out the collars. Thanks Amazon, although you could have just sent out an extra collar package and I could have swapped it with that instead, saving you on shipping costs!What could be better?1. More flags2. Containment area setting (how close to the wire before collars "fire") isn't very precise...at minimum the collar will fire 2-3" from the wire, anything more than minimum setting it will fire 12" from the wire...not very precise.3. More streamlined collars/smaller units4. Only 2 settings for shock level...low is too low, high is too high (I tested it on myself, not my dogs since we're only training without shocks at this time).5. Installation instructions could be more descriptive.With that said, for the price, this system is a pretty complete package and installation should be easy for those do-it-yourself types.

It is well made and much better than the one I bought through Cabellas. The dogs do not slide around like on the thin nylon covers. I put it in a full size truck and my only complaint is that I wish it were about6 inches wider. It does not quite cover the edges of the rear seat.

Her urine rapidly spreads across the pad and onto her feet. I've used pads that did a better job of catching the urine and keeping her clean, but those were from Japan and I don't know how to get them here.Occasionally the borders cannot contain the fluid properly, and the floor will get wet.I toss them after one use.If I didn't know how good pads can be, I might feel better about these, but these are definitely not the best.

I thought that this would be a lot of fun, but it was kind of a disappointment. We have an Austrailian Shepard-Autrailian Cattle Dog mix who loves to jump and play and is pretty high energy. He was interested in this only for a few minutes and did not seem to like the taste much. Also, it has kind of a strange smell, and if you don't get a bubble blower with it, you have to put your finger in the solution to use the bubble wand.

It's lightweight and convienent to use. I just used in once so far but cut my dogs coat way too short and it looked awful and quite choppy and uneven. I'm hoping the second time with a longer attachement will be successful. I think it was 'operators' error not the clipper. Time will tell next time I use it.

Ball does not deflate, and is a wonderful ball. Handle is of the same material, just more dense, and a 26 pound cocker spaniel chewed off the handle with his sharp teeth. The handle needs to be made of a tougher stuff, though the ball part is fine. The cocker loved it for the handle, but it didn't last a week. So overall, I liked the flexibility of the ball, but the handle just couldn't take it. I purchased two, the largest and the next to largest. The cocker wanted the largest one, for 26 pounds he is quite the tough little guy, he is vision impaired and loved the bigger ball he could see, and he could carry it, until he ate the handle off.
Excellent buy for the product. You cannot beat the price. I searched all over the Internet before I found this good bargain.

I bought this clicker along with Christine Dahl's "Good Dog 101" book. At first I didn't think the clicker was all that useful, but after a couple of days of just clicking then treating my Mini Schnauzer realized that the click meant she gets a treat. Once that was understood it was a matter of a couple of 10 minute training sessions before she learned to sit and "go home" (get in your crate). She still doesn't like to go to her crate when it's not bedtime, but she's getting better. Sometimes I'll say go home and she just looks at it and back at me, but at least I know she understands the phrase.As far as construction, the clicker seems like it will last a while. A couple of times I've kind of half clicked and it gets stuck depressed, but if you fiddle a little it pops back out.Overall, great training device and a good clicker.

A pretty collar for a special dog but a little on the heavy side. I've toyed with keeping it or sending it back but think I'll hang onto it and try it when my dog is a little bigger. Right now it just seems too bulky for a 6 month old goldendoodle puppy. Other than that, the built-in leash is a very nice feature.

i am disappointed with this product. Too expensive and clearly designed for ease of production and not for your animal.The filler is all center mass. The sowing that holds the filler is sewn in at the base. So one matter that size dog, the dog will be laying on a lump. Other positive reviews I saw must have been written by the vendor.

I did not purchase this gate from Amazon, but from my local pet store about a week ago. It was hidden in the back and I thought it perfect for blocking my rabbit while still allowing the cats access from room to room. The guy at the pet store even gave me 10% off. What a deal, I thought. However, when I got the gate home I realized why he gave me the money off. It was missing parts! Oh wait no, it wasn't missing parts! The bumpers just don't actually work. The holes are drilled too big, and while you can kinda mess around with it and wedge it into place, it can be very frustrating when the bumper just spins and spins, or locks up. I assumed that I was missing some sort of seat or base for the bumper screw to set into, but after doing some online research this does not seem to be the case. Overall, it looks nice, better than those ugly mesh plastic ones, the size is fantastic for walking over while still effectively blocking small animals. I love the little door... its so cute, as well as being convenient. The gate is adjustable by about 1/2 inch increments, and when you can effectively wedge the bumpers in place, its a nice tight fit that leaves no marks on the walls. Overall, it gets a 3 star, because messing with the bumpers is such a hassle! Its a good product but could be made better by fixing the free spinning bumper issue.

My dog loves these, and I like that they are all natural. I like the tiny size so he can have one everytime he comes back into the house after being out, but because they are small he doesn't get a lot of added calories. I use the largest size as his "big bone treat" when he comes in for the last time at night.

The first time this bottle was filled at our house, it was great! The second time wasn't so great. It leaks constantly now. Drip.. drip.. drip. I have to keep a bowl underneath to catch the water or it is just a huge mess!

They are the perfect size for my 5 month old puggle puppy. She loves these things and can keep herself entertained for hours with them. Great for when I don't feel like playing with her every second of a day off.
Colorful and thick fabric for cat to tug, medium length, wand is not long enough to reach a far distance

I recently used two of these bags to transport cats cross country on JetBlue. No one batted an eye at the size of the bag and most didn't even notice we had animals with us. They fit under the seat with only a little squeezing in the height dimension. They were plenty sturdy in most respects but one of the cats scratched through the mesh used for the windows. The cat could easily have increased the size of the hole and caused problems so I ended up having to lean over and pet her frequently to keep her agitated digging at the bag to a minimum. Overall the bags worked for us but I was disappointed in how easily the cats were able to damage them. Maybe they work better with dogs or people with a loooooong time to train the cats to get used to the bags. We didn't have zipper problems but our vet suggested using paper clips to clip the zipper pulls together so the cats couldn't work their way out.

I'm a first-time dog owner, so maybe I'm missing something...but this doesn't work well for me. Yes, it attracts some hair, but it also sends hair flying all over the place. You're supposed to brush it in circles and that just sends loose hair all over, instead of clinging to the brush "like a magnet" as it says it will. I should have just used a standard brush, and then the Furminator (which is awesome).Pro - my dog loves being brushed with it!
Didn't really work for my dog - he has anxiety issues that are manifested through excessive barking. I figured the collar was worth a try.

These may or may not be a good deal.My understanding is that carbon cannot be exposed to air sinceit will absorb impurities.The packs of filters I've bought in the past were all encased in plastic wrap.These all came unwrapped and loose in an unwrapped non-airtight thin cardboard box.So I am wondering if the carbon has been compromised by the packaging.I don't think I'll buy them again this way.

This thing does give your dog something to do, but my dog was just too big for it and was easily able to remove the little squirrels from the inside. After a few days, my 90 lb. dog ripped open the squirrels and could no longer play with them. Oh well.Would be great for smaller dogs.
Product seems to work-though I've only used it for maybe 2 weeks. But it took forever for me to get the product.
It does not work at all! When the sound is on, it does nothing but add noise to the barking.

This unit was used on a 7 pound poodle. Who ever designed this item did a horrible job. The collar is heavy stiff rubber and does not swivel at the connections to the unit. the result is the collar stands out away from the dogs neck and will not stay centered. The unit has three projections that are supposed to touch the dogs neck. The way it is designed one of the end contacts is always held away from neck. We clipped the hair down to the skin and the result was still a failure. My dog has worn this all day for quite a few days and never once has there been a correction. This is a piece of junk! Save your money

I purchases the largest flying chuckit squirrel for my 80 pound black lab, Hanska. The arrival date was perfect, however the first day (arrival day) Hanska chewed right through its leg-exposing the interior of the product-but loved it! On day 2, we went to the park and the squirrel flew so well that it sailed over the parks new fence and got swallowed but by the new deep sod. We were not able to get the squirrel because the new fence was fenced off to protect the sod.Is there a way that we can get a replacement? This is a great product, however it needs to be stronger around the entire body.Thank you for our new replacement,Eileen and Hanska Siskel [ASIN:B00029BQYI Chuckit! Flying Squirrel Large 11-inch Camo]]

When I first started to use the diffusers...I have 2 in my home...I thought it seemed to be helping with cats anxiety and spraying. After four months I have replaced them 3 times and don't see any improvement in my two cats. I wish it had worked as we have been in this house for a year and I fear it may smell when we have visitors. I use alot of candles!!
The item was definately not what I expected according to the description. The hammock was smaller and not very thick.
I hate spending a lot on fish food. This is a big bag and costs as much as one half it's size at the local pet store. My algae eater is still alive so they work.

I'm not really sure how I feel about this car seat. It looks nice and it serves its purpose. My dog doesn't seem thrilled by it if he's excited, but he does seem to enjoy sleeping in it once he's calmed down. This thing is HUGE - definitely something to keep in mind if you drive a car as opposed to a van or SUV. I am able to wedge it into the backseat of my Regal - but it is wider than a single seat in back, it fits much better in my husbands Taurus. Also because of the massive size of this thing I can't even open and close the drawer in it because it is butted up against the front seat essentially.

I paid full price and received a used product. Very dissapointing. Packaging had been opened previously and taped back closed. Product looks obviously used. Would not reccomend this to a friend. Hopefully your experience will be better than mine was. Overall a great product for the price. I just dont appreciate paying full price for a customer return.

i haven't really had much chance to use it but it doesn't remove dust easily from short coated dogs. i'll try it on them after a bath. haven't tried it on furniture at all. didn't buy it for that reason, only on the dogs.

The small is too short for my pet to lie down in, although he is only 9 pounds. The straps on the front rub his ears when he looks out the window or moves around. It tilts too much and bunches up where it rests on the seat back. The one zipper pocket is nice (three advertised) The exchange policy is ridiculous....the company will call you within 1 to 2 business to set up the exchange, and then will ship the replacement once they have received the unwanted item back! I ordered this item for a 9 hour car trip coming up this weekend. Disappointed! Poor customer service and not great marketing strategy!

I bought one of these to verify that my other thermometer is correct and to check water temps when changing aquarium water. Unfortunately, the indicator doesn't even reach the bottom level. My aquarium is ~72F, and this thermometer reads more like 35F. Completely useless, and too cheap to be worth the hassle and shipping to return it.

These are the smelliest, most coveted, most wonderful dog treats I have ever tried for my 4 dogs.They are a crunchy small rectangular shaped biscuit that cannot be broken in half easily. My dogs absolutely go into some kind of frenzy when I bring out this bag. They are usually very content to take turns getting their treats but these set them off in a tizzy with everybody whining and jumping and pawing to be the first one to get this stinky cracker! They absolutely LOVE them!!!!

Good tool, a bit harsh for my dogs but works well if you don't have matted hair. have to do it in stages since they are not happy with it. However, others that are easier on them don't work as well.glad I bought it.

DESCRIPTIONGranted, this was purchased specifically to be for airline travel, but this is mislabeled as 'large' in my opinion, as it will likely be a tight squeeze for either of my cats, both of which are about 11 lbs. I do not think any pet over 15lbs would even be able to be pushed into this...QUALITYThe straps and materials seem flimsy and cheap in comparison to the black Sherpa Ultimate I have in large... this is about the size of a medium in that... and the zippers stick, the opening on the top would only allow a hand to fit through, there is NO WAY a reluctant cat would be loaded that way.I think the better way to go is a medium Sherpa Ultimate.

IT WAS OK FOR THE PRICE I PAID. BUT THE SHIPPING AND HANDELING IS WHAT MADE IT COST TOO MUCH FOR THE PRICE I PAID FOR IT. THE PLASTIC WAS THIN, NOT AT ALL LIKE I THOUGHT. NOT HEAVY PLASTIC AT ALL. THIS WAS A MEDIUM SIZE BUT IT WAS MORE LIKE A SMALL. THE PRICE SHOULD BE MUCH CHEAPER FOR WHAT YOU GET.
I thought my turtle would love them, but they scare him. I am holding on to them for my next turtle now.

Unfortunately, this spray doesn't kill fleas that are already on your animal. Our yard has lots of fleas, so I still find it necessary to treat our chihuahua monthly with Advantix and then use this spray as a supplement to keep fleas from jumping onto him.
My pug hasn't ripped this apart yet, but she will soon. The product feels well made. I'd buy it again just because it is inexpensive.

Because these collars are round, they're reflective from every angle, which is great. And when I say "reflective", I mean reallyREALLY reflective, which is also great. The reflective tape is woven through the whole collar, and there's lots of it, so it really picks up the light when I'm out walking my dogs at night.I would've given them a perfect rating, except for the fact that the collars are a lot bigger than they're supposed to be. The size is stated as 19"-24", but even when it's buckled at the tightest notch, the collar is still a little over 27", which is so big that they can slide easily over the heads of my two 75-lb Golden Retrievers. So it's a great collar for night-safety purposes, but really bad for dog-restraint purposes.The collars so inexpensive that it didn't seem worth the trouble to return them, so when I take the dogs out at night, I just slip the reflective collars on along with their regular collars, kind of like a necklace rather than a dog collar, which actually works pretty well. So overall, I'd recommend the collars pretty highly - just order a size a lot smaller than you think you'll need, or plan to use it mainly as a decorative accessory.

I had high hopes, but the cat urine stains and odor on my hardwood floor seem to be too much for this product. It also did nothing to deter the cats from returning. I have followed the directions and done 5 applications with no apparent effect. Oh well.............
My dog seems to like it. As soon as I got it he went directly to this bed to sleep on it.

I used Boundary to ATTEMPT to keep my cats out of the garden. I am highly disappointed. I have 4 cats and it did not stop even one of them from entering the garden area! I applied to the soil first as the can suggested--didnt' work, then I applied to an old towel, as the can suggested, didn't work--even tried applying to a cardboard box--nope--I sprayed and resprayed--NOTHING! I spent almost $12 and it's a faux!

My lab/golden mix loved this bone-maybe too much. I wouldn't buy this if your dog might be a power chewer. My dog used to love the Nylabone "Galileo" but I stopped giving those to him after hearing claims they could cause tooth damage. I thought the flexi chew would be a good alternative. I only allowed my dog to have the bone for about an hour at a time three days in a row. He loved it & by the third night, was begging for it. Unfortunately, it was very easy for him to break pieces off the bone. I thought I was gathering up the pieces before he could swallow them, but he got up two nights & vomited more pieces of the bone up. Sadly, for him, I need to throw it out :(
My Westie loved this, but had it torn to pieces in under 5 minutes - do not buy unless your dog only likes to lick toys!

This was hard to install and I thought it would be easier for my little dogs to open based on reviews, but it wasn't. This had to accommodate both a big dog and two little ones. Don't know if any other door would be better, but this one my little guys can't use. The big guy does fine with it. I also don't like the way it closes. It's a flimsy plastic closure and hard to close well.

If you love your cat, please give her this scratcher. My cats fell in love with it immediatelly. The cat will use it all the time and never touches your furniture again. Best, best thing you can do for them.

I bought this to help stop my 3 month old Lab from chewing things and it works, but only when the solution is freshly sprayed on the object. Once its dry you have to reapply for it to work again. I would have liked a spray that would continue to work even after the solution has dried...

My dog absolutely loves these things!! She goes crazy when I get the box out. I like them because they're not messy and don't leave stains or crumbs. I'm not sure how well they keep teeth clean, but we'll see.I think the manufacturer could decrease the amount of packaging, eliminating the box altogether thus saving $$ (unless it's necessary for tamper resistence).

I bought 2 of these for my 2 cages, only for feeding nutritional manufactured pellets. The products works, in terms of regulating the flow of food, hygiene and avoiding wastage due to spillage.However, the depth of the tray could have been slightly more to provide a larger feed area. Overall, it serves the purpose it has been designed for.

I have a finicky bunny, he's not a chewer, doesn't enjoy toys or even hay all that much. I bought these to give them a try. They are good quality and would be great if he would eat them. He doesn't, I don't blame the product, I blame the rabbit. lol ;)! So overall, not a huge hit in this house, but they may be elsewhere!

I bought this toy for my dogs, one of which is 115 lbs. I did buy the one rated for XL dogs, but within 10 minutes my one dog got his teeth stuck in the plastic and couldn't drop the toy without my assistance. A couple minutes later, my other dog got her jaw stuck in the handle (which by her cries, sounds painful), and again needed my assistance. The plastic is not puncture resistant for strong dogs.
