I often use two to clean the box. My cat is around 14 pounds, and emits 2 #1 and 1 #2 and these bags are just a skoch on the small side.The bags in the 315-count size measure 3.6x2.6x9.5 which is about 20% larger, I'll go with these the next time.

My 5 month old kitten used it for about 2 weeks until i went back to a regular litter box. Made my whole 2 bedroom apartment smell like doo doo. Cat started urinating on everything else in the apartment except where she was supposed to. Switched back to using a regular litter box and everything is perfect again. Getting rid of this $100 piece of garbage asap.

I thoroughly researched adjustable feeding bowls for my dog. This bowl's description led me to believe it had a range from 8" - 12" However, the options are 8" or 12" inches. 8" is too low and 12" is too high. Therefor, I had to get creative and put it at my desired height between the two using screws to hold it in place. Wish I had bought a different product.

I scoop up buried treasures from my two cats everyday. This scoop is a great tool with two different sized mesh screens for sifting, a metal scraper edge, and a nice long handle with a comfortable grip.The only problem is, the handle broke off after about 10 months use. Still, it's a a great scooper and I'm going to buy a replacement until I find something better. Hopefully before 10 months!

My in-laws had a bad experience trying to get one that worked properly. For this price it should WORK and sing and dance too.OLDER CATS FEAR this box due to NOISE when it "cleans"~ therefore avoiding the BOX... Yep, you guessed it. Floor clean up time. SAVE YOUR MONEY, indoor cats MEANS cleaning kitty litter.

I have a large female Boxer & this collar did not deter her from running into my living room with muddy paws. She just charges right through the barrier zone with minimal correction as the corrections progress from a beep, to a mild then a stronger correction. She only feels the strongest corrections which she has to be within range for at least a minute in order for them to occur. So as far as using it as a doorway barrier to a room it does not work. She just sprints on through with no penalty.In another situation it did work well. She likes to charge & repeatedly ram into my back door. I set the sensor in between the back door & the screen door & it worked like a charm. Because it was inside the door & therefore making the door a shock zone she did not once come near that door & spent a good part of the day outside enjoying the beautiful spring weather!On another note because Boxers have sensitive skin she had a pretty bad allergic reaction to the collar after only wearing it loosely around her neck for about 4 hours. So keep an eye on the contact points & watch for any adverse reactions.
have to cut in half he is a pekingese good for a larger breed dog.we need a little pill

I have this product for my cat. He has normal cat fur. not long, and only semi thick. Like mink fur. It does take our mounds of hair...But it can go to far.Cat's inner coat is like the fleace in a rain jacket. It keeps them warm! I brushed my cat for 2 min in the same spot, and saw all the hair, but when I looked at the coat compared to the non brushed side I was shocked! The inner hairs where all gone and left with only gard hairs! IE same as just a plain plastic raincoat! Brrrrr! Now he doesn't want to go outside (outdoor indoor) even though our climate is mild. He notices the diffrence when this last winter he was A-OK with the 2 feet of snow. I'm glad it grows back, but don't spend to much time in the same area!I'm not using mine again! Poor kitty. He looks thinner and his coat is way less shiny than it use to be. I'm ok with a little bit of cat hair. Just let it fall out naturally. It releases oils for thier coat when it does.
My pup LOVES this ball - when it works. We bought 5!! Sadly only 1 is working now. The one that works broke open and cannot be used. Disappointed.

The cable is just fine and its a hard to find length, however, the eye-bolts provided with this set both snapped *As I was screwing them into 4x4 southern yellow pine posts that were fairly weathered*. The spring also doesn't look like it would handle any real tug by our 70 lb. hound.This is what happens when a company doesn't have the ethical backbone to spend 50 cents extra for decent steel and hardware to ensure your dog doesn't break loose and run off.Do not buy this product. Buy coated cable and go to the local hardware store and buy decent hardware and do it yourself, its pretty easy.

While the bed is very large and fluffy to start with, after a couple of months it becomes very lumpy and will no longer go back to its original shape. The outer cover easily comes off for washing, however the inner mesh (that holds the stuffing) does not come off nor is it water proof/resistant. The inner mesh is also very flimsy and you will tear it taking the cover off and on. All in all the bed is good but has a lot of room for improvement before its worth the price.
Finally found a filter to keep the water clean and not cloudy! Deinately a good buy. And the filters are cheap too

I have had several algae scrapers through the years and this is far and away the worst. What makes or brakes these scrapers is the head that holds the straight blade. This scraper does not properly hold the blade which results in the blade often times getting covered or so loose that you can't scrape anything but the very thinnest of films off of your tank. If you are thinking of buying a scraper..... buy a different one.

I had not heard of Lupine collars until I rescued a dog last year and she came with one, I changed the collar to a brand new one that I picked up from a local pet store and a couple weeks later my dog started having a reaction to the collar and had these unsightly hives on her skin. I took her to the vet and after about $300 later I found out she'sreally sensitive and the Lupine collars are the only ones that she doesn't have a reaction to. In addition to this, I don't know any other company that offers a lifetime warranty even if the product is chewed! The collars are made extremely well, not cheap at all! and I honestly don't think I would ever have to use their warranty for anything other than my dogs chewing it.

Mrs. Spudman picked up a bag of this canine treat because it was on sale. I don't think Beggin Strips are much of a deal at any price. Just read the list of ingredients. It's a wheat/corn product with a little bit of bacon and cheese far down on the ingredient list. There was a time when most of the dog treat products were of this low caliber. Today there are far better choices with more wholesome ingredients and even real meat listed first.Beggin Treats are soft and easy to break into small pieces. Our dogs do seem to enjoy this offering, but in the world of dog snacks, this one resides near the bottom of my list, a treat I wouldn't consider no matter the price.

After reading such glowing reviews as "best toy ever" I decided to give this a shot. My large dog needs sturdy toys, and this one does NOT fill the bill. About five minutes after removing this from the package to play tug with it, pieces started falling off. Not a good start. The toy is large but not durable, and not worth the money.

This collar is next to impossible to use. The clips are extremely difficult to attach/detach and I returned mine. Vet One makes a much better easier to use collar and I will go back to that brand.Buyer Beware!

I have read a few reviews on this item and I have to chime in.First of all, if you can't handle noisy toys, this ball might not be for you (Then again, if you can't handle nosie around the house, why do you have a dog anyway? Buy a goldfish.).If, however, your goal is provide your puppy with a toy that will delight him or her for hours and hours on end, then this ball IS for you. The babble ball speaks crazy little phrases when agitated. "Hello, puppy!" "What you doing?" "Hot Diggity Dog" etc. My Cairn Terrier loves to put one of her stuffed animals in her mouth and bat the babble ball around my living room. She paws at it (like a cat!) when it gets stuck behind something and she cries if she loses it under the couch.She is SO in love with it that she's worn out EIGHT of these balls (over the last two years) and is on her ninth.During the winter, she doesn't get as much outdoor exercise and this ball has been a great way for her to play indoors. We play fetch when I have time and when I don't, she plays with it on her own.It's fantastic.BTW - My parents bought one for their dog too (mini schnauzer) and she LOVES it as well.Your dog will thoroughly enjoy this toy. It's been my dog's favorite for YEARS now.

Having a digital lcd readout of temperature that is quickly viewable is very nice. As for the accuracy, after some testing I am fairly confident that my unit is within a degree of accuracy. I saw a comment from someone else that is very true and amusing: "If you have only one thermometer you know exactly what the temperature is. If you have more than one thermometer, then not so sure". My previous stick-on strip thermometer (on my 75 gal tank) was reading 78 degrees and the dial on my heater said it was set to 79 degrees. When I installed this new thermometer it registered 83 degrees! I thought that this unit was faulty. I then did some experimenting. Using a digital cooking thermometer and also a digital thermometer for outside reading, I found that these were reading 82 and 83 degrees. I then placed the probes in ice water and saw that they all read close to 32 degrees (the coralife read 32.8). This latter test is not conclusive as to the accuracy in the 80 degree range since the linearity of the device is not known, however it does provide additional credibility to its accuracy. So why the discrepancy between the stick-on strip and the digital thermometers? The stick-on strip is on the outside of the tank. From what I have read, there should not be much of a temperature gradient from the liquid on the inside and the outside, but I have not researched this enough to know exactly what the difference would be. (I need to dust off my old thermodynamics book from college!). I suspect on smaller tanks with thinner glass, this temperature gradient is much less and therefore the reading more accurate. Maybe with the larger tanks and thicker glass, these become less accurate. Not sure, however I feel fairly confident that this new unit is reasonably accurate and my tank inhabitants are thanking me fo it.
It is a nice cover but the zipper doesn't work that great and it's hard to close.

I'm very pleased with this product. I was expecting at least a hint of a fishy odor, but I smell absolutley nothing. I used to have to put some canned food on my dog's dry food in order for him to eat it, but a couple pumps of this and he gobbles up the entire bowl. Canned food is mostly moisture anyway and a waste of money. No need for it now.I'm very impressed with the amount of Omega-3's per serving. Based on 2.5 pumps (for a 25 lb. dog), it has a total of 1319mg Omega-3 fatty acids. 500mg DHA, and 455mg EPA (the good stuff). That's more than most human fish oil supplements per serving. I'd been giving him cheap fish oil pills for human consumption but this seems to be a superior product that will last quite a while based on 2.5 pumps per day.

we have about thirty of these, the biggest problem weve found is the rubber seal at the end of the float arm dosent last very long. we have ground the plastic seat flat (instead of sharply cone shapped like they are made.this seems to help seal better and lasts longer. a new design of this plastic seat should be looked into by the manufactor-but then they probably wouldnt sell as many replacement parts?

I recently purchased thePetSafe Deluxe Pet Panel Panels for Sliding Glass Doors 93-96" Tall, Medium, Whitefor my dog so she could go in and out on here own. It is a great product but it is quite a project to install. Not easy unless you are really handy. Had to drill into the existing door to install properly...One screw was already stripped when I received it.Dog loves it but be prepared.

The original Pad that came with the Turbo Scratcher was loaded with catnip which attracted the cats and made the whole purchase worthwhile. It is a great cat toy. BUT, Upon purchasing the replacement pads here, there was no packets of catnip for enticement as the product stated there would be. Now it is of limited use until I can purchase catnip on my own.
Wish the magnet was stronger. Not as great as everyone claims I still have to use other means to clean my glass

Simple design but has a flaw that you may not notice unless pointed out. If you don't mind excessive amounts of uneaten seed all around your feeder this isn't even a flaw. If you look at the picture where the chickadee's are you may notice that where the seed falls out is a trough of sorts. The trough is basically the outer edge of the bottom board of the feeder. The board has "trim" that makes a lip so the seed doesn't spill out immediately. What they forgot was a lip on either end by the suet feeder. I simply cut a 2"x2" pressure treated board I had laying around and made two end pieces to finish the lip all the way around the feeder. Just that 1/2 lip on each end keep 80% off the feed in the feeder which is where I prefer to view my birds.Otherwise good product and great shipping.

Bought this litter box for my two cats. They love it. However I am not using the rolling/cleaning feature. I just scoop because I don't see any real plus in retrieving the poop from the drawer compared with removing it directly from the main compartment from the box. I would not buy this litter box again because I am not using the drawer, which means I am wasting one third of the space reserved for the cleaning function. A plus however is that my cats love to sleep on top of the box and the esthetics is OK. Be aware that the large box is really huge.

This crate is so good, I have 2 of them for my Golden Retrievers. The crate is very well made and the 3 door option is very versatile. Both crates fit side by side in my Dodge Durango, allowing me to check on both dogs in the rearview mirror. I prefer the mesh crate for rear visibility when driving.
These liners are functional, but a little flimsy. I wish the liners were a little heavier.

We have tried a couple different dog booties for our two Bichons. We bought our first pair of these at Petco and liked them enough to order another- unfortunately we ordered them too soon- as the first pair wore through by the time the second pair arrived! They do the job to protect our boys' paws from salt, but the nylon shell wore through inside of a week so they are definitely not weather proof... Their little paws wind up wet anyway so we no longer bother to put these on them if it is just raining. If it is muddy, it would offer some protection from dirt-but I would not recommend these (or call them all weather) except for the fact that they seem to be the best available... I was not expecting Nike quality but I would hope something marketed as "extreme all weather" could hold up to 5 minutes of use a few times a day for more than a few low intensity potty breaks- it's not like we took the dogs camping or hiking or anything!

I purchased two of these toys and only one of them works - the other mouse is silent. I'm not sure yet if the cats will play with it anyway, but I'm letting you know that this is another cheap rip-off item from China - I should have known better

I was going to order this for my little shihtzu but knowing how picky he is I bought a can from the local pet store first. Glad I did, because Sheldon would have nothing to do with it. The chunks in it are huge for a little dog so I cut them up, but he still would only sniff it and walk away. Disappointing because I see now that they have the smaller cans I would have bought for him. Not sure if the pieces in those are smaller as well, but it doesn't really matter. He won't eat it.
Unless you have an outside dog, don't get these. The smell is absolutely horrible and stinks up the entire house... ugh ...

Its extremely dim. I tried a 75watt, its the same, but lots of heat (I dont need the heat in my country)You'll be better off with the glow light dome which you can purchase here as well. Unless of course, you are easily excited by violet lights in your terrarium. Remember, through your camera, it will look blue(like on youtube). But when you stand in front of it, its more like black light (violet)

Let's start with what might be the most important information to many, but not all, cat owners. My cat seems to love this water dish. Occasionally I will still find him in the bathroom navigating toilet water, but more often than not, he is enjoying this fountain. In that, Catit serves it's purpose. The problem is this thing seems to be really finicky to me. I had it in my bedroom but had to move it. If you don't have the bowl just right, the water doesn't dispense properly and it starts getting air into the pump. It appeared right to be until I woke up to loud gurgling and churning in the middle of the night. If that isn't a problem, sometimes I can't get this thing to run the water evenly over the bowl so there are patches of dry areas. It says to run your hand over it to fix that, that's not always the case, and the plastic top has never fit just perfectly for mine. I assume that's by design but maybe it's defective.I really did love this machine when I first got it, put it down, and it did it's thing. Since the first refill... been annoying, and I even cleaned it up too incase something was getting stuck in it... not a problem.My cat likes, so I will put up with it, but I am spending a lot more time tinkering around with this fountain every time i fill it than i ever did with my fresh flow. That's my only complaint though, everything is great when it works properly well that and the blue mat show on this product is not included... it's an add on.
Excellent product. Fast shipping. Am not disappointed at all.

After looking at a couple of stores, and online Amazon had this for the least amount of money. I received it very quickly, but was disappointed when I opened the box and found the lamp was dented, I'm not going to bother with sending it back, after all I did not order it for the looks. It works great, puts out a lot of heat, much more than I expected,it is a little hard to get the right angle so that the light hangs right over the tank, had to get a bit creative, but overall very happy.

It might just be my cat, but no matter what, she seems to be able to jump over these mats rendering them completely useless. We have bought so many of them we are now able to puzzle piece them together making one big, huge mat she can't cross. It's hard to tell which one is doing the job best. It is a cute mat though!

Length:: 0:13 MinsI was shopping for a 10 pack refill of the feather attachments (the best interactive cat toy EVER!)and on impulse I added this sparkler and a "mousie" to my order. One of my cats went nuts over this sparkler. I really did not expect this. Is it the noise? Is it that cats (like me) also like SHINY things? The sparkler refill had him spinning in circles and making impressive leaps in fast repetition until he was panting, and he still did not want to stop! I think I found part of the cure to kitty obesity here!Yes, the sparkler things start to fall off. Do not allow the cat to play with this thing without supervision. You do not want kitty to eat this plastic. And some cats will like it better than others.

After reading the other reviews I was excited to try this. I have a 60lb lab mix who loves to run in the snow. Extreme cold temps and road salt made it painful. I've tried this product a couple times and it did not work for my dog. First the product says it dries in a few minutes after applied. This did not dry and left greasy paw prints on my rug. Also, once out in the snow, it appeared the snow stuck to my dogs feet and he painfully picked up his feet more frequently. My latest attempt was a disaster. After walking on the street, the slushy grime, typical once snow starts to melt, mixed with the Musher's Secret and formed a tar-like consistency stuck between my dogs toes. Wiping his feet did not remove it and only after several washings with Dawn dishwashing liquid did the grime come out. This is an amazing well balanced food. I particularly like the size pellet this is.. though as a fair warning it's VERY small stuff! If you are looking for a bird feeder that squirrels can not steal from, look elsewhere. Squirrels are smart, and I have one that figured out how to climb down the hanger and cling to the feeder upside down, helping himself to the bird seed. I guess I'll have to try using a dome-shaped shield on the hanger and see if that helps. For now, I will try to keep the squirrels distracted by keeping an adequate supply of cheaper food on the ground where it is easier to access. Also, if you are shopping for your first bird feeder, I recommend getting a smaller one to start out. This one has a much larger capacity than my birds consume in a reasonable time, so I end up dumping most of the food when it's time to clean it and refill it with fresh food. Birds don't like moldy food. They also don't seem to like the cheaper seed blends that have a lot of milo and other cheap fillers, at least not here in upstate NY. It's probably better to have a number of smaller feeders instead of one large feeder, anyway. Just hope you're feeding the birds instead of the squirrels, or it can get expensive! Oh, I also read that squirrels don't like thistle, so maybe I'll get a thistle feeder as well. Not all birds like thistle, so a variety of feeders is a good idea. I would also like to get a suet feeder for a larger variety of backyard visitors, but squirrels like suet too.

My dog loves the kong toys, i just dont care to keep buying him a new one every month. My dog is a strong chewer, but i was still a little disappointed that my "extreme" kong was chewed up in about 3 weeks. I will keep looking for better toys.

For the first couple of days my dog was mesmerized. He could not get enough of this bone. Then he licked all the peanut butter out of it and now it has lost all of it's appeal. I have 3 cats and a busy life, so scooping a litter box daily was a fair amount of work. I spent several months researching the LitterRobot as well as the Cat Genie because I did really want my cats to have a clean litter box as much as possible. I decided that the Litter Robot was the way to go, despite the fairly high price. I then remembered seeing this product a few times but had dismissed it on grounds that it must be cheap, inferior and more of a hassle than it was worth.I was so very wrong.I read the reviews and after seeing the large number of positive reviews, I decided to try it. Every single one of them had it right, this box rocks! You still have to tend to the litter box at least once every 36-48 hours, but you really should do it daily. (With 3 cats at least, with one cat you could easily slide by with every other day.) It's very easy to roll it over and dump the cup into a grocery bag and toss the waste away. I haven't had a problem with the clips breaking but then I'm grabbing the bottom lip and rolling it over that way to avoid stressing the clips. Yes, they are kinda flimsy plastic. Sucks, they should work on that. The whole box honestly feels kinda flimsy compared to a traditional litter box, but it works well and if it was any thicker plastic it'd be a challenge to roll. I can see how the elderly would struggle to roll this thing, it can get heavy with a proper amount of litter. I do recommend keeping the litter level fairly high, as it helps get the waste into clumps and into the cup. I've had this for over a month now and have actually enjoyed taking care of the litter box. That's so weird! Definitely worth a shot and I'm thrilled I took the chance.

I did a fair amount of research about these style of gate before buying one. The majority are designed and on the market for new parents of human babies. Traditional dog gates can be limited in the features they offer. So believe me when I say I was super excited about getting this gate for my home, my dog's safety and implied ease of use for me. I had to purchase an extension for the Carlson Extra Wide to fit in my front hallway preventing the puppy from running to the door every time someone knocked or walked by. I was hopeful when I took it out of the box. The construction and welding seems sturdy and this is true, but unfortunately there has to more to recommend a gate then its construction. I also found out the ideally it is a two person job, because you want each of the 4 tightening screws to be equally extended for maximum stability of this gate. The bottom bar that runs across the the length of the opening can be tripped on, pushed etc.. slightly moving the entire placement of the gate or slanting it inward or outward.But here is my major disappointment and complaint about the design of the gate. The Extra Wide has a red slide lock that sits behind the locking mechanism on the gate. Meaning that a person must know to slide the red square back and up BEFORE even trying to lift the lock latch up and at a 90 degree angel before opening the gate. The two step process of releasing and engaging the lock is not made clear by any markings on the gate- like "step 1" or "push back" "Step two" or "lift to 90 degrees" I can't tell you how many times full grown adults who have Master's to your average joe like me looked at this gate and I had to explain how to open and then close it. I had to say " you have to pull back on the red thing and then lift up on the latch until it is at a 90 degree angel for the gate to work. So, the day came , a guest was leaving and they simply pulled up on the latch without pulling back on the child safety lock, red thing and two small pieces of plastic gate fell to the ground and it was broken - done. This gate was not inexpensive. I was hoping it would last a bit longer then about 5 months or less before a simple mistake, not any kind of misuse could break it so easily and completely. The lock, with the child safety (red thing) is totally unneeded or at the least poorly designed and is far too hard to operate with ease or without risk of breaking it. If all that is standing between me and a total waste of money is two little plastic knobs I wish I had know , so I could have spent my money somewhere else. So I would not be where I am now - with a lot of plastic & metal gate that I will have to pay to throw away at the dump. Plus the need to buy a whole new gate at yet another not minor expense - nearly $100 dollars when it is all said and done and at your door. expense. Why is everything made so darn cheaply? Is it really that hard to get it right? I guess the fact that there are countless child and pet gates out there answers my question. Yes, it is so hard to do it right the first time around. Was hoping for a better made product that was designed knowing it would be opened and closed several times a day for years. not 5 months or less.

Buy it. I used a clicker to get our litter-mate shelie puppies (2x8 months) to fetch. They picked it up at about 4 months. This toy is perfect. I bought it at 7 months once they had fetch with balls. Before I bought this and the Chuck It ball, they would great me at the door with tail wags and dances after work. Now, when I come home after work, they bark once or twice and do not come to me, but instead go to the back door to go outside and play fetch. "Fetch" or "where is it?" creates havoc in our house thanks to this toy. Oh - and these dogs eat everything!!!! yet this tough, but pliable canvas construction gives enough when they chew that it has not torn. 5 stars because I can't go higher.

A little larger than I expected. It holds three cups if you fill it all the way to the brim, but effectively holds only 1.5 cups as I will explain:The clips that attach the cup to the cage are very close to the top edge, with no way to attach the bottom. The clips are horizontal, so they act as a pivot. This means it can be flipped upward a couple of inches (by a bunny-rabbit's nose for example) and a significant portion of whatever is in it will be catapulted out of the cup, through the bars, and all over about six feet of floor. The amount of food launched depends on the strength of the flip.My rabbit loved this game when he discovered it. He was apparently going for distance, trying to beat his personal best. Which is laudable. Self-improvement is so important. I, however, did not love cleaning up the mess. So, I figured out to minimize the spills (or launches) I can only fill the cup half way.The cup does have a lip around the top, to keep food or liquids from slopping over the edge while your animal is eating or drinking. If you have a polite animal, it might work better for you.Note to manufacturers: I will purchase another one of these, only if you eliminate the pivoting action. The no-spill lip is a good idea but the implementation is lacking. Also, stainless steel is much nicer than plastic, especially for rabbits.

I bought this on Amazon and have been using it for 2 years with 2 cats. My initial enthusiasm has slacked off a bit. It is a good product but has a few issues.First, the top and bottom do NOT latch together tightly enough. I solved this by applying duct tape all around the seam. If it is not taped then litter leaks at the seams every time it is rolled. The tape method works but makes it a bigger pain to clean.Second, the grate slats seem too big. Over time quite a bit of litter, poop and small litter clumps get through the grate and accumulate on the far side of the grate. This creates less space for the clean litter to go into, and eventually means I have to take the whole thing apart (including untaping it) to hose it down. I think the grate slats should be narrower/smaller.Third, the grate can come detached from the little slots it fits into in the bottom of the box. The grate simply rests into 2 small grooves. A few times it has come up and out of the grooves which allows LOTS of clean litter to be wasted with each roll. The grate needs to have a better method to keep it firmly seated in the base.Fourth, there is a "sweet spot" for the amount of litter needed to be kept in the box. Too much litter and it doesn't all fit in the grate-bin on rolling and clean litter gets wasted. But too little litter causes urine clumps to stick to the bottom. When rolled I have to give the base of the box (now on top after rolling) a couple sharp whacks to dislodge the clumps. This works, but probably contributes to my complaint #3 above of the grate coming loose. This also sometimes produces litter smears on the top (ie- the top when is normal position) which I have to wipe out or it gets on the cat's head.Overall, I like the product but I feel it could benefit from 2 design modifications. One is to improve the seal between top and bottom so taping isn't needed. The second is to modify the grate so the slats are smaller and it stays firmly attached to the bottom . I'm sure this would raise the price. To me it would probably be worth it because having to take the whole thing apart to clean it is such a mess. Right now I'm thinking of going back to a regular litter box with sifting liners.PETCO Jumbo Sifting Cat Litter Box LinersI have used those in the past and find them very easy to use and overall less messy. Still, for 35 bucks its a pretty good product. Just needs some tweaking.

About two months ago I suddenly realized my three dogs were infested with ticks. I had never found more than one tick on any pet, so I was overwhelmed with the literally hundreds of ticks of all sizes I was picking off my dogs. They had also infested my house. I bought these collars and put them on my dogs while they still had some ticks on them. Within a few days, I could find no more ticks on the dogs or the house. I just wish these were sold in stores. I will be buying these regularly from now on!

My nextdoor neighbors have a young, large German shepard that they leave out all day and night. It barks all day long...but the police won't do anything about it because its not a "sustained" bark over a certain amount of time. The neighbors are elderly acloholics and will bring the dog in when i complain, but the next day its business as usual. Telling the dog to lie down and go to sleep didnt work...reporting the dog to the city police officers didnt work...talking nicely to the neighbors didnt work...so i tried out the Pet-Agree. Guess what? Nothing. The dog is 30 feet away and it had no affect. So, i went with Plan B. I pulled out an old wrist-rocket i have and plunked the dog on the rear end. He ran under the deck and didnt come out for the rest of the day. Works every time. Thanks Pavlov for the conditioned-response research. Problem solved.

I purchased this item because I wanted fresh water for my dogs. I have 5 dogs and during the day they stay outside in the patio. That's where I placed the water fountain. Thank God I have an electracal outlet outside and was able to connect it. Overall, it's a good little fountain if you only have one dog. I have an 11 year old jack russell who has tartar buildup on the way back molars so you can only see part of the teeth. He had only minimal placque on the canines. I have been using the gel at night and the spray in the morning since November, 2010. The placque on the canines is gone but I don't see a lot ofimprovement in the molars. Slight improvement in his breath. He is on the weight border line so I am going to up to the 1/3t gel at night and see if thathelps. I also have a soon to be 5 year old Aussie/heeler. Her teeth look brand new. I use the gel 3x a week on her and brush in the evening. I wish I wouldhave done this 11 years ago on my jr but was busy dealing with his urate stone forming problem! Anyway, works great on the aussie, her breath smells like clean air and the vet says her teeth look beautiful. I will report back after increasing the dose for my jack russell.Update on Oct. 25, 2011After a trip to the vet for yearly exam in June, the vet said I should really have a dental done on my jr. So I did. Since then I have been using the Oravet sealer once a week and the Petzlife gel on a tooth brush every night and so far, after 4 months, his teeth look good. His breath still smells bad and even after his dental it wasn't fresh smelling. Might have something to do with his food for urate stones. Anyway, I am happy with the protocol I am using and will continue. Would recommend the Petzlife oral gel, it is still working great on my Aussies teeth too.ps: forgot to add that after my dogs dental cleaning, it turned out he had no gingivitis nor gum inflammation, so even though the Petzlife didn't clean all the tartar and plaque off the molars, it was keeping the inflammation down on his gumline.

Linatone plus works awesomely with my GSD... he sheds when he actually has to, not just whenever, which is great.EntirelyPets was a WHOLE other story. Talking to them is like talking to a wall. It works well enough, although it seems a bit finicky about whether it will respond to the command module or not.The shock seems pretty weak, and of the three small dogs (10-20 lbs) that we have had it on, only one noticed the shock at all, even on the highest setting.They all respond quite well to the tone however (when it decides to respond to the control button.)The collar goes through batteries pretty quickly, just from being powered on. This crate is exactly as described. It's well-made and very sturdy, enough so as to withstand the shenanigans of one of my dogs who is creative when bored. I've installed the HOT Magnum with the BioWheel attachment (HOT Magnum Pro) on my 55 gallon tank for about 6 months now, and I'm very impressed with the performance of this filter system. This canister filter is powerful and power thrifty at 250gph while using only 18 watts. I especially like having the filter out of sight hanging behind the tank.This combination of canister filter and biowheel is pretty amazing. The water is very clear thanks to the no by pass design of the canister and the tank is well oxygenated due to the spray bar/biowheel component. The biowheel is also great at removing amonia and nitrite which becomes undetectable (amonia less than 0.25mg/liter and nitrite less than 0.1mg/liter) after a few days of running this filter. That's with a bio load of 12 adult Angelfish, 10 large swordtails, and 5 bushynose plecos! If you don't understand what all this mean, then trust me when I tell you the performance of this system is hard to beat.Now for the down side: This filter is a pain to clean.First of all, don't bother using the fine carbon that comes with the filter. This will cause your filter to clog up in no time if you have a heavily stocked tank like me. I threw out the carbon after the first week and replaced it with ceramic noodles, which does not clog at all. The nylon mesh sleeve works well to trap fish waste, but is messy to clean or replace, and you have to take the whole filter apart to do it. After I spent a few minutes taking this apart, clean it, reassemble it, and fill it with water, mine filter sometimes lose syphon and I have to take it apart and assemble it again. I have to pay special attention to the stupid red gasket that likes to fall out when I not careful. This is why I gave this filter 3 stars.The power switch is located near the bottom of the backside of the filter. While it's nice to have a power switch, the placement is bad because it's right up against the wall and you have to reach all the way down the back of your tank to reach it.So, to sum up. If you want one of the best performing and efficient filter and don't mind having to take a filter apart and get messy once awhile (for me that's about every 2 weeks), then this is the filter for you.Additional note: The BioWheel Pro30 (the one with spray bar) is really fantastic in it's performance, and is key to the awesome performance of this system. This component can be used with other easier to clean internal canister or powerheads, so don't ever discard this attachment.Update Oct 13, 2011I got tired of cleaning canister filters. Got sick of taking the canisters apart, cleaning all the pieces, putting it back together, and then reinstalling the filter to the tank.I've installed the Emperor 400 on 4 of my larger tanks. This outside hang-on-the-back power filter has the bio-wheels with spray bar and cartridges that are disposable. No more cleaning dirty sponges and taking apart canisters!!!

I hoped it would work in my small aquariums, but it did not. I guess the water levels weren't high enough? I have no idea why it was not able to vacuum anything out, but it would've really been useful and a convenient tool had it worked since I got it so that I wouldn't have to do a full water change so often or use a siphon on such small tanks. It did work okay in my full size tanks.

I purchased this filter to replace the cheap starter filter that came with my aquarium. The problem with my original filter was the lack of a bio sponge, so that every time I replaced the filter medium, ammonia levels would rise while the new filter grew bacteria, resulting in the nitrite spike when the bacteria finally caught up. I don't know whether this filter would actually handle a 50 gallon aquarium, but on a 20 gallon aquarium, cloudy water and detectable levels of ammonia, nitrate, and nitrite have become a thing of the past.When I initially set up the filter it was a bit noisy, but after removing and reinstalling the impeller it ran with an almost indiscernible hum. The bio falls booster has the additional side effect of slowing the water on the way out of filter so that it reenters the aquarium less violently than my previous filter despite pumping twice as much water. This helps the filter run quietly with no splashing if your water level is adjusted properly.The activated carbon filter is unique in that it is broken into a number of cells that each contain activated carbon. As a result, more of water flowing through the filter is exposed to the carbon without sacrificing ease of a slide-in cartridge.I have only two criticisms of this filter. First, the flow of the carbon cartridge should have been made higher, as there is a small amount of overflow even when this cartridge is new if the filter flow is adjusted to the maximum setting. Second, most of the noticeable noise from the filter comes from the vibration of the lid. This can be overcome by running without the lid, or by using a small piece of tape. This vibration made me question the build quality of an otherwise excellent filter.

It served its purposed....the dog was amused with it for a day.
These are pretty and all but you cant clean them. The bottle brush wont fit and you cant get to where its dirty.

This product works like a charm. My cat Snoopy took the medicine with no problem, I cut the pill in four pieces then put the pieces in his favorite tuna he ate it up. Hint, be sure your cat is good and hungry so he will eat it up before he notices that something is in his food. The package arrived in record time, I ordered on Thursday night and it arrived on Monday way sooner than the due date. Very pleased!!

The oil itself works great on any hair clippers (not just Wahl brand, I use it on myAndis 29775 Headliner Trimmer), but the stupid dispenser nozzle dumps out a ton of oil when you squeeze the bottle even gently. This is unacceptable and the dispenser's obvious design flaw is suspicious. Is it possibly the intent of Wahl in making such a crappy dispenser is to get you waste oil so you have to buy more way sooner than you should have to? After having been totally underwhelmed by their ridiculously heavy, epic failWahl Professional Super Taper II Hair Clipper 8470, I wouldn't be surprised. They probably also save a few pennies going with the awful nozzle instead of paying for one that works properly. One solution is to use an eyedropper to remove and apply the oil to your clippers, but you wouldn't have to do that if Wahl was actually producing a proper dispenser.The oil is five stars, the dispenser head is a one, which averages my rating out to three stars. I'll probably be switching toAndis Clipper Oil 4ozor another brand in the future. That's how much I hate the dispenser head on this bottle!
This is really great for small toy type dogs for going to the vet. But for Travel or vacation, I prefer the 'car seat type' where the dogs can look out etc.

I have two dogs and although I use the product as stated on the packaging it is still necessary to do a daily check for ticks and then remove them with tweezers - so I feel the product needs some improvement.
My order was shipped to the wrong address and get sent back. Why is there no where to tell you that i need it resent!! THIS IS RIDICULOUS

Worked fine for a short time, cats loved it, a few days after cleaning first time, found water all over the kitchen floor, would not stop running over. Checked everything I could, took apart, started over, still would not stop running over, solved the problem, now resting in county dump. Would not recommed this product unless it's in a large tub!!

I haven't tested this against the corded version, but in concept replacing cord with tape makes sense. However, this snapped after less than 5 months of ownership, during which it was used solely (and infrequently) with an 8 pound dog.

Someone warned me that the large box leaks when you tip it to move the litter into the pan. It's a great idea, but in reality it didn't work for me. The litter spilled out the side and my cat hated the lid.

I had high hopes for this product because my dog suffers horibly from flea bites as he seems to be allergic to them and I have not found a product that will stop every flea in their tracks. this gives some relief but then maybe I set the bar to high when it comes to my dog.
works well when the water can get to it. The listing that I bought it from didn't say that it was not designed for the big dog fountainthat we have.

I bought this for my outside cats and they love it! I have a smaller one but this large one is plenty big enough for all four of my grown cats to curl up on and stay warm! I would definately recomend this for anyone who wants to help keep their animals warm and cozy!
The cats just love chasing this and not sure which one but one of them has learned how to turn it on. It is a great way to get multiple cats to play together, if they do not already do so.

I have had this product twice. The first time I had one I had really nice "dirt" that it was installed in. The unit was able to retain the water long enough to digest quickly. This was in Florida and even the HOT summer did not smell. I recently moved and decided to get another unit. This one has not worked at all and I would say it has to do with the soil. I now live in an area where the soil is very sandy and fine. I will fill up the water level and it is gone in less then an hour. Even the rainy season didn't help. The Doggie Dooley is now totally full of dog droppings and I can no longer use it. Also the "step-on" lid broke (a rivet popped) before I even finished the install. I have not been able to figure out any way for it to hold the water longer which would help.

I bought 3 blue Ario 4s for my 110-gallon freshwater tank. These are beautiful, and you can control how much air comes out with a valve on the top. The tubing that comes with these is black, which I liked, since the backing on my aquarium is black...it blended in well.Complaints: It was hard to get these level in the tank (especially in a large tank, where I went swimming to get them level...and the power cord is pretty short (you'll need an extension cord).I was thrilled to remove my external air pump for this.Updated: The three of these I bought only lasted a year before either air wouldn't bubble through or the light had burned out. VERY disappointing. :-(

I bought this item for my Lab as she has elbow dysplasia and I didn't want to worry about electrical wires or over heating. It does keep the heat like it reports..the fleece cover is important as the disc gets quite hot. The only down side is that the disc is very hard; if it was a gel like item it would cushion her elbows better. She will only lay on it for a couple of minutes which defeats the purpose. We may use it for a fanny warmer at the football games but as for fido, it's not exactly what we needed...lesson learned.

Its a great size - I wish it folded up more compactly and that it was more waterproof. We use ours as a water dish when we take the pup on hikes or to restaurant patios, but it doesn't take long for the water to saok thru

These wee wee pads were great price wise and not as bulky as the ones that I normally buy which made them great for storage. However, one or two "pees" and the pad is somewhat done as any liquid spreads far and wide. As ok as these pads are, I will be returning to my expensive Drs Foster & Smith the next time around.

I really hate to be a "wet blanket," but this medication was a total waste of money and my dogs went through unnecessary pain. I have a shih tzu, a chow, and a dachshund. (I didn't know when I got these dogs that they were prone to bad backs and/or hip dysplasia - learn from my experience and educate yourself before buying a dog - no matter how sweet!) I'd been giving them glucosamine chondroitin for a couple of years and they thrived. I made a mistake and ordered the Cosequin tablets and they've suffered since they've been taking it. I couldn't afford the expense to throw out the Cosequin and spend big money (to me) for glucosamine chondroitin meds. Now I'm switching back to G-C and expect them to walk painlessly soon.

I did alot of research before I purchased this product for my Jack Russell. We live out in the country on 3 acres and we were having a lot of issues with him traveling too far out in the woods or running out in the road. After receiving and reading the directions and trying it out, I was very pleased, but it was very traumatic to watch my Jack get shocked when he did not at first pay attention to the beeps and stop. He would cry and keep going and keep getting shocked and I would beg and plead for him to come back closer to me so the shocks would stop. After a few days of training with the flags and beeps, he finally got it. I do have to add that he hates the collar and when we get ready to go outside he gets really irritated when I get it out. Once we get outside however, he forgets about it. I guess each dog is different.

I have a 7 month old schnoodle. He's only 10 lbs but while he's been teething he's been capable of destroying everything! He was initially very careful with this dragon. He would creep up to it and lick its tongue.. then run away when we squeezed it and the tongue flipped out.. after some introduction, he was all over this thing. Absolutely loved it. 1 day later we looked at the poor dragon and his tongue was missing! and one of his toes were gone too... :( I thought it would be more durable then it was.. I'm sure our puppy ended up eating these missing rubber parts despite our careful supervision. Also, we were concerned about the make/ coloring of the dragon. This was made in China? is there a possibility of lead in the coloring? (flashback; all the toy recalls in china).. Our puppy never got sick or anything, just our paranoid thoughts. anyway, though our puppy loved it, this is why I gave it only 3 stars.
These are too big for casual snacks. I use them for major rewards. The dogs love them and they are kept busy for a while with it. I'd get them again.

This tubing even though it was sold separately from the aerator I bought, had the correct diameter to fit and was good quality tubing.The only issue I had with this tubing is that the supplier did not let the purchaser know that they needed to cut the tubing in two halves to insert the provided valve...granted I am a newbie to aquariums. Other than that it has been working excellently!

The small KONG Air Dog Squeaker Dumbbell was the perfect size for my 20-lb terrier to carry around and she loved the sound...but she had the squeaker out in less than 10 minutes and then it wasn't very interesting any more. If your dog isn't as determined to kill small squeaky things it would probably be a great toy.

I ordered the Coastal Holt halter but received the Halti instead. I returned the Halti and ordered another coastal holt halter but received -- another halti. Unfortunately, these products are not identical or interchangeable. The Halti size 3 is MUCH larger than the Holt collar so the collar sent to me (twice) was too large for my dog. Also, the holt collar has a camlock on the chinstrap. This camlock seems to keep the chinstrap snuggly on the dog. My dog is a bit of a monster-puppy so we need all the reinforcing details we can get -- without the camlock, she can get a loose bit of the chinstrap into her mouth and can bite the harness in half in the blink of an eye. I know this because she has bitten through 4 Size 2 Haltis. I called Amazon customer service to see what I could do to make sure I got the Coastal Holt halter and the representative said I'd probaby just continue to be sent Haltis. He helped me return the Halti and get my money back. Be aware that if you order the coastal holt, there is a good chance you'll get a Halti.

generates no additional heat, I have a thermometer directly over the substrate heater (under a layer of substrate in fact) the temprature never changes by more than what would be expected naturally (never shifts more than 1 degree Fahrenheit inside of an hour or two this is in a 12ish gal tank at 76 Fahrenheit) do NOT buy this item, I plan on shipping it back and (hopefulness) getting my modey back, but refuse to bay more than the product is worth for shipping to do so, because guess what, that would be a free 15 buck for these jerks. don't let the company rob you DO NOT BUY.

My 13 mo. old Labradoodle started taking a liking to her own poop. Even once caught her trying out another dog's at the dog park. Saw the reviews for this product and tried it. I have been trying to be very diligent in getting her poop picked up in our yard after the first incident but if I miss some she totally ignores it and have noticed she is not even looking at trying out some at the dog park now. This product does have vitamins and such and that can't be bad. She get's one in the morning and seems to think it's a treat so I'll keep giving it to her.
My dog is a 24lb Basenji and fits him perfectly. Product has held for over a month so far, with no problems.

Great toy, simple design, effective at engaging the dog. He even played with it without food (unlike his Kongs). However, the material is very soft and the dog bit through it on his first use of it. Darn it! I would love the same toy made with tougher rubber/plastic.

this deterrent is a band aid only. Looked at all the options and went for the cage instead. My section of town was crawling with cats a few months ago. A cage in a few weeks took care of 90% of the problem, simple and effective, never needs batteries. If you live next to the "cat lady" or the like, the deterrents --and I've tried many, work for about a day. After that the cats alter their routine or get used to them. Why rig up your house trying to place deterrents everywhere, just get rid of the problem. Link to a small cage, might need a bigger one.Havahart Live Animal Single Door Cage Trap for Skunks and Rabbits #1078

I really am not impressed with this product. It does not work anything like the viedo showes. I have a lab and a chow mix and I hardley get hair off of either one with out a lot of pressure and both of my dogs really do not enjoy it. One actually wines when I brush him. It is not worth the money at all. The shipping and service from the company was great but the product sucks.

Cats are so different that I really think rating a cat food is redundant. Just try it to see if your cat likes it. I have a friend that has 4 cats and they fight over this stuff. Mine, however, just left an entire package in the bowl uneaten and he came over and pounced me one to give him something else. He's a Persian but prefers his regular cans of sliced Friskies over ANYTHING else. I thought that this would be a special treat but, guess again. He hates the stuff so I get to take all these back to the store again. Goofy cat!

We have three cats, two short- and one long-haired. We got this specifically for the long-haired cat and he was the only one who REFUSES to eat the stuff. The other two like it OK, so 66% of our cats will willingly eat it. I will force feed the long-haired cat (by rubbing it on his paws or with a syringe) once a week or so and he hasn't had any hair balls. I tried mixing it into wet food and he won't touch it, even though he will normally eat food with other meds (e.g. lysine) in it. I'll use this hairball remedy until it's gone, but then I will look for another product that my long-hair thinks tastes better.
What a total piece of junk.Did'nt last four weeks.Was as quiet as a chainsaw while it did work.Don't throw your money away on this garbage.

I was house sitting for a friend and watching the dog and I used the Sweepa there first. I noticed how easily it collected the dog hair and every bit of dust in the area. So I bought one for myself and am just as pleased. My dog is short haired, but he still leaves his locks all about the house and they are barely visible but I know they are there. With the Sweepa I can get all of his hair and all of the micro dust particles that make their way into the apartment. I haven't used it wet, but I love what the Sweepa does in the usual dry condition. If you have a pet you will really appreciate it.

I got my unit fast, looks exactly like the picture, easy to install, and is pretty solid.But I failed to "read between the lines", so this is not going to work for my configuration.My cats are indoor cats - but I needed this because one cat (RJ) is on a prescription diet (he HATES it), and I need to feed my other cat separately. So this door was intended to allow his brother (Archimedes) into the study, where he could have free access to his non-prescription food.Here are the problems I encountered with my configuration:(1) The locking mechanism is a plastic tab, held in place by a magnet. RJ is big enough/strong enough to break through the lock. He's about 12 pounds. Granted, he's slightly OCD, and more persistent than the normal kitty, especially when it comes to food! However, I can imagine a persistent Raccoon or Possum (anything over 20 pounds) could also break through the lock if using on an exterior door. Just to be clear - the door is not "broken" - it still functions, but it can pop open with about 20 pounds of pressure.(2) The lock is only one direction, designed to keep other animals OUT. So in my case, I had to install the door backwards (i.e., any cat can go OUT, but only the cat with the collar can come back in).(3) The opening is pretty small. Works fine for my cats (9 and 12 pounds), but might be a tight fit for a small dog or a larger cat.(4) The door will only latch shut if it swings shut. If your cat proceeds through the door slowly, or if your cat has a long tail, the door will NOT always latch shut.* FIX: Install the door at a tilted angle, with the top of the door leaning about 10 degrees, so that it always swings shut. This is trickier than it sounds, but I GUARANTEE it works, if that's your only issue.If anyone finds a better option, please comment - I'm still looking for a solution. And if you find my comments helpful, please vote below. For me, Amazon is community where we share our experiences & help each other out. I always read reviews before buying something, and I hope my comments help you make your decision AND save time, energy & money. Thanks!
It is too big for even a large cat to grab in it's mouth. Thrown across the room it is not interesting enough to chase, like little fake mousies are. It goes PLOP and the cats stare at it. Useless.

I have tried for years to find a good bulb for lighting (both in the house and the aquarium) that renders colors as well as incandescent or halogen, but without a yellow tinge. I think that by now we should be able to reproduce the full spectrum of sunlight artificially without making it feel harsh, cold, or unnatural. Apparently technology hasn't caught up to my expectations. No fluorescent bulb looks like pure white sunlight.I originally rated this bulb a two, because I wanted a pure white light that made the tank look the same as it does in sunlight. If that's what you're looking for, don't buy this bulb. Unfortunately, don't buy any fluorescent bulb. I tried about four different bulbs by different makers of high quality fluorescent bulbs before I tried colormax. Since it wasn't the natural look I wanted, I tried six more bulbs, again by different manufacturers at different color temperatures. I've spent over two hundred dollars and still haven't found a bulb that doesn't have a yellow, blue, red, or purple tinge. This bulb has a purple tinge, by the way. However, after a couple months of searching and trying bulbs of all kinds, I keep putting this one back in as my default bulb. It's not exactly what I was looking for, but it does make my blue dwarf gourami, yellow molly, and red guppy stand out nicely, just not the same color they have under sunlight.If you want a bulb that looks as close to white sunlight, this is at best a 2/5. But, if you want a bulb that makes the colors of your fish look brighter, deeper, and more vibrant (and you don't care if the colors of your fish look like the would in sunlight), then this bulb gets a 4/5.The average is 3/5. So, depending on what you want, take the rating with a grain of salt. Unless I can find something I like more, I'll keep using this.

Upon opening this product it was very hard to get it to work..."On" button on collar had to be jiggled, remote unit buttons often had to be pushed multiple times for reaction, etc. A friend had the same one and it worked flawlessly, so my unit is a lemon. I will be returning it.

I got this on recommendation from the pet store when I first got my Chin. It's really kind of pointless though unless you live in a house that doesn't have air conditioning. We have a/c and some days we don't use it, and so it gets a little toasty (not unbearable) and I've put this in the Chin's cage just as a precaution and she just ignores it. I would guess for it to have any real purpose, the environment would have to be pretty darn warm. In that case, you better get two or three and keep rotating them so your Chin can stay cool.

The first one that came actually broke in transit (that should've warned me). Amazon sent a return label and replacement on the double (love Amazon!). When I put my bag of flour (big bag, that's why I needed the thing) the wheels kept popping off. They simply don't work if you have any weight in this container.

I love the look of these, and all the Pet Stages fabric toys. They make such cool looking toys for cats. My cat hardly ever chewed these, though. She mostly batted them around a bit, and then ignored them. She likes toys with longer dangles than these have.

I do not like this feeder....the food does not fall freely out of the tube when it starts to get low. mine also showed up in looking mangled and missing the screw top....took the company (not amazon...forget the manufacturer name) 2-3 months to ship me a repalcement.

Catnip needs to be carefully cultivated (I read) so that other plants do not creep into the field. Also, it must be fresh to really get the cat to respond. My beloved cat did not react as I expected; truly effective catnip has a narcotic effect on susceptible cats, putting them in a spell almost. My cat could take or leave this catnip unless it was really laid on heavily.

So many seem unhappy with this product. Please consider discussing your purchase with your veterinarian and getting the product they recommend for your unique situation. Since they often have promotions, rebates, and many are willing to price match, you may find that it is cost effective to purchase from your vet's office. Then you have confidence in the product's origin, packing, instructions, and application to your need. It never hurts to ask. I'm glad I did.
I ordered a petsafe collar. It did not work. I called the company and was told I had to contact Amazon, the seller. I emailed Amazon as instructed and I still have had no response- over a month ago!

I have used this for years- it cleans well, rinses out nicely, and leaves the dogs smelling wonderful. I even put a little in loads of laundry that I want to smell nice- light scent lingers through drying.
My pup plays with it for a few seconds and then is on to some other mischief. Doesn't hold her attention.

I have two cats. The teddy bear style cat (male) has no problem having these put on, and they stay put for a while. The high-strung hysterical one (female) struggles from the moment she is held till the end of the exercise of applying these. Then she bites them off -- she has gotten better at this. They are pretty much all gone after about a week. In terms of protecting furniture, they work fine if they stay on the cat, but if the cat is determined to get them off, then it will probably be able to do so. I've been trying to do this (b/c I can't think of anything else) for nearly a year, so I don't think the female is going to get used to it after a while.

One cat drinks from it no problem. The other cat however will only drink from it the same day the water is changed. We keep changing the flow regulator (thinking this might help prohibit any algae growth), we have changed water more frequently (up to almost every other day now, which stinks as it is not very convenient- including scrubbing all the difficult to reach crevices and such) but it doesn't matter, she prefers to drink fresh water from any stupid bowl in the house than day old water from this thing. Go figure. So, although this is a great concept, for us it was a complete waste of $50.00 as it hasn't solved our problem, as it seems the water still must taste stale somehow from this.Cleaning is also a pain, as there are a few small crevices. I have read other reviews about the noise, but ours has been virtually silent, so that isn't an issue at all. The small water sound it makes is nice. I split the review down the middle because our other cat seems to like it just fine.

My first experience with this harness was great. My golden retriever had neck surgery and I didn't want to use a regular collar anymore. This harness was great for her; and she was very easy to walk. Whenever she rolled around on her back in the grass the harness would come off because she would pull her front legs out, but it wasn't a big deal with her.My second experience with this harness was okay. I was fostering another golden retriever and he was very strong. The harness helped but walking him was still difficult, and my arm and back still hurt.When I adopted a corgie/sheltie mix, I felt confident in buying the same harness for her. Unfortunately it was a mistake. There were several problems. It fit her properly, but she would just stop walking. I wasn't sure if she was uncomfortable or not. The loop and ring on the chest area coupled with the clasp on the leash would bounce around too much and hit her chest as she walked. Really annoying, because it was too close to her face (being a short dog). The main problem and why I stopped using it was because she is a jumper/lunger when she sees a cat or another dog. Several times her short little legs were able to jump out of the harness. And that was with it tightened properly! I also had a problem with the leash being too close to her feet and having to hold it up so she wouldn't get tangled up in it.So, now I've just turned it around so that the clasp is on her back and I only use it as a car harness with a seatbelt attachment.One solution to the jumping out problem is to get a double clasp attachment that you could attach to the front chest ring and to the dog's collar so that the front part stays up when a dog flips out. I would have done this except the bouncing metal really annoyed her.
I was expecting a quiet pump from reviews & product description, but it was just as loud and annoying as any other pump I've gotten. Works good, but noisy even on carpet.

This an awesome bird-feeder. Made out of cedar wood and has a large capacity for bird-feed.The suet holder on both ends of the feeder are a big plus. I was so impressed that I boughttwo of them. The birds just love eating the bird-feed and suet.
I LOVE penguin FILTERS..got curious after spending 9.74 american for 3 pack.problem becomes when I look to photo of package.Clearly 3-PACK in photo.is Really 6 Pack ship to me?Mucho Appreciado-do.

I ordered this product to help a stray cat that adopted me keep warm during the winter months. She was staying in my shed and needed a little extra help on those cold winter nights. She was thrilled with the warmth and the length the heat lasted.
Both dogs like them, but are not wild for them. They eat them readily but do not beg for more as they do for some treats.

This has worked to help with our cat eating of fabric. However it does leave a residue that stays on the fabric sprayed and if it gets on your hands you will have a difficult time getting if off. So this product is not for the weak.

I just came home tonight and I noticed only 2 Tablespoons of food in the Dog's tray.Normally the machine dispenses for 2 minutes, or about 2 cups of dog food. The poor dog would starve if I hadn't noticed this.I will attempt to contact the manufacturer on Monday. The warranty is only for 90 days and this should have been a clue to me prior to purchasing a $140 piece of plastic..

My dogs, all rottweilers, loved the balls. They are really holding up considering all the use they have received. I plan on getting more if and when they wear out. They arrived very quickly, which was a plus.

My dogs seem to like the flavor of these vitamins, and the ingredients are what I desired; however, upon receipt almost a third of the tablets had crumbled and turned to powder in the bottle. They are within the valid use date, and I just think the packaging needs to be more protective if the tablets are this fragile. Will not re-purchase due to loss of usable product in shipping.
if u get the large one, you need large bags, which may be hard to find. but otherwise the small one works better.
Greenies are very muched loved as a tatsy Treat by are two small dogs!!! At 96 Chews they last a long time!!!

The squirrels don't really eat this unless they are very hungry and nothing else around. I feed everything, birds, deer, squirrels. (spoil em really) They will last about 3-4 months!! I use them in winter only. They hold up well in weather, rain, snow, etc, but won't get eaten unless desperate. I have seen the deer sniff at em and nibble a bit only. The same thing goes for the yellow corn ones.

I love the Mr. Herzher's Litter Pan cover we just purchased to cover our kitten's litter pan! Fast delivery, SUPER easy to put together, and the color is great! I wasn't expecting the material to be so "plastic-ey", but it does the job. Thank you!

In a household with 6 cats and lots of attitude urine gone is a must have item. When one of my elderly cats started urinating wherever she happened to be, I tried urine gone for the first time. It removed the smell from the carpets as well as the wood floor where it had seeped in. I tried a similar item from the pet store and it just didn't work as well. I always make sure I have urine gone on hand. I have been using it for over 7 years now. It works!

EDIT: 1/24/2012Unfortunately I've had to revise my review of this carrier. After a few months of use I posted that this carrier was 'perfect,' but I'm afraid I spoke too soon. After less than a year of use, the zippers on both of my pet taxis failed. The stitching didn't rip but the zippers themselves no longer seal allowing my cats to just push their way out of the carriers. Very disappointing after I was so impressed with this product.Further inspection shows me that the zippers are made of a rather flimsy plastic, not metal. One of my cats managed to push hard enough at the top of the carrier to 'burst' the zipper apart. My second cat figured it out after seeing the first escape. Now that they've learned they can do that, they continue to do so every time they're placed in their carriers. In light of this I've dropped my review from 5 to 3 stars. I enjoyed the perks of this product, but I'm not willing to repurchase since the lifetime of the pet taxi appears to be less than a year.Original review is below:-------------------------I've been using the same hard-sided plastic pet carrier since I had my first cat as a child. The thing was excellent, but everything has to go eventually, and I wanted to try something that would fold up nicely when not in use. I also wanted something that was easy to clean since not all of my cats have been good travelers. I was very wary of a soft-sided carrier, though, because I didn't want the animals to claw right through the mesh and escape. I was also worried about size, since the old carrier was big enough for 2 cats easily.I can't say enough about the petmate taxi. It looks great, works well, and the cats actually like it. I leave one out now because my cats like to sleep inside of it. I have two 14 lbs mainecoons and each one easily fits into this carrier with enough room to turn around. The top zipper is perfect for going to the vet or anywhere else stressful because I can stick my hand right in and comfort the cat. The case is very well ventilated and lets them see out and get plenty of air. The semirigid bottom is removable in case there is an accident, and is very comfortable for them. The should strap is a godsend, especially when both cats need to go somewhere.The case is lightweight and folds up to easy closet storage. No more shelf dedicated to holding the plastic carrier. The material is also pretty durable and we've had no rips or escapes yet, despite several uses. I can't promise that a determined cat won't get through, so don't use this as a 'crate' or anything like that, but for a carrier it's more than strong enough. All-in-all, 5 stars!
I bought this item a few weeks ago and only have been using it for 2-3 weeks tops. I used it correctly as an under the tank heater and one day it just decided to stop working.

My cats which I have 4 of,don't like this product at all. The only thing they use it for is the two youngest thinks it's a toy and they bat it around. It is dried fish. It looks just like fish and smells like it too. It was cheap to try and truthfully I got this just to get the free shipping anyway so no loss for me.

worked well, made the dog visable and float able ( did not test the float part too cold). We left it on the dog most of the 5 day canoe trip. One seam the stitches let loose. Need to repair, not a big deal but it should be made better

I have purchased two large orange Aqua Kong on a rope for use in the pool and, as much as I wanted to love the toy, it just did not stand up to my 95-pound (muscle, not fat) male German Shepherd. I raise and train German Shepherds in obedience and Schutzhund sport, so I see a lot of big dogs and talk frequently with their owners/trainers. There is another male Shepherd in our club who has played retrieve games with his Aqua Kong for a year, and that toy is still in great condition.My dog, on the other hand bites through the plastic "rope" in minutes. The rest of the toy lasted a month or so (with supervised play,) but the "float" inside the toy did not work well at all. I finally replaced it with a piece of foam cut from a pool "noodle." The next pool season, I bought a new Aqua Kong (I really wanted to love this toy!) -- this one didn't last even one day. I was taking photos of my dog running around the pool with the brand new toy, and he just bit off the top section -- no chewing or tugging, just the pressure of his bite.While I continue to think that Kong toys are, in general, among the very best on the market, I would not recommend this particular toy if you have a big dog with a strong, powerful bite. Buy the black Extreme Kong instead and hope that Kong will add an "extreme" water Kong to the line!

After applying this to my little shih tzu, he became very sick, agitated, and aggressive. He seemed to be unable to breathe properly and acted as if he were hallucinating. I googled the product and found HUNDREDS of reports of Hartz products killing and injuring dogs. They have been reprimanded by the EPA and contain harmful poisons. Yes, most flea and tick meds are literally pesticides, but other brands are much, much safer for your pet. I am outraged Hartz products are sold anywhere! For the safety of your beloved pet, google this before you purchase and apply this to any living creature. If you have applied it already, bathe the dog immediately with a powerful dish soap and contact your vet if it exhibits alarming symptoms.

I bought two of these bulbs at the same time and they were delivered in the same package. One quit working after only 8 days. The other is still working after 4 months. Based upon this, I will be looking for a different product for my birds (hopefully more reliable). The birds that have the working bulb, however, seem to enjoy when it's turned on.

Jack is really long in the body so if he flattens out he stretches over it. But he loves his bed and he knows it's his bed. The khaki gets dirty easy, but I haven't cleaned it yet. It does have a zipper to remove the cover. I really like it and it arrived quickly and well packaged. I simply unrolled it and Jack was all about it.

The innotek sd2100 does the trick on my two beagles. The collars have been going now for 3 months or more and holding a green flashing light. Great to not have to worry about batteries. It does what it is supposed to, when at the boundary it gives a beeping noise for two seconds and then commences to giving a progressive stimulation. The collars are easy to take on and off and since they are beagles with short hair I do not have the collar tight but loose and it seems to do ok. My dogs have not attempted to chew on them either. The hardest part for me was running the wire, since the ground around my house is pretty solid. I used a gas powered edger and it helped to water the ground before or during edging to keep down the dust and make a cleaner slice in the ground. I used the double loop method since I didn't want to boundary of the back of the house where the dogs will be coming out from. It took about one and a half 500 ft rolls.My two beagles got shocked 4 or 5 times each and then they got the idea to stay back from the flags. I have put them out without the collar on and they still stay away from the flags. I haven't gotten around to taking up all the flags yet, I'm wondering if there will be a problem when I do eventually. I spent about twice the prescribed time training them to stay back from the flags, just to give them a fair shot but it took a few stimulations to teach them that this is not a game we are playing. They got over the stimulations easily after a couple of minutes of being held. I took them to the center of the yard and comforted them, then I walked them around the perimeter to show them their was nothing to fear if they stayed inside the flags. It's working great and they are enjoying running all over the back yard chasing each other. I wished I could have avoided running the double loop because you have to keep the wires at least 6 feet apart from each other and it takes away from their play area, I thought about running the wire along the gutter line across the back of the house but was unsure how that would work and didn't much want to put the wire on the house in case of lightning. I got the lightning protector and it is working fine also, at least I guess it is. My dogs are 15 and 20 pounds and a year old, they were ready for the fence.I would not use it on a puppy younger than 6 mos.unless he is a big dog.

I found the product was not up to my expectations. For a large dog bed, the foam padding was very thin and I've found the larger the dog, the more support and cushion their joints need. Also The bed was pacakged in a way where it was folded in half, which only creased the bed and side bolster. The sherpa inside was nice and soft but the bed was labeled as XL large but for my 91 lb Doberman, it is not large enough.

I have a 70+ lbs labrador retriever mix dog and she pulls when she's on normal collar-leash. When I use Gentle Leader, it helped but she really doesn't like the Gentle Leader where it goes around her mouth-muzzle area. She always try to roll around on the grass area and try to paw her way out of it. When I put this Easy Walk Harness on her, it takes a while to really get the correct position as there are quite a number of adjustments to do.
