I was hoping these beds would keep both dogs up off the carpet and offer them comfort.

My cat is indoor and outdoor, so she keeps getting fleas no matter what we do indoors.Pro's:kills fleas and eggs, when it worksNo need for stinky, itchy flea collarSo far it's the safest option...Con's:Cat hates it, gets sick for a couple of days afterDoesn't work for 30 says, needs reapplication sometimes after 3 weeks (vet recommended)We keep her locked infor a few hours after, so she can't go wash it off in the rain. Regular brushing and combing also helps, as well as vacuuming furniture.

I read the reviews for this filter before I bought it, that's why I was so disappointed when mine didn't seem to work as well as described. Mine is noisy. I called Aquaclear and they were very nice and sent me a replacement impeller thinking that was the problem. But after replacing it, it was still noisy. I ordered another filter to see if it was just a dud, and the second one did the same thing.As far as function it works very well. Just wish mine was as quiet as everyone else's.

Blades are sharp and handles are easy even for arthritic hands to hold onto. Not a lot of pressure required to make the cut. A little less expensive than brands in the big pet stores, but not available in stores. Had to order online, but shipping was very reasonable.

I had no problems with this feeder for a while ( except for 2 of the circular pieces where the birds feed, fell out), then recently, I have had 2 dead birds trapped at the feeder within a week of each other. Two different species of bird - this feeder should be recalled - the birds heads get stuck inside and then the birds die!!!!!!!!!!

Possibly it's because we have goldens but this item does not give us the control we feel we need. Our dogs, while enjoying the brushing experience, still move a bit and the length of the brush makes it difficult to wield.
My dog loved this, but had popped the sqeaker within 3 days--and a little plastic piece fell out of the ball- It was fun while it lasted though!

This product is basically very good and does what they advertise. I've used both buttons(tone&stimulation)with success. I try to use only tone and have found it works great. My dogs respond to the tone but on occasion I have had to use the other. The problems with this product are as follows; 1)the buttons stick..and if your in stimulation mode can cause pain for the dog(and anxiety for you). 2)The batteries go fast so turn the unit off if you're not training. 3)The collar is NOT waterproof. My dog loves playing in the sprinkler..when she's done so is the collar and it's off to the store to buy another $100 unit. Overall I recommend it. A lower price would be nice :)

Orbee toys have quickly become a favorite for both our six year old Old English Bulldog Harley and his partner in crime a six month old puppy of the same breed named Elvis. If you look at the 10 most wanted list in any post office you're bound see our two Bullies posted as the worst crimminal "Aggressive Chewers"The material used to make these toys is quite unique in that it's softer and more pliable then Kong toys - another favorite.Yet despite the softness Orbee toys hold up well - although like any toy for aggressive chewers they're not indestructible.This ball is well designed with the pooch in mind - and for us, that's a huge plus.1) The large ball attached to a smaller one makes this toy perfect for most any size breed.2) The 3 Dimensional raised parts of the globe are made of a denser material.These raised textured parts add extra chomping ecstasy while massaging gums and cleaning tarter of their teeth - great for teething pups!3) Being hollow - you can really crank up the crazy.Just add a cookie, treat of even the filler made by Kong. Which I'm pleased to see has a new protein based formula free of gluten.4) Excellent quality - the rubber is nice and thick. The unique shape makes this toy easy for your pooch to hold with their paws and chomp away.5) This is in every way a "dual purpose" as it works just as well as standard "Ball" and "chew toy" so you get two toys in - a great design.The pink and blue is certainly eye catching which no doubt is irrelevant to our beloved dogs. But the bright colors and fun contrast make these easy to find under sofas, chairs and tables. All the places dogs LOVE to roll these just to watch us go the through the misery of laying down on our stomachs to fish them out for them.Like all toys of this nature - play time should be supervised.Should a rip or tear occur it's time to retire the Orbee to that vast burial ground of half chewed Nylabones and once adorable and cute stuffed bunnies and other critters - that now resemble road kill.This Orbee Tuff large toy offers hours of fun at a very affordable price. We've learned (the hard way) to buy two of each toy - in order to save the world from full blown Bulldog Armageddon.At these discounted prices these are a must have dog toy.These also qualify for Prime so lightening fast two day shipping is 100% free.Making these toys even more affordable. Perhaps more importantly getting these toys into the waiting jaws of our beloved dogs who have us wrapped around their little toes.5 PAWS UP!
This is a very small toy. I paid 8.99 for it and I feel it should be more like 3 dollars since it is so small. The puppy likes to play with it but she will outgrow very soon since it is sooo small.

I am using this as a gate for an archway between my kitchen and the rest of the house, for a small puggle. It is easy to install, took 5 mintes. The slots are wide. First day i had it up my dog (puggle 15 weeks) got her head stuck in it, 2nd day she got all the way thorugh. Had to place extra rods in the space to stop her from getting stuck again. Works because it is cheep and extra wide, but if you have a small dog/cat or baby.. be careful. They wil get stuck

I bought this at the recommendation of a friend. I have been using a baby gate for years now in my kitchen but wanted to give my Cavalier King Charles Spaniel more room. I want her to be able to go wherever we have no carpeting but there are so many doorways to gate off so she has been limited to a small part of the kitchen. That has been a nuisance for us because it's a high traffic area so opening & shutting the gate is a pain. One opening into the living room is just too big for a gate so I felt I had no other options.Then I received my new Pawz Away Instant barrier. I have 2 door ways I wanted to stop her at so I bought an extra barrier. I set them on the floor where I didn't want her to pass. She only had to be corrected once! At first I had it at the lowest setting so she didn't hear the warning soon enough & she ran right through. But after I turned it up she has stayed exactly where I want her to be. Even though she's a really sensitive dog she seems comfortable with the barrier system. I was afraid she'd become fearful of going anywhere near it but she has no problem with using all the space she's allowed. If I'm in the area I don't even bother putting on the collar now.I wish I had gotten one of these long ago!

I have a long hair Chihuahua, and she had horrible stains around her eyes, I've tried several different products with no results. I started using Angel Eyes two months ago, and those nasty stains are gone. Finally I got a product that really works.

Pro: works just like they say. No smell, little mess.Con: With 2 cats this barely lasts 8 days before I have to change the entire thing. If you read the other reviews you will see the same thing repeated. Even 1 cat households do not make it a month. There is only so much liquid the crystals can deal with before they stop working.This is now my vacation litter box. It is too expensive to use daily. I am going back to scooping.

Well, I read a few reviews and gotta admit that I was sold based on the manufacturers words rather than the folks who bought the product. Sure it warms up (and "warm" is really being generous) but it just doesn't stay warm, especially for outside use. My inside cat sat on it once (after I put pressure on the unit to get it to warm up) and my cat (who is super arthritic and loves heat) jumped right off. It just wasn't warm. I bought two extra pads for the ferals I take care of outside but we'll see. The cord is a good construction and nice and long. The pad cover is a good design, easy to remove/clean and soft. But, it's the actual function of the pad that sold me and it just doesn't deliver. The ferals may prefer their straw than the boxes with the pads. Will keep you posted but for the amount of money, I wouldn't buy this product again. I recommend you save your money and try something else.

My 60-lb, 7-month-old Old English Sheepdog puppy and I only play retrieve with this ball. She has a soft (very gentle) mouth, and is not a chewer. We have not had this soccer ball very long, and it is already tearing at the large (manufactured) hole. I gave it 3 stars because it is a fun toy to play with, but it gets zero stars for durability.

I live in an apartment and decided to give this a try. It's easy to clean the litter because you just roll it over and the clumps are collected in a removable tray. I only had room in the bathroom to put a litter box, just between the toilet and tub. Because of how packed in it was, rolling the litter box was not that easy. If you have enough room to roll it over easily, this is a great product. But, if you don't have much room then rolling it will be a problem, so you may want to check out other options.
I have 2 of these and love them .. except when the puppy plays in the bowl! .

The cover came right off of this bed in very little time. However, we used it all winter for our outdoor cat who sleeps in the garage. Our dog also used it when he was in the garage. After about five months now it still works fine. It is very dirty and can't really be washed, but since it's in the garage we don't mind too much. Generally a good purchase. Hope it holds up for another winter.

I use this to attract pigeons to my window so my cat is entertained (we don't have "normal" birds around here). They seem to enjoy it! I bought a cage to put these in, and be warned, if left out, it will mold and stain concrete window sills!
I may install this later. The problem is the tiny hose that gets kinked easily in the gravel. Perhaps this was meant to be installed in fine substrate!!!

My baby is very a lazy, non-frisky, over-affectionate type of cat. She's not old or fat, just lazy. Her idea of exercise is to squirm around on her back while humans pet her tummy. She completely ignored this thing at first, but after a few minutes she started playing with it when I held it directly over her head. She still prefers sleeping to da bird. But she'll happily try to grab for it (and she tries to eat the feathers) as long as I hold it right next to her. She usually goes back to ignoring it after a couple of minutes. This is more success than I've had with any other toy. I did see the earlier reviews about the fiberglass on the stick - I've been holding the stick with a cloth or heavy duty rubber glove.
The collar does not work that well. It does not spray all the time when barking.

... especially if you want your feeder to hang OFF your deck rather than OVER it. Due to the way the rail overhang is structured on our deck (with the lip for the mount facing out) the only way to position the pole is OVER the deck -- the birds come and create an unholy mess that we'd much prefer having drop below (off the deck) out of sight and mind. This would not be an issue had the unit been designed to swivel. Alas, it is a fixed position unit so we are stuck using this to hang a potted plant.Further, this mount is suitable for small feeders ONLY.Glad it wasn't too expensive and because it is well built, it does make for a decent pot hanger...
it made loud noises and we had to fill it all the time. the cats stopped drinking out of it.

I was so excited to get this gate based on the reviews. I just got 2 dachshund puppies and the girl is well-adjusted and remains in the gate. The boy, however, has severe separation anxiety and will do just about anything to get out of a confined area and find me. With the 8-sided arrangement, even with the gate door locked tightly, he was able to pull it open and squeeze through. If the gate is against a wall, he uses his teeth to drag the panels close together so he can scale up the 2 adjacent sides. He did ok for a day or two when I changed it to 5-sided, but then he figured that out also. Same with a 4-sided (pulls it into a diamond shape). Even now as I'm typing (sitting on the couch no more than 10 feet from them) I have it in a 4-sided arrangement against a wall, and no less than 40lbs anchoring each exposed side, and he is still able to drag it around a little bit. If I just have the girl in there, she does great, so I think it is just this particular dog that has issues (he even chewed through two of the wire rods on the side of a plastic crate and squeezed through the openening).

We have an 8 month old beagle mix. We were given a bag of Science Diet when we brought her home from the shelter and she wouldn't eat that. My daughter picked up a bag of Iam's puppy food and that's what we were giving her the first month. Her poops smelled so bad from day one when we got her and didn't improve on the Iam's. She seemed to have consistently runny poops as well. She was also constantly itchy and scratching at herself. We switched to Wellness puppy food and after the initial introduction for her to get used to that brand we haven't looked back. She loves it! She is now on the adult formula even though she's not quite a year old (read that beagles should be switched over to adult food at about 6 months because they have reached their full height).We are finishing up her second bag on the adult formula and she is looking beautiful, sleek and healthy. We have so many people comment about how pretty she is and, especially, how soft her fur is. Her poops rarely smell and when they do it is usually because she was given new treats/snacks or one she hasn't had in awhile.I have seen some reviews (mostly from the puppy formula) with people complaining about runny stools but it is important to gradually get your dog used to any new dog food and gradually build up the amount by mixing it with the dog food you are replacing. We even did this when we switched from the puppy to adult formula even though it probably wasn't as necessary to do that as both were the lamb formulas.She's full of energy and very happy and seems to love her dog food as she always eats it up and sometimes will carry in her bowl looking for seconds!!Also love how fast this company ships out the dog food too! Whoever was selling the puppy chow would take awhile for it to arrive but this one usually shows up in a day or two. Do wish this was available at our local market though!
My pack loved it, chewed the face off in the first hour and ate the speaker. I hope the frog fares better.
I love the product, unfortunately this is the second one we have bought because the 1st one stopped working. But it is an essential appliance in our house.

VERY DISAPPOINTED....We had one of these dog food bins about 10 years ago (same manufacturer) and it was great.. they have obviously cheapened the entire product, the trap door won't stay shut and the dog food falls out the minute you fill it.. we ended up putting a door latch on the trap door to hold it shut because unfortunately we realized that it was a cheap setup AFTER we mounted it to the wall..
My cat doesn't care for K/d or Iams renal diet, but she'll eat this! I'm glad to have found it.

I recently purchased this habitat to house Fire Belly Toads. What sold me was the split level flooring, allowing for a part land and water enclosure.I love the split level flooring, it definitely works great for creating a half water/land environment. There is plenty of room in the front lower half for two small/medium sized decorations and some fake low lying aquarium plants. Another highlight is that the 'Tetra ReptoFilter For Frogs, Newts & Turtles' is a PERFECT fit on either side of the split level floor (far right or left back corner). This is extremely convenient and a small fake aquarium plant will conveniently hide the filter from view and silence the 'splash'. The 'land' portion of the habitat comes with a removable plastic 'tree trunk' hideaway and two feeding bowls in the shape of two leaves (that can attach to the trunk). I chose to use only one for dropping in the occassional waxworm the other we just tucked away.There is very little to like about the lid for this habitat. It can be difficult to open and it certainly makes feeding time more 'interesting' (you have to lift up the entire lid to get anything in there). At the same time, I do like that the lid has no movable parts and is difficult to remove because it means our 4 and 7 year old are less likely to let critters (frogs and/or their food) escape. It also ensures that they aren't placing items into the tank that don't belong in there, since the habitat is in their bedroom. The mesh wire top is nice but you'll need to avoid purchasing 'teeny tiny' crickets as they will find their way out (medium and large sized are fine). I don't understand the big 'rounded' part of the lid. This is where the 'not included' light should reside and the packaging claims it will fit most florescent light fixtures... however, I have no idea how a light would stay suspended within this hollowed out space (there is no hardware included) nor have I found a light that appears to be a good fit for this lid. As a result, I simply have a small external light resting on the outside of the mesh screen cover.What I don't like about this habitat is that the the plastic scratches very easily. In fact, mine was already all scratched up on the inside though I didn't notice until I had finished decorating my habitat (without contrasting colors I couldn't see the scuff marks). I have a feeling that this was a used habitat as I was very careful with adding in the aquarium gravel (I bought my habitat from a Petsmart store, not this seller). I also dislike that the big bulbous and non-functional part of the lid get's in the way of viewing the habitat! We have this up on the kids dresser and even the little one has to bend down to look inside. You don't realize this to be a problem when holding the product at eye level or from any of the well angled pictures shown of the habitat. If the lid was slightly better in design this would definitely be a 4 or 5 star review. That said, I still recommend this as a great starter kit for anyone who is looking to set up an impressive Fire Belly Toad habitat with minimal effort. 5 Fire Belly Toads will fit fine in the large Habitat and there is plenty of water to throw in a few feeder fish (we have 6 minnows in ours), nothing fancy since they may wind up a snack.

got thisfor my rabbit because she was chewing the metal of our old water bottle (to the chagrin of my lady). diameter of hole is pretty huge tho, and she tended to spill half the water on her head. notreally a problem, but she'd go through a full container once a day, which made me worried she wouldnt have any water while i was away at school.

Very nice product. The pets cant get into them and the food stays fresh. This way i can have my cat and dog food in the landry room and not in the garage so its easier. The wheels help too when needing to move the bins for cleaning and such. Would recommend 100%

I had this product last year and it worked wonderful. Don't know that it came from the same company but I do know that we had 2 weeks left before our dog was due for her next dose and was finding ticks stuck. I also noticed that on these boxes there are no expiration dates and the ones I bought last year there were so I am wondering if they are out dated or what is the problem this time!
This comb works very well and even works on our very fussy cat!!Catches a lot of fleas very quickly...

I have tried all kinds of hay, especially timothy of various brands, since that's supposed to be the best for rabbits. How much money I've wasted! Even with the herbs in it, they turn up their noses at any kind of timothy. Same story with numerous other kinds of hay until I found the Oxbow oat hay. They love it, and munch it on and off all day long. Occasionally we'll get some bags that are a green cut of the oat hay and they'll look at me like "Hey-ho, what's THIS?!" (if you have rabbits, you know that look). Apparently, they only deign to dine on yellow oat hay. So try the yellow if your buns won't eat the green, or vice versa. My local Petsmart now carries the oat hay, but I order it from various places online since it's about half the price and I have to order their pellet food online anyway. Just wish it came in bigger bags like the timothy does, since they go through it quite rapidly!
I have used this many times during water changes on my 75 gallon aquarium and it works great! I will always keep a bottle of this around.

Awhile ago I had ordered the smaller peek-a-prize pet toy box. My 2 kitties loved it but I wish I would have ordered this larger size instead. More fun for them. Now I have one upstairs and downstairs. I only put pingpong balls in the box and they have so much fun getting them out and then chasing them around the house. I like this size also because there is more room for them to lay on top of it. I really love the SmartCat toys.

Well there isn't much to add that hasn't been covered already, so I'll contribute what I can. This is far and away the highest quality cage on the market. The Marshall version appears to be the same or extremely similar, but as I haven't seen one in person I can't be sure.The main cage panels (doors, sides, rear and top panels) are finished with what appears to be a base powder-coat with a blue-grey painted finish. The remaining panels (shelves and main floors) are finished with a heavy-duty paint that has the look and feel of a vinyl coating.Construction is very straightforward, although the directions may leave something to be desired for anyone not accustomed to do-it-yourself style projects. Yes this cage can be put together by one person - although an assistant would make it infinitely easier. It took me just under an hour to complete. Which brings up a few important details: The cage in the package is about 100 lbs. (45 Kg). Unless you can manage that weight by yourself, you will need some help. Also, the primary panels (doors, sides, back, etc) that create the frame of the entire cage have threaded openings in various locations. These are used to secure machine screws that hold everything together. While the openings and all components lined up properly, I ran into a couple threaded openings that were painted over. As a result, it took considerably more effort to tighten those screws properly. I suggest that most people use a cordless drill/driver on those screws (and only those - handle the rest by hand).Aside from these rather minor things I'm very impressed with the quality. For roughly $200 you expect a certain, minimum level of quality and this cage definitely has it and then some. Even before it's put together, each component feels solid and well built. Once constructed, it feels virtually bomb-proof. I'm very satisfied with it and so are my 2 girls who call it home. Massive amount of space inside especially with the full-width doors.If you're serious about caring for your ferrets, look no further.

The product helped the older larger dogs a LOT more than what was offered locally or at the vet, but didn't kill ALL the fleas. I was just grateful that they were no longer scratching 24/7. However, when we treated Mom's 9 pound, 9 month old Yorkie-poo he had a severe reaction and went into shock and we thought we were going to lose him. He lived thanks to the vets suggestions. I'd test with a drop and wait at least 4-5 hours to make sure yours can tolerate it because it can't be thoroughly removed from their systems. If a reaction occurs you need to bathe them immediately with lots of soap and water to dilute what's on the skin and hasn't been absorbed, encourage them to drink lots of water, and keep them walking and awake until they start to rebound from the effects. As far as our vet knew, there is nothing else that can be done to save a pet from a severe reaction to any of the drops that are out, so treat them like you would yourself with any chemical you put on your skin and just try a tiny bit first.

This is an excellent product and a good price compared to what I can find locally. It is shipped timely and by ordering 4 at a time I can save around $15. My vet recommends this spray as relatively harmless and says I can use it daily if needed. I have 5 dogs and summers here in South Texas are rife with fleas.

Melinda Lucas has it exactly correct. The new Petromalt formulation for cats is horrible. Purchased 6, 4.4 oz. tubes on Oct 1, 2011, assuming (incorrectly) that I was getting the "Real McCoy". I would have given this new formulation zero stars if possible. Have been using Petromalt for decades, and my cats would beg for it as soon as they saw the tube. They won't touch the new formulation which is a drastically different chemical cocktail. My neighbors cats won't touch it either, and they have also used the previous formulation with great success. Sentry gave no indication on the packaging that it was a new formulation. The packaging states "The Original Hairball Relief for Cats". This is not the original by any means, but I doubt that they can be legally taken to task. I will no longer purchase any Sergeant's Pet Care Products. The hunt is now on for an alternate.

I ordered this unit as a replacement for an older unit (to be truthful, I have had several over a period of 8 years). It takes about a half hour to assemble the unit. Now I have to call Amazon and have a replacement sent, and use that packaging to return this unit. In addition, I don't think the unit will even fit in the box because of the rake being raised at the front of the unit. Lots of variables will throw the smooth operation of the unit off, many of the problems have been mentioned in the users' reviews. But for the money you get a good deal. That was, for me, up until today!

It was a alright toy for the price my dog liked it she tore it up in two days ow well

**************AUGUST 2010 update: ADD 1/4 CAT'S PRIDE FOR PERFECT FUNCTIONING OF LITTER MAIDs. Cat's Pride is an unconventional brand of cat litter that is lighter and clumps harder. So if you use 3 scoops of conventional cat litter + 1 scoop Cat's Pride--this results in extra-clean functioning of a Litter Maid. In my experience the best conventional cat litter is Scoop Away. The worst (most gooey) is Fresh Step. However perhaps when adding Cat's Pride this doesn't matter. Currently I use 1/4 Cat's Pride + 3/4 Best Friends (Price Chopper brand). Adding Cat's Pride almost eliminates gooing up the rake. However too much Cat's Pride will stick hard to the bottom. After experimenting, I find that 1/4 Cat's Pride works best.**************I suspect that the few reviewers who like this Elite LitterMaid may be feeding their cats only dry food, which in my experience makes for a short and uncomfortable life. The rake scrapes right along the bottom. Result: almost every time a cat makes a pee, it is going to jam.Try yourself living on crackers and jerky and see what happens to your skin and pancreas. A tablespoon of dry food daily with 'tarter control' is good for their teeth, but otherwise, give your cats only fresh or canned food please. Walmart and most supermarkets have a house brand of canned pet food that is not expensive.The steel rake could have made this the best LitterMaid--but instead it's the worst. Also Amazon currently has the wrong description.Usually, a LitterMaid works as best as can be expected at a reasonable price. Only problems: 1. Rake clogs. 2. Any cat box must be scraped. 3. LitterMaid's manufacturer is in denial that the box must be scraped.So, I was hopeful about this model with a stainless steel rake. But, while improving this feature, they insisted on changing the rake motion. So as I say, when the cat pees, the rake jams.Also, with all LitterMaids, you need to be careful when you remove the waste bin. The lip can snap at you, flinging cat litter in the eye. With this model, the lip of the waste bin fits very snugly and is an extra nuisance to replace.Also the current Amazon description reads:"Self-cleaning litter box for extra-large cats..."Even if this 'elite' model worked properly, it is definately not for 'extra-large cats.' You may risk them shooting over the sides. I got this at Target for $[...]. I took it back. Walmart has a slightly bigger all-plastic one for $[...]. However Amazon currently has the largerLitterMaid LM900for only $[...] with free shipping. In my opinion, this is worth the few extra dollars. Perhaps your current cats are small, but a LitterMaid can last several cat generations. Also, the larger the box, the more leeway you have to be lazy in the scraping.I personally like most LitterMaids because, if you have a minimum of 2 of them, plus one per cat, then usually you can ignore the cat box when you feel like it. Using scoopable cat litter also produces much less waste than old-fashioned cat litter.Notes.1. RE-USING THE 'DISPOSABLE' WASTE BIN. The same oblong waste bins seems to fit all Litter Maid models. They are made of flimsy frosted plastic but with slight care, each one can last for months. If you throw them away after each use--where are you going to throw them? With or without these bins, a double-lined trash can is needed. There is no point to throwing them out with each use.2. There is also no point to using the waste bin covers at all. All these do is get in the way.3. LITTER STICKING TO WASTE BINS? If so, in the bottom of the bin place one or two folded sheets of newspaper, creased at each fold, so as not to unfold. The newspaper prevents sticking to the waste bin.

My dogs are both pullers (large aussie mix and a greater swiss mountain dog). This harness is great for smaller dogs, but mine are 70 and 110bs. I got a dog trainer and we use springer prong collars. A few jerks with that and your dog will not get out of hand! We literally had them at our sides and under control in less than a hour. I must say that you should have a professional teach you how to use a prong collar correctly. I won't let my mom use it when she takes one of them for a walk because she's a spaz with it and incorrect use can hurt the dog and confuse them.

BUT-----and I should preface this with it just may be my cats----this is so light weight that when one of my cats would try to enter, it would roll, shift and move and he wouldn't go through. LOVED the idea, but at least for my "fearless" wonders, they wouldn't go anywhere near it. Also my "kids" are a little bigger and the hole isn't that large to comfortably accommodate them.

I have a dog that chews everything relentlessly. Spraying with Bitter Apple will slow him down but it certainly does not stop him. I tried spraying the cords from my computer with it to discourage my foster kittens from playing with them and disconnecting my system. Alas, it did no good. Yuck!

It says organic , but even compared to the regular , (which all my cats have always preferred) this stuff brings out the beast like it's laced with PCB . Not always available , try some and you'll find yourself rationing it for special occasions .

I have two cats: one sweet and mellow and the other normally a grouch. The sweet cat is still sweet and the grouchy cat is still grouchy. FAIRLY EASY TO PUT TOGETHER BUT HAS AN ODOR SO LEAVE IT OUT FOR A WHILE BEFORE PUTTING THE DOG IN IT. NOT TOO STRONG BUT EASY TO KEEP IN THE BACK OF AN SUV. GOOD FOR TEMPORARY USE LIKE WHEN YOU VISIT SOMEONE.

This is good stuff. I treated my pets and then my whole house. It doesn't get rid of every single flea for the whole seven months but it does work well. I bought some stuff for my yard that will help tremendously. It does have a smell but it goes away in a few hours.

The sticky tabs that came with the product doesnt work well. After a couple of rubs from my 16 LBS kitty, it was knocked off the wall. The cat likes it but still prefers the fish tank filter. Its a bit noisy but anything w/ a motor will be.

I bought one of these almost 5 years ago. I just now need to replace it. It is the best litter box. No mess, no icky scoop, no litter kicked all around. It's so easy my kids don't even mind cleaning it. I highly recommend it.
works great to help desolve the crystals in urin which make our cats feel better, very affordable and well worth it.

Bag seems to run small, I ordered a size Small based on the dimensions that are required by the airline service and of my dog (which is only 10 pounds) and he could not fit inside this bag. I bought this item for two kitten. Kitten 1 got used to it right away for urine, but refused to use it for feces. Kitten 2 climbed in, ate some of the special $30 flush-able litter you have to buy for this item, and never went back. We ended up with a messy bathroom, some urine-stained cushions and fairly unhappy cats.Both cats were 5 months when we started this and 7 months when we gave up.

I bought this playpen to use for my chinchilla. He is a bit of an escape artist but hasn't been able to figure out how to get out of this playpen. It's small enough to fit into the smaller rooms of my house, yet big enough for me to sit inside the playpen with him. He really likes it when I sit inside with him. I always use it with supervision but don't seem to have any problems. I've been using it for a few weeks now and am happy with it.

I do like that this managed to both clump and not be made out of clay, so in that regard it's great. But it seems corn is about the dustiest material you can make cat litter out of, because it is absolutely not dust free as claimed. A cloud of dust rises whenever the litter is slightly disturbed. In adition it smells "all natural" - like weird, food-y corn smell that then gets mixed with the smell of cat urine, which it's not very good at masking. It didn't track terribly and my cats used it readily. But I think the best clumping non-clay cat litter is Scientific Professional cat litter, so this one isn't the world's best after all.

This cube has an opening to the inside on each of its sides: 6 sides, 6 openings. For an easily bored dog, this toy doesn't last long to hold interest with this many openings. So, I sewed closed 4 openings completely and 1 opening only partially. As a result, that leaves 1 opening untouched and 1 opening partially closed. After this modification, I placed treats and many small plush toys into the cube.My 6yr old maltese and 2yr old poodle mix were entertained longer because the cube was a challenge for them to find the treats. My maltese found out that removing the toys helped him find the treats better. My poodle mix has a long nose and he navigates between the toys within the cube to find the treats. Both can be heavy chewers especially when bored, so I usually keep the cube stored away if I'm not present.As always, they now get alot of exercise with this cube by rolling the cube, digging at it, burying their face into it, throwing it around (hoping for the treats to fall out), yanking the toys out.
Although I followed directions on measuring & ordered accordinglyIt is too tight for our golden retriever & not a lot of adjustingCan be done. Should have been a size larger which was not offered.

Why oh why did we not listen to the reviews before purchasing this for our son???!!! Jellyfishes DO NOT FLOAT! Directions say you have to clear bubbles out of the jellys but when you turn it on, bubbles automatically come out from the bottom to make them "swim". So you have bubbles to beat off them again. Not to mention that you have to turn it off & unplug the thing to take the top off!I called the company who suggested using dish detergent in the water! The last I checked, dish detergent created bubbles...the one thing the manual said to get rid of! On top of that, they would not talk further about giving us our money back! They believe that this is enough to solve the problem and that they would not give out refunds for this product!!!

So far I have not seen a difference in my husky's limping. She seemsto be getting worse,instead of better. I'm puzzled, and will continue to check with the vet....Hope this helps you, but it hasn't helped my girl.

I brought our cat "Mittens" to the local veterinarian because he had recently started urinating on our walls. I assumed that he had a urinary tract infection. The veterinarian ran a series of tests, than after presenting me with a bill for $350, told me that there was nothing wrong with our cat, other than anxiety.She recommended that I try using this product, along with another one called Feliway Diffuser, a plug-in device that emits a synthetic copy of your cat’s natural facial pheromone. Between the two products, my cat has resumed using the litter box exclusively. Obviously, it's hard to say if it's one or the other product, or both that have resolved the problem, but I can say that it's a pleasure to no longer have to clean urine off of the walls and carpeting. If you have a cat that's urinating outside the litter box, try this product and the diffuser before spending hundreds of dollars on tests that may prove to be unnecessary.
This has a different exterior feel than others, slick. Great bounce which sends my corgi chasing. Thrilled that it is a 5 out of 5 as my dog is a toy eater.

I bought the Big Brute chewman toy for my dog because she seems to chew through everything pretty quickly. Arrived two weeks ago; have had in soapy water since then, but can't get rid of the stickum used to hold sticker to bottom of food/water surface. Throwing it in the garbage tonight.

Littermaid Elite is not so great. For the price I am still scooping out.Takes too long too sccop out and does not scoop out everything. I have a small dog and by the time the rake starts working the dog has already gotten into the box. Rake should be made longer to scoop out everything.

I loved these dishes when I first bought them for my outdoor ferals. No ants and it save me $$, no more wasting food. One year later, and they don't work as well anymore. it's hard to tell if it's working, so i sometimes feed the fish. of course, this negates the purpose of the automatic feeder. i would not recommend it.

My wife takes walks in the summer for exercise. She takes this along just in case, and feels all the better for having it. Good price, easy to use and carry.

I bought this item for my 2 year old Shepherd for correction of her aggressiveness towards other dog and bikers. I tested the stimulation on my foot to see how uncomfortable it can cause. At level 3, it's enought for me to hate it. At 6, I got two points of burn sores--though very light. I was stupid enough to press the button while setting it to level 6 to see the effect on my own. It hurts like hell! However, the thing I am complaining is that it's very hard to fit my dog's neck well without being either too tight--uncomfortable for her or too loose--helpless and without any effect. I unleashed my dog at a college campus and sat there to supervise her. She went to smell some cake or cookie crumbs on the ground and started to eat. I pressed the button with level 3 on. No effect whatsoever. I kept pressing, nothing happened and my dog ate one piece already. I could have used my voice command loud to stop her. I thought it was not strong enough so I set it to 6. Nothing happened. Then I had to ran towards my dog & say "NO"...that stopped it. A minute later she walked towards the food again. I used both voice command and the remote--and this time the stimulation worked (in a delayed manner). It worked at the time when my dog turned away from the food :( AND guess what, it caused my dog scream in pain and jump!! What the heck!! My poor dog had to suffer this unnecessary and unstable and untiming shock?!! If she were to run out of the street full of traffic, before the signal reaches her, she'd be in an accident already. This is very bad!I just figured out that it's probably because the hair was in the way so the metal doesn't tough her skin. Lucky that they provide another set of metal with smaller and longer end probes. I haven't tried it yet though I have switched. I guess this thhing works better for short hair or no hair dogs. Also it works while my dog was like 80-100 yards away--that's why it deserves a 3 star.PLEASE TEST ON YOUR OWN FIRST BEFORE GIVING IT TO YOUR DOG!!! I never go beyond number 4 to make correction from now on. Even pitbull probably can't take level 6!

I had one of the original dog doors from before this company changed hands, it was solid grey, with no window. Lighter weight, and didn't seem to seal as well.This is my third one - building a dog door for my patio slider. The basics are still there - but much more flimsy then the brown one. I'll use it, but its just sad that the quality isn't what it used to be. I'd pay more for better quality.
These are the best pee pads I have tried. They suck up anything very quickly and dry well. I can get more than one mess on it before having to throw them out.

Well, I don't know if these do anything or not. Never really tried it without. Sometimes I can smell the litter when the cleaning process opens the lid of the bin, but only for a couple of minutes. Often these filters don't stay stuck on the top and fall into the bin. I don't know if that matters, it should still be absorbing odor, but that is my only issue.

The stainless steel cage that holds the suet is nice and truly stainless steel. I was worried squirrels would open it as it does not seal very fully so I added a small clip.The most disappointing thing about this is that the chain it comes with is notthe same stainless steel and is not as shiny and attractive (seems to be tarnishing). The hooks that come on the chain are rusting. Working with the hooks and the eyelets was a little awkward and I broke out some pliers.
This is a single ply foam sleeve that is a little tight on my Magnum HOT. It works fine. Nothing special.
I love this dress but I had to return it because it was too small for my 3.8lb Yorkie. The return process was very easy.
I found this to be a great deal. it is a great product and I actually need to order some more now. If you are thinking about buying this ...go ahead. Good deal and this is what my vet sells.

I kennel my dogs at night when they go to bed. I've tried tons of different beds that fit into the kennels...and usually my dogs chew them up, or scrunch them out of the way. For whatever reason, this bed hasn't gotten that treatment. Also, it is well made, yet soft. Bottom line is that the dog is happy, so I'm happy!

After the Fluval carbon was no longer available I switched to the Marineland. I found the Marineland to be far dustier. I have to rinse it significantly longer before use. Until Fluval carbon becomes available again this will work.

It's pretty flimsy for the price. One of my cats took to it just fine while the other completely freaked out. She couldn't stand to sit on it because it was flimsy. We just got her back to where she will use the cat box again instead of the floor. I might try it again some other time and tweak the method a little so she can ease into it better.
Gets the job done. Wished it lasted longer and it wasn't so expensive. If the cost was cut in half, or it lasted twice as long, this would get 5 stars.
for the price I paid, I should have gotten the dog gone smart brand, this was not as plush as the pic shows, after a couple of months its flat already......
Love this product. My guinea loves her bedding and this is a great package for the price.. Will order again
chair squeaks - sprays my doganother dog barks - sprays my dog.this collar has turned my dog into a neurotic mess.

Comfort Zone Feliway has worked wonders for our very shy and formerly abused cat! He has worked through his "bad habits" caused by anxiety and is much more sociable. I have recommended this product to all my cat owning friends and they report equally good results.

I ordered 3 packages of this and one of them was made mostly up of alfalfa flakes, not hay. My guinea pigs didnot seem interested in eating the flakes, so I went through that bale very quickly. I guess it served as extra bedding.

I bought this thinking my babies would absolutely adore it but to my shock they did not even get curious like they do with everything. I kept it around the house just until my return date was due on Amazon to see if they would warm up to it but they didn't.The only reason i did not give this a one star is because it really is a good price for what you are buying and of course just like humans not all animals are the same and don't like the same things. This might work perfectly for someone else but for my family it didn't.Hard to say if i recommend this because i don't consider my cats fussy so i guess its kind of a gamble whoever orders it.

I recently started feeding the birds in my neighborhood and put up some little bird houses and some feeders around. I bought this feeder because it would bring the birds to my window and let me watch them up close.The feeder is a bit small and it took a while for the birds to figure out how to get into it. I would put seeds around the feeder just to attract them towards the general area. After they figured it out, then all the birds flocked to the feeder. It was great, I would refill the feeder every other day and the birds were happy as frogs.After a few weeks the feeder started to split down the middle. Unfortunately it has split completely in half and I am using duct tape to keep it together. I think that it's not a design flaw, but whomever put it together before they shipped it to me did a poor job. In any case, I will probably order another one just because with all the duct tape the feeder looks pretty ugly right now. So I'll get another one. If it's not put together right this time, I will send it straight back and get a refund.Oh yeah, this must be designed for small birds like sparrows. Some blue jays and cardinals have come to mine from time to time, but they seem agitated because it's hard for them to get into the feeder. It's really funny watching the little sparrows get into the feeder and guard their food like gladiators!

I used this on my cat just like the directions said. For 24 hours any time someone would touch the area that the flea medicine was distributed, she would freeze, then run under the bed. This product caused her to be very sensitive, and definetely not acting like herself, so we washed it off with dish soap and the symptoms slowly disappeared. I read the other comments of what this product has done to cats and I guess my cat is one of the lucky ones.I am now currently looking on line for non-chemical, more natural remedies....after all my cat went through, this product didn't even get rid of the fleas.

This bird feeder worked great for about the first 2 years I owned it, however now, the roof leaks water through the holes that you can hang it with, and the wood on the side has cracked and that now allows rain/bugs to get inside the feeder and ruin the seed. Looking to replace this with a metal/plastic unit that won't split and that has better roof overhang.

Bought this for a 50 pound dog who is not a tough chewer, the dog managed to get a small piece off and left teeth marks in the "bone" part of the rib.No suggested for dogs who chew anything other then extremely lightly. Not sure why the sell a large version of the toy without making it tougher. Oh well, if you are buying this toy for a medium-hard chewer I suggest : Galileo Bone Souper or Nylabone Big Chews

purchased this for crate training our puppy.the adjustable inside panel is wonderful. puppy is growing sooo fast and being able to custom size the interior space for him is fantastic! we like the fact that the crate folds flat if we need to get it out of the way too. great price here also. shopped around for this and this price was half of some other places.(and if you are shopping around for dog crates you know how expensive they can be)we couldn't be happier with our choice. and our dog likes it too!

My dog will get a treat out if I stuff it in the gripper, but otherwise ignores it completely. The best use I've found for it is holding ice cubes from the dispenser in the freezer door, the pup likes the cubes and putting them in the gripper makes it a little more interesting. It can also hold Greenies, which our dog then takes out and hides in a corner or buries outside. I wouldn't buy this again.
These are not good for my dog (Cavalier King Charles) as he gets diarrhea when he eats them. Otherwise good product for non-sensitive dogs.

Although higher priced than many other option, this is a very high quality, sturdy, well-built product. In fact, this is the second one I have purchased from this company because I was so pleased with the first one. I especially like the fact they offer a variety of colors to match any decor in your home. Highly recommended.

I have one cat and absolute hate changing the cat litter and the scooping part is even worse. So I figured what the heck let's give this a try. I love it! I hooked it up to the drain for my washing machine so I never see the waste. I also use the manual run cycle because sometimes it would run and there was nothing inside of it. If you have a cat then this is definately worth the money. In about 7 months I've gone through 2 boxes of granules and 3 of the solution. So it's really not that bad. The only negative is that the granules get all over the floor either from the cat getting them on her paws or when it runs the scoop kinda tosses some over the side. I bought the hood for this and that helps somewhat but I still gotta sweep up the floor every couple days. I highly recommend this to everyone!

This is a definite improvement over hand-scooping, and, I think, worth the price. However...the poop sometimes sticks and doesn't fall into the drawer. Moreover, some of the clips holding the top on have broken after only a couple months of owning this, forcing me to awkwardly hold the top down as I rotate the box...

Good looking, but taller than I expected, and did not fit where I needed to put it. Biggest obstacle was the screw-off top. It would have been a pain to use that because two hands are needed, and I needed a flip top. The opening was also rather small, and my scoop did not fit. I returned it, but anyone who has the space, it is a nice product.

This is not durable enough to leave with our 10lb chihuhua/daschund during the day, as after watching him play with it in the evening he will begin to gnaw on it and break chunks of plastic off! which I then need to take out of his mouth, terrible! This is good for supervised use ONLY.

This worked for our black lab. She started getting hot spots on her belly since we moved to Florida. I purchased this after reading the reviews and she seemed to have relief by the next day. I feel like it works better if you rub it in. She actually comes to get her morning spray and likes it!
got double the pills at 1/2 the price as from the vet and received them quicker than when ordered from vet, who had them in "stock "... :)

After reading many of the reviews, I purchased this feeder. I put a battery into it and the light didn't light nor did the feeder spin. I desperately needed a way for the cat to eat when I'm out of town since he gobbles all the food up almost immediately. So, back it went and I ordered a replacement. The replacement arrived, so I put a battery in it and voila, the light lit. It automatically spun so I set it for 6 hours as a test. 6 hours came and went, no spinning. So I reset it and waited another 6 hrs...no spinning. So, back it went and I ordered another replacement. It appears that the third time is the charm. This one works ... spins at the 6th hour so today I will test it with food since I leave in 2-days for a 2 day trip. Fingers crossed it works this time as advertised, and my cat will not starve!
My cat loved it. However, the catnip mouse sheds the carpet material it is made of.

First, I have to say our cats really enjoyed using this fountain. The large reservoir was really nice; I put ice cubes in it during the summer to keep the water cold. Also, if my wife and I were gone overnight, we could relax knowing there was plenty of water available for our cats. It's not too loud either; you hear the running water stream rather than the electric pump. Speaking about the water pump, that was a major headache. After 6 months it started breaking down. Ordering a replacement from the manufacturer was expensive and surprisingly difficult.Not as difficult as cleaning this machine, though. Since it's constructed of plastic with a very primitive filter system, it's a magnet for bacteria. We should have known something was up when my wife struggled to scrub away the slimy residue that envelopes the entire fountain within days. Disgusting. We used the official cleaning kit and it was still very tedious to get the grime and slime out of every nook and cranny. The cleanliness and quality of the water passing through this fountain became no longer acceptable. We ultimately decided to replace this with a different pet water fountain, one free of plastic, made from ceramic and glass in the USA. Think about it, would you want to dink from the same "made in China" plastic cup every day for months or years on end?

It is strong leather, but the strap and buckle are not very strong. I believe my APBT could break loose from this fairly easy, but it never came to that because the muzzle is a little big and he pulls it right off with a couple paw swipes. I think the paw swipes could probably break the strap though if the muzzle stayed in place. There is no flexibility to the muzzle so if it is not a perfectly snug fit from the start the dog will slip out easily.

We fed Canidae to our two dogs for almost 5 years--they always ate it eagerly, never had stomach upset, and got raves from the vet for their muscle, weight, and coats. It *was* a 5-star food. But last summer we opened a fresh bag of kibble (same exact packaging bought from our usual store) and immediately noticed it was much lighter in color than previous bags, but we fed it anyway. Within a day our Aussie, who has a bulletproof stomach with absolutely no digestive issues, began to have horrible gas, softer stools, and really loud, liquidy gurgling noises in his abdomen. We continued to feed the entire bag, thinking that he'd adjust to it eventually because our other dog was fine. Well, our Aussie never did adjust to it; he spent a month having those symptoms, and we dreaded mealtimes because of the stench and sounds he'd create.The kibble in the next bag we bought was the old normal shade of brown, and our Aussie's stomach noises, soft stools, and awful gas went away practically overnight. But by then I was hearing and reading that Canidae had developed a new formula that was making dogs sick. The stories about people whose dogs got *far* sicker than ours, and the dodgy responses that those long-time customers got from Canidae when they called to complain about the unannounced change, made us decide it was time for a new dog food. We went with Healthwise, a premium kibble made by the same company that makes Innova, California Natural, and Evo. It's not worth it to continue to be loyal to Canidae and to risk our dogs perhaps getting as sick as many others have. Read Canidae's new formula horror stories at consumeraffairs.com.

After I cracked and ruined my original filter, I purchased a new one that insisted the BioMax inserts were essential to its functionality. Having had my original filter for about 6 years, I decided to follow the instructions about adding BioMax, thinking this was a product upgrade. I was deeply dissapointed. Not only did it create cloudy water, despite my effort to add "clear water" drops to resolve this, but the lifespan of my fish decreased dramatically. I was losing fish every week. Once I removed the BioMax insert, the water cleared instantly and my fish started to thrive.

The toy is cute but make sure you check the size. I was so excited about finding a toy that it looked big enough in the picture i never checked size and if your like me and have a bigger dog this is just to small, i can put the whole thing in my hand, my dog would just swallow this whole but for a small dog im sure this would be a great toy.

In the product description, it mentions the sizes offered. At time of checkout, it is not asked which size is desired. When I received the product, it was clearly a small one. It is well made, etc. but was not suitable for my dogs due to the small size.

My goldendoodle has fast growing, tangle-prone hair that I like to keep trimmed short. In an effort to save on grooming expenses, I got this clipper comb along with a high quality Andis clipper and #10 blade. For the most part, the combs didn't work so well on my dog, who has soft, fine, wavy/curly hair that goes in every direction. Except with the shortest combs, I had to make multiple passes to get a cut that looked sort of clean, and it never came out anywhere near as even as his groomer did it. Because it took multiple passes, it took hours of cutting to get my dog looking decent.After seeing what professional groomers use, I've concluded that combs are okay for touching up or for working around the beard, but if you want a clean 3/4 inch cut you should just use an appropriately sized clipper blade--at least on my dog's coat.

I use this on my 80 pd white lab at least once a week. It is the BEST deshedding tool out there - bar none! We purchased the large sized tool and it works great. It doesn't hurt him and he doesn't mind being brushed.Just when you think there is no more hair, there is still more that comes off! But it doesn't make your dog bald, don't be mistakened. It removes the undercoat. Go over a certain spot (the back area by the tail) over and over and it will pick up a lot of hair. Be sure you do this outside because it can be a mess!Absolutely love it and would recommened it to any dog owner!
The toy was fine for one puppy, but we have two and they were to close to play tug of war very well. Also, fingers are a little too close to the grabbing teeth. But it was OK for the price.

I bought one of these about a year ago, it's a great size for small dogs (I'm a breeder) and then bought three more to use on the porch and the yard for small puppies. I also like the fact that you can easily connect several of them together. I give this product high marks.

Jolly Ball is a great toy for a large breed dog, providing the dog isn't too destructive. I've gotten several of these for my Labrador Retreiver over the last three years and the first one gave him hours of fun until he chewed a big hole in the handle and it became roadkill. Each successive Jolly Ball lasted a little less time than the previous. The last only lasted less than an hour before my boy turned it into roadkill.If Jolly Ball could make a ball with a solid rubber handle, that a labrador could tear apart so quickly, I would happily buy some more. But Jolly Balls are a bit pricey for a toy that doesn't last my dog more than an hour.

I've used this as a substrate for my hermit crabs and really liked it. It's great stuff, but you can buy the exact same thing and get more for your money if you get the compressed bricks. Now that I've tried the bricks, I don't plan to buy this again.

I added a decorative wire cord at the top to keep the hood up. My dog just prefers to lie on top, which doesn't provide enough warmth. This size is good for a toy dog, 5 lbs or under. The product is attractive. If your dog is a persistent burrower, he'll figure it out. Mine didn't.
Wow really was looking forward to this.Got it plugged it in filled it with water. I was awoke at night by a loud motor sound got up and my floor was soaked leaked by the motor.

Anti Icky Poo works about as well as other deoderizers we have tried. My wife is a Vet and we thought this might be the end all solution to odor problems from cats. Unfortunately, the claims we have seen DO NOT prove out during actual use. The vendor we purchased from provided a fair price and great service, we certainly do not hold them responsible for the product itself. Probably won't buy this product again.

I first wish to say I find no faults or defects with this cat toy, I just think for a very small or skittish kitten it might not succeed. I have a Singapura kitten, which is a tiny breed, and I think the Bergan Turbo Scratcher is a bit intimidating to him. Loud noises such as the ball makes when it whirls around, jar him and the size of the ball may also be a bit too big and heavy for him until he gets a bit bigger. I still have hope for the toy, though, because he does watch the ball go round when I tap it, so he's not entirely indifferent. Also he is soon to be joined by a Siamese kitten who I think will be much bolder and show him its entertainment value. I will amend my review pending the Siamese "test". :)

I don't know why she won't eat it, she's eaten the other premium brands I've gotten her, and this food's first ingredients are sardines, shrimp, and lobster, stuff I can't even afford to eat on a regular basis! I don't fault the company, I guess you just never know, but now I have to mix this with other food so I won't waste it, or just leave it there until she eats it I guess, but she'll go all day. :( I don't want to give it less than 3 stars though because the ingredients are very healthy. Like the other reviewer, my vet said only wet food for my cat. She ends up with bladder infections and other problems when she eats dry, even just when I've given her dry treats.

I purchased this toy as a gift and decided to test it with my own cats before sending it to the recipient. My cats could not care less about it! If your cats are not highly motivated by food, then this might not be an ideal toy for them.The ball is a brighter, sunnier orange than pictured here, which was a pleasant surprise. The packaging really emphasizes the usefulness of the toy for weight loss, perhaps making it an inappropriate gift. (Hey, I got this for your fat ol' cat!)The instructions came inside the toy itself, which wasn't necessarily ideal. I stupidly thought that it opened along its diameter to be filled, when in reality, there is a small twist-off piece on top. I'm glad I realized my folly before breaking the toy! Once open, the toy was easy to fill and adjust to distribute food.

I have a large icrate with a divider panel. I do love this crate, however the hooks and edges are very sharp. Today I took the divider panel out so I could collapse the crate to give to friend who is watching my puppy while I'm out of town. I leaned the panel against the bedroom door and my puppy came up to investigate. As she backed up, a hook went COMPLETELY THROUGH HER EYELID. After a couple seconds of her screaming in pain I managed to get her calm enough to carefully slide the hook back out and rush her to the vet. Fortunately the hook did not injure her eye but she has a bloody gash in her eyelid and it's very swollen. She's going to have to be on antibiotics for the next week. Vet visit cost $120, half of which was for the emergency status of the visit and the other half for the antibiotics. The hooks need to be rounded off or filed down.

I was a huge fan of canidae, but beginning about a month ago, the company changed the formula to cheaper raw materials, smaller bags, and worst of all outsourced manufacturing to Diamond pet foods (yes, the same company linked to multiple recalls in the past). Please do a search on google/consumeraffairs.com. I will not be giving my dog this brand anymore. It's the same mass produced garbage as is iams, eureka, etc.

When we got a second labrador, the first time I tried to hold both their leashes they pulled me out into the street. I still have scars on my knees. I shouldn't have been surprised - they weigh more than I do, combined (55lbs each - small Labs, really - but I'm a pretty small human). I started dreading a future of taking two walks each time the dogs needed exercise and my husband wasn't around to take one of them.Well, the Gentle Leader meant that future never came. I can walk them by myself, and while sometimes they still pull pretty hard, I've never felt in doubt that I was the one in control. That being said, the dogs hate the Gentle Leader. All the stuff on the package about how the dogs would like it once they're used to it proved utter folly in our case. They shy away when I try to put them on, pout about having them every time they get a chance on the walk, and once I take them off at the end of the walk, they both run over to bed and start scratching their muzzles against the bed. I guess they must really itch? So, I can walk them by myself, which is fantastic - but I do feel terribly guilty putting the dogs in a harness that's so obviously uncomfortable and irritating for them.To me, if you're in a position where the choice is between this product and not walking your dog because you're afraid of being injured, trying the Gentle Leader is a no-brainer. Otherwise, I wouldn't buy it, because I'm sure our dogs are not unique in hating how it feels. I only use it when my husband is away - otherwise we use a more traditional harness.

I had already purchased and was using one of these with an elderly cat. I bought two more because the first one holds heat so well (I follow the instructions to the letter - easy enough to do). I wanted our outside dog to have one for cold days and my elderly cat to have options of where to lay! No cords and no overuse of power - I could not be happier and have even recommended this to friends. Granted, they are hard to the touch, but all our pets lay on the deck, floor, dirt...so I figure if I tuck this just underneath a blanket, they are OK - and obviously so as all three seem to stay in use at virtually all times (we have multiple cats - the younger ones like the "heat" too).

I have bought other dog trainers and sent them back after using this one. I now own two of them, helps stop the two little dogs from going crazy when people come to the house. I keep one on one side of the house and the other on the other side. Wish I would have had one years ago.

Our problem was a neighborhood cat was doing it's night time hunting and catching rats, enjoying about half of them and leaving the remains at our front doorstep mat which we would discover in the mornings. Very disgusting to us. Our front courtyard is walled (5-6"), but that didn't stop the delivery of about 5-6 remains over a 3-4 week period. I tried initially with a motion activated light sensor, which seemed to work for about a week, but then new corpses were found. The Cat Stop I purchased 3 weeks ago has worked perfectly so far. I will be happiest after about 2 months of success to be certain our feline friend has found a new doorstep to place his trophies.
I have had this product for over a month and I love this product, but my 2 doggies hate it. Only time will tell.

Actually, one of my cats actually purrs the whole time I brush him. My other cat doesn't much like it, but tolerates a few brushes then runs away. He is a Maine coon though, so it didn't surprise me. I'd like the brush better is it wasn't quite as wide; it's hard to do much but their backs, tummy and sides with this large brush. Now if I can only buy a product that motivates the cat owner to brush everyday.
I have had this cage for over a year now. One of the platform clips broke easily, and the wheel is cheesy. But overall it works well and I have been satisfied.

Our Jack Russell Mags uses this when it's that time. It stays on her pretty well. She hated wearing it at first and would stick her but up at us to take it off. We kept it on her and it stays on her pretty good. She's a pretty active dog and our other Jack keeps trying to steal it. Anyway, I recommend it if you can find it for about 15 bucks. It'll stay pretty good if you get the right size. Mags is about 20 lbs and is a parson jack russell terrier. We use the medium for her. Fits pretty good.Good luck

I have two of these and they both have become clogged, I haved tried soaking them in everything from vinegar to hydro peroxide...barely any bubbles and it actually fouled up my pump because no air was getting through. Nice idea and design I just wish they would produce for longer than a month.

Got these and they worked fabulously for 2 weeks. Then the batteries went dead on all three collars! I am in the process of pricing new batteries, I have found them as low as $5 plus shipping for 2 online, but would prefer to find them locally for about the same. They do work, but I was disappointed in the short battery life. Maybe new ones will be better.

This bowl is not narrow enough at the top to keep a dogs ears clean. I have 2 full grown cockers and this exact bowl did not work to keep their ears out of the food. Do not buy this bowl if your buying for that purpose because it wont work !!!!
Spoke with my Vet. and she told me this product doesn't work and she is right. I have put it on all four of my dogs and am now having to switch to advantage. DO NOT WASTE YOUR $$$$$
I bought six airtight pet containers to hold horse feed. Each container will store about 65 lbs of oats or pelleted feed. Using these containers I gain more space in my feed room. I really like them.

We have a 50 lb Brittany/Eng Setter mix who LOVES these. The mere words "CET" cause the ears to perk up and the tail to wag. She also enjoys the poultry flavored toothpaste. Alas, her owners are not diligent in toothbrushing so the chews really help.

The idea is fantastic--a litter box that empties itself. The design is well thought-out. The execution of the design is rather questionable. The design seems to have been sent to an offshore plastic molding firm and then shipped to the customer directly with only a little bit of testing. The screws in the rake assembly rust badly from cat urine. The waste tub doesn't easily install and the plastic tub lid doesn't really stay on the lid opener mechanism. The noise is quite loud--our cat took weeks to get used to it. We have used every kind of clumping cat litter and the rake still jams on clumped litter near the ramp on the third day. Removing the waste tub is so clumsy that when I pull the tub upwards, the lip catches on the rim and flings cat litter chunks into my face. Every time.It still beats regular cat litter boxes. We are on our third unit--two have broken after one year of use by one cat but have always been replaced under warranty. The warranty policy is very good. All they want is the battery compartment cover for proof of ownership.

I have a 3 year old black lab named Layla who LOVED the busy buddy. It got to the point where she enjoyed having some of her meals put in the toy each day. Layla never really chewed on the toy, just picked it up and dropped it, etc. After about 2 weeks though the screw off bottom developed a crack that eventually split the top. The plastic on the screw off top doesn't seem as thick or sturdy as the rest. I thought about buying this toy again, but decided to try a treat toy made of rubber which is her new infatuation! If you have a gentle dog and carpet try this toy out, but if you have a large one and hardwood floors maybe think twice!

I have a 15 lb dog and I originally purchased this since i thought i would have better control of it than using a toothbrush. However, after using a toothbrush, i have realized that i was wrong. this finger brush is "one size fits all" and was too big for my fingers(i have decent size hand) I wouldn't recommend it, especially for smaller dogs that have smaller mouth.. i don't think this will even fit into really small dogs.

I was skeptical about ordering this because of the reviews. However, this was exactly like the product available in stores. It came in the proper packaging and in single doses. I love frontline plus, it works perfectly!

This drinking fountain is AWESOME! I have 2 kittens and they drink a lot of water because of this little (well big) fountain. I have had NO splashing issues. Occasionally you can hear the motor humming but usually the sound of the water is louder. It is a pain in the butt to clean all the pieces, but its worth it to know my kitties are getting fresh fountain water!
This is a great product! I use it on my teacup poodle who has such a tiny mouth it is hard to brush her teeth. Using this product, helps to reduce bad breath and tartar buildup.
I purchased this as a replacement for a worn out rope. This one is perfect for my cockatoo. It's wide enough for her to walk on and the the price was great!

This didn't work for my dog. She wouldn't keep this on, kept pulling it off, as if she couldn't stand thestrap around her snout. I think this is one of those ideas that seemed good on paper not not in reality.

i have a Boston Bull Terrier and there was no way she could get the eggs out of the Platypus. the pocket is very tight and i would think that most dogs would have a problem getting the eggs out. she does, howeveer, enjoy carrying the eggs around and trying to make them squeak - she has to bite hard.
Product is excellent, and service is too. You are on our favorties list for this regularly purchased items

This is the best $30 I have ever spent! This tool took off so much hair from my lab. I hardly have any hair around my house anymore. I would say the hair has been cut down by about 75%. I have recommended this to everyone I know.

I bought this for my puppy thinking she might grow into the costume (she was about 7 months old and 10 lbs at the time), but it's not very small at all! It fit my brother's 15 lb dachshund a lot better. The material is a bit cheap too, very thin. Overall, it's an okay costume (the hood is pretty cute) but it was not what I was expecting at all. I would buy a size smaller than what is indicated on the specifications listed.

the dog loves this toy. She figured out immediately how to get out the balls and loves to bury her nose in the openings. Most toys she destroys but this one she brings again and again to play with.It also appears quite sturdy. I am glad I found a toy she enjoys.

Once in a while a gadget comes along that does what it says it will do. This is it!My yellow lab looks 5 lbs more svelte with all the fuzz gone. One caution - don't brush hard, keep it light or you might irritate your dogs skin.Works on kitty too - just remember to go lightly - it's easy to overdo on this because it works so well!Dont use on long hair pets - it's way too intense - ask your vet.

This is the best dog toy ever invented. My Shepard puppy went through at least 10 old school frisbee'sShe would just shred the plastic to the point it would not fly. This chuck it lets her burn energy and bite and shakeIt without affecting flight. Speaking of flight, this thing can sail at least as far as a standard fresbeeAn added bonus is that its easier to catch for her in the freezing cold.If you have not tried one of these yet you owe it to yourself to do so.

These are hard to find in Denver, and irreplaceable. One virtue no one has mentioned is that they are entirely oil-free. Which means no stains on your clothes if you pocket a few. Of course, there is enough scent residue to account for what my dog and I refer to as the "unfortunate pocket eating incident involving the laundry basket and Dad's shirt."

I have had good luck just taking a shallow pan about the size of an oil pan, or 4qt cook pan, put a little dawn soap in it, add about 2 inches of water, and then suspend a light over it so it shines into the pan. Catches bunches of fleas for practically nothing. I just refill the water once in awhile when it evaporates. Leave the light on day and night, they especially flock to it at night when it's the only light on. It really works!

Buyer beware! I was looking for a replacement of my Doskocil litter scooper and this seemed to look the same on the website... what a disappointment when I got it!My old Doskocil is the only litter scooper on the market that I know of that actually filters scoopable litter effectively because it has a 3/16 inch ridge at the lowest point of the pan, right where the smallest solid pieces of the sifted litter collect. Ideally this ridge would be even twice as wide. The scooper I received does have a narrow solid part but on a slope, not the lowest part of the pan... so, it is of no use whatsoever to sift out the small solid parts (the most difficult to get out). Does anybody know of any scooper that is like my old Doskocil, i.e. that has an angle and a ridge across the pan? gabimaus@pacbell.net

Leaves a disgusting sticky film on your dog that won't let you pet him freely or get indoors without leaving remnants of the product. Plus it lasts just for a day, so you'll have sticky looking smelly dogs without mosquitoes.
My Maltese managed to put a hole in it within 5 minutes. Really surprised for a Kong product.

I purchased this box a month ago and have found that when it stays together it works exactly as described - which would be a five star rating - however, as mentioned by another customer the tabs which hold the lid on and the sifting tray inside do not work properly. This means I roll it and the lid pops off; spilling litter everywhere...or the sifting tray slides around and more than just waste clumps end up in the pull-out drawer. To say this box has *increased* my time piddling around with the litter is an understatement. After purchase of this box I have spent more time sweeping up piles of used litter off the floor and around the box and reaching in and scooping what it improperly sifted. If this box were manufactured to stay together with ease then it would be fantastic. Unfortunately you risk getting a box that is poorly designed and could cause you to dump litter everywhere. I will be returning if possible and hope another box will be better.

If the makers of this cube would make it out of a material that does not break so easily, I would buy another one in a heartbeat. I am debating it still. This was our border collier/blue heeler mixes' favorite toy for months. She whacked it around so much, our dining room sounded like a hockey tournament played with bricks was taking place. It entertained her for long periods of time, which is a major miracle when you have such a smart, active dog. Unfortunately, as others have said, the center piece came out, and I worried that she could hurt herself with the unprotected edge of the hole. I don't know, maybe I will get it again, and if it happens a second time, I'll just duct tape it or something. She really did love this toy, even more than her Kong Wobbler or the Omega Paw Tricky Treat Ball I got her. Just something about the cube. So, it might be a toy worth trying for a smart dog, but it is not indestructible. Marcy was hard on it, I fully admit, but, then, that is the nature of puppies. Buy it only if you will supervise play time. This is not a toy I would recommend an owner just leave with their dog while they are gone.
