Received item as described. The tubes are a little difficult to assemble, but not impossible. Our two hamsters love it.

My cat has been on soft claws for about 1.5 yrs now. My roommate had just bought a new leather couch, and just having my cat walk on it created scratches. Soft claws works like a charm, if your cat will stay still. Mine doesn't mind me putting the first few, then she gets impatient with my lack of skill and starts getting pretty fussy.This doesn't last 3-4 months like the package says! It only stays on her claws as long as she'll let them - max 4 weeks. I usually have to apply them every couple of weeks, but only for a handful of claws.

I have not actually used the seat cover yet. Although it looks durable and rugged, it smells strongly of solvents. I have had it hanging out on the clothes line since I bought it 3 weeks ago. I will probably put it to use this week. I recommend hanging it out in the fresh air prior to using it or you will think you have a leak in your fuel line.

This is the 2nd Littermaid I've had, and the original was definitely better. It lasted 9 years and cleaned very well. This new one cleans well about half the time, the other times is doesn't pick up all the deposits. The tines don't reach all the way to the bottom, so you still have to scrape wet litter off the bottom occasionally. But, all in all, it's better than cleaning the box 8 times a day (my cats are picky), just an occasional check and quick scoop, otherwise I have a lot more free time! BTW, I use Worlds Best Litter, it's made from corn, all natural, no toxic clay dust or additives. It makes the box fairly odorless, and clumps OK. I think a better clumper might work better in the Littermaid, but I'm not trading the all natural benefit for my cats just for convenience for me.

I had high hopes for this product and my poor baby's itchy summer skin. Unfortunatly, all products don't work the same for everyone. While my dog does suffer from extreme flea algeries and we do live at the beach in So CA, my pooch is on Capstar and Frontline Plus year round.Let me start by saying I usually use Head and Shoulders mixed with another Oatmeal shampoo. (This was a formula recommended by my vet).I shouldn't have made the change from prducts that had a 90% effective rate, but here's what the product (Miracle Coat Soothing Shampoo)promised:1.Conditions dry, irritated skin2.Relieves itching and flaking3.Helps soothe skin irritations due to flea and tick problems4.Repairs coat while restoring skin's natural moisture5.Rich in botanicals and colloidal oatmealHere is how these statement translated to how my dog felt/looked/smelled after her first bath with MCSSSforD:1.All oil stripped from skin and not returning even after 10 days since bathing with product. Some areas of skin (that were fine before) are a bright pink (lower bely and inside of back legs, armpits, base of tail all around, inside of right ear. This does NO have anything to do with fleas.2.Itching and flaking more pronounced after use of product. I KNOW I rinsed all of the product off after the bath - I spend twice as much time rinsing as I do washing.3.Again, my poor dog's skin is anything but soothed.4.As for repairing the coat, my dog lost 99% of her undercoat after using the product.5.Had a fruity smell that produced a few sneezes. The smell of the product was nowhere to be found on after her bath, and her summer dog smell returned in a matter of days after the bath.I don't believe that this is a harmful product, but I do wonder if other pet parents will have the same experience if their dog has even the slghtest tendency towards sensitive skin.

The 1st day after we attached the Door Scratch Protector to the outside of the back door, our dog was stand offish, and wouldn't come near the door. After about a week, she will sit up next to it, but won't scratch. After 2 weeks, she has scratched on the door twice, but she really doesn't like how it gives a bit. We're on week 4 and the adhesive is not holding the velcro to the door, so we'll have to get some gorilla glue to make sure it stays in place. For the price, we are pleased with this product. If the adhesive would have held, I would rate this a 5.
I had clear water to start with I did have a ton of algae, so I thought I would try this. The water is now cloudy milky white and the corals look really sick... apparently not reef safe.

Before we found Alpo's "Prime Slices", my husband & I tried a few different canned dog foods to mix with the dry food we prepare for our eldest dog (who is currently 1 1/2 years old) - and "Hearty Classics" was one of them. And, although he seemed to like it o.k., I found it to be difficult to mix in with the dry food - as I like to have a nice mix of both the wet and the dry."Hearty Classics" without gravy actually takes on the shape of the can, so you have to literally dig it out. Then, once you have the amount you want in the food bowl, you then have to spend the time cutting & "mishing" it all up - which is not a good thing when you have 3 dogs excitedly waiting for their meals...Overall, I would not recommend this particular type of Alpo. Instead, I suggest you try Alpo's "Prime Slices", which has a very nice mix of meat & gravy - allowing you to just pour it in with the dry & give it a good stir. "Prime Slices" is not only a time saver, but is also a HUGE favorite with our adult dog.

I have a 6in turtle and 40 gallon tank. I fill the tank just below the filter outlet where the water comes out. The problem is that from there to top the filter is not well designed for turtle to climb up. it is too steep for the turtle to climb. I have to shop for another filter. Water cleaning is just ok. If the water is too low, the filter stops working so make sure the tank is filled way up close to the outlet.

The product was recommended by our vet. Sugar lived her 15 years suffering from hip displacea. Dasuquin helped for a while. Now that she is deceased, we cannot use the unsealed product. Hopefully we can return it!

I have the Innotek dog containment system and needed a new collar. These collars only seem to last about year...quite expensive since they cost over $100. I have two dogs...that means two new collars every year. Sorry I got the Innotek containment system. There are other systems out there that work the same but less costly...

I purchased two of these seats and was most disappointed as my Shihs' were too large even though they weigh less than the 20 pounds stated. I dreaded the thought of having to return but Amazon made that very easy.

I purchased this bed because my dog likes making little "dens." His favorite is the small space between our bed skirt and under-bed drawers. But he doesn't like to burrow or be under blankets (so perhaps this bed wasn't really suited to him). First of all, I echo other people who noted that the cushion is so high that the dog can tip if s/he's near the edge. So that was the first thing I fixed. I removed the pad, and using dental floss (because it's so strong) sewed a seam 5 or so inches from the edge. As I sewed, I pushed some of the stuffing into the new edge, then tightened the "thread" (which is why floss is so important- regular thread would have snapped). This created a firmer, raised edge, like you see on many dog beds. This also lowered the overall height of the pad, and gives it a more stable base with a firm outer exterior. My dog also likes to rest his head on something elevated, so the new edge allows him to do that. But even after that, he would only lay on the outer 1/3 of the bed. Again, perhaps I shouldn't have purchased this bed since he doesn't burrow. So onto the second alteration. I inserted straightened plastic-coated wire hangers from the dry cleaner (we used 2, duct taped together) into the top hood (between the outer fabric and the fleece) to make another support to keep it open (we probably could have gone to the hardware store to find tubing like is used in the front of the bed). Then I sewed it into place. We decided that our dog would also benefit from yet another support, so we did it again, and this time I sewed it into the very back of the hood. The result is that now the whole top of the "cave" stays open. There is nothing to hang down and touch our dog. And now he loves it and will lay deep inside. I just hope that even though it's now so open, it still keeps him warmer than if he was in a regular bed.

Product does a good job of protecting your car seats, but in the case of liquid accidents, the material absorbs NOTHING and therfore the liquid will roll around and around. Also, the range of adjustments that can be made to the hammock to make it fit and work in your car's space is VERY limited. Finally, the hammock doesn't stay in place and shifts easily, especially when your pet is unsettled and moving around in the back seat. You still need to have lots of absorbent towels for clean ups, and if you do not have your pet in a seat belt, some other barrier to keep them from trying to climb into the front seat

Halo "Daily Greens" was one of the rare vitamin products that my finicky 21 year old kitty would tolerate. When I could no longer find it locally, I searched for it online and reordered from this seller. Delivery was a bit slow, but free--a fair compromise. What saddened me is that the vitamin formula must have been changed (or perhaps the batch I rcvd was not up to par in some way). When crushed and/or added to liquid, it's color was vastly different from that of my previous batch. It also smelled very STRONG and was not palatable to my kitty. Where were the "greens" that manifested themselves in the color and scent of the older version? Finding another satisfactory vitamin supplement will require more trial and error, but I won't order the Halo "Daily Greens" again.

I ordered this carrier to use for vet trips for my adult cats. The size is good enough for one adult cat. I was disappointed in the construction of this carrier. The plastic is very flimsy. I am going to use the zip ties as recommended to secure the top and bottom pieces. I just won't be able to take the carrier apart if my kitty doesn't want to come out. I was hoping this carrier would have been a little larger and more well constructed.

I bought mine today (large sized) at Big Lots for $50.00. I am very happy with the quality and size. The construction seems to be made to last for years and years with the heavy duty zippers and mesh materials. Even the rods are of metal (glad they didn't skimp and make them plastic). I have nothing bad to say about this item. I bought the one with the solid canvas on either end, not the one pictured, still I am extremely happy with it even though other reviewers were expecting the mesh on all four sides and are complaining just because they were surprised to get something other than what was being advertised, I guess I would have been somewhat angry if that were the case.This item is easy to set up and take down in seconds, perfect for traveling. Highly recommend this crate.
This is the only dog harness that I have found for my large dogs that restricts surging forward in a gentle manner. Love it!

I have been searching for a low maintenance litter box. I'm a single mom, working full time with two cats. The two things I hate most is the chore of cleaning a smelly cat box and coming home to a smelly cat box. It kills the mood of wanting to cook dinner for sure!Motorized boxes are expensive and motors break. I watched the video and was sold. I couldn't wait for my cats to try it just so I could clean the box. What took me 10-15 smelly minutes to do before only takes 2-3 odorless minutes to do now. It's truly no longer a chore.

I HIGHLY recommend this toy for medium to large dogs that are light to medium chewers. It is a ton of fun to play chase or fetch games with and most dogs really like the texture for chewing. But be warned. No matter what the package says, THIS IS NOT A TOY FOR STRONG CHEWERS!!!My Australian Cattle Dog LOVES the Orka Jack Chew, but she loves it a little too much and ends up destroying it. She will meticulously chew off one leg at a time. It is amazing to watch. But the product is borderline pricy for something that is destroyed (all 6 legs removed) in less than 2 weeks. Also, I worry about her health as many small pieces are swallowed no matter how close I watch her with the toy.This toy is AWESOME for chase or fetch. It bounces like crazy and floats. But the dog prefers to chew this toy, so the human ends up doing most of the running and fetching to keep the toy in one piece. We have lots of other toys that fit the "fetch" category which I don't have to watch like a hawlk. So now that two which we bought are dead and gone, we will not be repurchasing this toy.Toys that pass the ACD chew test:Kong (we still use the Red, have not had to upgrade to Black yet)LARGE sized Nylabone for Heavy chewersFresh moose antlerschuck it balls (but these are always getting lost)Pickle PocketToys we thought would work that failed:Kong Frisbee (died in 5 minutes of fetch)Kyjen Fire Hose (died in 5 minutes of fetch/chew)Orka Chew (died in 2 hours of chew, GREAT for fetch but dog prefers this toy for chew)West Paw Bumi (died in 5 minutes of chew, GREAT for fetch and tug)PawTrack (dogs just don't like chewing it, loved shredding the rope)Any Rope toy is shredded into a mess in minutes (OK for tug, but still gets messy)

The dog doesn't really sleep on it. I think it's because the cover isn't actually soft. It feels like a tarp, but rougher. I put a towel over it and she'll sleep there occasionally, but I mostly find her on the floor behind it or on the rug. It was really easy to set up, just four screws. Cleaning the top isn't as easy as I'd imagined either. You have to take the whole thing apart to get it off and wash it. Unless you just hose it down or something. Overall, I'd recommend it if your dog isn't a princess or doesn't mind a scaly, rough surface to lie on.

The product was about 1/2 the price as in pet stores or my vet. Feliway is an excellent product to begin with because it works well and has no oder. Low price, immediate delivery, great product. Can't lose.

Somehow the product description on Amazon leaves out the aditional wire needed. 500 ft of wire is barely enough to cover 1/3 of an acre. It's written on the box itself, but Amazon needs to adjust it's description. Maybe include the wire chart?

I was surprised when I received this formerly "perfect" treat. I had gotten all my dog club friends a large bag for Christmas. I love this collar! I have bought about four of them over the years. I use them for my Yorkie and my Chihuahua. I really like the break away feature...I don't have to worry about them getting caught up in something and getting hurt. Shipping was fast.

The bed is flimsy and the bottom is exposed foam, so it will not last at all. The fabric used is thin and cheap. Not worth even buying this, it will not last!They did refund all my money and the return was simple,

So much for keeping out the squirrels, it lasted one whole day before one of them managed to brake one of the plastic ports, that was supposed to close from their weight, will that did not happen!, it just broke out and all the seed fell out, save your money people this is a piece GARBAGE!!!!!

I had a VERY sick Betta fish. He had a couple white spots on him that looked like a fungus or something. I researched for a whole day online trying to find out what was wrong with my betta and what was the proper medicaine to help him get better. I bought this medicine and received it over night. I gave him the medicine and not much seemed to happen. it was almost like the medicine made it worse. I bought some Betta Revive and it seems to be helping. But none of this can be used long term. It worrys me cause my Betta is still sick acting and the white spots aren't going away. :( i'm not sure what to do or what i can do. I don't want to say that this medicine doesn't work. It very well might work of you KNOW that your betta has a fungus infection. this medicine is also supposed to help with bacteria infections. I have heard only good things about this medicine. It didn't work for my Betta, but i don't know what's worng with him. If you know your Betta has these type of infections i would atleast try it, everyone has had luck with it.

My hamster loves this cage. I didn't take him long to transition from his old cage to this one. It has a lot cool features like the tunnels of tubing and the second level. BUT IT IS A HORROR TO BUILD! When the cage arrived I was hopeful for the best but didn't expect to much (as the box made the product seem like one of those straight-from-china ok-but-not-great kinda items). When open the metal parts were ok and the plastic parts seemed cheap. The cage also came with NO DIRECTIONS AT ALL. I was forced to build the cage with the picture on the box as my only guidelines. That said - Everything is pretty clear and easy to build. The plastic tubing is awful to put together. It is extremely hard to join them together and attach to the cage! (I had to lean against my walls in order to snap the pink support rings into place). The is also poorly positioned in the cage and the hamster has never touched it.I give the cage 3 stars because the hamster likes it so much! He really does love it. But do expect to break your head, stump your mind, curse a bit, hurt your fingers and break a nail or too.

I found this collar very difficult to juice up initially. When it finally did get properly loaded, I used it for several weeks, recharging it in between. Then it worked quite well and my dog was much better behaved. I did not need to use it for several months, then when I tried to juice it up again it would not hold the charge. Now it had died completely even though I have replaced the battery.

Admittedly, we use this pad less for keeping pets warm than for keeping food and water from freezing in the century-old shack the former owner laughingly called a "garage" for our revolving population of stray cats - but it's held up over two winters and seems to be going strong through one of the worst blizzards in recent memory. Sometimes when it's cold but not freezing so we keep the food on the flor, we see cats resting on it and they seem very happy.We have a smaller version we keep on the unenclosed front porch, also mainly for food and water, and again it's lasted two winters without a problem and is making it through the blizzard just fine.

Do not buy this toy if your dog has destroyed every other stuffed or cloth toy. Its the same! Despite being solid under the Kong name, my 6 month old Yellow Lab ripped it to shreds in minutes. Are there any cloth toys out there for Labs?

The mechanics of this gate were fine but the quality of the wood needs some improvement. The wood is extremely soft which allowed my 10lb dachshund to pull it down and eventually eat through it. I had to make repairs and modifications in less than a week of use. I ended up having to replace it in a little over a month.
We don't keep the bulb on constantly and we did not get the hours mentioned. We only used ours for 5 months and now purchased a new one. We use it to keep our bird warm during the winter months.
This is easy to use and perfect for traveling in the car. Our dogs love it because it does give them more room than our last pet seat belt - they can sit, stand, or lie down with it on.

It was a bit smaller than I thought it would be, but my kitten does like to scratch it. She definitely uses it, but I was a bit disappointed that there wasn't a carpet covered mouse in the hole like it described in the information. Instead there's a little ball with colored tassels on it... just seems like a weird toy for a cat. I think she would have liked the mouse better. Otherwise, it's a good product. She loved the catnip I sprinkled on it.

I purchased a ZoomGroom for my cat. He was beginning to shed quite a bit and the slicker brush I had wasn't doing the job, plus he didn't enjoy being brushed with it. When I received the ZoomGroom we went into the bathroom and sat on the floor and he just melted in my lap while I brushed him. The amount of hair that was in the brush, on the floor, and on me was incredible, and when I was done I finished him off with aLove Glove Grooming Mitt for Catsto get rid of the loose hair still on him. He loved the massage and attention, so much so that he will pick up the ZoomGroom and carry it into the bathroom. I still use it even when I don't think he's shedding much and it finds hair I didn't even know was there. Just be warned, the first time using this the fur will fly!

I'm not convinced on this brand yet but we are trying it. A crf cat needs low protein and low phosphorous. The data on this from Tanya's guide for Crf cats shows this has pretty high phosphorous for a renal food. .72% vs .38% on the K/D. Also has 36% protein vs. 28% with the K/D. Its more equal to senior formula foods than the prescription foods. It might not be the best choice. It does have high fat though vs other brands which is my hope for keeping some weight on my 18 year old crf cat.
It is a nice little bed but it is to hard to clean and get dirty fast. My dog does like the plush sides of it though.

I was a little worried about setting up something like this, but I literally had it all set up in about 3 minutes. I didn't put the divider panel in because my dog is previously crate trained, and I bought this so he could have something bigger and more comfortable...and less smelly than the plastic crate he was in. As a point of reference (I would have found this helpful) I bought the 36 inch crate for my 5 month old 30 lb AmStaff/GSD cross. He has PLENTY of room in it and it is very secure. I would highly recommend this crate for a dog between 25-60lbs.

This is a fantastic product! Our elderly cat (now 21) has used these litter boxes for years. Older cats produce a lot of urine, and we were having to replace the disposable plastic litter box liner practically every day to keep the odor down. Using the Kitty's WonderBox means no more expensive plastic liners, NO ODOR, and we can scoop or dump out the litter and still use the same box for a week or more. It's amazing. These boxes also work great for cats who shred the disposable liners by kicking or trying to bury things, etc. The boxes are virtually indestructable. I'd recommend them for any cat.
The product works well a a temporary fix-the only way to fix the problem is to do daily water changes until issue is cleared.

Was an entertaining toy for my 2 cats (9yrs & 7yrs). My cats are very playful but seriously have a bad case of A.D.DThey played with this for about 45 minutes straight the first day it came and maybe an hour total since in the year we have owned it. They have gotten bored, they got used to the tricks and will catch the little mouse and hold on to it and kill it, so all you hear is the motor TRYING to work but the cats are holding it down!But, when they do play with it, it is entertaining for us to watch them play with it as it is for them to actually play! :)

This heater pad stays warm for hours. My cat loves hers and I ordered one for me that I love. Miss Kitty is curled up and warm on top of the bookcase and I put mine behind my back on the couch. Great product.

I bought this bed for my skinny 30-pound dog. In winter, she gets cold sometimes during the night even though we live in the South and this bed works great, since it keeps her warm. I wish, like with many other dog beds, that is was really washable. But since the cover is not removable, there is no way to clean it properly.

My Golden didn't seem too phased by the taste of this stuff when it was put on his leash to try and keep him from biting it. However, I do know of other dogs this has worked well for, so I'm sure it just depends on the dog.

I installed my pet door 8 years ago and it is used constantly by my large 100 lb dog and 1 cat. It works great!! Just receintly the outside part of the flap broke so I am buying a replacement. I have it installed through the wall of my home and I love it!!
I searched and searched for this product. It really helps groom my Pomeranian pets and it has one of the best aromas out there. Very Berry is the best. I also recommend the "Rainforest" one too.

We bought two of these. One for food and one for water. The sides on the bowl are high enough that the water does not splash out while driving. The seams are done very well and do not leak at all. We had water in the bowl for over a week while out of town for the holidays. I would surely recommend this to other people.
When I got this in the mail I was slightly disappointed. but my exceptions may have been a bit high for a cat toy that was just a couple of bucks. It functions exactly the way it said it would.

We bought this product to try and teach our 65 pound, 7 month old dog not to jump our fence. It failed miserably. First, though the instructions and illustrations make it look easy to put the harness on the dog, it is not easy. The straps all look alike and the buckles are interchangeable. When we finally got the harness on and fitted properly, our dog chewed the straps to pieces in only minutes. The webbing straps are flimsy and thin, and would probably not have restrained our dog even had she not destroyed the harness. Don't waste your money.
The anti-bark collar worked the 2nd time it was on our Irish setter. This is a wonderful/humane product for the slightly to highly emotional animal.
found out product contained pyrethins after I placed order. Found info on another website. One would think that as important as pyrethins are it would be listed in the product features!

The dish is fine - works as advertised & is cleverly designed & operates quietly. The problem is my geriatric cat who couldn't even be tempted to eat from the open tray, never mind once the mechanism was in place. He's 18 & goes through periods of wanting to eat every 3 hours, day or night - a bit rough on those of us who'd like an uninterrupted sleep. So I thought I'd try the auto-feeder. Oh. Well.

We've been using this product for many years. Now after moving from North Pole Alaska, I can't find it anywhere but Petco or Petsmart. I don't like either chain so I was really happy to find it at Amazon. I love shopping with them.
It works great. I feel like my tortoise gets enough of the nutrients he needs with it. Thank you.

This ball contains two locks on the polar sides of the ball to let chinchilla in (and out) . Very soon they lost their shape, became corrupted and now it's not as easy to lock chinchilla in as before.I do not like the product from this manufacturer for this reason (corruptable plastic)

We bought this door so we could put the litter box in the garage to keep it out of reach of our puppy. It worked for the past year or so, and the dogs also love to put their heads through to see us leaving and coming home. It worked well for our purpose, except after about 8 months of heavy daily use, the magnetic strip that keeps the door from flapping broke clean off and the 4-way lock quickly jammed. We don't us it, so it's no big deal, but the door swinging back and forth sure is annoying!Also large cat breeds like Maine Coons may have some trouble with this. Our cats are large DSHs and have a hard time squeezing through. In the beginning this led to some difficulty to teaching them to use it.

I liked this folding design and the steps were of decent quality, but even with the treads applied my dogs paws slipped around way too much. Also, the spacing, size, and height of the steps is best suited for small dogs with short legs, like a Yorkie or Chihuahua
There is a mistake in the description and label on this. This did not fit the newer small-head cordless wahl. I don't know how many stars to give this, it might be great for the right thing.

This has a very strong (fishy?) smell which offends the two cats I tried to give it to. I'm pretty good with giving medication to my mellow animals, but when I did get some of this into one cat, he ran off. The other took one sniff and didn't hang around for more. Whether it's effective remains to be seen. If I could get it into the one with the stomach issues, I'd have a better idea. I might just try slippery elm on its own.

I purchased the Petmate Le Bistro pet feeder for several reasons and it has lived up to my initial expectations. I would recommend it with some reservations...THE GOOD:1) I wanted a reliable feeder to automatically dole out small portions of food for my compulsively over-eating cat when I went away on short weekend trips. If you follow the instructions, you can work through the anti-intuitive programming to get the thing programmed and working properly.2) I was sure my cat would destroy the machine the first time I went away. My aggressive large male cat rips open bags of dry food in less than 1 second, and all plastic food containers need reinforcement. He tried to bust open the Le Bistro with all his might, but only managed to push the machine around the room. On two occasions in the year-plus that we've had the machine, he has managed to pop the top off of the food bin, and it was because he had observed the refilling of the machine earlier in the day.3) BONUS: My cat used to start yowling loudly for food every morning at 4AM. I realized that I could program the feeder to feed him his morning meal. Now he sits next to his machine and purrs at 5AM, eats when it feeds him, and goes back to sleep.THE BAD:1) The first and last time I tried to program the machine without referencing the instruction sheet, I hit the "Set" and "Plus" buttons at the same time and watched in horror as the machine starting doling out all of its food. I had to scramble to find the instruction sheet while fat kitty munched happily away at the mounds of food pouring out of his new best friend.2) I've noticed that the "low battery" light only lights up when it is trying to use its motor, so I don't see it because the machine is used for feeding the cat when I'm not there. The first time this occurred, my cat meowed and pestered me so much, that I went to the feeder and tried to do a manual feed. As it tried to use its motor, the machine's red "low battery" light lit up. My vocal cat helped me realize that his machine needed new batteries that time, but it seems like a terrible design flaw because it could happen while I was away for a long weekend and the cat would go hungry. Fortunately the batteries don't need to be changed very often, but I would still be cautious about the batteries if you are leaving for a long time.3) When I go away my cat likes to push his feeder around and try to get it open. One time he managed to flip the whole machine over on its side, which meant that the food no longer had gravity on its side and never found its way to the chute. Now I have to tape the machine to the floor so it doesn't happen.

I bought this at the suggestion of a volunteer for the rescue organization from which I adopted my second cat. She was very timid, whereas my first cat is outgoing, and was bullying her. The rescuer said that she has seen cats get so caught up in playing with this toy that they forget to be enemies...I haven't seen my cats playing with this *together* yet, but they each love it, despite their very different personalities. Both love to bat the ball around, scratch the cardboard, and sit in the middle. This is especially remarkable considering that my shy cat doesn't even bat an eye when I wave very tempting feather toys in front of her, which the outgoing cat would go ga-ga for.This ball track toy is much sturdier than those offered by other brands. Highly recommended!

The citronella spray collar is great except that it is much too sensitive. I have taped multiple layers of padding over the microphone, yet it still sprays when my dog sneezes or shakes his head (he has floppy ears). I'm trying different materials to see if something else may work better to muffle "regular" noises but still allow barking to trigger the spray.

I cannot recommend this product. First of all, when I opened the jar the odor was overwhelming (clove and vinegar). I let each of my Yorkies smell them to see what they thought. Each one had the same reaction: sniffed, shook his head, and ran away. I always taste any medicine that I give my dogs for palatability to see if I need to put it into a Pill Pocket or food to disquise the flavor so I opted to taste this. OMG, it was so nasty bitter; and I could not get that taste out of my mouth for the longest time. I put the lid back on the jar and threw them in the trash. I would never use something so vile on my dog. In my opinion using these on your pet would be animal abuse. My heart goes out to all the dogs the manufacturer tested these on.

Pros:Design of the fabric and the tie-downs is top notch. Fits many configurations well I'd assume.Nice color.Cons:*NOT* waterproof. "Water-Resistant" might be a better word. My pooch tossed his lunch up, soaked thru to the clothe seat. Not too excited about that.There are too many holes where they allowed for seat-belt-thrus in the design, which is pointless. Look, the dog mess is going to get thru those slots into the clothe seats. Those seat-belt-thrus should have a flap over them with velcro or something.As it is, if you put another blanket under this blanket, then you have a good solution. This cover is very well priced, and definitely holds in place. If you need to protect against liquids, put something underneath it though.

I bought this for my 15lb puppy under the assumption that it could hold up for simp rain and wind protection, I was wrong. Not only was the assembly rediculously difficult(none of the pieces lined up correctly, and the screws didnt even hold it together),my puppy ended up sleeping under my bed when it rained due to the fact that the house was flooded. To make matters worse, my puppy decided she wanted to get ontop of the crappy house. She ended up breaking it and getting cut...now I'm paying for a vet bill to stitch her up, extremely useless and dangerous for anything over 10lbs.

My Wiener Dog is terrified of this house but it's very pretty and very easy to assemble! :) I hope everyone else has a dog that's not scared like mine! :) It looks pretty in my back yard! But my dog won't go near it! LOL

I am disabled and had owned a LitterMaid once before. It made taking care of my cats much easier. I ordered this one thinking I would get the same quality as in the past but found that the standards were much lower. The fingers for the scoop used to be solid plastic but now they are a flimsy metal that is so flexible it lets most of what you are trying to scoop pass below this. I tried a little more litter to raise it up but the motor is incapable of pushing it even though it is far from being over filled. The box itself is not secure. The old boxes had latches to hold it together this one just sits on itself. This comes to be a problem with the lid when it tries to close. If the box has shifted even an eighth of an inch the lid hangs open releasing all the pleasant smelling oder into the air. The trays are harder to insert where they work. Many time they are lifted up and the poop and junk go behind it to the floor. LitterMaid needs to hire new R& D people. They have taken a good product and made it more difficult to use and less effective for more money. Once again the disabled get taken in with the shisters!!!

This is arguably as good or better than the top quality screen lids you can buy from petstores - for a fraction of the price. The screen mesh is very stable and secure, holds heat lamps well without much warping (in a 40-breeder some slight warping is inevitable). Fits perfect, A++ product.
So disappointed the pads you get don't even look like the picture advertised, they are so thin and smaller thanwhat they are suppose to be, very disappointed. :(

I must say I wasn't expecting this toy to hold up against my year old Boston Terrier. He is a ruthless chewer. However, he only managed to tear the tongue off the chameleon (in less than 2 minutes) and still has the rest today (2 weeks later) he likes the toy and plays with it all the time. Overall it's pretty durable but if your dog is a chewer and destroys toys in 3 seconds flat don't expect much!
Cat loves to use this. Cat uses it so much it's getting close to using up the second one in the pack.

This toy is much safer than the push-and-play hard plastic ball, as it didn't cause any bloody noses. However, once the rope was removed, my dogs were able to chew off pieces of it near the hole that goes all the way through. One of my German Shepherds played with her ball for months before destroying the ball, but my more aggressive chewing male tore his up in less than a week.

This was my first feeder. I bought it based on looks and the overall good ratings. I had two birds visiting it in no time. Unfortunately I don't have a garden to attract more so they didn't go through the nectar very fast, and I had to toss 2/3. This feeder has a narrow opening making it challenging to clean. First time I went to clean it, I discovered a crack in the neck, that wasn't there the first time I filled it up. I wont be putting this back up for fear that the bottom half is going to break off completely.
My dog gets wet and soggy because the closures dont fit right and it just flops around his body. I thought this was the smallest size

The information on the box for this product advertizes thousands of hours for this lamp, but we only get about 2 mos of life. Still, it is a sturdy, splash-proof lamp and our turtle really likes it in the cooler months.

Maybe I have a picky Guinea, but she rarely chews it. We used part of the yellow soft stuff under the igloo for there was so much she wouldn't go near the tube. Now she runs through it occassionally. The yellow stuff stains very easily. Pet stores have more of the soft stuff for about $2.

Hi,Bought this for a momma and her kitten. The momma (1 year old) took to this and was adjusting well to the hole. The kitten on the other hand is having difficulty but she is following her momma but did not like the sound of poop hitting the water. It could be that she is too young (3 months). For now, we are back to traditional litter box until she is older and will try again.

is good product resistant and is good for really big dogs german sheaperd, malinois, etc etc because is kind of heavy but you have to put sand inside and that is not an easy job because the hole is really small but the effort worth the estability that the ball doesn't go over your neighbord fence

I've had this litter box for a couple of months - I think its a good product, but have had some issues.First, I read the reviews before purchasing this product and was convinced that if I used the product in the RIGHT way, I'd have a great product! My impression was that the lower ratings were chalked up to user error.Now it's only happened twice so far but WHAT A MESS when it did! When tilting the litter box to the right to get the waste into the pan, what I thought was a securely latched side obviously wasn't because litter and small piece of pooh suddenly started to leak ALL OVER THE CARPET! This happened once in the morning when I thought I'd be making a quick job of emptying the litterbox and, to my dismay, it became a 15 minute project of scooping, vacuuming and cursing at the stupid thing.BUT it HAS worked effectively since, so I have to believe that one must really test the security of the latches before trying to tilt. The latches can appear to be latched when they really aren't solidly together and I think this was my problem both times. As one should be adding more litter often, or cleaning it thoroughly occassionally, I frequently take the lid off (how can you only take it off 4 times a year, as one reviewer said?!) and spend an extra few minutes ensuring that they truly are LATCHED to the bottom piece - which is difficult because they don't line up to latch perfectly.This is a good product and, if the latch system was perfected, it would be a GREAT product and would have gotten 5 stars. 3-star review for the horrific episodes of cleaning cat litter and feces out of my carpet on two occassions after only two months of having it.

This is the BEST product I have found to keep my dogs from pulling while on walks. They both wear one, and I am no longer jerked ahead when they see something they want to run after!!! It took a little time to get them used to it, but I just had little pieces of treats that I would give to my girls when they would try to paw it off. We have been using it almost daily for a month now, and my dogs walk just fine with them on! Great investment if you have dogs that like to walk you!!

I really like this bird bath. I received mines in yellow. Unfortunately my parakeets ignored it the whole time. I finally had to take it out cause it got soiled with droppings. Would have like if it had an attachment so it could hand off the side of the cage and not on the floor of the cage.

I purchased this harness for my 30# hound dog because she loves to ride in the truck, but the ride was too rickety for her to be comfortable. I also liked the fact that she couldn't leap out of the truck when I opened the door. Recently, we had a reason to never travel without it again. I was driving down a twisty two lane road when a driver coming in the opposite direction was distracted momentarily and swerved into my lane. I swerved to miss them but my truck lost control and we rolled over into the ditch on the opposite side of the road. My dog was securely fastened in her harness and I remember her flailing around, but securely attached! The truck landed on the driver's side door and she was dangling over my head. Had we not had her secured with the harness, she could have flown around or out of the truck and severely injured one or both of us. I will promote this product to everyone I meet with a dog, it saved our lives!!
This product came as expected. My dog loves to lay in it, as she does almost anything. I gave it 3 starts because to me it wasn't "great" or "terrible" but somewhere "in the middle".

This cat scratcher pad is fine in quality, my cat loves it in his toy with the ball track. The only problem is that it is advertised as 2 replacement pads but I only got 1. in reality, it is an incredibly cheap thing to manufacture so i bought it thinking I was getting an almost reasonable price for 2 pads instead i'm paying almost $8 for rolled cardboard. Granted my cat loves it and I would have been completely satisfied with 2 but that is not what I received.

If you are accustomed to pack walking your dogs this leash will do nothing for you. I bought it on a lark. In a pack walk both (or multiple dogs) walk in groups. On the odd occassion one may have trouble going to the bathroom, the other dog can pull on it without your control. Impractical product...unless your dogs aren't trained to pack walk, then it might be useful.Loops 2 Double Handle Nylon Leash, 6-Foot, Blue

This mat takes a long time to soak in water and the mat is not even. The bumpy strips of gell are a result and there is no smooth surface. The mat is very wet after soaking it in water and heavy. My dog refused to even go on it. I'm returning it!

Great idea - but the remote is way to sensitive. I try to be very careful with it, but if you ever put it in your pocket you are likely to fire at the wrong time. That is not fair to the dog and will ruin any positive impact I hope to gain from this as a training device.The buttons should be inset, have a cover, or require holding for a couple seconds before firing to prevent this issue.

I really like the concept but don't feel the construction quality is up to par. I own one for indoor use and it is much sturdier. I have had the other one for about 5 years now and it's in great shape. I forget the manufacturer but it's by far a better quality. I thought that since my dogs were used to this same concept for their indoor bed they would just take to this outdoor one. Not the case. My dogs don't like the fact that they just sink into it and it's wobbly. They are a bit skittish. They will lay in it if I call them over to it but quickly feel unstable and jump off. Wouldn't have minded paying a bit more for better construction. Still hoping the dogs will adapt to this bed a bit more. Just giving it a little longer.

I can't get my dog to wear these. She'd rather walk on ice. Actually she'd rather sit on ice because it's too cold to walk. The biggest problem I have with them is that they are too hard to put on. I think I could get my dog used to them if I used them more consistently but when it takes 5 minutes per foot, I just give up. That's what puppy pads are for.

a 150-pack box usually lasts us about 4 months with one mid-size dog. These Wee-Wee pads are fine, but they used to be better -- does anyone remember when the blue borders used to be made of an absorbent material with a continuous plastic underlay? I think the design changed about a year ago, but since then, if my dog miss-aims and urinates too close to the blue border, urine leaks through the pad onto the floor, whereas before, the plastic underlay locked in the moisture from leaking out.

I've had this litter box for about 6 months and I LOVE it. I have one small cat and live in a little apartment and I can't smell the box. I had a regular litter box before I bought this one and I was cleaning it at least 3 times a day and I could still smell it. I can go at least 3 weeks without even touching this box and still not smell it. It is supposed to go for a month and it gets really close, I think it could if I didnt have to have mine in a semi-public area. It is super easy, pretty quiet and it just really works well. The only reason its not perfect is that my cat still drops some litter on the floor on the way out. It is totally worth every penny!

It arrived in the box, as described. When I took the pieces out to assemble it, two tiny plastic clips broke off. It is definitely made of cheap chinese plastic, but functions fine without the clips. I would say it is overpriced for the quality, but I had a gift certificate and got it free. All in all, I would never pay full price for it.
Just wish this came in smaller size as it looked great on my dog, just would not stay on his feet two seconds. Had to return. Fortunately return was very easy and full refund was given.
I personally don't love it but my 2 puppies love it and my 1 old chi also eats it more than his other senior food.
This is a super tool for cats who shed a lot. My cat sheds constantly which drives me nuts. Using the FURminator cuts down on how much he sheds.
Unfortunately both of my cats turned their noses up at this product, and one of them would throw up after I put it on her food

This is easy to clip on & easy to get the bags out but after I ordered it I saw the same thing in a local store for a little less money & they had more colors to choose from. But the item itself is good.

Got this for a 9 month old stray (small female dog 16 pounds) since my husband thought steel was too much like prison. She figured out how to jump out in a few days--so husband put a "roof" on it (plywood). She literally chewed her way out (chewed at the rungs until they gave way and then wiggled out--not just one rung--several were gone). So--husband went and got a steel cage. She is fine now!

The grass didn't grow very well. Granted, I didn't have the pet fountain in direct sunlight; it just isn't possible to place it where my cat can reach it and also be in the sun.Also, it created a white foam in the water, requiring me to change out the water and clean the unit weekly.Too bad, too, because I love the idea of it!
It may well be that my hip is too far gone to be helped, other than surgery. But I received no relief after taking this for a month.

The item is not as green as shown and is held down by cheap thin and narrow plastic that can not hold enough gravel or sand to weigh it down. I wish I would have passed on this stuff and purchased something that looked a bit more realistic. this just looks like cheap faux plants floating in my tank (floating because I am tired of putting my arm in 20 in of fish water to re-bury them!)

i bought this for my pond to give it a water feature in the middle good flow rate but seems like the design has a flaw the foutain head does not screw onto the pump just slides onto the theaded port on the pump still somewhat tight fit to pump to hold it from blowing off
Only some of my bigger tropical fish like the crisps, so I doubt that I would purchase such a product again, in large quantity.

Love this tiny comb.... perfect for my standard size Yorkie ~ woof It works so well around face, be careful when combing. Dogs don't like to be brushed there. So a few mini treats distracts and makes it so much easier to comb out~

The advertized product dimensions on the website are 7.8 x 1 x 9.2 inches. The actual dimensions are: Overall Size 7 5/8"x 7 7/8"; Cut out Size 6 "x 6 7/8". My cat is 12 lbs and still growing. He won't be able to squeeze into the hole that small. Have to return it.

The idea of this product seems to make sense, but it didn't work for me at all. I ordered it with refills and moved it around a few different places where I knew fleas would have been hiding, but nothing happened. I don't want to knock it down completely and I would rate it a 2.5 if I could. I think it's a smart contraption and if you have a big flea problem, it might work. I think it didn't work well for me, because I didn't have as big of a flea problem as I thought. Mine was a flea and bed bug problem combined. I didn't know about the bed bugs until recently and I can definitely tell the difference between a flea bite and a bed bug bite. Also, my cats had flea dirt and the vet confirmed they had fleas. Again, I just think my flea problem was minimal. So...this product didn't work for me at all, but it might work for someone else with a bigger flea problem.
Sorry to say my cat didn't like these ,she prefer round ring ,I coundn't get her interested in these colorful springs at all.

I have three older cats who take arthritis pills. One also takes a thyroid pill. I decided to try the pill pockets. For the first month or so, they all loved them, and they made it easy to give the pills. However, after three months:One cat still loves them. I have to watch her carefully or she will steal the pills from the others.One cat has figured out how to eat around the pill.One cat sometimes takes them, but at other times just sniffs the pocket and skips it.I have figured out a few tricks that help:There are two types of pockets for cats: chicken and salmon. The chicken is slightly larger and more pliable and works better with larger pills. However, I think that the cats find the salmon tastier.Get another cat treat and stick it to the side of the pill pocket. Then place the pocket so the treat faces down. My finicky cat is much more likely to eat the whole thing that way.The pill pocket still helps with the cat who eats around it. After she eats the pill pocket, it is easier to shove the pill down her throat. She is more likely to swallow it instead of spitting it out if it tastes of pill pocket.If you have two pills, try to fit them both in one pocket. Giving the cat fewer pockets will make it seem more of a treat.
These treats are great. Our dog gets excited everytime he sees us reaching for them. The container is also a welcome change to resealable bags. Its much cleaner and portable. Love this product!

I always have a bit of a mental pause when it comes to reviewing an item like this. How much can you say? I mean, it's a laser... for cats. Any cat caretaker with even a little bit of experience serving feline overlords knows - a laser = cat crack. They don't care if it's a good laser or bad, they don't care if the batteries need to be replaced weekly or never. It's crack, and even bad crack is good to them.But as a human serving her fuzzy mistress and master, I'm pretty happy with this crack. It isn't sucking down batteries like a cat laps milk... it's comfortable in the hand (unless you get poked by the stiff whiskers)... and the kitties love it. Oh, and it also seems to be considerably cheaper here than the alternatives usually found hanging on the small racks near the checkouts at stores. Another point in its favor.My cats like it, ergo, even if I had to replace batteries daily, it would get five stars. Since I don't have to go broke buying batteries, pretend I just gave it ten instead. ;)

The harness was easy to put on and adjust, but might not be the most secure since my cat escaped from it. If a cat wriggles backwards, the adjustable lead on the top may become loose - it might not be the fault of the harness, maybe my cat is just extra wriggly.

I ordered this wheel 3 times. The first time was back in 2010, the wheel I ordered in 2010 seemed sturdy and did not arrive to me bent. I decided to order another wheel in 2011 just to freshen up my chinchilla's cage. The wheel arrived to me all bent up, and had sharp spokes, so I returned it. I just kept the wheel I bought in 2010, then this year 2012 when I bought my chinchilla a new cage I decided to try ordering a new wheel again, again, it came bent, but this time I bent it back into shape and kept it. This product seems to have a quality control problem. Overall I do like the wheel, but wish it was of the same quality that it was when I ordered it back in 2010.

I have an Australian/Border Collie mix who has separation anxiety. We trained her to eat in the crate and lay in the crate, but leaving her there when we walked out the door ... well... she wasn't ready for that. She escaped twice in one day by pushing on the side of the crate enough to get the bottom latch of the side door undone, then forced her way out. Her attempts/success in doing this, also made the front of the crate nearly fall off as it came undone some how. Now the crate has a total of 8 small luggage locks around the side door and the top corners to keep it together, but the dog is in daycare until we can better address the anxiety. Anyway, the crate is not good for dogs who really want out.

We have had our Dachshund puppy for two weeks now and this particular toy is her least favorite thus far. She has over twelve toys and the only time she has played with it is when I put kibble inside and she didn't play too long. We are curious if she will like it more when she is in full teething mode! No reason to dislike it. It's the perfect size for her and is attractive and made well. I think it's just this dogs choice.
The bowls itself is fine but the base/hanger is super flimsy. If you fill it with water it bends. In my case, the dog getting a drink busted the weld on the hanger the first week. Disappointing.

The width of the straps on this is tiny. It's for a very very small dog. It's like the width of cat leashes. It says it would fit up to 20" but it doesn't.The medium also has sizing issues--it says as small as 20" and it is too big. Very annoying! My dog is sort of compact and the area with the martingale loop is too long--I can't get it small enough. The girth around her chest is fine and will adjust as needed--it's the front that's the problem.If you can get it to fit (I can, at the very smallest setting in the front, but then it starts slipping as we walk), it works great.

I bought this product online. After seeing the picture of the large dog and the cover extending over the sides of the seat, this is exactly what I wanted. Got it the next day! The cover is too short by a couple of inches to cover the rear bench seat in my F350 SuperCab. My dog doesn't lay in the middle. She sticks her head next to the door on either side so now I have slobber on the leather. Now I'm concerned about shrinkage when I wash it. This would be great in a small pickup or car. In my view the picture is misleading.

I like gadgets and hate cleaning litter boxes so over the years I have literally owned nearly every brand and model of automatic litter box that there is/was. Some, like Litter Robot, I have owned more than more one of. Over the years I have literally spent thousands on this issue in an attempt to automate a much hated chore. I also travel a bit and an automatic litter box makes for happy kitties...THIS REVIEW IS WRITTEN FROM THE PERSPECTIVE OF HOW THESE PRODUCTS LAST OVER TIME. SOME OF THEM ARE OKAY AT FIRST.Put simply the Litter Robot is the only powered litter box that is worth buying; but it has several issues that I'll point out. There is also a cheap alternative.AUTOMATIC LITTER BOXES1) ALL of the various rake models leave clumps behind, get slime in the forks, and eventually break. The waste recepticals are all too small and are designed to be thrown away so they have you on the hook for life for overpriced supplies. I won't go into more detail, save your money. They are all a waste of time in the long run and either break or require so much maintenance and cleaning that you may as well be scooping the litter by hand. I never had one last longer than a year.2) The one that spins a flat pan and has a little conveyer belt to shuttle the waste away? So bad in so many ways it should be illegal to sell it... I threw it out even before it had a chance to break. Nuff said3) The expensive one that uses reusable waste pellets and then flushes the results down your toilet and is hooked up to a water source? If you have a poor sense of smell or can maybe put this in a garage or porch this might work for you but the supplies are expensive. I spent $650 on this puppy after buying accessories and plumbing it directly into the house. Even though it was in the basement the smell upstairs was pretty wretched when it was cleaning itself, but the real problem came when I had to clean the unit. It was such a mess and so disgusting a task that once again you may as well just scoop litter by hand and deal with a little grossness at a time. I eventually threw this one out fully "functioning" after I had to clean it the third time.4) I bought the original Litter Robot when it first came out. It had serious design flaws most of which they have fixed. When it broke the second time the new model was out so I tossed my first one. I now have two (and a half) of the new model which is notably better. This is the only powered litterbox I would recommend; but understand it is flawed as well.They break/jam fairly often. Sometimes I can fix it myself and sometimes it has to get sent back to the shop. To their credit, they have improved their customer service to a great extent and the response time and warranty is very good; which is fortunate because if your luck is like mine you will be needing it. (HINT: A can of compressed air can make a quick fix of most jams.)I have two and a half units because I had a breakdown at xmas one year and didn't have time to send in for a repair so I just bought an extra base on the net. It has been handy to have since I have a backup unit ready to go most times. The spare is recently broken and needs to go back now though. I also have extra circuit boards from various self repairs. That's a lot of fixes, parts, cash, etc. So be prepared. This isn't kitty litter utopia but it is as good as automated cat litter gets.The ball also gets coated with crud over time and needs a serious washing which is hard to do well. Hose it down on a hot day and leave the ball soaking in the sun to dry everything WELL.The Robot WILL smell more than a daily maintained manual litter box. Plus your cat is eventually surrounded by a ball coated in urine and fece dust that will gather over time. Luckily my cats don't rub up against the insides much, but it's a trade off if you want automation.I have read complaints about the waste tray on the Litter Robot and the way the bags attach, but I think the way they did it was brilliant. I just use regular tall kitchen bags (don't need the size but I buy them in bulk anyway and it is cheaper. Also leaves lots of bag to tie in a knot after it is filled.)It uses regular bags so that saves on costs and the Robot uses litter sparingly, I bet I use 1/4 of the litter that I used too.5) Don't want to pay for a Litter Robot and don't need a litter box that can tend to itself for a week at a time? There is a cheap option. There are various sizes of the "Omega Paw Self-Cleaning Litter Box" that is basically a Litter Robot without the motor. You do the rotating yourself but it is easy. This still beats manually scoopin the poopin in a major way and costs less than $50. Much better than the "rake" options, and easier to clean. I would buy the big one if you have room because this device has the same internal "dust" issue as the Litter Robot.

We have the regular and extra large versions of this box. The box works great for our 11-lb normal female tortie, who likes the high sides and generous headspace. Despite her age and slight arthritis, she has no trouble getting in and out. She pees a "normal" amount.Now, fire hose kitty.... Our 15-lb male kitty, who came to us via the humane society after being rescued, along with a few dozen other cats an dogs, from a subpar shelter/hoarder. He is the sweetest, happiest kitty in the world and is ecstatic to have a family. Like many cats rescued from hoarding conditions, even after several months of intensive vet care before being placed up for adoption, he has many medical complications and some peculiar behaviors.He does not enjoy using the box and generally avoids as long as possible, resulting in moments where the length and volume of his pissing inspired my husband to say "I thought a homeless man had wandered in and was peeing in the corner of the study". Fire hose kitty is also prone to UTIs, so we have to feed him lots of wet food and encourage excessive water consumption.Because of the volume of urine he excretes on his twice-daily box visits, he creates what we oh so fondly refer to as "kitty concrete" - football-sized clods if clumping litter, stuck in the corner of the box, that never dry and must be pried free.We tried a few different things -- putting in deeper litter (he just soaks through it) smacking the bottom of box, rolling after every pee, etc. What it came down to is, the drawer to remove wast is just too short to handle his clods, and would make a giant mess.Fire hose kitty also has digestive problems, which result in "peanut butter poops" in color and consistency. He does not like covering his poop, so we either have to cover it for him an hour or two before rolling or we end up with skid marks on the top of the box, the drawer, sometime the drawer opening or the floor if he also had a too-big-for-the-drawer pee that morning. In other words, a nasty mess.We also have difficulty rolling the box without spilling litter everywhere because it has to be filled so high.On the plus side, this box works great for our normal cat, and for those that care, it is made in Canada by what appears to be a small business.Three stars for working OK for normal kitty.

Good value for the price, dont expect a soft and plushie bed, it is more like a sheepskin, not very thick, but my dog likes it and that is what matters. I really like that I can throw the whole thing in the washing machine.

These treats are definitely my dogs' favorite. They gobble these up and have started turning down other treats. They come in fun shapes and when you open them up, they smell just like peanut butter. They smell so good, I've been tempted to try them. The ingredients are wholesome and natural and I feel good about giving these to my dogs. I just wish more came in a box.

The product is plastic, you can call it vinyl if you want, but to me, it's plastic. I have a built in pet door on my storm door with a heavy soft vinyl flap and my dogs loved it from day one, several years ago and the flap is still in perfect condition. I built this on a frame for my patio door and my dogs won't use it. The solid plastic two piece door bangs when I make them go through it and they won't use it on their own. The screws are designed for a 3" thick frame so anything less than that needs to have the screws cut down or buy new ones. This information is at the end of the directions. Nice time to find out. My dogs run through the storm door pet door and this one they struggle to go through and it's actually larger than the built in one. I will not buy a hard plastic flap door again. The panel you insert to close the door is also hard plastic which feels like it would crack in a minute if it got hit too hard. Overall, I am not impressed with this product's quality for the money. I have three large dogs and I think if they try to run through this door they will break the flap, that's if they ever start using it.

This crate looked nice and set up easily when i received it, but it didn't last long. I have a mid sized dog, a wheaton terrior, with a strong will. She broke the crate within 2 weeks, She scratched and scratched at the bars next to the door, some of the metal bars started to fall off. She broke out of the crate one day!!! The crate I had previously lasted 6 years and it was still strong, but the bars were starting to get rusted and the plastic tray at the bottom was cracked, so I bought this new crate. Now I wish I had kept the old one.

We've been using Advantix for a long time and it works great BUT recently we had an emergency with our small dog.I came home to find her eyes swollen shut. We'd done nothing out of the ordinary except apply her latest dose of Advantix the night before. We thought perhaps she had rubbed some on her bed and then gotten it in her eyes. While my wife ran the dog to the vet, I called the emergency help number for Advantix to see what they recommend should this be the case. After describing the situation to the Advantix representative, he told me in a most condesending tone that it sounded like "an interesting theory". After repeating that I was just interested in finding out what we should just in case, he again refused to give me any sort of advice and instead implied I was lying. He sarcastically informed me that "it's not like there's an antidote". Eventually I just hung up.I'm not sure why there is an emergency help number listed if Advantix is not planning on giving any help, but for all the other pet owners out there--don't bother calling and don't bother buying!
Millet was falling apart, thought it would be more fresh. Birds still seem to like it. Will look somewhere else next time.

A stray cat adopted us after surviving last winter outside and on her own. She would never alllow us to get within 100 yards, until one day decided we were "OK". What a sweet animal. But a cat and inside the house is not an option, so we got this pad and placed it inside a wooden cat carrier in the garage. She loves being on this pad, and now we know where to find her. We have many coyotes so keeping her wandering to a minimum was a good thing. Great idea, great product so far - had it about 3 months now.

I wanted to get an automatic cat feeder so that my cat wouldn't wake me up at 5 am, and also so that she could eat more regularly scheduled meals and lose weight. I really liked the idea of this since you get to pick the portion size, and I didn't have any problems with her trying to get to the next meal early. The problem I had was that the timer on this thing is totally off. Sometimes it worked fine, and other times it wouldn't feed her until hours after it was supposed to. Sometimes I wasn't home when it was scheduled to feed her, so I had no idea that she hadn't been fed until I heard it turning hours later. I couldn't count on this to work properly, so I returned it and switched to the Crown Majestic. It was a little more expensive, but far more reliable.

This product contains high quality sources for its protein ingredients. The products high protein content improves a dog's oral health. VitaHound believes cleaning dog teeth is important to the over all health of dogs.
i have found this piller to be too small for most pills, and too long to handle efficiently

Only problem it takes the patience of Job to get a cat or a dog to submit to this thing. It takes forever to remove dead hair and my recommendation is to take your pet to a good groomer and let them do in an hour what it would take days to do IF your pet would quietly submit to it.
we do not use that plastic container, it's a nuisance. Bags are leak proof and big enough -- they do their job; but they are hard to separate from the roll and then hard to open, doh...

This toy has a failing if you have a dog who's too clever for it's own good. The rope is a weak point. I understand the theory that the dog is supposed to use the rope to chuck the bottle around and have the food come out, but after a couple of days our collie picked the toy up, took it across to her bed, and started determinedly chewing through the rope.The manufacturer recommends you put the plastic practice golf balls in the jug instead of the rope, and this worked for a while, but then our dog started chewing the purple ball off the end of the bottle, and when she'd got sufficiently through that, managed to crack the neck of the bottle itself.We got her a replacement (as it took some weeks for her to crack the first bottle) and this time the rope lasted less than two days. So, it's back to the plastic golf balls, and hopefully it will take her some while to get to the stage of cracking the bottle again, but I suspect it's only a question of time.The manufacturers, IMO, need to implement two improvements.1) The rope needs to be impregnated with something which tastes unpleasant.2) The spikes on the rubber ball need to be made longer and firmer to try to protect the neck of the bottle.Those reservations aside, our dog loves the toy, but then she has a very high food drive, probably due to her months as a stray.
Face it, cat's aren't fun to bathe. This shampoo makes it worth it. My cat is shinier than I thought possible, plus he smelled great for a week after the bath. And it's all natural. Totally worth it.

My veterinarian said not to use products with coal tar. He gave me a modern product that did the job of clearing up skin problems. If you recall, Denorex used to be on the market and they removed it because it was a coal tar product. Coal tar has been known to cause cancer. Talk to your vet before using this product on you or your dog.

It looks great in my backyard. The birds like it, also. I like the feeder because it holds a good amount of seed. One of the feeders has a deep split in the wood on the corner already. It would be really helpful to have a slight raise in the middle of the floor of the feeder. The seed seems to stay in the middle and the birds can't reach it when it gets low. There is still a good amount of seed in the feeder at that time.

This is a good product. Other than making my dogs hair shiny and healthy, it also eliminates dog body odor as well as fecal odor. Normally, my bullmastiff smells after 4-5 days after her bath,I noticed that with this product, even after 2 weeks from bath, she still doesn't smell dog.. Great product however, upon my reorder, when I received the product, it is already less 20% since the smelly salmon oil leaked. I hope the shipper will be more careful in packing this item next time to avoid spillage and loss.
Fast shipping!Received as advertised and works great!Comes with reminder stickers that are great to put on calendar. Will definitely purchase again.

For the price you pay for 500 feet you pay for 50 feet elsewhere. This is quality air line hose that is durable enough to manipulate with out collapse. We run several air pumps for plankton growing and I was tired of spending $10 for 25 feet of air line. This is a great price for a bulk amount of air line.

Within 3 minutes Leo was intrigued and drinking from the fountain.The other cats Peebo and Bro were drinking within a week...They are all enjoying the clean, fresh water ...and the waterfall!I am glad we bought it and the filters to go with it!I tried for days to download a short seconds video of Leo drinking from the fountainI have mpeg ..and have no idea why it did not download...It would have really shown how much Leo loves the waterfall.
just does not work like the stuff at the vets , wish it would, the price is great....

The feeder was poorly packaged for shipping and came broken - when I went to return and reorder, it was out of stock so we nailed the piece back on. After a squirrel jumped in it, the feeder rope gave way from where it was attached at the bottom, so we had to fix that as well.

I have a Weimaraner that Loves to chew up most items in a few seconds. Zeus has been chewing on this toy for 4 weeks and it is still intact. There are few strands of rope removed, but overall this has lasted longer than any toy we have purchased, even the black Kong is no match for him. Zeus and I both love this toy so much that I just ordered a second for when this one finally dies.

I have a 4 1/2lb maltese puppy. The coat fits her very well, but sometimes she pulls up one of her front legs and it gets stuck in the coat. Then she falls on her cute little face. It's kind of amusing when it happens on the grass, but I do have to carry her up and down the stairs for obvious reasons. If your dog is not active than this is a great coat. Or maybe if it is overly active and you would like to slow it down. I'm personally going to go buy something else before I have to go buy another dog.
My Dog loved it so much, he chewed it up in a week.I just wish it would last longer

This item is widely marketed as "non-toxic" and safe for kids and pets. So I bought a bunch of it to spread around my very swampy lawn. But when I read the instructions, they were filled with warnings to contact poison control if swallowed and to wash thoroughly if the product touches your skin! So maybe this really is non-toxic and the company is just trying to protect itself from liability. Or maybe it really is unsafe. In either event, I can't take the chance with my two-year-olds running around my yard.

If there's one thing I hate about trying to dress my large breed dogs, it's that sizing charts are always WAY off. I did my research on size and the XXL was way too big for a very tall labradoodle. But the quality is quite good.

I was pretty dubious when I got this as a retirement gift for my boss. She absolutely loved it (she meaning the cat and her human). I got one for myself and discovered the long hair cat is not too wild about the Furminator, but the short hair one likes it a lot. I also get a lot more fur off of the short hair cat with the Furminator. I suspect the long hair has such long fine overcoat hair that it simply doesn't reach the undercoat. The amount of fur I got off the short hair is amazing. And the difference it makes in how often I have to vacuum is wonderful!
This turned out to be completely opposite of what I thought. It is a nice dog costume but the dogs have to wear it in the front not on their backs and its very hard to keep on a hyper dog!

My two Dalmatians are not crazy about these vitamins. I bought them because of the recent problem with Pet Tabs coming from China which my dogs liked to eat and never refused. They both refuse these vitamins so to use them up I hide them in their food.

Bought two of these for my rats (I have a male cage and a female cage) because they like to climb. Ladders got here 2 days early which was very pleasing. Packaging was great and they were not at all damaged. My only complaint is I had the worst time with attaching them to the cage bars. They went right on but the latches at the top are open enough where if weight is applied to them, they move around and can even come all the way off. Not very sturdy but if you have a smaller pet they might work for ya. I ended up having to use bread ties to hold them still. I love how they look in my cages and have no other complaints. Very durable. :) Just watch out using them with larger pets! But well worth the price.

My dog certainly loved these, but they do not go well in the Kong like they are advertised. They just broke into small peices when I tried putting them in, and my dog could not get the small peices out. I would recommend getting the Ziggies to put into the Kong toy intead.

I bought two of the 48 ounce size feeders so I wouldnt have to fill it every day. One of the feeders leaked around the bottom right from the start. The other one started leaking after about a month's use. I fixed it myself by applying gutter sealant around the bottom and letting it dry. However for the price of these feeders, it should have better quality. I do like the size of it. However, I cant say these are exactly easy to clean either. I have a couple of First Nature feeders that are great, and easy to clean, but the largest size is a quart.

Purchased this toy for our small 6 pound Yorkie. Within 15 minutes of play, the stuffing was coming out of the beak and the seam had completely opened on the underside. Very poor quality for a dog's toy.

Ok, the product worked, but it was way more work than I bargained for. When they say program they really mean program and the program is more for you than the cat. Its not a sprinkle and let em tinkle solution, but meh it does work.

This tag came quickly and was packed just fine. My dog's name and my name were equal size, so I felt that people would think his name was my name. In the photo it looks like the second line is smaller, but mine wasn't. So I wrote his name with a magic marker on the other side on the white coating stuff and put tape over it. My last tag broke apart. On my last tag the writing scraped off. Neither of those things will happen with this tag. And it's light. So it turned out just fine once I did my thing.
GREAT BUT CHEAP.WE HAD TO HOT CLUE THE WHOLE BALL IN THE MIDDLE.THE HAMSTER SO SO LIKES IT BUT NOT ALOT.GREAT PRICE GREAT PRICE.

I've had this filter for about 2 weeks. I used it first in a "Lee's habitat", which was a disaster because the current is too strong for that little amount of water (it's a large plastic habitat with a raised part, which can be used as a home for reptiles, -terrarium- amphibians -rain forest- or aquatic turtles - about 3 gal of water space with a asking platform) So no, in 3 gallons of water the filter creates too much of a current. I'd have to turn it off while they ate because they would get knocked around otherwise :(I now have it in a 10gal aquarium, and it seems to work alright.My only concern is that it only filters out debris. Like other reviews stated; there is just a sponge in there, which is pretty "coarse" and stuff can get past it easily, in which case it would just get "spit back out".. It doesn't filter ammonia or small pieces of debris etc (turtles are very messy eaters and their food, if left uneaten, disintegrates and lies on the bottom to rot.) It has only been a few days in the 10 gal tank, but I assume I will still have to dump out, clean the aquarium by hand, and replace the water at least once a week...I am looking into an ammonia filter, or at least something that has a carbon filter in there... something more than a simple sponge that catches only half of the debris..
