I brush his teeth every night and after a week there was nothing left of the finger brush! I would rather spend a little more and get the CET toothpaste from another vendor that also has free shipping. Don't buy CET via Amazon's 3rd party sellers or you will have to pay for shipping.

It arrived bent from shipping, but I was still able to put it together without too much trouble. (I think that it would have been a bit easier if it wasn't bent.) Overall it's great and it's given our puppy room to roam when we have to leave her. The two doors are a good option so that you can put it however you are in the room. Our puppy likes being in her crate so it's not an issue for us, but I'm not sure that the door would remain closed for a dog that wants to get out. There is a small latch, but I'm pretty sure a dog could get out without too much trouble if you didn't reinforce it in some way. Overall it's great!

I purchased this litter box at the begnning of November. It has been a lifesaver for the two new kittens that I have. All of a sudden the other day it started to make awful noise and just quit working. I wish it would have lasted longer!!

I rated it 3 stars, because it is cooler than say vinyl flooring, but it doesn't offer that much relief. If you want to get an idea of what it's like, put a piece of 1 inch foam in a zip lock bag and saturate the foam with water. Close the bag and lay it on the floor. That's basically what the bed is. It is cooler than other surfaces, but my dogs gave it a mediocre response. They would rather lay on the tile or laminate floor.I would shop around. I got mine out-of-season on clearance at a pet store chain.

I purchased this product back in July 2011 because my cat loves to play in his water and I read that this might help. It did. He barely ever plays in his water anymore. However, this product is a pain to clean since it has so many tight spaces and creases for gunk to build up in. I started out cleaning this product every week, but it gets dirty so fast that I soon had to increase my cleanings. This would not be enough for me to dislike this product except that lately, my cat has developed a bald spot on his chin with little black dots. My cat is an indoor only cat and I give him flea/tick/dewormer every month so these should not be an issue. I again did a little research and found out that plastics can harbor bacteria which can cause feline acne. From what I read and saw, this fits the description of what my cat has. I am now switching to a ceramic fountain. I would not suggest this product.

Just got this, assembled it and I am one happy camper. This is a big litter box, doesn't look bad and adds some greenery to my living room and its made in the USA! I don't think the greenery is from the US, but how refreshing that the litter box /planter is made here.I cant wait to get our new Kitty and for him to use it! This was totally worth the money.The only critical remark I have is that the top of the box would be much easier to remove if it had handles: a detail like some large planters or earthen vessels do...

This cage over-all is well built, very roomy plenty of space for a hamster..--BUT the tubes are very hard to keep together..I had to tape them to keep them from falling apart. My suggestion if you get this cage is to keep enough tubing so your hamster can crawl up to the second story,(throw away the rest of the tubes!) and lower the wheel to ground level so he/she can just jump on the wheel. It is a great cage otherwise, your hamster will enjoy living in it!
TINY, looks like a hamster with a beaver tail. My dog seems to like it but definitely not worth $5.. more like $ .50
Wish I hadn't wasted my money on two of the "automatic" litter boxes, nither of them lasted a year. This is sooo simple to use and works great!!

The toy is really cute, but the opening is too small for my terriers to remove the eggs. It looks like I would have to do major "surgery" to slightly enlarge the opening. On the plus side, it was very reasonably priced and did come with 2 extra eggs, which was nice.

This is a slide gate not a swing gate. I was upset when it arrived. It has no secure way to keep it together and it requires you to own a drill to put in holes. The wood does not appear sturdy and once assembled it would have a gap in the middle and no swinging attachment. Unless you have a very wide doorway this item does not slide in enough for a single person to walk through. In my huge entryway this item would not work. I had to return it for a refund.

My 20lb (at the time) terrier mix had to curl up VERY tightly to uncomfortably fit in it. He filled it up completely, but the website we ordered from (not amazon) charged a high restocking price so we gave it to my brother for his 15lb dog. She fits perfectly. She isn't able to stretch out and still has to curl up but for shorter car rides it works just fine. She definitely enjoys seeing everything go by from the window. Now at 25lbs, my own dog still likes to jump in it when he gets a chance. Having said that, the sides are not too sturdy if your dog leans on them and can tip the seat or fall out. It is also difficult to clean. Somehow, fur gets under the cover and since the seat is made of foam, it attracts fur and is hard to remove. The cover is also hard to get back on and after about one year of regular use (maybe once every two weeks), it has really worn down. It would be a good idea to use a blanket or some additional cover on top of the original cover. It is still a good car seat and the foam has held up pretty well. It really is overpriced, being that it is just a large piece of foam with a small drawer and cover on it; however, if the sides were sturdier and the seat were easier to clean I could give this 5 stars because the dogs do seem to enjoy it.

This box is a dream come true for cat people, right? Totally marvelous. Unfortunately, the manufacture is so sloppy you can get a hernia trying to lock those tabs. No wonder the Chinese laugh at us for accepting the crap they send us. I used a box cutter to trim the plastic tabs so they would fit into the slots. When I finally got it put together everything was fine, I rolled it, removed the little box and dumped it. Very tidy. I can see that it will make my life easier and my cat's life pleasanter, plus the hole is too small for the dogs to stick their heads in, if you know what I mean. I just wish it wasn't such a total POS as far as manufacture is concerned.

My husband and I are pretty busy people, and there's nothing I hate more than spending what little free time we have running to the pet store to get pet food. With Amazon Subscribe and Save, we are able to get this delivered right to our front door at the same (or lower) cost of running to the pet store or market.This particular formula seems to be fine for our 2 spoiled felines. We switch them back and forth between this, Chicken and rice, and Indoor formula and I haven't seen an increase or decrease in hairball activities. They seems to still have the occassional hairball, but I think that's pretty typical.For the price I feel that this brand and formula provide a good diet and nutrients that our furbabies need.

I have to use these plastic receptables as I have the marvelous self-cleaning cat litter box. However, the plastic in the boxes and lids is very thin and cracks easily. Very disappointed but am stuck. EFS

We use this every day on my dogs food. After the dry food goes in the bowl, he walks me over to the cabinet where we store this..."come on, Mom!". You could use this as a special treat or for a tool to get your dog to eat when its appetite is low. But don't be surprised if your dog starts the cabinet walking routine. This stuff smells gross but dogs love it.

My 4-lb yorkie puppy loved the extra small frog. However, he destroyed the squeaker in less than 5 minutes. He did the same with the extra squeaker. Most of his squeakers in his other toys have survived so perhaps the lack of padding in this one makes it easier to destroy the squeaker. He still plays with the frog sans the squeaker but it's not as exciting for him.

The Drinkwell Platinum works fine, except that water level is usually at, and occasionally over the top of the bowl. Why, you ask? Probably the combination of the relatively hard aquafier water in this region (southern New Mexico) and the elevation of 4,000 feet. (Remember that high school physics lesson about atmospheric pressure pushing down on everything --- we just have a little less pressure here at 4,000 feet.) So, I give the product three stars, since the manufacturer didn't mention this limitation.

worked good at first she is still getting used to them trys to remove them. one note of advice remove the lens till they get used to them the lens plastic is so soft that she scratched them by head diving in the grass. will not buy anymore unless they do something about how soft the lens plastic is. this was within 20 min of removeing them from plastic adjusting them and letting her go outside.

As I shop for a new, replacement contain 'n train collar I feel it necessary to share feedback on my experience thus far.The containment system is well thought out and works well. How long it holds up is another question. After 1.5 years the lithium battery would no longer take a charge. Be aware that this receiver is sealed and end user battery replacement is not possible. Additionally the "tongue" where one side of the collar strap mounts broke as well. I used some epoxy to repair, but if better made this would not have happened. So here I am needing to spend $100+ to replace a component that should be serviceable to some level. Not too happy about it.Regarding the training remote, I tried using this part of the system but gave up shortly after it didn't live up to expectations. My two complaints: 1 - the battery on my original unit died very quickly....within days of light usage 2 - The remote had a distinct lag from when the correction button was pushed to when the actual correction was administered. Very frustrating and confusing for both pet and owner. I called Innotek and they sent a replacement. The very polite and accommodating customer service rep pretty much acknowledged these as known issues. Unfortunately, the new remote performed as poorly as the first.All-in-all if the quality were a bit higher and the collar battery was user replaceable I'd be much happier with the containment part of the system.If I were to advise someone on which system to purchase it would be this containment system, less the remote trainer. Which I believe is the the IUC-4100.

I'm looking for a formaldehyde free shampoo for my dog. I'm trying to go all healthy in our home. This shampoo has DMDM hydantoid, which is a formaldehyde releaser. Formaldehyde is used as a cheap preservative in shampoos and conditioners, liquid soaps. Formaldehyde is also used in enbalming the dead. It is not healthy for a live person's skin, so why would it be healthy for your pet?

The tent is incredibly big, I own a fairly small litter tray for my kitty, and well, it ocupies about a third of the tent itself.It makes a fairly good job at keeping odors under control and keeping sand contained. Depending on your cat's sloppyness you'll have to clean it about once every week.It has a very tall top, and putting it together is rather tough, you have to pull tightly for the top cover to fit with the zipper at the bottom cover. Besides that, it is worth the money and the wait.

I bought this with the hope of getting something that would give my dog a challenge in getting the treat out. It took her all of 5-7 min before she had it out! Either she was very smart at figuring it out or this was just too easy. The concept is wonderful though and for a smaller dog it would probably be great.

I purchased the Lucky Dog 5 x 15 foot weatherguard Kennel Roof System less than a year ago from Atwoods and the tarp is disintegrating. It is shedding small silver flakes all over the place and has developed a large tear. This cover is in an open area that is not exposed to falling limbs or excessive pine straw, just a lot of hot Arkansas sun. I am very disappointed in this tarp because I have car covers, boat covers, motorcycle covers, propane grill covers, etc. that are several years old and they are holding up fine. This tarp didn't even last a year. I like the kennel, it wasn't to difficult to put together and it gives you the option of 5 x 15 feet or 10 x 10 feet. But I do not recommend this cover. You can purchase a much cheaper tarp that will hold up for several years.

If you are walking a dog that walks faster than you, the only way to stop the leash from going out further is to hold the button down or grab the belt part. All the previous ones I had purchased the lock worked, this one not at all. And there is no indication that it is not on the leash anymore. Expensive leash that does not last long before knots appear and you have to manually stop your dog or hold the button down to stop the leash from extending.

This is not the product I thought I was getting. I wanted to order Malacetic HC spray which comes in a blue and white bottle as pictured. What I received is Malacetic conditioner spray in a totally different bottle. Now I have 3 bottles of the wrong product. This product is nice and smells good, but won't treat the condition I wanted to use it for in my dogs.

I had hoped that maybe this "ginormous" bone would last a little bit longer, but my 95-pound Husky mix ate the entire thing in less than 15 minutes! She seemed to really enjoy it, though, so I guess that's good!
I've been feeding Blue Buffalo Spa Select cat food to my two furred companions for over two years now. They love it. Their coats are shiny and, more importantly, they're satisfied and healthy.
Love, Love, Love this it has been great, fit my dog good and reflects well. I use it if I walk the dogs late or if we go out to the lake and they run around people see them.
I gave it two stars because she had a lot of fun removing it, and she is still playing with the partially deflated ball left. My dog is a 90 pound lab/ pitt mix.

I ordered the Furminator for a friend who just got a St. Bernard puppy. But in the meanwhile, my lab mix started to shed badly. June seems to be shedding month. I decided to try the Furminator before giving to my friend. Guess what? She's not getting it! This tool got rid of all the undercoat and my dog is shiny and thinner after getting rid of a bag full of fur. He doesn't especially like being brushed, but stood patiently while raking him with the Furminator. BTW I did order a second for my friend!

I bought one of these a few years ago, didn't last the winter, got another one via the warranty and that one broke even faster than the first. Do yourself a favor and spend the extra dollars for a better heater.In Cleveland area.

I ordered the Easy Walk Harness-Tweener Size M/L. Size description on Amazon states 22.5"-35" girth. The package after I received shipment says other wise, 25"-35". My dog's girth is 22.5", after all adjustments, it is still way too big for her. Don't be mislead by sizing chart as I was.

I have a lab mix that normally wears a large collar. I ordered the large dice that is the size that normally fits and needless to say its WAY too big. I can slip it over his head with ease. The collar also claims to be adjustable, maybe if you're adjusting it an inch tighter. The light tube Inside the collar will not let you adjust it anymore than that. Otherwise it is a very bright collar and easy to see at night, just with the measurements were more accurate and the collar had more room for adjusting.

The bag has no support on the bottom so your dog practically gets involuntarily curled into a ball If it was a young dog it would be ok I guess but my dog being older I don't want to put that much stress on her spine also I could see that she was not comfortable. I have a little French poodle by the way. You can see from the picture the bag is not rigid at the bottom but the dog looks like he is sitting quite happily and my dog was not like that she was all curled up and was uncomfortably trying to sit or get out

I hadn't paid attention to how large this thing is. My golden retrievers ignored it. Every once in awhile one might sit on it. It makes great noise but it is probably too large unless you have one of the giant breeds.

I thought this toy was really cute, and my dogs will play with the squirrels, they want nothing to do with the trunk, and won't pull the squirrels out if I put them back in. So, it's okay, atleast my dogs play with the squirrels.
colors are to close to each other and hard to read, comes with eye dropper which is nice, would be nice if glass came with a desent lid on it,

After reading the majority of reviews I expected more. Unfortunately, neither cat was very comfortable and found the space a bit constricting. I constantly had to clean poop off the steps and would find my cats head covered in litter. It might work well for some, but not for me.
This is really great piece, and it will be much realistic after 1 month in he water, I loved it.

There are two brushes in the kit, one finger brush and one that looks more like a smaller human toothbrush. I tried the long handled brush on my cats today for the first time and all in all it went fairly well, considering. I bought 3 other brushes, and this brush is the second softest brush, but it is more maneuverable than my first choice (silicone human baby finger brush). So for now this brush seems to serve the purpose. Only time will tell if going through all this hassle is really doing the job it's suppose to do as far as clearing up my cats' beginnings of gingivitis.The finger brush of this kit seems too stiff and awkward to wear on the finger - also there is a piece of rigid rubber sticking out at the base of it, which would probably get in the way of things and I can't imagine it's purpose. So this brush will probably end up in the trash.

I bought this feeder in a rush right before I was going on vacation. I'd completely forgotten about how I was going to feed my fish for 11 days while I was away and I made the decision almost solely on cost and how fast it could be shipped (Amazon Prime). I went out on a limb with this selection because I was looking for a pond feeder, but not willing to pay over $100 for a typical one. While this labeled as an aquarium feeder, I wasn't sure how it would work out. Once I got the feeder in, I rigged a setup for it to be suspended over the pond, and the rest is history. It worked out perfectly. I have 7 good size Koi to feed and the feeder allowed for great flexibility (how many times a day to feed, and adjustable levels of how much to feed).

The unit and bowls are good quality material. The only problem I am having is adjusting the height. Sometimes it holds and sometimes it doesn't. The price here is competative however compared to other sources.

This definetly does work...my cat was very into it the day he received it but has not been so into it after that. But it does work, it retains the cats heat and stays nice and warm, without overheating. It is not too noisy like some have said. So it is a good product you just have to take a ricsk on wether you're cat will like it or not...and with cats...you can never tell!

IF IT WERE POSSIBLE TO GIVE THIS NEGATIVE STARS, I WOULD!I bought 2 of these items for each of my kittens at a pet store for $6 each. All I can say is that I thought they were adorable at first. They are total crap. The "safe" clasp is NOT safe for cats! It's plastic and a small piece broke off and my 8 week old kitten could have eaten it! I went back to the pet supply store and they replaced the item for one of Li'l Pals other types of cat collars. It's stretchy with a Metal clasp and completely adjustable. I recommend that one!DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY OR PUT YOUR PETS IN JEOPARDY BY PURCHASING THIS ITEM.

I got this pen for two of my cats. I wanted something that would allow them to be outside but safe and secure. This looked like just the ticket. However, in practice, it fell short of the mark for me.PROS- great ventilation- easy to unfold; pops right into place- length makes it easy for several cats to be inside- several zippered openings make it easier to get cats in and out- stakes included for securing to the groundCONS- although it is long, the top slopes down, so the only place the cats can stand up is in the very middle- needs a pad or pan if putting on a hard sufrace such as a deck or concrete rather than on the earth/lawn- cannot use pins to secure on a hard surface; ends curl up and pen tips over unless weights are placed at each end, which reduces interior space further- cats repeatedly got their claws stuck in the mesh -- don't leave your cats unattended- virtually impossible to re-fold and store- when another cat wandered into the yard, they lashed out and tipped the whole thing over, despite the stakes in the grassThe idea is great, but just didn't work for my needs. I'll be looking at a larger stand-up wire crate with a solid bottom and shelves -- which I didn't want to spend the money on to begin with. I think they'll be happier in a more solid enclosure with more room to jump and move around.

Is vinyl is supposed to smell incredibly bad?I was originally planning on keeping this rolled up into my dogs day pack but the smell is so bad that I don't want to risk having the day pack smell as bad as this rain jacket.I washed the jacket and it didn't help.I'm only keeping it as an emergency item for fast lunch breaks while it's pouring outside. I have it rolled up in the back of a closet. I'm hoping guests won't notice the smell. If they do I'll have to throw it out.

The cage is really great at keeping everything inside. However, the latches on the door are big and square in the middle of the front panel, it's hard to see my pretty bird! Also this one doesn't have a fast way to change out the paper used to collect waste. I never use the little food doors, but I don't have an escape artist to worry about. Seems like it was over-designed.
I purchased this for my boxer lab. He thinks it is okay. I thought it would stretch more. He plays with it a little, but it is not his favorite toy.

I moved my dog out east from a dry western climate. Her joints (along with mine) started acting up due to what I and my vet believe to be due to the Barometric pressure change. Read about this stuff on a blog and decided to try it after reading the reviews on here. This stuff really is a miracle joint cure for older dogs (mine is almost 8). She's now running around like a puppy. I actually feel I might have to cut down on her dose so I can keep up with her. Just kidding :) Highly recommend if you want your dog to live comfortably for long. I hardly ever write reviews but had to on this.
This is a very handsome warm coat. I bought the xs for my Chihuahua. My only problem with it is the Velco is not the most powerful and somtimes comes undone.

I have had this product for 9 months and use it at least 1 x everyday. The only feature I feel could use some improvement is the clasp. The way the carrier clips onto a O ring is fine. It is the getting it back off to refill the carrier with new bags that I found a little too difficult or complicated. If you have it clipped to a treat bag or something similar it tends to hit your leg as you are walking along. I suppose you could clip it to a leash as well? But overall considering the price and everything together it does a fine job. I have no major complaints.
The bottom of this thing is hard plastic, so it has no resistance when placed on a hardwood floor. Seems well made, otherwise.

Our Havanese has managed to claw through every carrier we've ever bought within minutes. We carried duct tape with us on the airplane just to hold the carrier together long enough for one flight. In frustration, I dropped $125 on this carrier, and amazingly enough, it held beautifully!However, the carrier has some issues. Although it is soft, it's firmer than other soft carriers, and it really didn't fit under the seat in front of us. We were actually lucky that the flight attendents didn't say anything. In addition, and a bit more worrisome, I truly do not believe that the carrier has enough ventilation. Our dog was dripping with sweat when we took him out of the carrier and he was panting so har in the carrier that the whole bag was shaking. You'll notice that there is very little netting on the bag, and where there is, it's a double layer and it's so fine (that's why the dog couldn't claw out) that it's really questionable as to how much air gets through it.
Order was not processed very quickly. Arrived OK, once shipped, and I am pleased with product; at lease the parakeet is.
This product seems durable but very small. Must change 2+ times a day for an 18 lb. pup.
this has a nice smell not very strong but it has zero affect on my two yorkies. I stopped using it about a week after I bought it because it was just wasted time.

I generally trailer my dog to a nearby shared use path, using a Croozer dog trailer, then she runs with my bike using the Springer Dog Jogger until she has been exercised (1-3 miles) and then she gets back in the trailer. Anyone using the Springer Jogger to exercise your dog must note that except for the spring (S-tube) and plastic "safety release" breakaway attachment that the rest of the kit is garbage. I had to replace the joke-of-a-harness with a store-bought one, discard the harness clip for a carabiner, and had to buy a separate bike seat post and use an automotive adhesive (my husband's smart idea) to glue the seat post to the insert and the insert to the clamp that attaches to the S-tube; this keeps the clamp from swiveling which it will do.Note that you will need to spend an additional 20.00 for a designated seat post, whatever the glue costs, 5.00 for a carabiner (I use one with a screwgate/lock), and 25.00 for a new harness (reflective for safety). I also bought reflective climbing cord from REI for safety and so I could adjust the cord length; this replaces the short piece of cord that comes with the Jogger.My setup now works GREAT. Just note that you will need an additional 50.00 - 75.00 to get to this point.

The construction of this item is really pretty nice. That isn't my problem....it is that the photo shows a dog going down the 3-step product, so it looks just right. Not.I have a Shih Tzu and a Terrier. Neither one likes using this because the steps are too tall for them, and then the step itself is too narrow. It is hard for either one to get up or down, and both are uncomfortable. If they would make the steps shorter and wider it would be a super, super good product. As it is, as far as my dogs go, it isn't appropriate for them
I always dreamed of getting a bearded dragon but my folks didn't want me to have one because she said i wasn't responcible enough. how much work does it take to be a dragon owner?

I taught my puppy how to sit using the puppy version of this product. Now she's 11 months old, so I'm switching to the adult version. Each treat is about twice the size of the puppy version and since my dog is only 5 lbs, I tear each treat into 4 pieces. She absolutely loves these and they are a healthy treat for her.

We found fleas on our miniture schnauzer, even though she is on frontline plus, we bathed her in dawn detergent at our Vets suggestion, and used the flea trap. It seemed to be effective and our problem went away. We also vacumed a lot (furniture and rugs.) Our problem is over for now because it's winter in NY, but I am thankful I bought the trap and refills and will have it for spring, summer and fall. I should also mention it's very easy to use, and there is no odor, it just simply attracts the fleas and they are killed on the sticky circle inside the trap.
I wanted a matching set of feeder/waterer for my cat. The waterer came apart at the bottom when I went to clean it. Other wise it is fine.
It took forever to receive this item. the product is fine , we don't understand why it took forever to ship . not sure if we'd order again from them.

So, i was at the store and they were out of the litter i wanted. i figured that this would be great its LOW TRACKING (FALSE) and good for the environment. My Siamese cat seemed to get the litter all over. It gets stuck in his paws. After 2 weeks it began to smell like urine. When he pooped it smelled awful. I've tried so many litters including the World's Best Cat litter, Feline Pine, and many others. I've yet to find a decent one. Don't waste your money on this product.
This seemed to work well at first but our dog quickly got used to it and it no longer detered him from barking...I have heard it works well for some, it probably depends on your dogs personality.

Our small dog loves this toy. Or, maybe he hates it. I can't tell because he goes nuts when I let him play with it. He wears himself out throwing it, chasing it, and activating Mr. Dogg. I can't tell if he's trying to rip Snoop out of it, or whether he can't get enough of him.As many times as I've heard "Bow wow wow, yippee yo, yippee yay," it is not annoying. I don't know how long this toy will last, but it doesn't matter. I am absolutely amazed and thoroughly entertained watching our dog play with this thing. It does seem that supervision is important, since a dog might eventually shred this and eat the chip. So, I limit play and watch while the dog gets a great workout, and I get a really entertaining show.Update. Snoop no longer with us.On the day it was reported that the Australia's Minister of Immigration canceled Snoop's visa, I discovered that our dog had also canceled Mr. Dogg. The exterior of this toy has held up perfectly, but the interior Snoop has been reduced to a rattling, yet otherwise silent, artifact. Still, 5 stars for a great performance while it lasted.
It would have been a great purchase if it actually fit. I measured my dog and ordered the appropriate size. This would fit a dog about 6 inches smaller than my dog. It is nicely made, however.

My dogs lets say...aren't the most cooperative bunch. My fiance and I have probably spent over a hundred dollars on different types of leashes and slip leads trying to find out what works best for them. Both my dogs have a tendency to try and lead us on walks, so as a last resort I tried this.Fitting:As soon as we got them we tried them on both our dogs and our older dog took to it okay, he was really scared of it at first. Our youngest one however had a holy fit and started rolling around even did a back flip trying to get it off. The video DVD that came with it said that if your dog does this to adjust the lead as it may be uncomfortable for the dog. After the adjustment he was perfectly fine. One thing is, I went with a size smaller than what I would normally get for a harness or a collar. My older dog wears a medium in harnesses and collars but for this I got him a small and it fit perfectly. Same with our younger dog. He usually wears a small and I went with the petite.Walking:We too both our dogs to the park. Our older dog still managed to get ahead of us, but with a light tug on the lead he seemed to fall back in line. Our younger dog did better on it, not sure if its just hes more impressionable or what. Three days later our older dog is back to pulling at his leash again and not walking in line with us, even when we give him a tug and gorge him with treats.Overall feelings:This is probably a great product if you already have a dog that just needs a little extra guidance but its definitely not going to substitute taking your dog to a obedience class (ours are already set up to go but we wanted to try this in the meantime). The DVD video that comes with it makes it seem like your dog is going to make a miraculous change but if you notice a lot of the dogs are sitting with trainers.
It does a good job keeping out the squirrels but it also keeps out the birds. because of that I dont recomend it.

We have a Schnauzer that has separation anxiety and, in general, is a hyper dog. He has had the collar on for one month today and during this month he has only peed on the floor three times and has settled down considerably. The times that he did mess on the floor we noted that the collar had worked loose around his neck. I have just purchased a second collar and hope that this one will be the one to break him of his separation problems.

I had heard this was wonderful canned food, so I tried it for my very fussy schnauzer. I was first surprised to see a layer of fat on the top when I opened the can....I scraped that off and added a couple spoonfuls to her dry....and she sniffed it and walked away. She does seem to like the Merrick BG dry food. I chose the buffalo flavor and my girl says this is a winner.
I am very pleased with my purchase. It was a gift for my step-daughter. It works perfectly as an add on to the original cage that we purchased.

I usually buy the smaller version for my heavy chewing dog. I bought this larger one for her on Christmas and she had ruined it in about 10 minutes. She is a medium sized dog, but she was able to get more access in the larger openings to chew and bend them. I had to throw it away that night because I didn't want her cutting herself on the sharp edges or swallowing any pieces. I'm sure this would be fine for a larger dog who doesn't chew quite as much. I'll stick with the smaller version now. She's never broken the one she has.

I bought this for my African grey. He is a plucker so I was very worried about him staying warm. After about two weeks of Grey scrutiny He is now much warmer. Please for those with large parrots or ones that are deconstructive. Get some plexie glass attach to outside of cage, drill hole in plexi to run the cord through it. That might keep them from grabbing the wire. It is plastic so it does not have the traction a regular perch does, but its well worth the try for the warmth. I would love to see these inbedded in a concrete perch.

I've had the Robot now for about a year and it has been terrific. The cat likes it and uses it and I like that I don't have to touch anything or get any dust in my lungs from cleaning and adding fresh litter.So far the mechanics have performed nicely, the unit is quiet and relatively easy to maintain.

This was yet another of many attempts to get my medium-sized dog to stop pulling. He absolutely hated it and refused to go anywhere. It was like an episode of crocodile hunters- he was on the ground spinning and tangling in it to get it off. The part that goes over his muzzle was irritating his skin as well. I went with another no-pull leash-- the one with the hook on the chest and one strap goes under the front legs. That one works WONDERS if you can find it. This one is too difficult to get adjusted to.

The concept is neat, but I couldn't adjust the toy to let the treats out correctly. Either nothing came out or all the treats came out at once. I have other treat and food dispencing toys that are more user friendly.

Got this collar for training my 100lb rottie. I had previously trained him using my friends very nice and very expensive shock collar. I could not afford to spend $200+ on a collar so I opted to purchase this one.My review may be a little unfair since my comparison is to the more expensive one I used previously. Function wise, as far as administering enough shock to get my large stubborn dogs attention it works great. The difference I noticed was there was some inconsistency in the signal transfer from the remote to the collar even at short distances of 10 to 15 feet away for tone and shock. Also, the shock button would stick at times if pushed with any force resulting in continually shocks being given to my dog. Not a very effective way to properly train a dog.At first I was ready to return the collar after this happened. But I worked with it some (while not on my dog) and discovered that the shock button doesn't stick if it is pushed without significant force.Bottom line, you get what you pay for. Compared to the more expensive collars, I have found that the more expensive collar are made much better, the collar and remote are just nicer, but this collar can get the job done.

I love this ship. It is very colorful and still somewhat natural. My fish love that they have a place to hide. Wish it were taller though for my 50 gallon tank. Don't regret the purchase and it adds pop to the tank while still being a usable piece of art.

Have had this for over a year now. Works ok. Like other reviews have said the bars that extend across do not stay in place but a little super glue or tape can fix that right away. So for the price I was satisfied even with having to make a small modification to get the bars that go across to stay in place.

I don't particularly care for this particular seller, however. Delivery was SLOOOOOOOW.My cat loves these treats but she tends to scarf them, pretty much negating the point of them. I don't buy them for her too often any more since they don't do anything for her teeth if she swallows them whole.It would be helpful if they were somewhat larger. I give her Science Diet dental dry food now, instead.

I got this toy (size large) to keep my 25lb corgi/sheltie foster dog busy in his crate post-neuter. 10 minutes in he was ripping chunks of rubber off like it was nothing. He is NOT an aggressive chewer by any means and actually uses a puppy kong because he's such a mild chewer. I figured something like this would be okay but not even close. I'm glad I found it on sale because if it'd cost me the full price I'd be really sad.If it didn't withstand the chewing of a very mild chewer who is less than 25lbs it shoudln't be given to any moderate or heavy chewers... MUCH to my dismay.

This toy was highly recommended by my trainer, so I thought I'd give it a try, desperate to find anything to keep my "little" guy (70+ lb Lab mix puppy) and my adult German Shepherd busy for more than a couple minutes. The first time, the treats stayed in for about an hour but were devoured 5 minutes later. I then tried the caps with the screw rod in the middle, my puppy had it disassembled and devoured in under 10 minutes (far less time than it took me to assemble). Went back to the original caps and this time around they too only lasted about 10 minutes before they were completely devoured as well. Soon after, my puppy had one side torn completely off and reduced to little blue plastic bits. While both of my dogs really loved it while it lasted, for the price of the toy and the price of the refills (which sell out from my local store so quickly I have a hard time getting them), for my guys, it just wasn't worth it, but for less aggressive chewers, this would be great.

I've been using this filter for about 6 months. I got it with a tank that I bought used. It seems to be a decent filter for my 55 gallon tank, but I like having lots of small fish (from tetras to swordtails) and it sucked up dozens of them. Needless to say all of the fish and about 5 frogs were killed. I tried making a screen for the intake with both fabric and metal, but they got really messy and I gave up. I also tried adjusting the flow to a very low setting, but then my tank didn't get clean enough. I'm currently looking for a different filter with a built in screen.

I bought this as a gift for my sister. The item arrived in great shape and on time. HOWEVER, it is a large item and only filled 1/2 of the ridiculously large box it was shipped in. The other half of the box was filled with smaller empty boxes, paper, and random packing materials. I had the task of disposing of the enormous shipping box, plus 4 other boxes and paper.....not too happy. I WILL NEVER BUY FROM PETCO AGAIN IF THEY CAN'T APPROPRIATELY PACKAGE ITEMS. I also wonder how much my considerable shipping fee paid for the shipment of empty boxes which then I got to pay to dispose of.

I have a 4.5 lb chihuahua and this was very roomy for him. I wanted a sturdy carrier that would be comfortable for my dog and me, something that would be easy to carry through airports, and not look like a "dog carrier". Here are some things I've noticed after multiple air and ground travel with this carrier.1. My husband and I flew with this bag and it did not meet the size requirement for one portion of our flight. It was a small plane headed into Aspen, CO and the length was 1.5" longer than the requirement. The people at the counter didn't bother measuring so it wasn't an issue for us, but I was a little stressed that they would reject the carrier. On one of our flights, for some reason, it was somewhat difficult to get the carrier down into the feet area so that you can push it under the seat in front of you. I had to squish the carrier to get it down into that area. I'm sure my dog didn't appreciate being rolled around in the crate so I could get him under the seat.2. While walking through the airport, it was a little cumbersome for me to carry. The strap seemed a little too short for me to carry it cross body, so it was always on one shoulder (I'm 5'10"). I didn't feel all that secure about it not falling off my shoulder. I wish this bag came in a smaller size, especially lengthwise. I think that might have helped the cumbersome feeling.3. For car rides, I feed the seat belt through one of the side handles. It seemed to work well, except now there is a depression where the seat belt creates tension. It's like the sides are caving in. I wish there was some sort of metal brace that goes across the two handles. Like someone else on here mentioned, it would be nice to have two handles on the sides of this bag so you can carry it like a duffel bag. It tends to wobble when you pick it up with the shoulder strap and it is not a secure way to carry it.4. The one side opening is too low for my dog to crawl into. That opening might have been designed with the intention of letting people check on their pets during flight, not as a door, but I wanted something that could function as a crate once we got to our destination. Yes, the top can be left open, but some dogs like to be enclosed. I thought about turning it on its side, but it was too narrow and I wanted him to be able to stretch out. I took the padded lining to make more room, but still the opening is a little low.5. I also wish this carrier had one of those open sleeves on one side (since there is nothing there anyway), that you could slide your rolling luggage handle through for transport through the airport. I tried to wrap the handle around the luggage handle, but it kept sliding off. Seems like this would be a simple fix that would make a significant improvement in the design. It's a little much to rush around in crowded airports with a purse, this carrier on my shoulder that didn't feel all that secure on my shoulder, and a rolling luggage.Still, the quality of this carrier is excellent. Just a few minor tweaks and it would be perfect. I don't regret buying this carrier, but it didn't live up to all my expectations. I'm buying another carrier that has wheels and a telescoping handle, just like regular luggage, and can be converted to a backpack.

I ordered this Phoshate test product some months ago - Actually, you might like to know that this thing is made for little tropical fish tanks. I use the word, "little" fish tanks - as compared to a "swimming pools".For some reason, this stuff can't be found in 'Pool Supply' stores in most of So. Florida - so, I'll try the fish tank stuff - mind you, this is only a 'test' kit, not a remedy. If you find phosphate in your pool water, then you're going to have to buy some pretty expensive pool stuff to remedy the problem.In the past year Phosphate seem to have become a problem in residential swimming pools in our area. I hope I'm not starting something here - fish tank stuff is largely reasonable in price compaired to swimming pool supplies. If the producer of this stuff discovers the swimming pool market I fear what will happen to the price of his kits - get the picture?.I hope that the Phosphate problem in pools is not [also] connected to Globle Warming. I'll have to work extra hard to try and make the connection on that one.

i bought this initially for my 12 lb terrier's travel fear. This calms him, but he would still puke in the car. So, I decided to try to use this for his separation anxiety instead, and it works quite well. Instead of howling for hours home alone, he chills out most of the time instead.UPDATE: This doesn't seem to work consistently. It will work one day, but not the next day, and might work 3 days later. I don't really get it.

I bought this at IKEA a few years ago for $7.50. It took my cat six months or more to start using it--I think she was freaked out by the smell. It's a pretty nice tent though...my cat sleeps in it all the time. I put a heated cat bed in there and a blanket over it for the winter (I don't turn on the heat since I live in Oakland.) People who list this for $50 or $100 are completely insane.

My dog is a chewer and also loves playing by himself with various balls, rolling and tossing then chasing them. Not this ball. He scoped it out when I first gave it to him but hasn't touched it since. Maybe because it smells so unnatural. This ball really reeks.

The concept is great. It took a couple days for my cats to get used to (they were a little afraid of the bubbles at first, so it was nice that I can adjust the bubbling level). But they're drinking from it now, and I'm glad to have fresh water for them all the time.But my beef is, it is overpriced. The first one I bought was broken (cheap plastic). I had to take apart the second one to get it to work. And I discovered it is nothing more than an overpriced aquarium bubbler. Unless you're looking for something with a large reservoir, just buy your own pump and secure it to the bowl.

This filter does a pretty good job keeping a turtle tank clean but the attaching hardware is unreliable and flimsy and these flaws have turned out to be very costly...CONS:1) The plastic piping is thin and has cracked in multiple places. Luckily it was easy to find replacement parts but they were not cheap!2) The plastic hoses that connect the filter to the inlet/outlet pipes are also pretty weak. If the outlet hose is bent a little, the hose will collapse in on itself into a kink and cut off water flow... luckily this hasn't fried the motor, yet... Also, the plastic hoses are really hard to clean! I haven't found a pipe cleaner that's 3 feet long so I usually wrap a paper towel around the dull end of one of my husband's spear gun spears and run it through the hoses... obviously not a very good solution!And worst of all...4) The plastic piping pieces go together by fitting one into the other (no threads, no adhesive.. just insert and hope it stays together). This might be okay if you are using the filter for fish, but if you have a turtle, beware! My turtle knocks the piping pieces off ALL the time. Usually she will knock the inlet pipes off and the filter will fill with air (luckily this hasn't fried the motor, yet..). However, just yesterday (while we were at work of course) she knocked the outlet pipes off the outlet hose and the hose emptied the entire tank (50 gal) onto our wood floors... I bought a dehumidifier ($250 yikes) to pull the moisture out of the room but the floors are totally warped. The filter motor might be fried now... I am a little too frustrated to test it out...But, there aren't too many decent filters in this price range.. So, next time I hook up this filter I will be using duct tape on the tubes...

This scratching post just begs to be scratched. It's great looking (not that that matters to my feline friends) and the cats are drawn to it. It is large and sturdy - no rocking around while the kitties lock the claws down!I also bought the slide-on seat that sits on top and the cats enjoy sitting on their little perch.
My dog loves the bed, once I finally had it together. It looks super simple to attach, but couldn't get all the bars equal... took me over an hour to assemble!

We bought the Fluval 305 to replace a Fluval 203 that we'd had for about 11 years. Based on the reviews, I was expecting a 10-minute set up. However, we encountered two unexpected difficulties, one minor and one more significant. The minor: the intake/output hoses are a single hose that users need to measure and cut to fit their own tank setups. Not a big deal for us but not what we were expecting based on our prior Fluval filter and definitely would be a problem for anyone for whom the distance from canister top to aquarium top is more than 3.75-4.0 feet. The more significant: the pump primer is very flimsy and, at least in our case, was not up to the task of creating enough suction to start the gravity-aided flow of water. Because of the large diameter of the intake/output hoses, neither was the suction bulb we used to use with the Fluval 203. However, it took hours of troubleshooting to ID the problem, in part because the hoses are opaque, making it impossible to see how high in the hoses the water is getting with the pump primer. Even then, after phone calls to the vendor and to Fluval, the best solution anyone could offer was to suck on the end of the output hose to get the flow of water started. Yuck. I did it this time, but I hope to find another way of creating sufficient suction by the time of our first filter change. That said, the filter is quiet and nicely engineered despite these problems, which is why I still gave it 4 stars.

I expected the bubbles to be of more varied size but all of the bubbles this thing emits are super tiny 'fizzy' bubbles.I was hoping for larger bubbles like some of the bubble stones that I own. no such luck.

I have a stray Tuxedo cat that found us that needs to gain some weight. He is on the skinny side and is sensitive at times to the food we feed our kitties - this sensitivity comes in the form of vomiting. I bought this product to ensure that Tuxedo Joe was getting a higher caloric intake and proper vitamins.Ounce for ounce, this is a good option for caloric intake. The reason for 4 stars is the greasy, oily formula. This formula is very similar to the products used for hairballs and I know that it could be done differently -- similar toNutri-Vet Pet-Ease Paw-Gel for Cats, 3-Ouncewhich my kitties find easier to get off the spoon, paw or finger. Think of the Nutri-Vet as a cream and the Nutri-Cal as an ointment. This ointment quality makes me think that kitty is getting the junk stuck on the roof of his mouth. It would be like me getting peanut butter stuck on the roof of my mouth.Despite this, this is the only product of it's type that I have found and I will continue to use it in hopes that it will provide more calories and weight gain for our little Tuxedo cat. This product does is well-tolerated with out kitty and he has had not issues.

Our dog who came to us as a stray loves this toy.She loves plush toys generally, but this one especially. She has destoyed lesser toys in a day. This one has lasted two years. We are on our second now. I would buy more toys of this quality for her in a minute, very few can match this for play value and durability. We will always try to have another on hand for her, as I'd hate to see her be without "hedgehog". She also really likes the little one "hedgette" but she misplaces it more easily. Plush Puppies make more like these please.

After purchasing several Kong Material stuffed animals and seeing that my little 7lb puppy couldn't rip them apart, I expanded and purchased most of their other stuffed toys in size small. This one isn't my favorite. I think the material is just too plush. Kong also uses a fleece material for their other toys, and I feel that maybe they should have done the same for this one. Definitely sturdy though!

I have had several Lupine collars and the product is absolutely the best there is. These can't be destroyed!! The colors stay sharp and it doesn't fray no matter what you do to it (and we're pretty harsh on our dog stuff around here).My ONLY complaint is that this collar doesn't have a 'click' buckle to open and close the collar, it has to be slipped over the dog's head. Kennels do not accept these types of collars and they're not ideal for dogs with great big heads (like mine). I assumed all Lupines had buckles on them and didn't even think to look more closely!!

I purchased this in 2010. It's a great idea but the actual product has been nothing but headaches. The first unit we got would spin and spin and never stop. The company replaced it. That was nice except for the hassle of shipping back a giant used litter box. The new unit worked okay for awhile but soon enough it developed the same problem. Sometimes it stops upside down. That means the cats can't use it so they use the floor instead. At this point we've replaced the ball, the base and the whole unit once each. We clean the unit as directed and our cats are average sized and use the unit appropriately. Consider why the company has enough "refurbished" inventory to be able to offer them as an option.Overall I would advise you to consider the price of the unit prorated against the warranty period. Then consider the hassle of getting repair or replacement service even if it's covered. Then consider that the company is very slow to respond. If you have the money to purchase a back-up in case of malfunction, then I'd say you should go for it. Not having 700 bucks to shell out for litter boxes, we'll be returning to a traditional litter pan.

This toy, while sturdy for the average dog, is not good for aggressive chewers. I have a pit bull and an American Bulldog. Both of them tore it apart right away. They took all the stuffing out. I think this toy would be good for dogs who are not aggressive chewers. It's the best tug toy I have found though so I will give them 3 stars.

This item arrived on time and well packaged with no damage. This water and food bowl is aesthetically appealing and very solid. It looks like a great deal of r and d went into the development. It is up off of the floor for ease of access and the serving bowls are firmly in place so your pet can not shift the contents around causing spillage. Lastly, the bowls can be lifted out for easy cleaning. Thanks Our Pets!

My unit arrived with no documentation, no screws, and the bottom (carpeted) section has a strong smell that probably will have a bad effect on your cat...may not be healthy, either. Comes in two pieces. I used a rubber hammer to force the base to the top section, then found thee screws of my own that fit the slots. After that, I put in a towel for added comfort and to try to reduce the processed smell (which is awful). My recommendation is to get some screws and not rely on the snaps. Also, leave it out in the cold for a few days and hopefully the smell will siphon off. The size is great for two cats, but is optimum for one. Screws take some elbow grease to screw in, but it's not a bad job. Still, they should have come with the unit.

This cat door worked well. We have it going between our garage and the kitchen. I was glad to be able to move the litter box into the garage so now the bathroom doesn't have cat litter all over the floor and she can come in and out as she pleases. Recently though, at night, we started locking the cat in the garage because she wants to play at 2 am and makes a lot of noise in trying to get our attention: yowling, playing with her toys, jumping on the bed to wake us up, etc. (She has always done this, and we just put up with the interruptions until recently, when we had a baby and are too sleep deprived to put up with yet another creature waking us up in the middle of the night).Unfortunately, she quickly (within a few days) learned how to unlatch the lock mechanism from the garage side of the cat door. So now, on top of locking her in there (with food and water, of course), we have to put a crate of books in front of the cat door on the kitchen side so that once she does unlatch the lock, she still can't fully open the door and get into the house. I wish I would have purchased the kind with the extra door piece that slides over the flap instead. This is just not cat proofed enough. :(If you have a dumber cat, or one that isn't so inclined to do so much work (lazier than ours), then you should be fine.
This is an excellent buy for minimal money. I saw others similar but for twice the money. Delivered quickly as well.

We purchased the FURminator for our son and daughter-in-law's dog, a Yellow Lab, who sheds and sheds and sheds. After being brushed with the FURminater several days in a row, the shedding is considerable less. The dog likes to be brushed with the FURminator and after the initial brushing every day, you only need to do it every couple of days and there is a significant decrese in the shedding. We highly recommend the FURminator to anyone with a dog who sheds. We adopted a small Pomeranian mix dog, and he sheds a little, not like the Yellow Lab, non-the-less he sheds. We then bought the smaller FURminator and it works well on our Pomeranian.

This is a worthless item. I bought it a couple of months ago and stopped using it within a week. Yes, it is absolutely adorable, but at the end of the day it doesn't work. When I tried to scoop up the poop it smeared into the rake area and made a mess. It was hot that first time it happened so needless to say I was quite irritated. The next times were no better. Unless the poop is dried all the way through it will not scoop it well.The larger pooper scooper that I bought off of Amazon is a PetCo that works perfectly. It is a simple scooper with no rake or snap back affect. This purple one is leaning against my fence being decorative along side the cute waste basket. I am back to using the bags in the small area that this scooper was bought to handle. The PetCo scooper is in the larger area of the yard. I won't buy another cute non-functional item again. A waste of time and money.

I received this Hidden Litter Box today in the mail. I read a lot of reviews before buying it to make sure, because of the cost. This Hidden Litter Box was worth buying. There were complaints about problems with the upper part fitting the lower part, but I think the company must have heard complaints because mine was easy to put together. The top sits on a ridge on the bottom half. The body itself is worth the money because it does look like a planter. Problems with this item are the moss and the fake green plant. I don't like the moss, but another reviewer said he replaced it with rocks and that is what I did because it looks better. Also the plant looks like total crap. It came with the leaves looking cheap and bent. I have seen alot of fake silk plants and this particular plant is pathetic for the price we are asked to pay for it. I actually tried to use an iron and steam on it to make the leaves look decent and gave up because it was too much of a problem to fix. I am going to a craft store and buying a fake plant to put in it which is what I sugguest to whoever else wants to buy this item. You can go on EBAY, a pet store or to a hobby store and buy rocks to put in the planter and buy what ever fake plant you want for the planter and then it would look real and fantastic. Presently I am using the orginal green plant in the planter and have it in a corner of my room. I have the entrance of the condo facing the corner with enough space for the cat to whip in and do her business. I also put a piece of carpet under the condo to catch the litter that comes out with the cat. I have actually had people sitting right next to the condo and they didn't believe me when I told them it was a litter box. They thought it was a real plant. The problems are simple to fix with this item. So I do suggest buying it for people who do not want to see a litter box, but if you want it to look real, you need to replace the moss and plant which is easy to do.
This is by far my favorite toy for my dog. I love it because it keeps him busy, and forces him to slow down in his eating. Durable, too!

based on the sizing on the site we ordered a small for our 8 lb chihuahua.. but it was still too small. Our little girl is a bit muscular, so it didnt fit around her chest. - we ended up giving it away. :(Super cute though and made very well! Just wish it had fit!

Slightly annoyed that the packaging pictured for this flea and tick product was different than what I received in the mail. The packaging on amazon displayed the product in lbs, which would be distributed in the US obviously. The packaging I received referred to the dog's weight in kilograms and clearly not packaged for the United States. It appears to be what is sold in Australia. Hope it's an authentic Merial product that kills the fleas, but not my dog.

On Sept. 11, 2012, this food was recalled for possible salmonella! Please do not endanger your pups. I almost purchased this dog food, but wanted to do some research on it to see what the actual ingredients were and also to read other consumer reviews. The recall was the first thing that came up.[...]

I got this in a lightning deal around the holidays and it's now $1 more than the "deal". I'm not saying that's bad, but it just doesn't seem very normal (or common).Regardless, I overpaid. I got the small pad because I'm tired of my cat insisting to sleep in my bed and resist whenever I try to move her over to give me soon room.She likes the warmth, that's what the star is for.The rest is disappointing. First of all, my cat is not fat, but she is longer. As a result, this pad is too small for her. Unless she is curled up in a tight ball, it's not big enough. Could I have measured? Yes, I could have. Then again, since people are buying larges for their great dane's, I figured the small would work for a moderately sized feline.Also, it is an air mattress. That's not horrible, but it's not very clear from the description. What is horrible is since the pad is so darn small the air mattress isn't very flat. If you have any real amount of air in it, it sort of takes a "balloon" shape. This makes the cat fall off the side due to the curvature. I think sometimes this makes her think, "oh to heck with it," and lays somewhere colder.Lastly, the product does "appear" to be built safely, and I'm thankful for that. However, the instructions have spelling and grammar errors all over the place-- the kind of thing I've seen written to accompany knock-off products product in China on the cheap.Overall, this may not be the absolute worst heating pad ever made, but I struggle to think it deserves two solid stars. Consequently, I offer my rare 1-star rating.
But my dogs didn't like it. I was hoping to distract him when we leave the house, but he wasn't much interested in the toy.

I want to give this 5 stars because it's the only toy in which my recently adopted, timid rescue dog has showed any interest.I want to give this 1 star because an older bichon was able to power through a good 1/3 of the clear bone in under 3 hours.A little disclaimer, the dog on whom this review is based is a 15 lb. bichon. She was rescued from a really sad situation which made estimating her age particularly difficult, but she's definitely not a puppy and it's likely she's approaching senior status if she's not there already. Point being she's not a strong healthy puppy in her chewing prime, yet she gnawed right through the clear bone from this pack within a few hours. The packaging (and any research into the product's safety) says to throw these out if more than a small piece comes off. When I lived at home with my parents, we gave these to our dachshunds and they lasted weeks. I didn't want to startle my new adoptee while she was appearing to enjoy herself so I let her go at her bone for a bit before I felt the need to see what kind of damage (expecting none) she had done. I was surprised and a little panicky to see that the nubby ends from both sides of the bone were completely gone and she was well on her way to getting one end fashioned into a pointy shiv-like shape. This was almost two days ago and she hasn't shown any signs of digestive issues, so hopefully we dodged a bullet there.I'm giving it 3 stars because she loved it and it's my own fault for not watching her more closely the entire time to ensure she wasn't eating it, but still, I wouldn't be a huge fan of any non-free toy she can completely destroy in no time even if it didn't carry the safety concerns. I'm going to go up to a bigger size - only because I was so happy to see her respond to something besides her dog bed and food - and see if that makes a difference. If anyone has had experience with toys for timid dogs who never learned how to play and has any suggestions, I would be happy to hear them. She clearly likes to chew. She's so-so about her KONG. She seems to like watching her Cuz bounce, but that's about it. No interest whatsoever in rope toys, squeaky toys or plush toys.

I purchased this pump to in hopes that it would be quieter than the one I had already, plus I needed a bit more power. This pump delivered the power as advertised but it is very noisy. I wrote to the company and got a prompt reply. They tried hard to help me and sent me a new impeller to try. The new impeller didn't fix the problem. I switched to a pump made by Lifegard called "Quiet One."
